He says he noticed them as<span class='line-break'> </span>being only staked.</p>
<p>Have you ever found<span class='line-break'> </span>my note of Christmas Day?</p>
<p>Yours truly</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A. J. Coolidge</a> Sec.y</p>
<p>110</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133600">
<h3><a name="page-1133600">CB01_0111</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>33 School St <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a>, <date when='1863-12-31'>Dec<sup>r</sup> 31, [186]3</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/64115' title='Phillips, William H.'>Mr W<sup>m</sup> H. Phillips</a>, Undertaker<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/72694' title='Newton Corner, MA'>Newton Corner</a>,</p>
<p>Sir,</p>
<p>I wrote you on the <date when='1863-07-31'>31<sup>st</sup><span class='line-break'> </span>of July</date> last, asking you to send me<span class='line-break'> </span>the order properly filled out for an interment<span class='line-break'> </span>which you made on the <date when='1863-05-11'>11<sup>th</sup> of May</date> last<span class='line-break'> </span>in <a href='/pages/subjects/64116' title='Lot 698'>lot no 698</a> (Snow's tomb): and you<span class='line-break'> </span>have been requested by the officers at Mt Auburn<span class='line-break'> </span>to do the same. I have never rec<sup>d</sup> any reply<span class='line-break'> </span>from you on the subject: although I learned<span class='line-break'> </span>from our Gatekeeper a few days ago that you<span class='line-break'> </span>told him in reply to his last inquiry for this paper,<span class='line-break'> </span>that you had sent it to me. -</p>
<p>Not doubting that it is in your power to<span class='line-break'> </span>comply, I have only to say now, that unless I<span class='line-break'> </span>receive this paper from you before the next meeting<span class='line-break'> </span>of our Trustees on Monday next, I shall lay<span class='line-break'> </span>the matter before the Board for such action as <span class='line-break'> </span>they may think proper. --</p>
<p>Respectfully yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a> Sec.y</p>
<p>33 School St <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a>, <date when='1863-12-31'>Dec<sup>r</sup> 31, 1863</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/64117' title='Snow, Henry A.'>H.A. Snow</a> Esq, Representative of <a href='/pages/subjects/64116' title='Lot 698'>Lot 698</a><span class='line-break'> </span>in the Cemetery of Mt Auburn</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>I have just written a note to<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/64115' title='Phillips, William H.'>W<sup>m</sup>. H. Phillips</a> of <a href='/pages/subjects/72694' title='Newton Corner, MA'>Newton Corner</a>, an<span class='line-break'> </span>undertaker, who has never returned to me<span class='line-break'> </span>any information of the unknown (to us) child<span class='line-break'> </span>deposited by him in your tomb on the 11<sup>th</sup> of<span class='line-break'> </span>May last - for record - stating that if<span class='line-break'> </span>I do not receive the proper order from you<span class='line-break'> </span>with the necessary information before the<span class='line-break'> </span>meeting of the Trustees on Monday next,<span class='line-break'> </span>I shall lay the matter before the Board<span class='line-break'> </span>for such action as they shall think<span class='line-break'> </span>proper. -</p>
<p>I have heard that he says that he has<span class='line-break'> </span>sent it to me -- but it has never been received.</p>
<p>Yours respy.</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y Mt Auburn Cem.y</p>
<p>111</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133601">
<h3><a name="page-1133601">CB01_0112</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>33 School St <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a>, <date when='1863-12-31'>Dec<sup>r</sup> 31, [186]3</date></p>
<p>Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/57826' title='Shedd &amp; Edson'>Shedd &amp; Edson</a></p>
<p>Gentlemen,</p>
<p>I have searched <span class='line-break'> </span>for a little plan of <a href='/pages/subjects/65224' title='Colburn, George W.'>Mr Colburn's</a> lot<span class='line-break'> </span>without success - but find that the<span class='line-break'> </span>lot was reported as containing 792<span class='line-break'> </span>square feet - dimensions 24f x 33 f.<span class='line-break'> </span>the longest way southward &amp; north<span class='line-break'></span>ward. - Please plot the same as<span class='line-break'> </span>suggested by you so as to bring it within<span class='line-break'> </span>five feet respectively of <a href='/pages/subjects/61172' title='Eagle Avenue'>Eagle Av<sup>e</sup></a>. and<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/61266' title='Raven Path'>Raven Path</a>: and so as to show<span class='line-break'> </span>how the land to the northward between<span class='line-break'> </span>it and <a href='/pages/subjects/61227' title='Magnolia Avenue'>Magnolia Av<sup>e</sup></a>. lies, or will cut at.</p>
<p>Also please make duplicate of<span class='line-break'> </span>plan for <a href='/pages/subjects/54936' title='Appleton, William'>W<sup>m</sup>. Appleton</a> Esq. as requested.</p>
<p>Truly yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a> Sec.y</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a> <date when='1863-12-31'>Dec<sup>r</sup> 31, [186]3</date></p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/81482' title='Shedd, J. H., Mr.'>Mr Shedd</a> has<span class='line-break'> </span>mislaid the office plan of your<span class='line-break'> </span>lots - but will no doubt find it.</p>
<p>Meantime, if you will loan <span class='line-break'> </span>me yours, I will endeavor to<span class='line-break'> </span>push your business respecting<span class='line-break'> </span>the lots forward one stage<span class='line-break'> </span>at least.</p>
<p>I have requested him to <span class='line-break'> </span>make the duplicate plan for our <span class='line-break'> </span>portfolio as you state you had<span class='line-break'> </span>ordered - but which they appear<span class='line-break'> </span>to have overlooked.</p>
<p>Very respectfully yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a> Sec.y</p>
<p>To <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54936' title='Appleton, William'>W<sup>m</sup> Appleton</a> Esq<sup>r</sup></p>
<p>112</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133602">
<h3><a name="page-1133602">CB01_0113</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>33 School St <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a>, <date when='1863-12-31'>Dec<sup>r</sup> 31 [186]3</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/65267' title='Wentworth, E. W., Mr.'>Mr E.W. Wentworth</a></p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>The order for interment<span class='line-break'> </span>which I drew for you for the inter<span class='line-break'></span>ment of your child on the <date when='1863-10-08'>8<sup>th</sup>of<span class='line-break'> </span>October</date> was not accompanied by<span class='line-break'> </span>the town clerk's permit for burial,<span class='line-break'> </span>as I requested. As I desire that<span class='line-break'> </span>of  files should show regularity<span class='line-break'> </span>of proceeding, will you get a<span class='line-break'> </span>permit from the town clerk to <span class='line-break'> </span>forward to me? -</p>
<p>Yours Resp.y</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y Mt Auburn Cem.</p>
<p>33 School St. <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a>, <date when='1863-12-31'>Dec<sup>r</sup> 31, 1863</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/65268' title='Messrs F. [Siaetto?]&amp; Son'>Messrs F. [Siaetto?]&amp; Son</a></p>
<p>Gentlemen,</p>
<p>Please send me<span class='line-break'> </span>the burial permit of the <a href='/pages/subjects/64279' title='Dorchester, MA'>Dorchester</a><span class='line-break'> </span>town clerk for the interment of<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/65269' title='Bigelow, Prescott'>Prescott Bigelow</a>, who died on<span class='line-break'> </span>the 14<sup>th</sup> of Octo. last - that our<span class='line-break'> </span>files &amp; records may show correct<span class='line-break'> </span>procedure, and oblige.</p>
<p>Yours truly</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A. J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y Mt. A. C.</p>
<p>113<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133603">
<h3><a name="page-1133603">CB01_0114_1</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>Boston - <date when='1863-12-31'>Dec<sup>r</sup> 31, [186}3</date><span class='line-break'> </span>[I?]. H. Woolcott Esq</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>Mr. Curtis has <span class='line-break'> </span>sent back to me the plans<span class='line-break'> </span>of lots between <a href='/pages/subjects/61259' title='Pilgrim Path'>Pilgrim &amp;</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/57829' title='Snowdrop Path'>Snow -<span class='line-break'> </span>drop paths</a>, stating that he <span class='line-break'> </span>had a conference with you,<span class='line-break'> </span>but that nothing had been <span class='line-break'> </span>decided.</p>
<p>I do not know whether another <span class='line-break'> </span>interview will be of any avail, but <span class='line-break'> </span>have the impression that you and <span class='line-break'> </span>I can arrange terms to your sat<span class='line-break'></span>isfaction; and I shall be happy <span class='line-break'> </span>to see you here, at your convenience <span class='line-break'> </span>any day, after 12 o'clock.</p>
<p>Very Respy yours</p>
<p>A. J. Coolidge<span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
<p><date when='1863-12-31'>Dec<sup>r</sup> 31, 1863</date>-</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/64145' title='Vinal, R. A.'>R.A. <!--Vinal--></a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/64146' title='Vinal, Quincy Adams'>Q.A. Vinal</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Gentlemen,</p>
<p>(note recalling their attention <span class='line-break'> </span>to note of Sept 23 <sup>d</sup>last -<span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; copy accidentally omitted.)</p>
<p>114</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133604">
<h3><a name="page-1133604">CB01_0115</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a> <date when='1864-01-01'>Jany. 1, 1864.</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'>Capt. D.L. Winsor</a></p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>I wish to see the<span class='line-break'> </span>bequests that have been made for the<span class='line-break'> </span>care of lots paid in as fast as is<span class='line-break'> </span>practicable: I remember that the be<span class='line-break'></span>quest of <a href='/pages/subjects/64082' title='Mumford, Sophia'>Sophie Mumford</a>, late prop.<sup>r</sup><span class='line-break'> </span>of <a href='/pages/subjects/64083' title='Lot 126'>lot no 126</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/60336' title='Willow Avenue'>Willow Av<sup>e</sup></a> was not<span class='line-break'> </span>paid in on account of a clause ie.</p>
<p>Your report which is as follows: -<span class='line-break'> </span>[1. ans.?] "The centre posts are loose, the ground<span class='line-break'> </span>requires new grading, and monument [ought?]<span class='line-break'> </span>to be raised 8 or 10 inches."</p>
<p>So the Committee on Lots accepted her<span class='line-break'> </span>$300, "provided the lot be first put in<span class='line-break'> </span>complete order."</p>
<p>The last I heard of the matter, her<span class='line-break'> </span>Ex<sup>or</sup>, <a href='/pages/subjects/65277' title='Drake, Jeremy'>Jeremy Drake</a>, Cash<sup>r</sup> of the <a href='/pages/subjects/65278' title='Freeman&apos;s Bank'>Free<span class='line-break'></span>man's Bank</a> was arranging the repairs<span class='line-break'> </span>with you.</p>
<p>Will you please inform me upon<span class='line-break'> </span>this tomorrow.</p>
<p>Truly yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a>, <date when='1864-01-02'>Jany. 2<sup>d</sup>1864</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/65279' title='Loring, George H.'>Geo. H. Loring</a> Esq<sup>r</sup></p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>I return you<span class='line-break'> </span>a new deed of your lot in Mount<span class='line-break'> </span>Auburn - <a href='/pages/subjects/65280' title='Lot 3336'>no. 3336</a> - in place of the<span class='line-break'> </span>old one returned me on account<span class='line-break'> </span>of erroneous description.</p>
<p>The Treasurer suggests that<span class='line-break'> </span>he never rec<sup>d</sup> the $1. for the deed,<span class='line-break'> </span>which you can enclose him by mail.<span class='line-break'> </span>(<a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'>Geo. W<sup>m</sup> Bond</a>, Treas<sup>r</sup> 167 Congress St.)</p>
<p>I perceive that the old<span class='line-break'> </span>deed did not contain the Internal<span class='line-break'> </span>Rev. Stamp of 50 cts, which is re<span class='line-break'></span>quired on all instruments after<span class='line-break'> </span>June 1. 1863 to render them valid.</p>
<p>You had better put one upon the<span class='line-break'> </span>new deed &amp; cancel it. -</p>
<p>Yours respy</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A. J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
<p>115</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133605">
<h3><a name="page-1133605">CB01_0116</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>33 School St. <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a> <date when='1864-01-05'>Jany. 5. 1864</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/65290' title='Cady, Daniel R., Rev.'>Rev. D.R. Cady</a>, W. <a href='/pages/subjects/53203' title='Cambridge, MA'>Cambridge</a>,</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>Will you please write<span class='line-break'> </span>out on the enclosed order of interment<span class='line-break'> </span>which I return you for correction,<span class='line-break'> </span>the <ins>legal</ins> name of  "<a href='/pages/subjects/65291' title='Cady, Allie S.'><ins>Allie</ins> S. Cady</a>",<span class='line-break'> </span>which is the only one we should use upon<span class='line-break'> </span><ins>record</ins>. We wish to rob no one of<span class='line-break'> </span>the <ins>household</ins> name, but you will cer<span class='line-break'></span>tainly perceive that great inconvenience<span class='line-break'> </span>often ensues in giving it in for record.</p>
<p>To illustrate - a citizen of your town lately<span class='line-break'> </span>sent in the name of "Georgie" for record:<span class='line-break'> </span>and not until the orthography had been<span class='line-break'> </span>corrected, ^<sup>to "Georgia"</sup> could we know whether the de<span class='line-break'></span>ceased was a male or female. -</p>
<p>Please also fill the blank<span class='line-break'> </span>for the <ins>age</ins>, and return the paper<span class='line-break'> </span>to me.</p>
<p>Respy yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A. J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y Mt Auburn Cem.y</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a> <date when='1864-01-05'>Jany. 5. 1864</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/65224' title='Colburn, George W.'>Geo. W. Colburn</a> Esq</p>
<p>Dear Sir</p>
<p>I am anxious<span class='line-break'> </span>to price you a deed of your lot <span class='line-break'> </span>in the Cemetery - <a href='/pages/subjects/65292' title='Lot 3260'>no 3260</a> - I<span class='line-break'> </span>have caused the surveyors to<span class='line-break'> </span>sketch it &amp; to go in the new<span class='line-break'> </span>laying out. Will you please<span class='line-break'> </span>call and see the plan - and<span class='line-break'> </span>that it is satisfactory.</p>
<p>Truly yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A. J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y Mt. A. C.</p>
<p>116</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133606">
<h3><a name="page-1133606">CB01_0117</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>33 School St. <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a> <date when='1864-01-05'>Jany 5, 1864</date></p>
<p>Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/65294' title='John Peak &amp; Son'>J. Peak &amp; Son</a></p>
<p>Gentlemen,</p>
<p>We wish the order of <a href='/pages/subjects/65295' title='Kennard, Michael'>Michael<span class='line-break'> </span>Kennard</a>, now of late of <a href='/pages/subjects/53204' title='Watertown, MA'>Watertown</a>, for<span class='line-break'> </span>interment by you in his <a href='/pages/subjects/65296' title='Lot 974'>lot no. 974</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span><date when='1863-09-05'>Sept. 5, 1863</date>, of <a href='/pages/subjects/65297' title='Stevens, John H. W.'>John H. W. Stevens</a>.  We<span class='line-break'> </span>have the <ins>city permit</ins>.</p>
<p>Wanted also the city of <a href='/pages/subjects/59911' title='Chelsea, MA'>Chelsea</a> <ins>permit</ins> for<span class='line-break'> </span>interment of <a href='/pages/subjects/65298' title='Stokes, Mary'>Mary Stokes</a>, <date when='1863-09-08'>Sept. 8/63</date> in <span class='line-break'> </span>lot of late <a href='/pages/subjects/65299' title='Brown, David R.'>David R. Brown</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/65300' title='Lot 2417'>no. 2417</a>.</p>
<p>Respy yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A. J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y Mt. Auburn <span class='line-break'> </span>Cemy</p>
<p>33 School St. <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a> <date when='1864-01-05'>Jany. 5, 1864</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/104063' title='Marden, David M.'>Mr. David Marden</a>,</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>Please get and<span class='line-break'> </span>send us the north <ins><a href='/pages/subjects/59911' title='Chelsea, MA'>Chelsea</a> permit</ins><span class='line-break'> </span>for the interment of <a href='/pages/subjects/65302' title='Clark, Cyrus T., Jr.'>Cyrus T. Clark<span class='line-break'> </span>Jr.</a> on the 3<sup>d</sup> of Sept/63 in <a href='/pages/subjects/65303' title='Lot 515'>lot no. 515</a><span class='line-break'> </span>represented by <a href='/pages/subjects/70500' title='Tirrell, Edward Q.'>E. Q. Tirell.</a>  We<span class='line-break'> </span>have the order of <a href='/pages/subjects/70500' title='Tirrell, Edward Q.'>Mr. Tirrell</a>, but<span class='line-break'> </span>not the town permit.  Send<span class='line-break'> </span>to <ins>me</ins>, not to the gate.—</p>
<p>Your truly</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A. J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y Mt. Auburn Cemetery</p>
<p>117</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133607">
<h3><a name="page-1133607">CB01_0118</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>33 School St - <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a> <date when='1864-01-05'>Jany 5, [186]4</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/65305' title='Fairbank, Dexter'>Dexter Fairbank</a> Esq<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/64140' title='New York, NY'>New York City</a>,</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>Please send <span class='line-break'> </span>me the name <ins>in full</ins> of your<span class='line-break'> </span>son lately interred at Mount<span class='line-break'> </span>Auburn - for record. We <span class='line-break'> </span>have it only <a href='/pages/subjects/65306' title='Fairbank, Franklin D.'><ins>F.D.</ins> Fairbank</a>.</p>
<p>Yours truly</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
<p>33 School St <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a> <date when='1864-01-05'>Jany 5, 1864</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/65307' title='Goodrich, Charles B.'>C.B. Goodrich</a> Esq.</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>Please send me<span class='line-break'> </span><ins>in full</ins> the name of your son<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/65308' title='Goodrich, Frank Chester'><ins>F. C</ins>. Goodrich</a> for our record<span class='line-break'> </span>of interment: also his rank<span class='line-break'> </span>and place in the army, which I<span class='line-break'> </span>am not sure whether I have,<span class='line-break'> </span>as my Register is at home for<span class='line-break'> </span>now.</p>
<p>Truly yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A. J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y Mt Auburn Cem.y</p>
<p>118</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133608">
<h3><a name="page-1133608">CB01_0119</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>33 School St - <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a> <date when='1864-01-05'>Jany 5 [186]4</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/65309' title='Bordman, William H.'>W<sup>m</sup> H Bordman</a> Esq</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>I find that the<span class='line-break'> </span>several deeds of lots <a href='/pages/subjects/65310' title='Lot 2158'>2158,</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/65311' title='Lot 2159'><!--Lot-->2159</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/65312' title='Lot 2160'><!--Lot-->2160</a><span class='line-break'> </span>in Mt Auburn to yourself, Mr Bates &amp;<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/65313' title='Rice, Henry Gardner'>Mr <!--Henry Gardner-->Rice</a> were dated Dec<sup>r</sup> 10, 1856, - more<span class='line-break'> </span>than two years after the death of <a href='/pages/subjects/65313' title='Rice, Henry Gardner'>Mr <!--Henry Gardner-->Rice</a>. <a href='/pages/subjects/65314' title='Pine, Henry G.'>Mr Henry<span class='line-break'> </span>G. Pine</a> of <a href='/pages/subjects/64807' title='Baltimore, MD'>Baltimore</a>, the <ins>son</ins>, is evidently the propri<span class='line-break'></span>etor of <a href='/pages/subjects/65312' title='Lot 2160'>lot 2160</a>. Before examining dates, I had<span class='line-break'> </span>supposed the father was the proprietor.</p>
<p>I find that the deeds have been delivered by<span class='line-break'> </span>the Treas<sup>r</sup>, as they are erased from a list of<span class='line-break'> </span>deeds remaining in his hands. If you do not find<span class='line-break'> </span>them among your papers, I will ascertain who<span class='line-break'> </span>receipted for them.</p>
<p>I enclose our usual blank form for the<span class='line-break'> </span>representation of the Bates Lot. If his Bates'<span class='line-break'> </span>lot goes to more than one heir, this is the proper form.<span class='line-break'> </span>You will know from the will, if he left one. -</p>
<p>If you find the facts about decease of <a href='/pages/subjects/65315' title='Otis, Arthur H.'>Arthur H Otis</a>, please<span class='line-break'> </span>return the paper to me. --</p>
<p>Very resp.y yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a> Sec.y</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a>, <date when='1864-01-06'>Jany. 6<sup>th</sup> [186]4</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53153' title='Baldwin, Henry'>Henry Baldwin</a> Esq</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>I wish to complete the<span class='line-break'> </span>deeds of the three lots in Mt Auburn to<span class='line-break'> </span>be carved out of <a href='/pages/subjects/65316' title='Lot 2326'>no. 2326</a> -- to your father,<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/65317' title='Hollis, Mr.'>Mr Hollis</a>, &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/59212' title='Fuller, Mr.'>Mr Fuller</a>. Presuming<span class='line-break'> </span>that they would prefer consecutive<span class='line-break'> </span>numbers, I propose to give the numbers<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/57816' title='Lot 3034'><!--Lot-->3034</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/57817' title='Lot 3035'><!--Lot-->3035</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/57818' title='Lot 3036'><!--Lot-->3036</a>. If there is any<span class='line-break'> </span>objection to this by reason of cutting<span class='line-break'> </span>the old number on the granite, or for any<span class='line-break'> </span>other cases, please inform me at once.</p>
<p>I think probably this has not been<span class='line-break'> </span>done, as I suggested that we should<span class='line-break'> </span>have to give you new numbers.</p>
<p>Yours truly</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a></p>
<p>119</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133609">
<h3><a name="page-1133609">CB01_0120</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a> <date when='1864-01-06'>Jany. 6. [186]4</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/65319' title='Upham, Thomas'>Thos. Upham</a>, Esq.</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>You proposed when<span class='line-break'> </span>last here to let me know, in a<span class='line-break'> </span>few days, if my memory serves<span class='line-break'> </span>me, how to divide the lots<span class='line-break'> </span>in Mt Auburn. As I should <span class='line-break'> </span>like to return the deeds to the<span class='line-break'> </span>Treas<sup>r</sup>, now that [a?] year is<span class='line-break'> </span>at an end, I will thank you<span class='line-break'> </span>to send me words &amp;<span class='line-break'> </span>oblige.</p>
<p>Yours truly</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a></p>
<p>Has desk at <a href='/pages/subjects/65320' title='Keith, W. W.'>W.W. Keith</a>, broker's --<span class='line-break'> </span>5 &amp; 13 Old State House</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a> - <date when='1864-01-09'>Jany. 9<sup>th</sup> [186]4</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P. Curtis Esq</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Chairman of Com<sup>ee</sup> on Lots.</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>Will your Com<sup>ee</sup>please<span class='line-break'> </span>consider and report for what sum<span class='line-break'> </span>they will recommend the Trustees to guarantee<span class='line-break'> </span>the perpetual repair of the several lots belonging<span class='line-break'> </span>to <a href='/pages/subjects/54936' title='Appleton, William'>W<sup>m</sup>. Appleton</a> Esq, all in one enclosure -<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/65321' title='Lot 464'>nos. 464,</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/65322' title='Lot 465'>465,</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/65323' title='Lot 466'>466,</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/65324' title='Lot 468'>468 &amp;</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/65325' title='Lot 469'>469,</a> with additions,<span class='line-break'> </span>amounting to 6946 feet: for which the Super<span class='line-break'></span>intendent suggests $1500. --</p>
<p>I think <a href='/pages/subjects/54936' title='Appleton, William'>Mr Appleton</a> will desire<span class='line-break'> </span>to reconvey his lots to the Corporation in<span class='line-break'> </span>trust: and told him I would get<span class='line-break'> </span>the views of your Com<sup>ee</sup> as a preliminary<span class='line-break'> </span>step.</p>
<p>Yours very resp.</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A. J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
<p>120</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133610">
<h3><a name="page-1133610">CB01_0121</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a>, <ins>33 School St</ins>  <date when='1864-01-11'>Jany, 11. [186]4</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/65228' title='Allen, Lydia M.'>Mrs Lydia M. Allen</a>     <span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/65229' title='Caulk, Mary B.'>Mrs Mary B. Caulk</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/59911' title='Chelsea, MA'>Chelsea, Mass</a></p>
<p>Ladies,</p>
<p>Will you be so kind, as to send <span class='line-break'> </span>me word, at once, how you  divide <a href='/pages/subjects/65248' title='Lot 3388'>lots<span class='line-break'> </span>3388</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/65249' title='Lot 3389'>&amp; 3389</a>, which are in one enclosure. <a href='/pages/subjects/65248' title='Lot 3388'><!--Lot-->3388</a> <span class='line-break'> </span>is <a href='/pages/subjects/65228' title='Allen, Lydia M.'>Mrs Allen's</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/65249' title='Lot 3389'><!--Lot-->3389</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/65229' title='Caulk, Mary B.'>Mrs Caulks</a>. I <span class='line-break'> </span>subjoin this sketch and will thank you to <span class='line-break'> </span>indicate by these figures, which owner the <span class='line-break'> </span>northerly and which the southerly side. I see<span class='line-break'> </span>that <a href='/pages/subjects/65327' title='Coffin, Eliamkim'>Mr Coffin's</a> grave is on the north side<span class='line-break'> </span>of the centre line, and the grave without a <span class='line-break'> </span>headstone is on the south side.</p>
<p>The lot fronts to the eastward, &amp; <span class='line-break'> </span>towards <a href='/pages/subjects/60030' title='Oak Avenue'>Oak Avenue</a>.  I have put in<span class='line-break'> </span>the numbers short of the last figure <span class='line-break'> </span>which by you adding 8 and 9 where<span class='line-break'> </span>they belong will show which each owns:<span class='line-break'> </span>or as you face the headstone, say which the left side belongs to,<span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; which the right.</p>
<p>As soon as I receive your answer, your deeds will be ready.-</p>
<p>Respectfully yours.</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A. J. Coolidge</a>, Secretary</p>
<p>33 School St. <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a> <date when='1864-01-11'>Jany 11 [186]4</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/65232' title='Clark, Alvan'>Alvan Clark</a> Esq<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/64864' title='Cambridgeport, MA'>Cambridgeport</a>,</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>On the <date when='1863-12-16'>16<sup>th</sup> of Dec<sup>r</sup>/63</date><span class='line-break'> </span>an order was sent me by <a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'>Mr Bond</a>, our<span class='line-break'> </span>Treas<sup>r</sup> for a deed (among others) of your<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/65328' title='Lot 3411'>lot, no. 3411</a>, situated on <a href='/pages/subjects/61283' title='Sumac Path'>Sumac Path</a>, for <span class='line-break'> </span>which you paid $150.  In his order, he includes <span class='line-break'> </span>a <ins>tomb right</ins> which I found from his books, <span class='line-break'> </span>soon after that date, had not been paid on; <span class='line-break'> </span>and of course I have delayed mailing the deed.</p>
<p>I understand from <a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'>Capt. Winsor</a>, our Super<span class='line-break'></span>intendent, that he informed you of the rule re<span class='line-break'></span>quiring $50 additional fee for a tomb privilege - and <span class='line-break'> </span>now write you, lest you should have been under <span class='line-break'> </span>some misapprehension.  If you do not wish the <span class='line-break'> </span>tomb privilege, please notify me.writing me. If you do, please <span class='line-break'> </span>send $50 to the Treas<sup>r</sup>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'>Geo. W<sup>m</sup> Bond</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>167 Congress St.</p>
<p>Yours truly</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A. J. Coolidge</a> Sec.y</p>
<p>121</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133611">
<h3><a name="page-1133611">CB01_0122</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a>, <date when='1864-01-11'>Jany 11 [186]4</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'>Capt. Winsor</a></p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>The contents of Mr Apple<span class='line-break'></span>ton's lots, as ascertained by the surveyors,<span class='line-break'> </span>are 6.946 square feet. <a href='/pages/subjects/54936' title='Appleton, William'>Mr Appleton</a> has<span class='line-break'> </span>heretofore paid, (including the addition of 3767<span class='line-break'> </span>feet reported by you in Octo. 1862) for 6619 ft.<span class='line-break'> </span>As he takes all the passageways into his<span class='line-break'> </span>area at 50 cts, it make therefore <ins>327 feet</ins><span class='line-break'> </span>which he has not yet paid for, and which<span class='line-break'> </span>I told him today I would get you to [report?]<span class='line-break'> </span>in form. I have sent a note to <a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'>Mr Bond</a><span class='line-break'> </span>to the same effect, in case he should call to [?]<span class='line-break'> </span>for it before - you report.- I presume this also<span class='line-break'> </span>will be included in last year's report.-</p>
<p>Please also ^<sup>make</sup> this amendment to refs<span class='line-break'> </span>of Dec<sup>r</sup> 1862, to <a href='/pages/subjects/65224' title='Colburn, George W.'>Geo. W. Colburn's</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/65292' title='Lot 3260'>lot 3260</a>, con<span class='line-break'></span>taining 792 ft.- instead of<span class='line-break'> </span>[24?] x 33 as before. This suits <a href='/pages/subjects/65224' title='Colburn, George W.'>Mr<span class='line-break'> </span>Colburn</a> &amp; the requirements of the positions.</p>
<p>[diagram: lot measurements on <a href='/pages/subjects/61172' title='Eagle Avenue'>Eagle Avenue</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/61266' title='Raven Path'>Raven Path</a></p>
<p>Yours truly</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A. J. Coolidge</a> Sec.y</p>
<p><date when='1864-01-20'>Jany. 20, 1864</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/65213' title='Merrill, Lewis F.'>L. F. Merrill</a> Esq</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>The collector of our Treas<sup>r</sup><span class='line-break'> </span>brought the second bill of $89.94 to me yesterday, to<span class='line-break'> </span>inquire about the terms stated by you &amp; in the <span class='line-break'> </span>agreement for the purchase of your old <a href='/pages/subjects/65212' title='Lot 2297'>lot no.<span class='line-break'> </span>2297</a> for <a href='/pages/subjects/65211' title='Hemenway, Mary Tileston'>Mrs Hemenway</a> - and that was that<span class='line-break'> </span>all expenses were to be included in such pur<span class='line-break'></span>chase. I asked <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Dr Bigelow</a> the Pres<span class='line-break'></span>ident yesterday, if there was any such under<span class='line-break'></span>standing with you in any conversation that<span class='line-break'> </span>he had, and he replied, "none at all.'-<span class='line-break'> </span>that he began by offering you 50 cts.<span class='line-break'> </span>a foot for your land, and finally acceded<span class='line-break'> </span>to the price you named of $250<sup>00</sup>, which<span class='line-break'> </span>is 83 cts per foot. And his statement of what<span class='line-break'> </span>your proposed to do is corroborated by<span class='line-break'> </span>my own recollection of our conversation<span class='line-break'> </span>when I paid you the $250 &amp; took the</p>
<p>[You do to this agree?]</p>
<p>122</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133612">
<h3><a name="page-1133612">CB01_0123</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>transfer from you. And that is this <span class='line-break'></span>that you hardly knew what you should<span class='line-break'> </span>do — that you expected to remove the bodies<span class='line-break'> </span>to New Hampshire; but your wife, it seems<span class='line-break'> </span>from a subsequent conversation, was dis <span class='line-break'></span>satisfied with your selling the lot, and<span class='line-break'> </span>when I came to urge you to have the<span class='line-break'> </span>bodies removed, before winter, you were<span class='line-break'> </span>sorry you sold it, but promised to attend<span class='line-break'> </span>to the matter very soon. You will, perhaps,<span class='line-break'> </span>remember that you came to my office, &amp;<span class='line-break'> </span>proposed to go to Mt Auburn about it on<span class='line-break'> </span>a certain day: but a deep snow came,<span class='line-break'> </span>and nothing more was done. In order<span class='line-break'> </span>to get you to make the removal of the bodies,<span class='line-break'> </span>I told you, as instructed by <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Dr Bigelow</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>that if you would be expeditious about<span class='line-break'> </span>the removal, I did not doubt <a href='/pages/subjects/65211' title='Hemenway, Mary Tileston'>Mrs.<span class='line-break'> </span>Hemenway</a> would bear the expense<span class='line-break'> </span>of it. Nothing had even then, so long<span class='line-break'> </span>after the purchase, been said about your<span class='line-break'> </span>buying another lot and the lot fitted<span class='line-break'> </span>[?] for you: and it was with<span class='line-break'> </span>[missing line?][astonishment that?]<span class='line-break'> </span>I saw your name reported among<span class='line-break'> </span>the orders for deeds of new lots, last<span class='line-break'> </span>summer.</p>
<p>I do not see how you can have<span class='line-break'> </span>got the idea that the expense of fitting up<span class='line-break'> </span>a new lot for you in our Cemetery was to be<span class='line-break'> </span>borne by Mrs H. or the Corporation.  It<span class='line-break'> </span>was an outright purchase of your lot for<span class='line-break'> </span>$250, you to have liberty to remove to remove the fence<span class='line-break'> </span>and your dead: &amp; finally to hurry you this<span class='line-break'> </span>offer was made to bear the expense of removing the<span class='line-break'> </span>bodies. - So much for the <ins>bargain</ins>.</p>
<p>However, <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Dr Bigelow</a> recommends you<span class='line-break'> </span>to pay the bill, &amp; go to <a href='/pages/subjects/65211' title='Hemenway, Mary Tileston'>Mrs Mary Hem<span class='line-break'></span>enway</a>, 40 Mt Vernon St &amp; state the<span class='line-break'> </span>facts to her, of your removing for her accom<span class='line-break'></span>modation,— and he has no doubt she<span class='line-break'> </span>will be disposed to do what is fair in<span class='line-break'> </span>the matter.</p>
<p>Very respy. yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
<p>123</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133613">
<h3><a name="page-1133613">CB01_0124</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><date when='1864-01-20'>Jany. 20<sup>th</sup> 4</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/105156' title='Stafford, Mr.'>Mr. Safford</a>,</p>
<p>Dear Sir, your note of<span class='line-break'> </span>yesterday has come to hand: &amp; I send<span class='line-break'> </span>the blanks requested. The order<span class='line-break'> </span>for "Removal <ins>to</ins> the Cemetery" is of no<span class='line-break'> </span>consequence, as it is difficult to keep the<span class='line-break'> </span>distinction, so as to have all orders for <ins>re</ins>in--<span class='line-break'> </span>terment made outlaw, and I shall not<span class='line-break'> </span>print any more I send you is what remains<span class='line-break'> </span>of them.</p>
<p>The correction of <a href='/pages/subjects/65330' title='Lot 883'>lots 883</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/64822' title='Lot 885'>&amp; 885</a><span class='line-break'> </span>on the plan shall be attended to.—</p>
<p>I would like to have you [race?] over<span class='line-break'> </span>your entry books and see if your<span class='line-break'> </span>figures for the year agree with mine.</p>
<p>Whole no. internments 698, of which 116 are<span class='line-break'> </span>reinterments. (I generally consider the int. of soldiers brought<span class='line-break'> </span>home within a month or so, a <ins>1<sup>st int.</sup></ins>) No. depos. in <a href='/pages/subjects/57656' title='Receiving Tomb'>R. Tomb</a><span class='line-break'> </span>53: no. in <a href='/pages/subjects/61319' title='Public Lot'>Pub. Lots</a> 67.</p>
<p>Truly yours,<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a> Sec.y</p>
<p><date when='1864-01-20'>Jany. 20. 4</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/64135' title='Stephens, H. C.'>H. C. Stephens</a> Esq<span class='line-break'> </span>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>The Corporation is ready<span class='line-break'> </span>to receive the $400 stipulated for the<span class='line-break'> </span>perpetual care of <a href='/pages/subjects/65332' title='Lot 1673'>lot 1673</a> (<a href='/pages/subjects/64134' title='Baxter, Sarah'>Sarah Bax<span class='line-break'></span>ter's</a>) in Mt Auburn: and I sup<span class='line-break'></span>pose from what you said two<span class='line-break'> </span>months or so ago, you are<span class='line-break'> </span>ready to pay it.</p>
<p>I send you our form of donation<span class='line-break'> </span>in trust ready for execution. When<span class='line-break'> </span>you have paid over the amount<span class='line-break'> </span>to <a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'>Mr Bond</a>, Treas<sup>r</sup> at 167 Con<span class='line-break'></span>gress St., return the document with<span class='line-break'> </span>your signature &amp;c for completion &amp;<span class='line-break'> </span>record.</p>
<p>Yours truly</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A. J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Secy</p>
<p>124</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133614">
<h3><a name="page-1133614">CB01_0125</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><date when='1864-01-20'>Jany. 20. [186]4</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/65277' title='Drake, Jeremy'>Jeremy Drake</a> Esq<sup>r</sup></p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>I am informed by<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'><!--Winsor-->our Superinendent</a> that the repairs<span class='line-break'> </span>required to be made upon the lot of the<span class='line-break'> </span>late <a href='/pages/subjects/64082' title='Mumford, Sophia'>Mrs Mumford</a> (<a href='/pages/subjects/64083' title='Lot 126'>no 126</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/60336' title='Willow Avenue'>Willow Av<sup>e</sup></a>)<span class='line-break'> </span>before the Corporation would assume the contract<span class='line-break'> </span>for perpetual repair, were overlooked by him in<span class='line-break'> </span>the hurry of business last fall, although he had your<span class='line-break'> </span>order therefore.</p>
<p>It has occurred to me that the Corporation<span class='line-break'> </span>can as well receive the $300 and put it upon inter<span class='line-break'></span>est, subject to the completion of the repairs, which<span class='line-break'> </span>can be done in the Spring. If this is satisfac<span class='line-break'></span>tory to you, I will make out the document for it<span class='line-break'> </span>when you say so. Then there will be an ample<span class='line-break'> </span>fund at the head of 1864 to pay the bills of<span class='line-break'> </span>that year, &amp; probably a surplus. --</p>
<p>Yours truly</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a> Sec.y</p>
<p><date when='1864-01-27'>Jany. 27 [186]4</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'>Capt. D.L. Winsor</a>, Sup<sup>t</sup></p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/65333' title='Dehon, William'>William Dehon</a> Esq,<span class='line-break'> </span>the proprietor of the large <a href='/pages/subjects/65334' title='Lot 2337'>lot no. 2337</a> between<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/60005' title='Pyrola Path'>Pyrola<!--Path--></a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/61130' title='Bellwort Path'>Bellwort Paths</a> wishes to take<span class='line-break'> </span>and pay for the lot on the north side <span class='line-break'> </span>of <a href='/pages/subjects/60005' title='Pyrola Path'>Pyrola Path</a>, opposite to his lot, and<span class='line-break'> </span>situated between <a href='/pages/subjects/65335' title='Lot 218'>lots 218</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/65336' title='Lot 3279'>3279,</a> the latter<span class='line-break'> </span>belonging to <a href='/pages/subjects/65337' title='Tufts, Edwin O.'>Edwin O. Tufts</a>. - He wishes<span class='line-break'> </span>it for a friend. I think you said it<span class='line-break'> </span>was engaged to some one else - but if there<span class='line-break'> </span>has been no bargain which can be consid<span class='line-break'></span>ered as a sale, Mr D. would seem to have<span class='line-break'> </span>the prior claim, as he is ready to pay for it.</p>
<p>Will you please see to the enclosed<span class='line-break'> </span>internment order - common grave - funeral<span class='line-break'> </span>in <a href='/pages/subjects/53239' title='Bigelow Chapel'><!--Bigelow-->Chapel</a> at 12 M. Friday. -</p>
<p>Yours truly</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
<p>125</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133615">
<h3><a name="page-1133615">CB01_0126</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><date when='1864-01-28'>Jany 28.</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/65338' title='Dyer, Elisha'>Elisha Dyer</a> Esq<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54378' title='Providence, RI'>Providence R.I.</a></p>
<p>My dear Sir,</p>
<p>I owe you a dozen<span class='line-break'> </span>apologies for neglecting your request<span class='line-break'> </span>for information &amp; forms so long: -- but [have?]<span class='line-break'> </span>hardly known for a month whether<span class='line-break'> </span>I was in or out of the body, such has<span class='line-break'> </span>been the load of work upon me. I shall<span class='line-break'> </span>be so occupied for a week or ten days.</p>
<p>After that, if I can do you service<span class='line-break'> </span>I shall be most happy to comply with<span class='line-break'> </span>your wish, if such matters will then<span class='line-break'> </span>be seasonable. Please inform.</p>
<p>Very respy. yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Secretary</p>
<p><date when='1864-02-03'>Feby. 3 [186]4</date></p>
<p>Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/64145' title='Vinal, R. A.'>R.A. <!--Vinal--></a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/64146' title='Vinal, Quincy Adams'>Q.A. Vinal</a>,</p>
<p>Gentlemen,</p>
<p>I have written you<span class='line-break'> </span>twice before that there is a difficulty<span class='line-break'> </span>and contradiction about the num<span class='line-break'></span>bers applied to your lots in the<span class='line-break'> </span>Cemetery -- <a href='/pages/subjects/64147' title='Lot 2767'>2767,</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/65340' title='Lot 2768'>2768,</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/65341' title='Lot 2769'>2769,</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/64152' title='Lot 2770'>2770,</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/64148' title='Lot 2771'>2771</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>which I wish you to enable<span class='line-break'> </span>us to clear up. To say nothing of<span class='line-break'> </span>the error upon our present plan,<span class='line-break'> </span>we are preparing a lithograph plan<span class='line-break'> </span>for the proprietors, as it is to be<span class='line-break'> </span>regretted that any known error<span class='line-break'> </span>should be perpetuated. You can<span class='line-break'> </span>of course, set it straight, if you<span class='line-break'> </span>choose - and I trust you will do so.</p>
<p>Yours respy</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
<p>126</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133616">
<h3><a name="page-1133616">CB01_0127</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><date when='1864-02-03'>Feby. 3 1864</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/67138' title='Renton, Peter'>Dr Renton</a></p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>What progress,<span class='line-break'> </span>if any, do you make in<span class='line-break'> </span>the matter of <a href='/pages/subjects/65930' title='Lot 1349'>lots numbered<span class='line-break'> </span>1349,</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/65931' title='Lot 1350'>1350,</a> &amp;c. on <a href='/pages/subjects/61250' title='Oxalis Path'>Oxalis Path</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>in the Cemetery. When we last<span class='line-break'> </span>met, (it being also the first time)<span class='line-break'> </span>I believe you proposed to go<span class='line-break'> </span>forward, &amp; ascertain and adjust<span class='line-break'> </span>the difficulty - not doubting that<span class='line-break'> </span>such a result could be attained.<span class='line-break'> </span>I shall be happy to learn<span class='line-break'> </span>of that result.</p>
<p>Yours very resp.y</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y Mt. A.C.</p>
<p><date when='1864-02-18'>Feby. 18. 1864</date></p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>In <date when='1862-07'>July 1862</date>, you reported the<span class='line-break'> </span>condition of <a href='/pages/subjects/57820' title='Lot 497'>lot <ins>497,</ins></a> <ins><a href='/pages/subjects/60336' title='Willow Avenue'>Willow Av<sup>e</sup></a></ins>, belonging to the<span class='line-break'> </span>estate of the late <a href='/pages/subjects/53154' title='Lombard, Israel'>Israel Lombard</a>, with a view to the<span class='line-break'> </span>acceptance of a bequest in his will. As the lot<span class='line-break'> </span>has undergone extensive repairs since then, will<span class='line-break'> </span>you please report on it again, as the parties<span class='line-break'> </span>now wish to finish the arrangement.</p>
<p>Please also report upon lot of late <a href='/pages/subjects/65932' title='Fiske, Benjamin'>Benj.<span class='line-break'> </span>Fiske</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/65933' title='Lot 203'>no 203,</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/58791' title='Central Avenue'>Central Av<sup>e</sup></a> - and return<span class='line-break'> </span>to me this week, as they have a family meeting<span class='line-break'> </span>next week, and wish to place our proposition<span class='line-break'> </span>before the heirs.</p>
<p>Will you have the enclosed memo.<span class='line-break'> </span>handed to <a href='/pages/subjects/65934' title='Safford, Edward'>Edward Safford</a>?</p>
<p>Truly yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'>Capt. D.L. Winsor</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Supt Mt Auburn</p>
<p>127</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133617">
<h3><a name="page-1133617">CB01_0128</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><date when='1864-02-01'>Feby. 1, 1864</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/65277' title='Drake, Jeremy'>Jeremy Drake Esq</a></p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>I have conferred<span class='line-break'> </span>with the Committee on Lots about<span class='line-break'> </span>the matter inquired about, and<span class='line-break'> </span>they are willing to accept the<span class='line-break'> </span>$300 and allow you to pay the<span class='line-break'> </span>bill of $30 as estimated by the<span class='line-break'> </span>Sup<sup>t</sup> for the present repair<span class='line-break'> </span>of the lot. - So I will be ready<span class='line-break'> </span>at any time to attend to the<span class='line-break'> </span>execution of the papers which I<span class='line-break'> </span>herewith send for your signature.</p>
<p>The money will be payable to the<span class='line-break'> </span>Treasurer, - <a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'>Geo. W<sup>m</sup> Bond</a>, 167<span class='line-break'> </span>Congress St. --</p>
<p>Yours truly</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a> Sec.y</p>
<p><date when='1864-02-20'>Feby. 20 1864</date></p>
<p>I send the supt's reports upon<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/65933' title='lot 203'>lot 203</a> owned by heirs of <a href='/pages/subjects/65932' title='Fiske, Benjamin'>Benj.<span class='line-break'> </span>Fiske</a>, and of <a href='/pages/subjects/57820' title='Lot 497'>497,</a> by heirs of<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/53154' title='Lombard, Israel'>Israel Lombard</a>, in both<span class='line-break'> </span>of which cases the parties wish<span class='line-break'> </span>the estimate of Com<sup>ee</sup>on Lots<span class='line-break'> </span>for contracts for perpetual<span class='line-break'> </span>repair. -</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53154' title='Lombard, Israel'>Mr Lombard</a> left $300 by<span class='line-break'> </span>his will for the repair of his lot,<span class='line-break'> </span>but did not explain <ins>perpetual</ins><span class='line-break'> </span>repair: but the Trustees of his estate<span class='line-break'> </span>desire the guaranty.</p>
<p>Very resp.y</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
<p>128</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133618">
<h3><a name="page-1133618">CB01_0129</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><date when='1864-02-26'>Feby. 26 1864</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/65935' title='Blanchard, Nathan'>Nathan Blanchard</a> Esq<sup>r</sup><span class='line-break'> </span>Ex<sup>or</sup> Estate of <a href='/pages/subjects/65932' title='Fiske, Benjamin'>Benj. Fiske</a>,</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>At the request of <a href='/pages/subjects/65932' title='Fiske, Benjamin'>Mr<span class='line-break'> </span>B. Fiske</a>, I have caused a report to<span class='line-break'> </span>be made upon <a href='/pages/subjects/65933' title='Lot 203'>lot no 203</a> in our<span class='line-break'> </span>Cemetery belonging to the late <a href='/pages/subjects/65932' title='Fiske, Benjamin'>Mr Fiske's</a><span class='line-break'> </span>estate, and have obtained the estimate<span class='line-break'> </span>of the Com<sup>ee</sup> on Lots for what sum the Corpor<span class='line-break'></span>ation will <ins>guarantee the perpetual repair</ins><span class='line-break'> </span>of said lot, - which is $500. -</p>
<p>You will understand, of course, this does<span class='line-break'> </span>not prevent the heirs from paying [to?]<span class='line-break'> </span>the amt. named in the will, without<span class='line-break'> </span>requiring the guaranty, if they prefer to<span class='line-break'> </span>take that course. In the one case the re<span class='line-break'></span>pair fund alone is held responsible; in the other<span class='line-break'> </span>the whole property of the Corporation, if the particular<span class='line-break'> </span>fund fails.</p>
<p>Very respy,</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a>, Sec.y</p>
<p><date when='1864-02-26'>Feby. 26 1864</date></p>
<p>Messrs <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/65936' title='Whitney, Israel'>Israel Whitney</a><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/65937' title='Washburn, Emory'>Emory Washburn</a> <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/65938' title='Lombard, Dwight Boyden'>D.B. Lombard</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Ex<sup>ors</sup></p>
<p>Gentlemen,</p>
<p>The Com<sup>ee</sup>on Lots<span class='line-break'> </span>in our Cemetery have authorized<span class='line-break'> </span>me to notify you that the<span class='line-break'> </span>Corporation will assume the<span class='line-break'> </span><ins>perpetual</ins> repair, under the guaranty<span class='line-break'> </span>contract, of <a href='/pages/subjects/57820' title='Lot 497'>lot no. 497</a> in the<span class='line-break'> </span>Cemetery, belonging to the estate<span class='line-break'> </span>of the late <a href='/pages/subjects/53154' title='Lombard, Israel'>Israel Lombard</a><span class='line-break'> </span>for the sum of five hundred<span class='line-break'> </span>dollars ($500).</p>
<p>Very respy<span class='line-break'> </span>Your Ob<sup>t</sup> Serv<sup>t</sup></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A. J. Coolidge</a> Sec.y</p>
<p>129</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133619">
<h3><a name="page-1133619">CB01_0130</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><date when='1864-02-29'>Feb.y 29, 1864</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'>Capt. D.L. Winsor</a></p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>Please report<span class='line-break'> </span>upon <a href='/pages/subjects/64829' title='Lot 2113'>lot no 2113</a>, on <a href='/pages/subjects/61222' title='Lime Avenue'>Lime Av<sup>e</sup></a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>belonging to heirs of late <a href='/pages/subjects/64830' title='Gassett, Henry'>Henry <span class='line-break'> </span>Gassett</a> for Perpetual Repair.<span class='line-break'> </span>Mr Gassett, the representative informs<span class='line-break'> </span>me that there are several brick<span class='line-break'> </span>graves or catacombs which have<span class='line-break'> </span>cost quite a sum. - If you<span class='line-break'> </span>do not know about these, or<span class='line-break'> </span>cannot leave the facts at Mt Auburn,<span class='line-break'> </span>I will ask him for the under<span class='line-break'></span>ground data.</p>
<p>Truly yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a></p>
<p><date when='1864-04-01'>March 1, 1864</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'>Capt. D. L. Winsor</a></p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>I have just rec<sup>d</sup><span class='line-break'> </span>a note from <a href='/pages/subjects/65940' title='Osgood, Samuel S.'>Sam<sup>l</sup> S. Osgood</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Esq of <a href='/pages/subjects/64140' title='New York, NY'>New York City</a>, the Prop<sup>r</sup><span class='line-break'> </span>of <a href='/pages/subjects/65941' title='Lot 2151'>lot no. 2151</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/61244' title='Orange Path'>Orange Path</a>,  -<span class='line-break'> </span>where the broken or unstrung hasp<span class='line-break'> </span>surmounts the monument, -<span class='line-break'> </span>in which he desires to know for what<span class='line-break'> </span>sum the Corporation will keep his lot<span class='line-break'> </span>in perpetual repair. Will you please<span class='line-break'> </span>report upon this lot also.</p>
<p>He says he wishes the grave kept in<span class='line-break'> </span>good order -- the single rail around it<span class='line-break'> </span>painted, but does not wish flowers<span class='line-break'> </span>planted in front.</p>
<p>Yours truly</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
<p>130</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133620">
<h3><a name="page-1133620">CB01_0131</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><date when='1864-03-01'>March 1<sup>st</sup>, 1864</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/65940' title='Osgood, Samuel S.'>S. S. Osgood</a> Esq<span class='line-break'> </span>54 East 20<sup>th</sup> St. <a href='/pages/subjects/64140' title='New York, NY'>New York</a></p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>Yours of 27th postmarked<span class='line-break'> </span>yesterday, has come to hand. I have<span class='line-break'> </span>written the Superintendent to have<span class='line-break'> </span>the necessary survey of your lot,<span class='line-break'> </span>and having gone through the<span class='line-break'> </span>regular form of ascertaining,<span class='line-break'> </span>for what sum the Corporation<span class='line-break'> </span>will contract with you for<span class='line-break'> </span>perpetual repair. I will<span class='line-break'> </span>acquaint you with the<span class='line-break'> </span>result, which will require a few days.</p>
<p>Very truly yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
<p><date when='1864-04-02'>March 2<sup>d</sup>, 1864</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'>Geo. W<sup>m</sup> Bond</a> Esq<sup>r</sup></p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>It is proper that I<span class='line-break'> </span>should apprize of the following matter<span class='line-break'> </span>acted upon by the Trustees at their meeting<span class='line-break'> </span>fri., organization on the 22<sup>d</sup> inst. -- I should<span class='line-break'> </span>have done so immediately, had I not<span class='line-break'> </span>been very much pressed with other matters<span class='line-break'> </span>for a week past, and under the impression<span class='line-break'> </span>that no instant action will be had: --</p>
<p>"Voted that the question of the<span class='line-break'> </span>expediency of uniting the duties of Secre<span class='line-break'></span>tary and Treasurer in one person,<span class='line-break'> </span>be referred to a Committee of three<span class='line-break'> </span>to report upon as soon as they may<span class='line-break'> </span>deem it expedient.</p>
<p>Upon nomination by the Chairman</p>
<p>Messrs<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Rand</a><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54832' title='Austin, Edward'>Austin</a><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/65944' title='Sleeper, Jacob'>Sleeper</a></p>
<p>were so chosen</p>
<p>131</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133621">
<h3><a name="page-1133621">CB01_0132</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>Upon motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Mr Rand</a>,</p>
<p>Voted that the election of<span class='line-break'> </span>persons to fill the offices of<span class='line-break'> </span>Secretary and Treasurer be post<span class='line-break'></span>poned until the report of the<span class='line-break'> </span>Committee just appointed."</p>
<p>Truly yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
<p><date when='1864-03-04'>March 4, 1864</date></p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>I have got a report<span class='line-break'> </span>upon your lot from <a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'>Capt. Winsor</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>our Superintendent, in which he<span class='line-break'> </span>says -- "there are some catacomb graves,<span class='line-break'> </span>but no one here knows just how<span class='line-break'> </span>many."</p>
<p>Will you please refer to your<span class='line-break'> </span>bills and give me the number<span class='line-break'> </span>and cost, that I may add<span class='line-break'> </span>it to the report to send in to<span class='line-break'> </span>the Com<sup>ee</sup> on Lots.</p>
<p>Very respy yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A. J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/64830' title='Gassett, Henry'>Henry Gassett</a> Esq<sup>r</sup></p>
<p>132</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133622">
<h3><a name="page-1133622">CB01_0133</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><date when='1864-03-07'>March 7, 4</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'>Geo W<sup>m</sup> Bond Esq</a><sup>r</sup>, Treas<sup>r</sup></p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>At the meeting of<span class='line-break'> </span>the Trustees of Mount Auburn held<span class='line-break'> </span>this day, the following votes were<span class='line-break'> </span>adopted: --</p>
<p>"That the Committee on the prosecu<span class='line-break'></span>tion of the claim against <a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'>Mr Mann</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>be instructed to discontinue the suit<span class='line-break'> </span>against him. --</p>
<p>That the Treasurer be directed<span class='line-break'> </span>to refund to <a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'>Mr Mann</a> the sum of<span class='line-break'> </span>one thousand dollars ($1000)<span class='line-break'> </span>deposited in his hands, without<span class='line-break'> </span>interest." --</p>
<p>Respectfully yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
<p><date when='1864-03-09'>March 9<sup>th</sup>, 1864</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/65945' title='Browne, Edward I.'>Edw<sup>d</sup> I. Browne</a> Esq</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>I enclose a rough<span class='line-break'> </span>draft (so far as the copy is concerned,<span class='line-break'> </span>best expressed with a good deal of<span class='line-break'> </span>care and after much study,) of such<span class='line-break'> </span>a contract as I understand to be<span class='line-break'> </span>in accordance with <a href='/pages/subjects/54936' title='Appleton, William'>Mr Appleton's</a> wish.</p>
<p>I have endeavored to dovetail the<span class='line-break'> </span>"Donation in Trust" for the <ins>care</ins> of his lot<span class='line-break'> </span>with the "Reconveyance of the lot in trust",<span class='line-break'> </span>(which I told him he could not easily do,)<span class='line-break'> </span>for the sake of having the entire contract appear<span class='line-break'> </span>in one or more places, without the necessity of<span class='line-break'> </span>reference from one to the other. --</p>
<p>I have queried opposite to one or two<span class='line-break'> </span>blanks, and other places where he might<span class='line-break'> </span>not possibly wish to express what is ex<span class='line-break'></span>pressed. The blank for price, I</p>
<p>133</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133623">
<h3><a name="page-1133623">CB01_0134</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>have thought he had better leave un<span class='line-break'></span>filled for the present, as I suggested<span class='line-break'> </span>to you the Committee might, upon reviewing<span class='line-break'> </span>the numerous details, respecting which nothing<span class='line-break'> </span>was said to them before their estimate of<span class='line-break'> </span>fifteen hundred dollars for the care of <span class='line-break'> </span>the lots, - think that the sum was<span class='line-break'> </span>insufficient. I know that this<span class='line-break'> </span>sum is low when compared with<span class='line-break'> </span>some other trusts assumed, and<span class='line-break'> </span>none, as yet, is loaded with so many<span class='line-break'> </span>provisions. I should advise <a href='/pages/subjects/54936' title='Appleton, William'>Mr<span class='line-break'> </span>Appleton</a> to get expressed about what<span class='line-break'> </span>he desires, and I will submit the<span class='line-break'> </span>proposed contract to the Committee.<span class='line-break'> </span>Perhaps they will not wish to <span class='line-break'> </span>change the sum - perhaps they will:<span class='line-break'> </span>but I doubt not, they will be<span class='line-break'> </span>reasonable in their views.</p>
<p>I will confer with you or <a href='/pages/subjects/54936' title='Appleton, William'>Mr<span class='line-break'> </span>Appleton</a> at any time about what<span class='line-break'> </span>I have written.</p>
<p>Very truly yours,</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A. J. Coolidge</a></p>
<p><date when='1864-03-10'>March 10, 1864</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P. Curtis Esq</a><sup>r</sup>, Chairman Com. on Lots.</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>Will the Committee please<span class='line-break'> </span>consider the sums for which they will<span class='line-break'> </span>recommend the guaranty of perpetual repair<span class='line-break'> </span>of <a href='/pages/subjects/64829' title='Lot 2113'>lots 2113,</a> belonging to the heirs of the<span class='line-break'> </span>late <a href='/pages/subjects/64830' title='Gassett, Henry'>Henry Gassett</a>, and <a href='/pages/subjects/65941' title='Lot 2151'>2151,</a> belonging<span class='line-break'> </span>to <a href='/pages/subjects/65940' title='Osgood, Samuel S.'>Sam<sup>l</sup> S. Osgood</a>, of <a href='/pages/subjects/64140' title='New York, NY'>New York</a>, hus<span class='line-break'></span>band of the lamented poetess.</p>
<p>I send the reports of the Super<span class='line-break'></span>intendent: and have added to<span class='line-break'> </span>his report upon the Gassett lot (the<span class='line-break'> </span><ins>underground</ins> condition of which he was<span class='line-break'> </span>ignorant - the work having been done in 1853<span class='line-break'> </span>and 1854) the several items of cost<span class='line-break'> </span>of lot and appartenances as appear<span class='line-break'> </span>from the bills exhibited to me by Mr<span class='line-break'> </span>Gassett, the Representative.</p>
<p>Very respy yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
<p>134</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133624">
<h3><a name="page-1133624">CB01_0135</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><date when='1864-03-11'>March 11 [186]4</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53153' title='Baldwin, Henry'>Henry Baldwin</a> Esq</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>I send the three<span class='line-break'> </span>deeds of lots in Mt Auburn, be -<span class='line-break'> </span>longing to Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/57320' title='Fulke, Granville'>Granville Fulke</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/53156' title='Hollis, John W.'>John W. Hollis</a>  &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/57321' title='Baldwin, Life'>Life Baldwin</a>.<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/57816' title='Lot 3034'>Nos. 3034,</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/57817' title='Lot 3035'>3035,</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/57818' title='Lot 3036'>3036.—</a></p>
<p>Please send me $6.50 for<span class='line-break'> </span>same— viz— $5. for recording<span class='line-break'> </span>the transfer back to the Corporation of<span class='line-break'> </span>making &amp; recording these three deeds<span class='line-break'> </span>and $1.50 paid out for stamps.</p>
<p>Truly yours<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec<sup>y</sup></p>
<p><date when='1864-03-15'>March 15 4</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P. Curtis</a> Esq<sup>r</sup></p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>The executors of<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/53154' title='Lombard, Israel'>Israel Lombard</a> decline, as I<span class='line-break'> </span>am informed by <a href='/pages/subjects/65937' title='Washburn, Emory'>Gov<sup>r</sup> Washburn</a>, the<span class='line-break'> </span>proposition of the Com<sup>ee</sup> on Lots— to guaranty<span class='line-break'> </span>the perpetual care of <a href='/pages/subjects/57820' title='Lot 497'>lot No. 497</a> for the<span class='line-break'> </span>sum of $500. for want of funds at their con--<span class='line-break'> </span>trol for the purpose—</p>
<p>And they wish to know if the<span class='line-break'> </span>Corporation will accept the bequest<span class='line-break'> </span>of $300. upon the terms named<span class='line-break'> </span>in the will.</p>
<p>I send you a copy of this clause.</p>
<p>Respectfully<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Collidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec<sup>y</sup></p>
<p>135</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />

<h3><a name="page-1133625">CB01_0136_1</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><date when='1864-03-19'>March 19 4 [1864]</date></p>
<p>Rev Simon [Barnes?]<span class='line-break'> </span>[...?]</p>

I [?]<span class='line-break'> </span>gladly comply, but [the?] measure will<span class='line-break'> </span>wish, conformity to our regular practices<span class='line-break'> </span>[that our?] of you should [?] in the<span class='line-break'> </span>certificate which he gave you, [?]<span class='line-break'> </span>[?], and receipt [?]<span class='line-break'> </span>[?] the deeds. Either of you [?]<span class='line-break'> </span>[?]<span class='line-break'> </span>[?] you [?] 16<sup>th</sup><span class='line-break'> </span>[?]</p>

<p><date when='1864-03-19'>March 19 4 [1864]</date></p>
<p>Messers <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/65936' title='Whitney, Israel'><!--Israel-->Whitney</a><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/65937' title='Washburn, Emory'><!--Emory-->Washburn</a> &amp;<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/65938' title='Lombard, Dwight Boyden'><!--D. B.-->Lombard</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Ex<sup>[?]</sup> [?] Lombard</p>
<p>Gentlemen,<span class='line-break'> </span>I am directed by<span class='line-break'> </span>the [?] to notify you<span class='line-break'> </span>[?]<span class='line-break'> </span>[?]<span class='line-break'> </span>come to be applied[?]<span class='line-break'> </span>[?]</p>
<p>Under [t/his?] decision then your<span class='line-break'> </span>can pay in [?]<span class='line-break'> </span>[?]. I send you <span class='line-break'> </span>usual form of instrument or [?]<span class='line-break'> </span>donation in trust. Please [?]<span class='line-break'> </span>same get the Treaturer's receipt<span class='line-break'> </span>[?]<span class='line-break'> </span>[?]</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y.</p>
<p>136</p>

</div>

<div id="page-1133626">
<h3><a name="page-1133626">CB01_0137_1</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a>, <date when='1864-03-22'>March 22 1864</date></p>
<p>Rev. Simon [Barrows?]<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/65949' title='Des Moines, IA'>Des Moines, Iowa</a></p>
<p>My dear Sir,</p>
<p>Your old friend, <span class='line-break'> </span>apparently unknown to you as "the Secretary<span class='line-break'> </span>Mount Auburn", which office he has <span class='line-break'> </span>held for the last nine years, has, by<span class='line-break'> </span>the [?]mail which brings this to you <span class='line-break'> </span>enclosed our last catalogue of the Cemetery,<span class='line-break'> </span>printed in 1860, and, [?]you <span class='line-break'> </span>[?]as far as possible, has [insisted?] are old [?] of 1854, [?] being <span class='line-break'> </span>entirely exhausted. We have a new <span class='line-break'> </span>[?]  preparing on a much larger scale, and I regret that I [?]  <span class='line-break'> </span>[?] you one with many [?] and additions. Still, <span class='line-break'> </span>the general features of our [?] shown on that one [?]</p>
<p>The [?]<span class='line-break'> </span>five [?] with [?]<span class='line-break'> </span>[?]<span class='line-break'> </span>[?]<span class='line-break'> </span>[?]<span class='line-break'> </span>[?]<span class='line-break'> </span>[?]<span class='line-break'> </span>you will [?]<span class='line-break'> </span>preserve any [?]<span class='line-break'> </span>[?]<span class='line-break'> </span>[chases?] today, [selects?] a [?]<span class='line-break'> </span>[?] (to illustrate) [?] <a href='/pages/subjects/65950' title='Lot 1151'>number<span class='line-break'> </span>1151</a> the next [?]<span class='line-break'> </span>selects, we will [?]<span class='line-break'> </span>and [?] <a href='/pages/subjects/65951' title='Lot 1152'>number<span class='line-break'> </span>1152</a> &amp; so on. The [?]<span class='line-break'> </span>in the order in which he [?]<span class='line-break'> </span>of [that?] [?] it may happen to be [?]<span class='line-break'> </span>[?] annual correspondance<span class='line-break'> </span>[?] your brother  [?] <a href='/pages/subjects/65952' title='Souix City, IA'>Souix City</a> [?]<span class='line-break'> </span>[?], father's [lived?] in [?] County<span class='line-break'> </span>137</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133627">
<h3><a name="page-1133627">CB01_0138_1</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>I am happy to hear from you, &amp; <span class='line-break'> </span>see that you are one of the [educated?]<span class='line-break'> </span>of "the great Wesh": and approve your<span class='line-break'> </span>further enterprize of giving your<span class='line-break'> </span>neighbors a decent and Christian burial.</p>
<p>I shall be happy to hear from<span class='line-break'> </span>you at anytime, and to do any<span class='line-break'> </span>thing that may be in my power<span class='line-break'> </span>to and in your place for a <span class='line-break'> </span>Cemetery.</p>
<p>I am very truly yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A. J. Coolidge</a></p>
<p>P. S. <a href='/pages/subjects/65957' title='Henshaw, Mrs.'>Mrs Henshaw</a> &amp; all her ought<span class='line-break'> </span>still line, although the old lady is<span class='line-break'> </span>quite blend.</p>
<p><date when='1864-03-22'>March 22 [1864]</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/64830' title='Gassett, Henry'>Henry Gassett</a> Esq<sup>r</sup></p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
