<p>better for her to know your wishes now, than to defer the<span class='line-break'> </span>subject, when a renewal of it might be less pleasant,<span class='line-break'> </span>especially, if you obtained the impression that there was<span class='line-break'> </span>a careless disregard of your <ins>rights</ins>, which I cannot<span class='line-break'> </span>perceive is <ins>now</ins> the case.</p>
<p>Please state your views and wishes as fully as you<span class='line-break'> </span>have time to do. I have never seen or heard of <a href='/pages/subjects/66046' title='Hallet, Esther'>Mrs H.<!--Hallet--></a><span class='line-break'> </span>before, but should infer from her appearance her<span class='line-break'> </span>entire respectability. Upon inquiry of her, I find she is<span class='line-break'> </span>the daughter of <a href='/pages/subjects/66048' title='Stone, George Washington'>G.W. Stone,</a> Esquire, a lawyer in the town of <a href='/pages/subjects/66049' title='Cabot, VT'>Cabot,<span class='line-break'> </span>Vermont</a>.</p>
<p>If you consent to the interment of the child, please<span class='line-break'> </span>sign the accompanying order, and send me. --</p>
<p>I am very resp.y your Ob<sup>t</sup> Serv<sup>t</sup></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a></p>
<p>P.S. The questions are -<span class='line-break'></span>1<sup>st</sup> Shall the child remain?<span class='line-break'> </span>2<sup>d</sup> If not, do you consent to the removal of father &amp; child?<span class='line-break'> </span>3<sup>d</sup> Do you consent that <a href='/pages/subjects/66046' title='Hallet, Esther'>Mrs Esther Hallet</a> shall have burial there?</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133654">
<h3><a name="page-1133654">CB01_0165</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>165</p>
<p>33 School St. <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a> <date when='1864-08-10'>Aug. 10, 1864</date><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/66046' title='Hallet, Esther'>Mrs Esther Hallet</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/66049' title='Cabot, VT'>Cabot, Vt</a>.</p>
<p>Dear Madam,</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/66039' title='Green, Elizabeth T.'>Mrs Green</a> called at<span class='line-break'> </span>my office last evening, the day of your departure, while<span class='line-break'> </span>I was writing to her at <a href='/pages/subjects/66040' title='Worcester, MA'>Worcester</a>.  She was in <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a> or<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/60012' title='Winchester, MA'>Winchester</a>, and consequently did not receive my letter.<span class='line-break'> </span>She came in as soon as her husband wrote her that<span class='line-break'> </span>my letter had been received.</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/66039' title='Green, Elizabeth T.'>Mrs Green</a>, although evidently having strong<span class='line-break'> </span>feeling in reference to matters alluded to by yourself,<span class='line-break'> </span>appeared to hear what I had to say with calmness,<span class='line-break'> </span>and came to her conclusions with deliberation.</p>
<p>She is perfectly willing that the remains of the child<span class='line-break'> </span>should lie in the <a href='/pages/subjects/66042' title='Lot 2603'>lot (2603)</a> or be removed from it, <span class='line-break'> </span>as you prefer.</p>
<p>She is unwilling -- and will never give her consent --<span class='line-break'> </span>to have the body of <a href='/pages/subjects/66041' title='Hallet, Ezekiel, Jr.'>Ezekiel Hallet Jr.</a> removed from the lot.</p>
<p>Upon the 3<sup>d</sup> point, whether she would consent to your<span class='line-break'> </span>having a personal right there for yourself,  I do not think<span class='line-break'> </span>she is yet prepared to give you any pledge for it, or<span class='line-break'> </span>to absolutely deny you that right.</p>
<p>She says she does not wish to carry animosities<span class='line-break'> </span>beyond the grave, and, so far as she personally is<span class='line-break'> </span>concerned, it would make no difference:  but she<span class='line-break'> </span>thinks there are others who would object, at least<span class='line-break'> </span>as matters now stand.  She cannot tell what she</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133655">
<h3><a name="page-1133655">CB01_0166</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>166</p>
<p>might do, if she were to survive you, which is<span class='line-break'> </span>hardly probable in the ordinary course of events, but it<span class='line-break'> </span>is entirely possible.  My own impression is that if<span class='line-break'> </span>the question were to arise today, while you are the<span class='line-break'> </span>widow of <a href='/pages/subjects/66041' title='Hallet, Ezekiel, Jr.'>Mr Hallet</a>, she would not refuse, and<span class='line-break'> </span>that perhaps might be the case twenty years hence if you<span class='line-break'> </span>still remained his widow, and the request was made<span class='line-break'> </span>in your behalf, there still being room in the lot.</p>
<p>But, the more I think of that point, the more<span class='line-break'> </span>I am convinced it is rather an impracticable ques-<span class='line-break'></span>tion for you.  You are yet young, and the chances<span class='line-break'> </span>are very strong that you will marry again. If<span class='line-break'> </span>that <ins>should</ins> be the case, it would, in my judge-<span class='line-break'></span>ment, put at rest all anxiety -- in your mind on that<span class='line-break'> </span>point; and your fortunes would be as likely to be cast elsewhere<span class='line-break'> </span>as in this vicinity.  Indeed, if you should remain un-<span class='line-break'></span>married for some time, I think it more than probable that<span class='line-break'> </span>your wishes would change on this point.  I regard you,<span class='line-break'> </span>at present, unfitted to settle so uncertain a point as this<span class='line-break'> </span>for all time.</p>
<p>I have looked at the plan of the grounds about this lot and<span class='line-break'> </span>there is no more land that can be added to the lot.</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/66039' title='Green, Elizabeth T.'>Mrs Green</a> tells me that <a href='/pages/subjects/66041' title='Hallet, Ezekiel, Jr.'>Mr Hallet</a> <ins>never did</ins> pay for the<span class='line-break'> </span>lot -- that <a href='/pages/subjects/66043' title='Hallet, Elizabeth D.'>Mrs Hallet</a> and herself paid for it, and it belongs to her<span class='line-break'> </span>no less from purchase than as heir.--</p>
<p>The result then is -- if you are willing <a href='/pages/subjects/66039' title='Green, Elizabeth T.'>Mrs Green</a> is also<span class='line-break'> </span>willing to let things remain where they are now.  She is unwilling that<span class='line-break'> </span>any more interments should be made there without her order.  She<span class='line-break'> </span>will probably remain here all this week.  If you have anything further you <span class='line-break'> </span>wish to say, &amp; will write me at once, I will confer further with her before her leaving.</p>
<p>Yours resp.y <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A. J. Coolidge</a></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133656">
<h3><a name="page-1133656">CB01_0167</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><date when='1864-09-15'>Aug. 15 [186]4</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/66039' title='Green, Elizabeth T.'>Mrs E.T. Green</a></p>
<p>Dear Madam,</p>
<p>I have, two<span class='line-break'> </span>or three hours since, rec<sup>d</sup> a note<span class='line-break'> </span>from <a href='/pages/subjects/66046' title='Hallet, Esther'>Mrs Hallet</a>, at <a href='/pages/subjects/66049' title='Cabot, VT'>Cabot, Vt</a>.<span class='line-break'> </span>the result of which is that she<span class='line-break'> </span>is determined to have transferred<span class='line-break'> </span>from <a href='/pages/subjects/66042' title='Lot 2603'>lot 2603</a> both child and<span class='line-break'> </span>husband, if the law will allow.<span class='line-break'> </span>She appeals to the Trustees, and<span class='line-break'> </span>will have nothing to do with <a href='/pages/subjects/66042' title='Lot 2603'>lot 2603</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>further than to have the remains<span class='line-break'> </span>of the child and of <a href='/pages/subjects/66041' title='Hallet, Ezekiel, Jr.'>Mr Hallet</a><span class='line-break'> </span>removed therefrom, if she can<span class='line-break'> </span>compel or procure it.</p>
<p>I shall not probably reply<span class='line-break'> </span>to her for the present. I under--<span class='line-break'> </span>stand you are just leaving <span class='line-break'> </span>for home, and would<span class='line-break'> </span>send her note to you to read,<span class='line-break'> </span>but think, upon the whole, you<span class='line-break'> </span>would feel as well not to see<span class='line-break'> </span>it.</p>
<p>I presume nothing will be done<span class='line-break'> </span>at present. -- If you should,<span class='line-break'> </span>upon reviewing the matter, think it<span class='line-break'> </span>the best way to get rid of a<span class='line-break'> </span>troublesome subject, you can<span class='line-break'> </span>communicate further with me.</p>
<p>Truly yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A. J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
<p>167<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133657">
<h3><a name="page-1133657">CB01_0168</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><date when='1864-08-16'>Aug. 16 [186]4</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/66056' title='Shimmin, Charles F.'>Cha<sup>s</sup>. F. Shimmin</a> Esq.</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>Your deed had<span class='line-break'> </span>not come to me when I saw you the other<span class='line-break'> </span>day. Since then it was handed in for record<span class='line-break'> </span>together with a very scaly looking deed from<span class='line-break'> </span>Garder to <a href='/pages/subjects/66057' title='Hood, Mrs.'>Mrs Hood</a>. -- As you executed<span class='line-break'> </span>it as the Ex<sup>or</sup>of <a href='/pages/subjects/66058' title='Parkman, Mary George'>Mrs Parkman</a>, I feared<span class='line-break'> </span>you had made an error therein and went to<span class='line-break'> </span>the Probate office here to see if I could trace<span class='line-break'> </span>the title. Not finding it, &amp; remembering being<span class='line-break'> </span>once shown a place in <a href='/pages/subjects/60948' title='Brighton, MA'>Brighton</a>, when I was<span class='line-break'> </span>a little boy, as that of <a href='/pages/subjects/66059' title='Parkman, David'>David Parkman</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>I thought I would refer to the records<span class='line-break'> </span>in Middlesex county:  and there found a<span class='line-break'> </span>will of <a href='/pages/subjects/66059' title='Parkman, David'>David Parkman</a>, <ins>of <a href='/pages/subjects/53203' title='Cambridge, MA'>Cambridge</a></ins>, in which<span class='line-break'> </span>all his personal estate was given absolutely to his<span class='line-break'> </span>widow, <a href='/pages/subjects/66058' title='Parkman, Mary George'>Mary George Parkman</a>, and "all real<span class='line-break'> </span>^ <sup>&amp; personal</sup> estate in reversion or expectancy, to my wife <a href='/pages/subjects/66058' title='Parkman, Mary George'>Mary G.<!--Parkman--></a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>to be held and endorsed by her during her natural<span class='line-break'> </span>life, and after her decease to be divided equally<span class='line-break'> </span>between my two youngest children, <a href='/pages/subjects/66060' title='Parkman, Charles M.'>Charles M.<!--Parkman--></a><span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/66061' title='Parkman, Mary H.'>Mary H. Parkman</a>," &amp;c. -- In the inventory, to which<span class='line-break'> </span>I turned, with a view if possible of further inden--<span class='line-break'> </span>tification (for I had never heard of his living in Camb.)<span class='line-break'> </span>I found returned "<ins>no</ins> real estate". &amp; under<span class='line-break'> </span>the head of personal, 2<sup>nd</sup> item -- "Lot in Mt<span class='line-break'> </span>Auburn $75." -- This I dare say was the<span class='line-break'> </span>source of your error. The charter of our Corp<sup>n</sup> <span class='line-break'> </span>declares every lot to be <ins>real</ins> estate, and no inven--<span class='line-break'> </span>tory or other process could change it to personal.<span class='line-break'> </span>Real estate then goes directly to the heirs. If<span class='line-break'> </span>the second clause above quoted "real estate<span class='line-break'> </span>in reversion or expectancy" does not cover it --<span class='line-break'> </span>by which it went to your wife &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/66060' title='Parkman, Charles M.'>Mr Chas. M.<!--Parkman--></a><span class='line-break'> </span>upon the decease of <a href='/pages/subjects/66058' title='Parkman, Mary George'>Mrs P.<!--Parkman--></a>, still it would<span class='line-break'> </span>go as real estate <ins>in possession</ins> and not<span class='line-break'> </span>referred to in the will, to his heirs general;<span class='line-break'> </span>and I infer from the assent of C.M. &amp; M.H. as<span class='line-break'> </span>the only heirs of Mrs P. to the probate of <ins>her</ins> will,<span class='line-break'> </span>that Edward B. has deceased, without<span class='line-break'> </span>issue. If that is the case, then the<span class='line-break'> </span>same persons are ^<sup>now</sup>  heirs general of</p>
<p>168<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133658">
<h3><a name="page-1133658">CB01_0169</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/58448' title='Parkman, Daniel'>Daniel Parkman</a>, as the parties<span class='line-break'> </span>named in the will. --</p>
<p>From the foregoing, you therefore per<span class='line-break'></span>ceive that your deed gives no title<span class='line-break'> </span>to the lot. I send you a transfer,<span class='line-break'> </span>which, as I understand the facts, when<span class='line-break'> </span>executed, will straighten the matter.</p>
<p>I have been at so much trouble in<span class='line-break'> </span>the matter because I could not inform<span class='line-break'> </span>you without investigating the facts, and I<span class='line-break'> </span>knew you would wish the purchaser to have a<span class='line-break'> </span>valid title. I have said nothing to <a href='/pages/subjects/70551' title='Gardner, Henry N.'>Gardner</a><span class='line-break'> </span>about it, and, I presume he knows nothing about,<span class='line-break'> </span>and he needs to know nothing. We can substi<span class='line-break'></span>tute the new deed for the one which you gave him.<span class='line-break'> </span>To save expense of stamp, I have transferred the<span class='line-break'> </span>stamp from the old to the new deed. -- Please get<span class='line-break'> </span>it executed (your wife's acknowledgement will do, and save<span class='line-break'> </span>expense of coin -- in <a href='/pages/subjects/64807' title='Baltimore, MD'>Baltimore</a>) and destroy the old deed,<span class='line-break'> </span>which I send you. -- As a partial compensation for<span class='line-break'> </span>my trouble in the matter, you may, if you please, send<span class='line-break'> </span>me $3.00, as I have been to the Probate office, ransacked<span class='line-break'> </span>the records, copied one will &amp; show [minutes?] of another, drawn<span class='line-break'> </span>transfer, advised you &amp; so.</p>
<p>I sent for <a href='/pages/subjects/70551' title='Gardner, Henry N.'>Gardner</a> &amp; made him execute<span class='line-break'> </span>a new deed, and that is all we need of him, but it was<span class='line-break'> </span>as I said, before I ascertained about the title.</p>
<p>Yours truly</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A. J. Coolidge</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
<p>After the return of the transfer we can cut off the first, &amp; annex that to the original deed.</p>
<p><date when='1864-08-16'>Aug. 16 [186]4</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/66063' title='Stearns, Josiah O.'>Josiah O. Stearns</a> Esq<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/66064' title='Elizabeth, NJ'>Elizabeth City, N.J.</a></p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>Three or four weeks<span class='line-break'> </span>since, I sent you some blank orders for<span class='line-break'> </span>interments of <a href='/pages/subjects/66065' title='Stearns, Obed'>Obed<!--Stearns--></a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/66066' title='Stearns, Mary A.'>Mary A. Stearns</a> &amp; for their<span class='line-break'> </span>removal to your lot, which, although I enclosed with<span class='line-break'> </span>a note from our Sup<sup>t</sup>  to you, I requested should<span class='line-break'> </span>be returned me at <ins>this office</ins> and <ins>not</ins> to Mt Auburn,<span class='line-break'> </span>as it is my duty to make the record of interments.<span class='line-break'> </span>I also requested you to fill the blanks in the order<span class='line-break'> </span>for the interment of <a href='/pages/subjects/66066' title='Stearns, Mary A.'>Mary A. Stearns</a> -- viz. of <ins>late residence</ins>--<span class='line-break'> </span>and <ins>date of death</ins>. She is reported to us as having<span class='line-break'> </span>died at <a href='/pages/subjects/66067' title='Corning, NY'>Corning, N.Y.</a> ^<sup>aged 31 years</sup>. Please reply to <ins>me.</ins> -- What<span class='line-break'> </span>was her <ins>residence</ins> at the time of her death, and what was<span class='line-break'> </span>the <ins>date</ins> of her death? If you had noticed my re--<span class='line-break'> </span>quest particularly, and not returned my papers to the Cemetery,<span class='line-break'> </span>you would have been saved the trouble of my writing<span class='line-break'> </span>you again. If you can ^<sup>not</sup> give these answers, please<span class='line-break'> </span>obtain them for me, or direct me to one who can.</p>
<p>Yours respectfully</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a></p>
<p>169</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133659">
<h3><a name="page-1133659">CB01_0170</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><date when='1864-09-05'>Sept<sup>r</sup> 5. [186]4</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/66068' title='Tenney, Amos'>Amos Tenney</a> Esq<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/64140' title='New York, NY'>New York City</a></p>
<p>Dear Sir, Upon <a href='/pages/subjects/66069' title='Merriam, Mr.'>Mr<span class='line-break'> </span>Merriam's</a> request of me of a blank form<span class='line-break'> </span>for transfer of your lot, I happened to discover<span class='line-break'> </span>that you had never taken the <ins>original deed</ins><span class='line-break'> </span>in possesion of the Treas<sup>r</sup> and I told him<span class='line-break'> </span>I would get it of the Treas<sup>r</sup>.</p>
<p>The Treas<sup>r</sup> however wishes <ins>your</ins><span class='line-break'> </span><ins>written order for its delivery,</ins> or the <ins>surrender</ins><span class='line-break'> </span><ins>of the certificate,</ins> if you can find it: and<span class='line-break'> </span>I agreed to be responsible for the return of<span class='line-break'> </span>the proper voucher from you, if he would<span class='line-break'> </span>deliver it in advance. Please therefore sign<span class='line-break'> </span>the paper which he has drawn and return<span class='line-break'> </span>to <a href='/pages/subjects/66069' title='Merriam, Mr.'>Mr. Merriam</a> or myself. If you should<span class='line-break'> </span>find the certificate which he issued to you, en--<span class='line-break'> </span>close that also.</p>
<p>Yours respy</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a>, Sec</p>
<p><date when='1864-09-05'>Sept<sup>r</sup> 5 [186]4.</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'>Geo W<sup>m</sup> Bond Esq</a>. Treas<sup>r</sup> &amp;c—</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>The Trustees at their<span class='line-break'> </span>meeting this day passed the following<span class='line-break'> </span>votes:—</p>
<p>"That a grant of ($200) two hundred<span class='line-break'> </span>dollars be made in addition to the regular<span class='line-break'> </span>salary of the Sup<sup>t</sup> for the present year"—</p>
<p>That a grant of $50 fifty dollars be<span class='line-break'> </span>made in addition to the Gatekeeper's salary<span class='line-break'> </span>for the present year."—</p>
<p>"That the fees for making and<span class='line-break'> </span>recording deeds and transfers be<span class='line-break'> </span>two dollars each instead of one<span class='line-break'> </span>dollar hereafter changed."—</p>
<p>Truly yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
<p>170</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133660">
<h3><a name="page-1133660">CB01_0171</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><date when='1864-09-05'>Sept<sup>r</sup> 5, [186]4</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'>Capt D.L. Winsor</a>, Sup<sup>t</sup></p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>At the meeting of<span class='line-break'> </span>the Trustees held this day the following<span class='line-break'> </span>vote was adopted:—</p>
<p>"That a grant of two hundred<span class='line-break'> </span>dollars ($200) be made in addition<span class='line-break'> </span>to the regular salary of the Superin<span class='line-break'></span>tendent for the present year."</p>
<p>Very Respy Yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
<p>P.S. To satisfy the Treas<sup>r</sup>, you will please<span class='line-break'> </span>add to every certif. you issue, under the<span class='line-break'> </span>amt to be paid by the person for his land the words<span class='line-break'> </span>" $2 for deed " &amp; record", the fees for making<span class='line-break'> </span>same having been this day increased to that level.</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J.C</a>.—</p>
<p><date when='1864-09-05'>Sept<sup>r</sup> 5, [186]4</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/63799' title='Derby, James, Jr.'>Mr James Derby</a>, Gatekeeper &amp;c</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>At the meeting of<span class='line-break'> </span>the Trustees held this day the <span class='line-break'> </span>following vote was adopted:—</p>
<p>"That a grant of fifty dollars<span class='line-break'> </span>be made in addition to the Gate<span class='line-break'></span>keeper's salary for the present<span class='line-break'> </span>year."—</p>
<p>Very Respy yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
<p>171</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133661">
<h3><a name="page-1133661">CB01_0172</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>I, <a href='/pages/subjects/67006' title='Crowley, Elizabeth A.'>Elizabeth A. Crowley</a> of <a href='/pages/subjects/67007' title='Holliston, MA'>Holliston</a>, in<span class='line-break'> </span>the county of Middlesex and Commonwealth of Massa<span class='line-break'></span>chusetts, (formerly <a href='/pages/subjects/67006' title='Crowley, Elizabeth A.'>Elizabeth A. Fitzpatrick</a>) married woman,<span class='line-break'> </span>on oath declare that my brother, <a href='/pages/subjects/67008' title='Fitzpatrick, Matthew'>Matthew Fitzpatrick</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>late of <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a>, deceased, the proprietor of <a href='/pages/subjects/67009' title='Lot 2624'>lot numbered<span class='line-break'> </span>twenty six hundred and twenty four (2624)</a> in the Cemetery<span class='line-break'> </span>of Mount Auburn, situated in the rear of <a href='/pages/subjects/67010' title='Lot 964'>lot numbered<span class='line-break'> </span>964</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/60651' title='Fir Avenue'>Fir Avenue</a>, was killed at the battle of Ball's<span class='line-break'> </span>Bluff, Virginia, on the 21<sup>st</sup> day of October, A.D. eighteen<span class='line-break'> </span>hundred and sixty one; that he was never married,<span class='line-break'> </span>and left no father nor mother and no brother nor<span class='line-break'> </span>sister other than myself; and that he made <span class='line-break'> </span>no disposition of said lot by will -- that I am<span class='line-break'> </span>his sole heir at law, and as such am entitled<span class='line-break'> </span>to be recorded as the proprietor of said lot. --</p>
<p>State of Massachusetts<span class='line-break'> </span>Middlesex Js. <a href='/pages/subjects/67007' title='Holliston, MA'>Holliston</a> <date when='1864-09'>Sept<sup>r</sup> 1864</date>. There personally<span class='line-break'> </span>appeared the above-named <a href='/pages/subjects/67006' title='Crowley, Elizabeth A.'>Elizabeth A. Crowley</a> <span class='line-break'> </span>and made oath that the above statement by her<span class='line-break'> </span>subscribed is true;</p>
<p>Justice of the Peace</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133662">
<h3><a name="page-1133662">CB01_0173</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><date when='1864-09-09'>Sept 9. [186]4</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/67006' title='Crowley, Elizabeth A.'>Mrs E.A. Crowley</a><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/67007' title='Holliston, MA'>Holliston, Mass.</a></p>
<p>Dear Madam, I understand that<span class='line-break'> </span>you are the only heir to <a href='/pages/subjects/67009' title='Lot 2624'>lot no. 2624</a> in<span class='line-break'> </span>the Cemetery: but you cannot so stand on<span class='line-break'> </span>our records without making the affidavit<span class='line-break'> </span>which I send you. If you will sign<span class='line-break'> </span>it and make oath before a Justice of the Peace,<span class='line-break'> </span>I will record you as the proprietor. This will<span class='line-break'> </span>probably be of importance to you to preserve<span class='line-break'> </span>the title for you and your heirs. Our charge<span class='line-break'> </span>is $2. which you may remit, when you<span class='line-break'> </span>return the affidavit.</p>
<p>Please also sign and return as soon<span class='line-break'> </span>as you can the order for the removal of<span class='line-break'> </span>Mr Fishe's body. Mrs. Powers showed me<span class='line-break'> </span>your letter requesting it, but we want this<span class='line-break'> </span>formal order. --</p>
<p>Yours respectfully</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a> Sec.y</p>
<p><date when='1864-09-10'>Sept. 10 [186]4</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'>Capt D.L. Winsor</a></p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>Will you please direct<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/52579' title='Safford, Truman H.'>Mr Safford</a> to see that no removal<span class='line-break'> </span>of the body of <a href='/pages/subjects/66041' title='Hallet, Ezekiel, Jr.'>Ezekiel Hallet</a> or any<span class='line-break'> </span>other person interred in <a href='/pages/subjects/66042' title='Lot 2603'>lot no 2603</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>rear of <a href='/pages/subjects/58791' title='Central Avenue'>Central Avenue</a>, is made<span class='line-break'> </span>without further orders, as a question of<span class='line-break'> </span>rights is pending respecting it before the Trustees.</p>
<p>Will you personally notify <a href='/pages/subjects/55348' title='Jones, Lewis'>Lewis<span class='line-break'> </span>Jones</a>, the undertaker, that he<span class='line-break'> </span>must not come again to Mt Auburn<span class='line-break'> </span>with a body for interment without a<span class='line-break'> </span>proper order for the same from a person,<span class='line-break'> </span>duly authorized, under the risk of being<span class='line-break'> </span>stopped at the Gate: and direct the<span class='line-break'> </span>Gatekeeper not to open the gate to <a href='/pages/subjects/55348' title='Jones, Lewis'>Mr<span class='line-break'> </span>Jones</a> with any body for interment,</p>
<p>173</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133663">
<h3><a name="page-1133663">CB01_0174</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>without first taking from him<span class='line-break'> </span>the proper authorization of the pro--<span class='line-break'> </span>prietor.</p>
<p>Will you please bring in the key<span class='line-break'> </span>of <a href='/pages/subjects/58363' title='Stone, William W.'>W<sup>m</sup> W. Stone's</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/67016' title='Lot 358'>lot -- no 358</a>, on<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/55273' title='Narcissus Path'>Narcissus Path</a>. He has just<span class='line-break'> </span>written me requesting it to be<span class='line-break'> </span>sent viz express. He left it when<span class='line-break'> </span>here to have lock repaired, and<span class='line-break'> </span>a duplicate to be made and kept<span class='line-break'> </span>at the Gate. If this has been done,<span class='line-break'> </span>let the key and bill be sent: if not,<span class='line-break'> </span>have the order executed forthwith,<span class='line-break'> </span>and we will then send key and<span class='line-break'> </span>bill.</p>
<p>Yours truly</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
<p><date when='1864-09-13'>Sept. 13 [186]4</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/66056' title='Shimmin, Charles F.'>C.F. Shimmin</a> Esq</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>I have just<span class='line-break'> </span>received the deed of <a href='/pages/subjects/67018' title='Lot 76'>lot 76</a> in the<span class='line-break'> </span>Cemetery from you, and presume<span class='line-break'> </span>you overlooked a suggestion that<span class='line-break'> </span>I made in my first note<span class='line-break'> </span>that I should feel obliged to<span class='line-break'> </span>make you the small charge of<span class='line-break'> </span>$3 for examining into the facts and<span class='line-break'> </span>preparing deed. --</p>
<p>I now send the bill, trusting<span class='line-break'> </span>that as it was an indispensable<span class='line-break'> </span>service, the charge will be<span class='line-break'> </span>satisfactory.</p>
<p>Most respy yours,</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y Mt Auburn</p>
<p>174</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133664">
<h3><a name="page-1133664">CB01_0175</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><date when='1864-09-13'>Sept<sup>r</sup> 13 [186]4</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'>Capt. D.L. Winsor</a></p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>I send a note from<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/104060' title='Lawrence, William R. (1812-1885)'>Dr Lawrence</a>. --</p>
<p>Will you tomorrow send a<span class='line-break'> </span>certificate of the lot on <a href='/pages/subjects/61196' title='Harebell Path'>Harebell Path</a><span class='line-break'> </span>by mail, to "<a href='/pages/subjects/67019' title='Hall, Edward F., Jr.'>Edward F. Hall Jr.</a><span class='line-break'> </span>21 Kelley St. <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a>."</p>
<p>He is about to leave the city, &amp; wishes to pay for it.</p>
<p>Will you also examine, and advise<span class='line-break'> </span>me how much to offer for <a href='/pages/subjects/67020' title='Lot 2485'>lot no. 2485</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/59904' title='Spruce Avenue'>Spruce Av<sup>e</sup></a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/67021' title='Gray, David B.'>David B. Gray</a> -- how much<span class='line-break'> </span>for lot, and how much for fence, in separ--<span class='line-break'> </span>ate items. I am about to write him.<span class='line-break'> </span>He resides at the west. -- Write tomor<span class='line-break'></span>row, if you can. --</p>
<p>Yours truly</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a></p>
<p>Send me a leaf of that certificate book.</p>
<p><date when='1864-09-19T18:00:00'>Septem<sup>r</sup> 19 [186]4</date></p>
<p>6 P.M.<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'>Capt Winsor</a></p>
<p>Dear Sir</p>
<p>Miss <a href='/pages/subjects/67022' title='Hosmer, Harriet'>Harriet G.<span class='line-break'> </span>Hosmer</a>, the great sculptress is here<span class='line-break'> </span>and, at her request, I wish to make<span class='line-break'> </span>an appointment with you to meet<span class='line-break'> </span>her and her friends tomorrow morning<span class='line-break'> </span>about 10 o'clock, to look for a lot<span class='line-break'> </span>in some prominent place, where she<span class='line-break'> </span>can erect a bronze statue to her late<span class='line-break'> </span>father, <a href='/pages/subjects/67023' title='Hosmer, Hiram'>Dr Hosmer,</a><del>preparatory</del> ^<sup>in connection with</sup> which<span class='line-break'> </span>she will probably dispose of her old<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/67024' title='Lot 367'>lot no. 367</a> at the north end of <a href='/pages/subjects/55273' title='Narcissus Path'>Nar<span class='line-break'></span>cissus Path</a> (<a href='/pages/subjects/57671' title='Forest Pond'>Forrest Pond</a>) as that<span class='line-break'> </span>place is unsuited for such a purpose. --</p>
<p>I told her we could take her<span class='line-break'> </span>old lot, privately, and give her as<span class='line-break'> </span>much, as she would otherwise get.</p>
<p>175</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133665">
<h3><a name="page-1133665">CB01_0176_1</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>She thinks she will first consult<span class='line-break'> </span>her cousin, whether he may not<span class='line-break'> </span>wish for it. --</p>
<p>Will you, if I should not see you,<span class='line-break'> </span>please show her in the neighborhood of<span class='line-break'> </span>the new Fountain -- also the lot you<span class='line-break'> </span>purchased on <a href='/pages/subjects/55347' title='Laurel Hill'>Laurel Hill</a>. --</p>
<p>I also mentioned to her the high<span class='line-break'> </span>ground just southerly of the new Av<sup>e</sup><span class='line-break'> </span>you are making up by <a href='/pages/subjects/61237' title='Myrtle Path'>Myrtle Path</a>.<span class='line-break'> </span>I told her it is as yet unfitted<span class='line-break'> </span>for sale. She thinks she before<span class='line-break'> </span>marked this ground.</p>
<p>I shall try to get up there. If<span class='line-break'> </span>the weather should be unfavorable<span class='line-break'> </span>the party will not come out. --</p>
<p>Truly yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a></p>
<p><date when='1864-09-17'>Septem<sup>r</sup> 17 [186]4</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'>C. [L?] Winsor</a></p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>Mr <a href='/pages/subjects/67065' title='Farwell, Oliver A.'>Oliver A. Far--<span class='line-break'> </span>well</a> of <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a> has been out twice<span class='line-break'> </span>looking for a lot, but did not find<span class='line-break'> </span>you. [?] [?] think it was [?]<span class='line-break'> </span>him a lot at the corner of <a href='/pages/subjects/61270' title='Rose Path'>Rose<!--Path--></a><span class='line-break'> </span>and <a href='/pages/subjects/61242' title='Oleander Path'>Oleander Paths</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/67066' title='Lot 525'>numbered 525</a><span class='line-break'> </span>on the plan. It was one of the old<span class='line-break'> </span>lots in the early [?] [?]. He saw<span class='line-break'> </span>others and likes this the best &amp;<span class='line-break'> </span>wishes you send him a certificate<span class='line-break'> </span>of 300 feet. He is about to leave<span class='line-break'> </span>town tomorrow for Lake [Superior?]<span class='line-break'> </span>as is [........?]  check with<span class='line-break'> </span>[...?] Have [...?] if you<span class='line-break'> </span>will [?] her [?] to me at once.</p>
<p>He does not care to grade the<span class='line-break'> </span>lot he has [?] [?]. (over)</p>
<p>176</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133666">
<h3><a name="page-1133666">CB01_0177</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>[first line illegible?] [... nor have they ...?]<span class='line-break'> </span>meeting you yesterday, in showing<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/67022' title='Hosmer, Harriet'>Miss Hosmer</a> [?].<span class='line-break'> </span>over time, and thinks much of a triangle<span class='line-break'> </span>at the Northwesterly end of <a href='/pages/subjects/57671' title='Forest Pond'>Forrest Pond</a>, formed<span class='line-break'> </span>by the three branches of <a href='/pages/subjects/55273' title='Narcissus Path'>Narcissus Path</a><span class='line-break'> </span>just below <a href='/pages/subjects/58525' title='Thaxter, Levi'>Levi Thaxter</a>'s lot - containing<span class='line-break'> </span>about 1000 feet, perhaps, border and all.—</p>
<p>She wishes to erect a bronze statue to her<span class='line-break'> </span>father. For such a purpose, under proper<span class='line-break'> </span>restrictions, I should think these would<span class='line-break'> </span>be no objection, but rather be desired.</p>
<p>She will probably be out again in the<span class='line-break'> </span>course of a week.</p>
<p>I have given a pass today to<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/67068' title='Parmenter, William E.'>W<sup>m</sup> E. Parmenter</a> Esq<sup>r</sup> to visit Mount<span class='line-break'> </span>Auburn tomorrow with officers &amp; members<span class='line-break'> </span>of the <a href='/pages/subjects/55274' title='Grand Lodge of Odd Fellows of the US'>Grand Lodge of Odd Fellows of the US</a>., to<span class='line-break'> </span>the number of 80 or 100, he thinks, in carriages.<span class='line-break'> </span>They will reach the Cemetery about 4 o'clock.</p>
<p>I wish you would attend at once to my note<span class='line-break'> </span>the other day referring to <a href='/pages/subjects/58363' title='Stone, William W.'>W<sup>m</sup> W. Stone's</a> want of key<span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; bill for same. He has sent again.—</p>
<p>Yours truly</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a></p>
<p><date when='1864-09-29'>Sept<sup>r</sup> 29, [186]4</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Dr Jacob Bigelow</a>, Pres<sup>t</sup> &amp;c</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>I have finished the<span class='line-break'> </span>paper which I spoke to you about, &amp;<span class='line-break'> </span>which I desire, with your approval &amp;<span class='line-break'> </span>that of the Board to see go forth<span class='line-break'> </span>to the proprietors in a printed<span class='line-break'> </span>form. I have spent a month<span class='line-break'> </span>or two in elaborating and putting<span class='line-break'> </span>together, with a good deal of care,<span class='line-break'> </span>what I believe are the views of the<span class='line-break'> </span>Trustees on the subject of the future<span class='line-break'> </span>^<sup>&amp; perpetual</sup> preservation of the Cemetery and<span class='line-break'> </span>all the lots therin.—</p>
<p>It very may occur to you, who<span class='line-break'> </span>are so familiar with the subject,<span class='line-break'> </span>too long— but I think a careful<span class='line-break'> </span>reading of the paper will show that<span class='line-break'> </span>I have not been repetitious.</p>
<p>177<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133667">
<h3><a name="page-1133667">CB01_0178</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>or too full in the explanation of<span class='line-break'> </span>matters which are quite <ins>unfamiliar</ins><span class='line-break'> </span>to most of those for whose benefit<span class='line-break'> </span>it is intended. The Trustees may<span class='line-break'> </span>not need this presention of these<span class='line-break'> </span>views for their <ins>individual</ins> enlighten--<span class='line-break'> </span>ment; but there are few others<span class='line-break'> </span>who have no such need.—</p>
<p>What I wish is that<span class='line-break'> </span>the subject may be referred<span class='line-break'> </span>to the Committee on Lots, unless<span class='line-break'> </span>a Special Com<sup>ee</sup> should be<span class='line-break'> </span>preferred, with full power to<span class='line-break'> </span>issue an address to the proprietors<span class='line-break'> </span>on this subject.— or that the<span class='line-break'> </span>Secretary under the direction of the<span class='line-break'> </span>Committee on Lots be authorized to<span class='line-break'> </span>address the proprietors in the name of<span class='line-break'> </span>the Trustees on the subject of the<span class='line-break'> </span>perpetual preservation of their lots.</p>
<p>I am<span class='line-break'> </span>Very respectfully your Ob<sup>nt</sup> Serv<sup>t</sup></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a></p>
<p><date when='1864-09-30'>Sept<sup>r</sup> 30 [186]4</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'>Geo. W<sup>m</sup> Bond</a> Esq</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>I send deed of<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/55276' title='Pratt, Frank G.'>Frank G. Pratt</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/73016' title='Barker, Alexander Augustus'>Alex<sup>r</sup> A. Barker</a><span class='line-break'> </span>which wants your signature &amp; 50 ct.<span class='line-break'> </span>stamp. Please sign &amp; return <a href='/pages/subjects/73016' title='Barker, Alexander Augustus'>Mr<span class='line-break'> </span>Barker's</a> deed to me.—</p>
<p>Trustee process has been served upon<span class='line-break'> </span>attaching the wages of <a href='/pages/subjects/63799' title='Derby, James, Jr.'>Jas. Derby</a> to the<span class='line-break'> </span>extent of $20 &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/67071' title='Powers, William'>W<sup>m</sup> Powers</a>, a<span class='line-break'> </span>laborer to the amt of $50.— Also <a href='/pages/subjects/67072' title='Hazlett, George'>Geo.<span class='line-break'> </span>Hazlett</a>, I think after you paid, last month<span class='line-break'> </span>I will see what time.—</p>
<p>Will you please return by bearer a<span class='line-break'> </span>check payable to my <ins>order</ins> for $237.50,<span class='line-break'> </span>for which I send the accompanying<span class='line-break'> </span>receipts.</p>
<p>Yours Resp<sup>y</sup></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a></p>
<p>178</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133668">
<h3><a name="page-1133668">CB01_0179</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><date when='1864-10-03'>Octo. 3 [186]4</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'>Capt. D.L. Winsor</a></p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>Please send me<span class='line-break'> </span>a report on the condition &amp;c of lot<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/55279' title='Lot 2820'>2820</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/55287' title='Lawn Avenue'>Lawn Av<sup>e</sup></a> (<a href='/pages/subjects/67073' title='Powers, Deborah C.'>Mrs Deborah C.<span class='line-break'> </span>Powers</a>) and an estimate of the<span class='line-break'> </span>cost of perpetual repair.—</p>
<p>Please explain your note in answer<span class='line-break'> </span>to 7<sup>th</sup> question about the <a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Parker</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/67074' title='Lot 1250'>lots 1250</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/67075' title='Lot 1315'><!--Lot-->1315</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/67076' title='Lot 1333'><!--lot-->1333</a><span class='line-break'> </span>which is "3 pr steps into lots &amp; 3 pr steps in<span class='line-break'> </span>the banks, without buttresses".—</p>
<p>Do you mean that those steps<span class='line-break'> </span>exist there &amp; <del>will</del> make it practicable to require<span class='line-break'> </span>more than $1000, or that such steps should<span class='line-break'> </span>be erected before entereing upon the contract?.</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/67073' title='Powers, Deborah C.'>Mrs Powers</a> wishes immediately to<span class='line-break'> </span>pay the sum for hers.</p>
<p>How about the key to <a href='/pages/subjects/58363' title='Stone, William W.'>W.W. Stone's</a> tomb, &amp; bill?</p>
<p>Yours Truly<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a></p>
<p>If the weather is fine, I think I must see you tomorrow morning.</p>
<p><date when='1864-10-03'>Octo. 3. 4 [186]4</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/67077' title='Gates, Stephen F.'>Stephen F. Gates</a> Esq.</p>
<p>My dear Sir,</p>
<p>The Committee on <span class='line-break'> </span>Lots have instructed me to notify<span class='line-break'> </span>you that the Corporation will<span class='line-break'> </span>contract for the perpetual repair<span class='line-break'> </span>of your lot on <a href='/pages/subjects/55284' title='Laurel Avenue'>Laurel Avenue</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/55285' title='Lot 3348'>No 3348</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>for four hundred and twenty five<span class='line-break'> </span>dollars.— This is the sum suggested<span class='line-break'> </span>by the Superintendent.</p>
<p>If this is satisfactory to you, I<span class='line-break'> </span>will prepare the necessary papers.—</p>
<p>Yours trule</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
<p>179</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133669">
<h3><a name="page-1133669">CB01_0180</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><date when='1864-10-05'>Octo. 5 [186]4</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/56312' title='Norcross, Otis'>Otis Norcross</a> Esq</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>There has been<span class='line-break'> </span>but one lot added to the list<span class='line-break'> </span>previously made, which you are<span class='line-break'> </span>now bound to look after -- that<span class='line-break'> </span>is <a href='/pages/subjects/66017' title='Lot 587'><ins>587</ins></a> -- the "Murray Monument"<span class='line-break'> </span>on <a href='/pages/subjects/61234' title='Moss Path'>Moss Path</a> --</p>
<p>I have also noted on your<span class='line-break'> </span>list <a href='/pages/subjects/66010' title='lot 243'>lot 243</a> -- <a href='/pages/subjects/61302' title='Woodbine Path'>Woodbine Path</a> (<a href='/pages/subjects/66009' title='Churchill, Marion S. L.'>Mrs<span class='line-break'> </span>Churchill's</a>) for your exam. --<span class='line-break'> </span>She has deposited $300, to accumulate<span class='line-break'> </span>to contract to be made. --</p>
<p>Yours very respectfully</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
<p><date when='1864-10-05'>Octo. 5 [186]4</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/58363' title='Stone, William W.'>W<sup>m</sup> W. Stone</a> Esq.<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/64140' title='New York, NY'>New York City</a></p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>I send your<span class='line-break'> </span>key at last. It has been<span class='line-break'> </span>done for some time, and I<span class='line-break'> </span>have requested it several<span class='line-break'> </span>times for you, but was<span class='line-break'> </span>overlooked in the drive of<span class='line-break'> </span>other matters. The bill,<span class='line-break'> </span>as you see, is payable<span class='line-break'> </span>to <a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'>Geo W. Bond</a> Esq<span class='line-break'> </span>the Treas<sup>r</sup></p>
<p>I am very Respy<span class='line-break'> </span>Your Ob<sup>t</sup> Serv<sup>t</sup></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
<p>The key you will<span class='line-break'> </span>receive by [request?]</p>
<p>180</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133670">
<h3><a name="page-1133670">CB01_0181</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><date when='1864-10-14'>Oct. 14, [186]4</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54832' title='Austin, Edward'>Edward Austin</a> Esq</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/56312' title='Norcross, Otis'>Mr Norcross</a> has<span class='line-break'> </span>asked me today to say to you<span class='line-break'> </span>that the weather forbids going<span class='line-break'> </span>to Mount Auburn this week --<span class='line-break'> </span>that Monday is Aldermen's<span class='line-break'> </span>Day, &amp; Tuesday he expects<span class='line-break'> </span>to leave town to be gone a<span class='line-break'> </span>day or two, and<span class='line-break'> </span>thinks that he will be ready<span class='line-break'> </span>to go to Mt Auburn the latter<span class='line-break'> </span>part of next week. He will<span class='line-break'> </span>notify you when he returns.</p>
<p>Very Respy yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a></p>
<p><date when='1864-10-14'>Octo. 14, [186]4</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/67073' title='Powers, Deborah C.'>Mrs D.C. Powers</a><span class='line-break'> </span>4 Lyman St</p>
<p>Dear Madam,</p>
<p>The Committee<span class='line-break'> </span>on Lots have examined your appli--<span class='line-break'> </span>cation to know for what sum the<span class='line-break'> </span>Corporation will contract for the<span class='line-break'> </span>Perpetual Repair of Lot no <a href='/pages/subjects/55279' title='Lot 2820'>2820</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>belonging to yourself, and have<span class='line-break'> </span>directed me to notify you that<span class='line-break'> </span>they will assume such contract<span class='line-break'> </span>for the sum of two hundred<span class='line-break'> </span>dollars. --</p>
<p>Whenever you are ready to pay<span class='line-break'> </span>the sum, I will prepare the<span class='line-break'> </span>necessary papers. --</p>
<p>I am very respectfully yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
<p>181</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133671">
<h3><a name="page-1133671">CB01_0182</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>182</p>
<p><date when='1864-10-29'>Oct. 29 [186]4</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54832' title='Austin, Edward'>Edward Austin</a> Esq<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/56312' title='Norcross, Otis'>Otis Norcross</a> Esq<span class='line-break'> </span>Com<sup>ee</sup>on Lots</p>
<p>Gentlemen,</p>
<p>At the meeting of the<span class='line-break'> </span>Trustees held Monday <date when='1864-10-03'>Octo. 3, 1864</date>,<span class='line-break'> </span>the accompanying paper and the sub--<span class='line-break'> </span>ject embraced therein was, by vote<span class='line-break'> </span>of the Trustees referred to the Com--<span class='line-break'> </span>mittee on Lots, with instructions<span class='line-break'> </span>to report thereon.</p>
<p>I shall be happy to wait upon<span class='line-break'> </span>you, whenever you may wish for my<span class='line-break'> </span>assistance in the matter: and I trust<span class='line-break'> </span>you may endeavor to report upon<span class='line-break'> </span>the subject at the next meeting, as it will<span class='line-break'> </span>save much other labor to be able very<span class='line-break'> </span>soon to address the proprietors on<span class='line-break'> </span>the perpetual care of their lots. --</p>
<p>I am with great respect<span class='line-break'> </span>Your Ob<sup>t</sup> Serv<sup>t</sup></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133672">
<h3><a name="page-1133672">CB01_0183</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p> 183</p>
<p><date when='1864-11-05'>Nov. 5 [186]4</date></p>
<p>Hon. <a href='/pages/subjects/67089' title='Parker, Joel'>Joel Parker</a>, Esq<sup>r</sup> &amp; Trustee<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/53203' title='Cambridge, MA'>Cambridge</a> Mass</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>I regret that there<span class='line-break'> </span>has been an accidental delay in giving a prompt<span class='line-break'> </span>reply to your request to know for what sum<span class='line-break'> </span>the Trustees of this Corporation would guarantee<span class='line-break'> </span>the perpetual good repair of <a href='/pages/subjects/67074' title='Lot 1250'>Lots no.<sup>s</sup> 1250</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/67075' title='Lot 1315'>1315</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/67076' title='Lot 1333'>1333</a> in the Cemetery.</p>
<p>The question having been considered and<span class='line-break'> </span>reported upon, I am directed to inform you<span class='line-break'> </span>that the Corporation ^<sup>will</sup> enter upon such a <span class='line-break'> </span>contract, upon payment of one<span class='line-break'> </span>thousand dollars. -- ($1000).</p>
<p>I have the honor &amp; be<span class='line-break'> </span>Very Respectfully<span class='line-break'> </span>Your Ob<sup>t</sup> Serv<sup>t</sup></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133673">
<h3><a name="page-1133673">CB01_0184</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>184</p>
<p><date when='1864-11-07'>Nov.<sup>r</sup> 7, [186]4</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54832' title='Austin, Edward'>Edward Austin</a> Esq<sup>r</sup></p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>The accompanying appli--<span class='line-break'> </span>cation from <a href='/pages/subjects/67090' title='Callis, Charles'>Dr Chas. Callis</a>, in behalf of the "<a href='/pages/subjects/67091' title='Home for Indigent and Incurable Consumption'>Home for Indigent<span class='line-break'> </span>and Incurable Consumption</a>" was presented to the Trustees,<span class='line-break'> </span>and it was Voted</p>
<p>That the memorial be referred to the<span class='line-break'> </span>Committee on Lots to report thereon. --</p>
<p>There are two or three other matters already referred <span class='line-break'> </span>to, or in the hands of, your Committee, upon which,<span class='line-break'> </span>and the matter stated above, <a href='/pages/subjects/56312' title='Norcross, Otis'>Mr Norcross</a> desired<span class='line-break'> </span>me this morning to request you to appoint a meeting<span class='line-break'> </span>of the Committee at this place some morning at 9 o'clock.<span class='line-break'> </span>He says he will attend almost any morning except<span class='line-break'> </span>Monday, if you will notify him a day or two<span class='line-break'> </span>beforehand, to allow of a change in case of previous<span class='line-break'> </span>engagement.</p>
<p>I am<span class='line-break'> </span>Very Respectfully yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133674">
<h3><a name="page-1133674">CB01_0185</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>185</p>
<p><date when='1864-11-08'>Nov<sup>r</sup> 8 [186]4</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'>Capt D.L. Winsor</a>, Sup<sup>t</sup></p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>At the monthly meeting<span class='line-break'> </span>of the Trustees of Mount Auburn Cemetery,<span class='line-break'> </span>on Monday 7<sup>th</sup> inst, the following vote was<span class='line-break'> </span>adopted: --</p>
<p>"That the Superintendent be instructed<span class='line-break'> </span>to engage from six to twelve suitable laborers,<span class='line-break'> </span>to be employed through the winter, if necessary,<span class='line-break'> </span>in removing superfluous trees from the Cemetery, --<span class='line-break'> </span>the work to be done with such caution as not<span class='line-break'> </span>to occasion damage to or in proprietors' lots,<span class='line-break'> </span>and under the direction of the Committee on<span class='line-break'> </span>Grounds, as to the particular trees to be<span class='line-break'> </span>removed." --</p>
<p>Yours truly</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133675">
<h3><a name="page-1133675">CB01_0186</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><date when='1864-11-10'>Nov<sup>r</sup> 10 [186]4</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'>Capt. Winsor</a></p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>Please return me<span class='line-break'> </span>the list of lots of which the fences need<span class='line-break'> </span>painting -- which I left with you -- <ins>corrected</ins>.</p>
<p>Please also make up a list of the<span class='line-break'> </span>lots ready for <a href='/pages/subjects/81482' title='Shedd, J. H., Mr.'>Mr Shedd's</a> survey.</p>
<p>I send you an order from<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/67092' title='Eliot, Samuel'>Sam. Eliot</a> for a headstone.</p>
<p>Complaint was made to me<span class='line-break'> </span>two or three days since that the<span class='line-break'> </span>boundary posts ordered, and <ins>paid for,</ins><span class='line-break'> </span>on lot of <a href='/pages/subjects/67093' title='Hall, Thomas'>Thos. Hall</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/67094' title='Lot 641'><!--Lot-->641</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/60336' title='Willow Avenue'>Willow Av<sup>e</sup></a><span class='line-break'> </span>Dec<sup>r</sup> 11, 1863, are not yet set. -- $8.00 was<span class='line-break'> </span>paid. You will find it among your<span class='line-break'> </span>orders. Please look to this.</p>
<p>Yours truly</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a></p>
<p><date when='1864-11-29'>Nov. 29, [186]4</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/81482' title='Shedd, J. H., Mr.'>J.H. Shedd</a> Esq</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>I have made<span class='line-break'> </span>a careful list of all lots sold since<span class='line-break'> </span>no. 3000 not on the Sectional Sur--<span class='line-break'> </span>vey, and have gone over this list<span class='line-break'> </span>with the Superintendent, and noted<span class='line-break'> </span>all lots ready for survey, and<span class='line-break'> </span>have duplicate lists of the same,<span class='line-break'> </span>one of which is at your service for<span class='line-break'> </span>making the survey. The danger of bad<span class='line-break'> </span>weather is now so great, I should like<span class='line-break'> </span>to have you proceed at once. --</p>
<p>Please inform me on what day<span class='line-break'> </span>you will commence. -- There are<span class='line-break'> </span>no less than 103 lots ready &amp; per--<span class='line-break'> </span>haps there will be others before it is com--<span class='line-break'> </span>pleted. Some of these, like <a href='/pages/subjects/55347' title='Laurel Hill'>Laurel Hill</a>, you<span class='line-break'> </span>may have already. --</p>
<p>Yours truly</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a></p>
<p>186</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133676">
<h3><a name="page-1133676">CB01_0187</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>187</p>
<p><date when='1864-11-29'>Nov<sup>r</sup> 29 [186]4</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'>Capt. D.L. Winsor</a>,</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>Mr <a href='/pages/subjects/67098' title='Lathrop, William M.'>W<sup>m</sup> M. Lathrop</a> called in this P.M.<span class='line-break'> </span>and says he thinks he gave you an order for both posting &amp; grading<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/65246' title='Lot 3363'>lots 3363</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/65247' title='Lot 3364'>&amp; 3364</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/59966' title='Acanthus Path'>Acanthus P.</a> rear of <a href='/pages/subjects/67099' title='Lot 1833'><!--Lot-->1833</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/67100' title='Lot 1856'><!--Lot-->1856</a>. He talked over the<span class='line-break'> </span>size of the posts, &amp; thinks he signed his name to the order book. -- If<span class='line-break'> </span>he is in error, please inform me, and I will have him give the<span class='line-break'> </span>proper order. -- He would like to have the grading done this season,<span class='line-break'> </span>if not too late: at all events, set the posts.</p>
<p>As it will probably be a day or two before the surveyors<span class='line-break'> </span>get out to you, I think it will be well for you to set as many<span class='line-break'> </span>of the posts to the lots of delinquent proprietors as possible: -- and<span class='line-break'> </span>their survey would then be the more complete. I subjoin a<span class='line-break'> </span>list of ^<sup>all</sup> the earlier lots contained on the list shown you, remaining without bounds. --</p>
<p><table class='tabular'><thead><span class='line-break'> </span><tr><th>?</th> <th><a href='/pages/subjects/67101' title='Lot 3027'><!--Lot--> 3027</a></th> <th><a href='/pages/subjects/61227' title='Magnolia Avenue'>Magnolia<!--Ave.--></a></th> <th>630 f.</th> <th>Hunt.<span class='line-break'> </span></th></tr></thead> <tbody> <tr><td/> <td><del><a href='/pages/subjects/71440' title='Lot 3081'><!--Lot-->3081</a></del></td> <td><del>"</del></td> <td/> <td/> </tr> <tr><td/> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/67102' title='Lot 3213'><!--Lot-->3213</a></td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/60336' title='Willow Avenue'>Willow<!--Ave.--></a></td> <td>300</td> <td>G. href='/pages/subjects/67165' title='Lot 3511'><!--Lot-->3511</a></td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/61115' title='Anemone Path'>Anemone<!--Path--></a></td> <td>370</td> <td>Sturgis</td> </tr> <tr><td>   {</td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/67168' title='Lot 3514'><!--Lot-->3514</a></td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/61120' title='Arethusa Path'>Arethusa<!--Path--></a></td> <td>300</td> <td>Elliott</td> </tr> <tr><td>   {</td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/67169' title='Lot 3515'><!--Lot-->3515</a></td> <td>"</td> <td>300</td> <td>Ames</td> </tr> <tr><td/> <td><a 3528'><!--Lot-->3528</a></td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/59966' title='Acanthus Path'>Acanthus<!--Path--></a></td> <td>300</td> <td>Abbott</td> </tr> <tr><td/> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/67186' title='Lot 3530'><!--Lot-->3530</a></td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/61235' title='Mound Avenue'>Mound<!--Ave--></a></td> <td>400</td> <td>Chapman</td> </tr> <tr><td/> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/101308' title='Lot 3534'><!--Lot-->3534</a></td> <td>"</td> <td>300</td> <td>Clark</td> </tr> <tr><td>   {</td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/67294' title='Lot
