than<span class='line-break'> </span>I had supposed on so long a list.</p>
<p>Will you also, in compliance with the<span class='line-break'> </span>request of the Com<sup>ee</sup> on Lots furnish me before next Monday,<span class='line-break'> </span>a list of all lots of which the bounds have been neg--<span class='line-break'> </span>lected. The above will aid you somewhat, but I am<span class='line-break'> </span>not sure that it embraces all <ins>since</ins> 3000.</p>
<p>Yours truly</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133677">
<h3><a name="page-1133677">CB01_0188</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>188</p>
<p><date when='1864-11-30'>Nov.<sup>r</sup> 30, [186]4</date></p>
<p>Hon <a href='/pages/subjects/67089' title='Parker, Joel'>Joel Parker</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>Ex<sup>or</sup> &amp;c</p>
<p>My dear Sir,</p>
<p>I enclose a draft of<span class='line-break'> </span>the instrument which seems to me proper<span class='line-break'> </span>for the purpose required -- viz to complete<span class='line-break'> </span>the contract for the perpetual repair of<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/67074' title='Lot 1250'>lot nos. 1250</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/67075' title='Lot 1315'>1315</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/67076' title='Lot 1333'>1333</a> in the Cem<span class='line-break'></span>etery.</p>
<p>As you have failed to find me <span class='line-break'> </span>at the office, it will be no more than fair<span class='line-break'> </span>that I wait upon you, and I will<span class='line-break'> </span>endeavor to call at your office in the<span class='line-break'> </span>Law School, perhaps tomorrow before<span class='line-break'> </span>coming to town.</p>
<p>I am very respectfully yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a> Sec.y</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133678">
<h3><a name="page-1133678">CB01_0189</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>189</p>
<p><date when='1864-12-06'>Decem<sup>r</sup> 6, [186]4</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'>Capt. D.L. Winsor</a></p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>The following votes relating to the<span class='line-break'> </span>administration of affairs in your department were <span class='line-break'> </span>yesterday adopted at a meeting of the Board of Trus--<span class='line-break'> </span>tees: --</p>
<p>"That the Superintendent be instructed to place<span class='line-break'> </span>the numbers and bounds to such lots as have<span class='line-break'> </span>been neglected, at the expense of the proprietors,<span class='line-break'> </span>notice having previously been given in accordance<span class='line-break'> </span>with the rules of this Board." --</p>
<p>"That the Superintendent, under the direction of the<span class='line-break'> </span>Committee on Interments be directed to exclude from<span class='line-break'> </span>the privileges of the Cemetery, any Undertaker, in his<span class='line-break'> </span>official capacity, who shall have been reported<span class='line-break'> </span>as delinquent in complying with the Regulations<span class='line-break'> </span>relating to Interments."</p>
<p>Respectfully yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133679">
<h3><a name="page-1133679">CB01_0190</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><date when='1864-12-06'>Decem<sup>r</sup> 6 [186]4</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'>Capt. Winsor</a></p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/59579' title='Adams, Mr.'>Mr Adams</a><span class='line-break'> </span>has called upon me today with<span class='line-break'> </span>reference to the lots owned by himself<span class='line-break'> </span>the Foster &amp; Webb families, and<span class='line-break'> </span>states that he has had the lots [recently?]<span class='line-break'> </span>sodded &amp; put in repair: &amp; wishes<span class='line-break'> </span>to see if he can make arrangements for<span class='line-break'> </span>their permanent care.</p>
<p>I therefore return you the Report<span class='line-break'> </span>made more than a year since, and will<span class='line-break'> </span>thank you to correct the answer to [?]<span class='line-break'> </span>quest. &amp; make any other corrections if [?]<span class='line-break'> </span>have been any changes, redate it, [?]<span class='line-break'> </span>erasing the old date, and send it [?]</p>
<p>I think you had better add your [?]<span class='line-break'> </span>in a postscript on the 2<sup>d</sup> page.</p>
<p>Truly yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a></p>
<p><date when='1864-12-06'>Dec<sup>r</sup> 6 [186]4</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'>Capt. D.L. Winsor</a>,</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>In my other note to<span class='line-break'> </span>you of this date, I overlooked the<span class='line-break'> </span>following vote adopted yesterday<span class='line-break'> </span>by our Board of Trustees: -</p>
<p>"That the Secretary be directed<span class='line-break'> </span>to give notice to the Superintendent<span class='line-break'> </span>that the fee for interment, having been<span class='line-break'> </span>increased from three to five dollars,<span class='line-break'> </span>the charge for a grave in the Public<span class='line-break'> </span>Lots, as required by the by-law, - Art.<span class='line-break'> </span>18, is seventeen dollars for the body of<span class='line-break'> </span>any person except a child under ten<span class='line-break'> </span>years of age, ^<sup>which is fifteen dollars,</sup> and that he be au--<span class='line-break'> </span>thorized to have the blanks corrected<span class='line-break'> </span>in accordance with these rates".</p>
<p>Yours truly</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a></p>
<p>190</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133680">
<h3><a name="page-1133680">CB01_0191</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><date when='1864-12-08'>Decm<sup>r</sup> 8 [186]4</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/67115' title='Atkins, Benjamin F.'>B.F. Atkins</a> Esq.</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>I regretted to hear <span class='line-break'> </span>yesterday from <a href='/pages/subjects/54774' title='Little, Charles C.'>C.C. Little</a> Esq. that you <span class='line-break'> </span>had for years felt aggrieved with me<span class='line-break'> </span>on the ground (as you supposed) that<span class='line-break'> </span>after having been paid by you the usual fee<span class='line-break'> </span>for filing your affidavit as sole heir at law<span class='line-break'> </span>of <a href='/pages/subjects/67116' title='Atkins, Benjamin'>Benj. Atkins</a> to <a href='/pages/subjects/67117' title='Lot 62'>lot No. 62</a> in Mt Auburn,<span class='line-break'> </span>I had neglected to record you title or<span class='line-break'> </span>make the same appear.</p>
<p>I do not learn that you ever<span class='line-break'> </span>called upon or inquired of me whether<span class='line-break'> </span>I had done my duty in the matter, but<span class='line-break'> </span>by some means had come to the<span class='line-break'> </span>conclusion that I had omitted<span class='line-break'> </span>to do it. I must therefore infer that<span class='line-break'> </span>you arrived at this conclusion<span class='line-break'> </span>by forgetting the date when<span class='line-break'> </span>you made your affidavit<span class='line-break'> </span>and examining some edition of<span class='line-break'> </span>the catalogue antedating your<span class='line-break'> </span>affidavit.</p>
<p>The facts I find from record<span class='line-break'> </span>are -</p>
<p>Affidavit of <a href='/pages/subjects/67115' title='Atkins, Benjamin F.'>Benj. F. Atkins</a> as sole<span class='line-break'> </span>heir at law of <a href='/pages/subjects/67116' title='Atkins, Benjamin'>Benj. Atkins</a> filed<span class='line-break'> </span><ins>July 31. 1857</ins> -</p>
<p>The only edition of the Catalogue<span class='line-break'> </span>of Lots &amp; Proprietors published since<span class='line-break'> </span>that date was issued in June 1860.<span class='line-break'> </span>That edition contains your name<span class='line-break'> </span>printed as such sole heir both<span class='line-break'> </span>in the numerical &amp; alphabetical<span class='line-break'> </span>part of the catalogue.</p>
<p>The previous edition, if you<span class='line-break'> </span>will examine, was printed as early<span class='line-break'> </span><ins>May 1, 1857,</ins> and was distributed<span class='line-break'> </span>among the proprietors in June of that<span class='line-break'> </span>year, at least a month before your affidavit.</p>
<p>I am Very Respy, your Ob<sup>t</sup> Serv<sup>t</sup></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>Austin J. Coolidge</a></p>
<p>P.S. I mailed between 1700 &amp; 1800 of the Catalogue of 1860 to <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a> Proprietors, &amp; find your<span class='line-break'> </span>name checked as one to whom a copy was sent.--</p>
<p>191</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133681">
<h3><a name="page-1133681">CB01_0192</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><date when='1864-12-08'>Decem<sup>r</sup> 8 [186]4</date></p>
<p>Mr. <a href='/pages/subjects/65998' title='Lears, William C.'>W<sup>m</sup> C. Lears</a></p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>I met you<span class='line-break'> </span>some weeks since, and you suggested<span class='line-break'> </span>that you were intending to come<span class='line-break'> </span>in the next week &amp; finish<span class='line-break'> </span>the conveyance of the Spring<span class='line-break'> </span>lot &amp;c.</p>
<p>I must request you once<span class='line-break'> </span>more not to delay this matter<span class='line-break'> </span>longer.</p>
<p>Yours respectfully</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Secretary</p>
<p><date when='1864-12-09'>Decem<sup>r</sup> 9 [186]4</date></p>
<p>Hon. <a href='/pages/subjects/67089' title='Parker, Joel'>Joel Parker</a>,</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>I return the<span class='line-break'> </span>instrument which was made to<span class='line-break'> </span>express the terms of contract for the per<span class='line-break'></span>petual repair of <a href='/pages/subjects/67074' title='Lot 1250'>lots 1250</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/67075' title='Lot 1315'><!--Lot-->1315</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/67076' title='Lot 1333'>1333</a> in this <span class='line-break'> </span>Cemetery, duly executed &amp; recorded.</p>
<p>My charge in connection therewith is $5.-<span class='line-break'> </span>which, by the bylaws of this Corporation, is paid by the<span class='line-break'> </span>party for whose benefit the contract is made.</p>
<p>I enclose also one of our printed<span class='line-break'> </span>blanks for the designation of a person to repre--<span class='line-break'> </span>sent <a href='/pages/subjects/67074' title='Lot 1250'>lot No. 1250</a>, under the Charter. The regu--<span class='line-break'> </span>lations, you find at the foot of the blank. I am<span class='line-break'> </span>unable from my own knowledge to fill up the<span class='line-break'> </span>names of the children in order - which should be<span class='line-break'> </span>as they stood at the death of the testator, noting<span class='line-break'> </span>any who have died since.</p>
<p>I am very Resp.y your Ob<sup>t</sup> Serv<sup>t</sup></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a></p>
<p>192</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133682">
<h3><a name="page-1133682">CB01_0193</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><date when='1864-12-10'>Decem<sup>r</sup> 10 [186]4</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/64302' title='Lawrence, James'>Jas. Lawrence</a> Esq.<sup>r</sup></p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>Upon the application<span class='line-break'> </span>of <a href='/pages/subjects/104060' title='Lawrence, William R. (1812-1885)'>Dr Lawrence</a> in behalf of himself<span class='line-break'> </span>brother &amp; yourself for a relocating of<span class='line-break'> </span>your lot in the Cemetery, presented<span class='line-break'> </span>to the Trustees last Monday, the  subject was<span class='line-break'> </span>referred to the Com. on Lots, who have<span class='line-break'> </span>decided to grant your request, by giving deeds<span class='line-break'> </span>anew to the parties, they first reconveying<span class='line-break'> </span>their lots to the Corporation. If you will<span class='line-break'> </span>send or bring your deed I will prepare<span class='line-break'> </span>transfer for your signature.</p>
<p>I had supposed we should effect it<span class='line-break'> </span>by a change of the plans, but that arrange<span class='line-break'></span>ment did not appear to suit <a href='/pages/subjects/104060' title='Lawrence, William R. (1812-1885)'>Dr Lawrence</a>.</p>
<p>Very Respy. yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a> Sec.y</p>
<p><date when='1864-12-10'>Decem<sup>r</sup> 10 [186]4</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/104060' title='Lawrence, William R. (1812-1885)'>Dr W<sup>m</sup>. R. Lawrence</a></p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>The Trustees have<span class='line-break'></span>referred your application to the Com<span class='line-break'></span>mittee on Lots, who have decided<span class='line-break'> </span>to grant your request, you first<span class='line-break'> </span>reconveying your lot to the Corpor<span class='line-break'></span>ation -- your brother &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/64302' title='Lawrence, James'>Mr Jas. Law<span class='line-break'></span>rence</a> doing the same thing.</p>
<p>If you will send your<span class='line-break'> </span>deed, I will prepare transfer.</p>
<p>Very Resp.y yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
<p>193</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133683">
<h3><a name="page-1133683">CB01_0194</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><date when='1864-12-12'>Decr<sup>r</sup> 12 [186]4</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'>Capt. D.L. Winsor</a></p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/67121' title='Roberts, E. K., Mr.'>Mr E.K. Roberts</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>of <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a> had his <a href='/pages/subjects/67122' title='Roberts, Alfred'>brother Alfred</a><span class='line-break'> </span>deposited in the <a href='/pages/subjects/57656' title='Receiving Tomb'>Receiving Tomb</a> Aug 9,<span class='line-break'> </span>1864, &amp; has rec<sup>d</sup> notice of expiration<span class='line-break'> </span>of the 4 mos.-</p>
<p>He wishes a little further time<span class='line-break'> </span>to select a lot, &amp; will do so, if the<span class='line-break'> </span>snow leaves so as to afford him an<span class='line-break'> </span>opportunity. I have told him, that<span class='line-break'> </span>$ 1.25 per month would be charged<span class='line-break'> </span>him extra to be deducted out of<span class='line-break'> </span>the am<sup>t</sup> to be refunded.</p>
<p>Yours Respy</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Secy</p>
<p>P.S. Williams left two plans here on Saturday for you.-<span class='line-break'> </span>or rather two views of same plan - I should think.</p>
<p><date when='1864-12-14'>Decr<sup>r</sup> 14, [186]4</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/55342' title='Adams, Edwin F.'>Edwin F. Adams</a> Esq.<sup>r</sup></p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>I have ^<sup>had</sup> a new<span class='line-break'> </span>Report made upon the four lots of your<span class='line-break'></span>self and others, and have sub<span class='line-break'></span>mitted them subject to the Com<span class='line-break'></span>on Lots, who have directed<span class='line-break'> </span>me to inform you that the Cor<span class='line-break'></span>poration will assume the contract<span class='line-break'> </span>for perpetual repair of these lots<span class='line-break'> </span>for $1200.-- The by laws do not<span class='line-break'> </span>permit the assumption of one of<span class='line-break'> </span>the guarantee contracts for less than<span class='line-break'> </span>$300 for each lot of 300 feet.</p>
<p>If you shall conclude to accept<span class='line-break'> </span>the offer, I will wait upon you at<span class='line-break'> </span>any time to draw the necessary papers.</p>
<p>Yours Respectfully</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
<p>194<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133684">
<h3><a name="page-1133684">CB01_0195</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><date when='1864-12-15'>Dec<sup>r</sup> 15 [186]4</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/104065' title='Messenger, George W.'>Geo W Messenger</a> Esq</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/62820' title='Gould, Eliza'>Mrs Gould</a>'s daughter<span class='line-break'> </span>is the legal heir to <a href='/pages/subjects/97359' title='Lot 1769'>lot no 1769</a>, our lots<span class='line-break'> </span>being declared by this Charter to be real estate.<span class='line-break'> </span>As the daughter is abroad, I see no objection<span class='line-break'> </span>to <a href='/pages/subjects/62820' title='Gould, Eliza'>Mrs Gould</a>'s representing this lot.</p>
<p>But a new dilemma may be presented by<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/62820' title='Gould, Eliza'>Mrs Gould</a>'s going abroad, as the lot is enclosed<span class='line-break'> </span>with iron fence. These lots need constant attention,<span class='line-break'> </span>or they soon fall into disrepair. If you should<span class='line-break'> </span>advise <a href='/pages/subjects/62820' title='Gould, Eliza'>Mrs Gould</a> to avail herself of a provision<span class='line-break'> </span>of our by laws in giving the Corporation a sum of<span class='line-break'> </span>money to keep her lot in <ins>perpetual</ins> repair, from the<span class='line-break'> </span>income of the fund. I think you will do her<span class='line-break'> </span>and those interested good service. The same<span class='line-break'> </span>paid for that are $300 &amp; upwards, according to the nature<span class='line-break'> </span>of the lot site requirements.</p>
<p>My Respy yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a>. Sec.y</p>
<p><date when='1864-12-20'>Dec<sup>r</sup> 20, [186]4</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/67123' title='Balls, Sullivan B.'>Sullivan B. Ball</a> Esq<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/67124' title='Fitchburg, MA'>Fitchburg, Mass.</a></p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>Excuse my seeming<span class='line-break'> </span>want of attention by your request of Dec<sup>r</sup><span class='line-break'> </span>5 to know the value of lot of <a href='/pages/subjects/67125' title='Morse, Molezias'>Molezias<span class='line-break'> </span>Morse</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/67126' title='Lot 624'>- 624,</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/60001' title='Walnut Avenue'><ins>Walnut</ins> Av<sup>e</sup></a> (not <a href='/pages/subjects/57668' title='Chestnut Avenue'>Chestnut<!--Ave--></a>).</p>
<p>I expected to be at the Cemetery in a<span class='line-break'> </span>day or two after the recpt of your note, &amp;<span class='line-break'> </span>give you my opinion from personal inspection;<span class='line-break'> </span>but the snow has decided that matter.</p>
<p>However, I can give you about as good<span class='line-break'> </span>an opinion from knowledge of its location. It<span class='line-break'> </span>cannot be worth less than $300, and $400 could not<span class='line-break'> </span>be a high price, at all, for the lot.</p>
<p>I like to know where our proprietors are.<span class='line-break'> </span>My catalogue fixes Mr Morse in <a href='/pages/subjects/67127' title='Leominster, MA'>Leominster</a>.<span class='line-break'> </span>I rather infer he is now in <a href='/pages/subjects/67124' title='Fitchburg, MA'>Fitchburg</a>. Will you<span class='line-break'> </span>please state? If I can serve you in any way further<span class='line-break'> </span>I shall be happy to do so.</p>
<p>Yours Respy <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a> Secy.</p>
<p>195</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133685">
<h3><a name="page-1133685">CB01_0196</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><date when='1864-12-20'>Dec.<sup>r</sup> 20<sup>th</sup>, [186]4</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/67128' title='Parker, H. G.'>H.G. Parker</a> Esq</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>I return the<span class='line-break'> </span>deed of lot <a href='/pages/subjects/67076' title='Lot 1333'>1333</a> in the Cemetery,<span class='line-break'> </span>having duly recorded the transfer<span class='line-break'> </span>from <a href='/pages/subjects/62332' title='Parker, Henry Melville'>Mr Parker</a> to his<span class='line-break'> </span>widow. --</p>
<p>The usual fee is $2.<span class='line-break'> </span>which please send at your<span class='line-break'> </span>convenience.</p>
<p>Truly yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
<p><date when='1864-12-20'>Dec<sup>r</sup> 20 [186]4</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/67129' title='Savell, Charles E.'>Chas. E. Savell</a> Esq<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54347' title='Roxbury, MA'>Roxbury, Mass.</a></p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>I have been<span class='line-break'> </span>much pressed for time, or should<span class='line-break'> </span>have returned the petition to you<span class='line-break'> </span>sooner for execution.</p>
<p>If your father left a widow, please<span class='line-break'> </span>insert the fact and her name. If not,<span class='line-break'> </span>say "no widow" &amp; erase the "whose name is." --<span class='line-break'> </span>If your brother John left children, their<span class='line-break'> </span>name &amp; residence should be inserted.</p>
<p>If under guardianship, the guardian<span class='line-break'> </span>should sign. --</p>
<p>I have at your request, changed<span class='line-break'> </span>the family name, in my catalogue.</p>
<p>Yours truly</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
<p>196</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133686">
<h3><a name="page-1133686">CB01_0197</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>197</p>
<p><date when='1864-12-20'>Dec<sup>r</sup> 20. [186]4</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'>Capt. D L Winsor</a>,</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>I wish you would<span class='line-break'> </span>endeavor to report upon <a href='/pages/subjects/67066' title='lot 525'>lot 525</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/59901' title='Olive Path'>Olive Path</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>to <a href='/pages/subjects/67065' title='Farwell, Oliver A.'>Oliver A. Farwell</a>, if you can. I am inclined to,<span class='line-break'> </span>think, from <a href='/pages/subjects/81482' title='Shedd, J. H., Mr.'>Mr Shedd's</a> statement, that his surveyor's<span class='line-break'> </span>measurement is correct - for he states that although<span class='line-break'> </span>he gives one of the distances on the sketch handed you,<span class='line-break'> </span>as 13ft., that was a mere error of figures there,<span class='line-break'> </span>and that he calculated the area by calling that distance<span class='line-break'> </span>15 feet. It seems a pity, when the money has been ready<span class='line-break'> </span>for the lot so long, that the proprietor should not receive<span class='line-break'> </span>his deeds. I have the impression the figures he<span class='line-break'> </span>gave me were 356 ft. but your memo will<span class='line-break'> </span>show. My former note contained it as he<span class='line-break'> </span>gave it to me.</p>
<p>Respectfully yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133687">
<h3><a name="page-1133687">CB01_0198</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><date when='1864-12-20'>Dec<sup>r</sup> 20. [186]4</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'>Geo W<sup>m</sup> Bond Esq</a></p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>I wish<span class='line-break'> </span>very much you would<span class='line-break'> </span>return to me the transcripts<span class='line-break'> </span>of deeds made which I sent<span class='line-break'> </span>you some months since - <span class='line-break'> </span>say 50 deeds or more, or<span class='line-break'> </span>send me the same in the <span class='line-break'> </span>usual form of order -- I am <span class='line-break'> </span>wholly afloat &amp; don't know<span class='line-break'> </span>where to start again.</p>
<p>Respectfully yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a></p>
<p><date when='1865-01-03'>Jany 3 [186]5</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/67130' title='Tucker, Lyman'>Mrs Lyman Tucker</a><span class='line-break'> </span>935 Washington St.,</p>
<p>Dear Madam,</p>
<p>The bills<span class='line-break'> </span>against proprietors are sent ^<sup>from the Superintendent</sup> to the office<span class='line-break'> </span>of the Treas.<sup>r</sup> <a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'>Geo. W<sup>m</sup> Bond</a>, 167 <span class='line-break'> </span>Congress St. and you will doubtless find<span class='line-break'> </span>it there.</p>
<p>Allow me further to suggest<span class='line-break'> </span>that the Secretary would like a <span class='line-break'> </span>reply to his note addressed to<span class='line-break'> </span>Mrs Tucker at 59 Shawmut Av<sup>e</sup><span class='line-break'> </span>on the <date when='1864-04-01'>1<sup>st</sup> April 1864</date>, on the sub<span class='line-break'></span>ject of recording the transfer to her<span class='line-break'> </span>of the lot in Mt Auburn, without which<span class='line-break'> </span>her right as proprietor cannot be<span class='line-break'> </span>recognised.</p>
<p>Respectfully</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Secretary</p>
<p>198<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133688">
<h3><a name="page-1133688">CB01_0199</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>199</p>
<p><date when='1865-01-03'>Jany 3 [186]5</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'>Capt Winsor</a>,</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/71286' title='Converse, James C.'>Mr J.C. Converse</a><span class='line-break'> </span>wishes me to say that he is ready to take<span class='line-break'> </span>the land as surveyed by you in addition<span class='line-break'> </span>to <a href='/pages/subjects/67133' title='Lot 889'>lot 889</a> on <a href='/pages/subjects/60335' title='Poplar Avenue'>Poplar<!--Ave--></a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/60336' title='Willow Avenue'>Willow Avenues</a>. --He<span class='line-break'> </span>thinks he left it so a year ago, when he talked<span class='line-break'> </span>with you, but as you showed him a plan, and he<span class='line-break'> </span>did not decide upon the granite contract, he<span class='line-break'> </span>says you may have rec<sup>d</sup> the impression that he<span class='line-break'> </span>left both undecided. He would have preferred a little<span class='line-break'> </span>less of a jog on the west side - but is willing to lease<span class='line-break'> </span>that to you.</p>
<p>I have told him that he will have to pay $1.00<span class='line-break'> </span>per foot for his land now, when he could have<span class='line-break'> </span>rec<sup>d</sup> it, if he had been more punctual, at 50 cts.</p>
<p>He says if you will report the amount<span class='line-break'> </span>to be added, he will pay for it, at any time.</p>
<p>As the matter has been lying unfinished with<span class='line-break'> </span>me for two or three years, the event is to be very<span class='line-break'> </span>much desired; and I hope you will report it<span class='line-break'> </span>forthwith.</p>
<p>Respectfully yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a></p>
<p>Please say to <a href='/pages/subjects/52579' title='Safford, Truman H.'>Mr Safford</a>, I would like the orders of interment for<span class='line-break'> </span>Nov<sup>r</sup> &amp; Dec<sup>r</sup></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133689">
<h3><a name="page-1133689">CB01_0200</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>200</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a> <date when='1865-01-07'>Jany. 7. 1865</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54832' title='Austin, Edward'>Edw<sup>d</sup> Austin</a> Esq</p>
<p>My dear Sir,</p>
<p>Your note of yesterday with accompanying<span class='line-break'> </span>papers was rec<sup>d</sup> today between 1 and 2 o'clock, so that<span class='line-break'> </span>it would be impossible for me to redraft the paper on<span class='line-break'> </span>the Repair Fund in the manner suggested by you in season<span class='line-break'> </span>for the next meeting of the Trustees - on Monday morning.<span class='line-break'> </span>Indeed when I saw you two days since, I understood<span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; thought it was agreed, that, such were your and my<span class='line-break'> </span>engagements, the matter should stand for some time longer.</p>
<p>However, if I quote the vote of the Trustees on this, you<span class='line-break'> </span>will see that it need not be brought before the Board<span class='line-break'> </span>again.</p>
<p>"Voted that the Secretary, under the direction of the<span class='line-break'> </span>Committee on Lots, be authorized to send a printed circular<span class='line-break'> </span>to every proprietor of a lot in the Cemetery, in accordance<span class='line-break'> </span>with the previous vote."</p>
<p>The previous vote referred to was the acceptance of<span class='line-break'> </span>the report of your Com. through <a href='/pages/subjects/56312' title='Norcross, Otis'>Mr Norcross</a>, recommending<span class='line-break'> </span>that the Proprietors ^<sup>should</sup> be made acquainted with the subject<span class='line-break'> </span>by sending a printed notice.</p>
<p>The power, therefore, over the whole matter is<span class='line-break'> </span>rested with your Com.<sup>ee</sup>.  The vote does not<span class='line-break'> </span>limit the Com. as to the cost. Nor does it conflict<span class='line-break'> </span>with the by-law limiting a Com. to $100 in any ex-</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133690">
<h3><a name="page-1133690">CB01_0201</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>201</p>
<p>penditure without authority from the Board, as you<span class='line-break'> </span>have been specially authorized by the Board to<span class='line-break'> </span>incur such expenditure as will effect the object. --<span class='line-break'> </span>The limitation was intended of course to apply to the ordi<span class='line-break'></span>nary operations of a Com. without consulting the Board.</p>
<p>Then as the question of expense is one ^<sup>alone</sup> for you and<span class='line-break'> </span>your Colleague, I suggest that you have probably an<span class='line-break'> </span>overestimate of what it is necessary to cost to print the<span class='line-break'> </span>paper as last suggested by me: although in my judg<span class='line-break'></span>ment, the highest figures shown you would be a wise<span class='line-break'> </span>investment for the Corporation, and would be returned<span class='line-break'> </span>an hundred fold. --</p>
<p><table class='tabular'><thead><span class='line-break'> </span><tr><th>For the first thousand copies. cost -- 12pp</th> <th>30.50<span class='line-break'> </span></th></tr></thead> <tbody> <tr><td>"</td> <td>"</td> <td>second &amp; third [indecipherable]</td> <td><ins>36.--</ins></td> </tr> </tbody> </table> <span class='line-break'> </span>Or to have it a little more finished in dress with a <ins>cover</ins> --</p>
<p><table class='tabular'><thead><span class='line-break'> </span><tr><th>For first 1000.</th> <th>$38.25<span class='line-break'> </span></th></tr></thead> <tbody> <tr><td>"</td> <td>second &amp; third 1000 each $25.77</td> <td><ins>51.54</ins></td> </tr> </tbody> </table> <span class='line-break'> </span>I have made a little estimate of it cut down<span class='line-break'> </span>by the paragraphs marked: -- and as nearly as I<span class='line-break'> </span>can judge 3000 copies would amt to say $42.25. --<span class='line-break'> </span>The difference between this and 66.50 is <ins>$24.25</ins> -- a<span class='line-break'> </span>sum surely, you will say, which should<span class='line-break'> </span>not stand in the way, for a moment, of<span class='line-break'> </span>sending this paper forth in the best form. --</p>
<p>I have carefully looked over the paper as you<span class='line-break'> </span>have marked it, and am certain that such<span class='line-break'> </span>an <ins>excision</ins> would leave it a disjointed piece</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133691">
<h3><a name="page-1133691">CB01_0202</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>202</p>
<p>of work, which, to say nothing of its inartistic<span class='line-break'> </span>appearance, would have the sting extracted. --</p>
<p>The paper made up of the sentences marked by<span class='line-break'> </span>you would be only a bald statement of facts<span class='line-break'> </span>unsupported by reasons. It <del>says</del> ^<sup>is</sup> to the proprietor <span class='line-break'> </span>the <ins>ipse dixit</ins> of the writer, requiring him to<span class='line-break'> </span>believe it and act upon it, if moved<span class='line-break'> </span>by anything outside to do so, but he fails to<span class='line-break'> </span>find the reason in the paper itself. --</p>
<p>The great object I have endeavored to<span class='line-break'> </span>keep in view throughout, is that men are moved<span class='line-break'> </span>by <ins>argument</ins>, by <ins>inducement</ins>. I have supplied<span class='line-break'> </span>this partly by illustration -- partly by picture of what<span class='line-break'> </span>Mt Auburn will become if neglected, and their own<span class='line-break'> </span>lots in particular: partly by statement of plain facts, very<span class='line-break'> </span>necessary to be known by them. I wish proprietors<span class='line-break'> </span>to be able to find <ins>somewhere</ins> a tolerably full statement of<span class='line-break'> </span>facts which they greatly need to know; and which they have <span class='line-break'> </span>hitherto looked in vain for, and to repeat which to<span class='line-break'> </span>them orally in each case is too great a labor for any<span class='line-break'> </span>trustee or officer.</p>
<p>I believe the facts contained in my paper, in their very<span class='line-break'> </span>style, are calculated to make those who read think more upon<span class='line-break'> </span>the subject, than if presented in a balder, and more formal style.<span class='line-break'> </span>If, however, anybody can put together a paper more satisfac<span class='line-break'></span>tory, I should hope the Com. would employ him to do so; for I<span class='line-break'> </span>am not ambitious in the matter. On the other hand, I am quite<span class='line-break'> </span>willing to submit the <ins>proofs</ins> to the Com. and if they see anything that does<span class='line-break'> </span>not read so well in type to amend.</p>
<p>Very Respectfully yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133692">
<h3><a name="page-1133692">CB01_0203</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><date when='1865-01-09'>Jany. 9<sup>th</sup> [186]5</date></p>
<p>My dear Sir,</p>
<p>I have obtained a<span class='line-break'> </span>Report from our Sup<sup>t</sup> upon<span class='line-break'> </span>the lot in the Cemetery of your<span class='line-break'> </span>late father, <a href='/pages/subjects/67134' title='Lot 2963'>no. 2963</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/61123' title='Asphodel Path'>Asphodel<span class='line-break'> </span>Path</a>, and have laid the<span class='line-break'> </span>same before the Com<sup>ee</sup> on<span class='line-break'> </span>Lots, and they have directed<span class='line-break'> </span>me to notify you that<span class='line-break'> </span>this Corporation will guaranty<span class='line-break'> </span>the perpetual repair of said<span class='line-break'> </span>lot, if desired, for four<span class='line-break'> </span>hundred and fifty dollars<span class='line-break'> </span>($450.-)</p>
<p>I am<span class='line-break'> </span>Very truly yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/67135' title='Mackintire, George E.'>Geo. E. Mackintire</a> Esq<span class='line-break'> </span>44 Franklin St</p>
<p><date when='1865-01-10'>Jany. 10, [186]5</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/55348' title='Jones, Lewis'>Mr Lewis Jones</a>, Undertaker</p>
<p>Sir,</p>
<p>On the <date when='1864-08-08'>8<sup>th</sup> of August 1864</date>,<span class='line-break'> </span>you made an interment in <a href='/pages/subjects/65729' title='Lot 591'>lot no. 591</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>(it is said) represented by <a href='/pages/subjects/65730' title='Lamb, Thomas'>Thomas Lamb</a>.<span class='line-break'> </span>I have asked you in vain for such an<span class='line-break'> </span>order as our by-laws require, giving the name<span class='line-break'> </span>of the person interred and other facts, and<span class='line-break'> </span>although you have promised to obtain &amp; send<span class='line-break'> </span>it to me, you have not done so: - and the space<span class='line-break'> </span>today stands a blank on my records.</p>
<p>I have now only to say that if you<span class='line-break'> </span>do not get the proper order signed and re<span class='line-break'></span>turn it to me within the present week, I shall<span class='line-break'> </span>make such representation of the facts as a vote<span class='line-break'> </span>of the Trustees has authorized, and you must<span class='line-break'> </span>run the risk of the result. You will please<span class='line-break'> </span>notice that you are to seal it to <ins>me</ins>, and <ins>not</ins><span class='line-break'> </span>to Mt Auburn.</p>
<p>Yours resp.y</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a> Sec.y</p>
<p>203</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133693">
<h3><a name="page-1133693">CB01_0204</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>204</p>
<p><date when='1865-01-16'>Jany. 16 [186]5</date></p>
<p>To the Superintendent of the Cemetery.</p>
<p>Sir,</p>
<p>The By-laws of this Corporation<span class='line-break'> </span>make it the duty of the Committee on Regulations and Records<span class='line-break'> </span>of Interments "to see that the laws of the Commwealth &amp;c.<span class='line-break'> </span>those of the Cemetery relating to Interment are complied with:"<span class='line-break'> </span>and they further provide "that no interment shall be made<span class='line-break'> </span>until such a permit as may be required by the laws of the Common<span class='line-break'></span>wealth, or of the City or town from which the deceased may be brought,<span class='line-break'> </span>together with an order from the proprietor of the lot in which the<span class='line-break'> </span>interment is to be made, or his legal representation shall have<span class='line-break'> </span>been presented at the Gate, nor until the fees shall have been<span class='line-break'> </span>paid".</p>
<p>The Trustees having voted "that the Superintendent, under the<span class='line-break'> </span>direction of the Committee on Interments, be directed to exclude from<span class='line-break'> </span>the privileges of the Cemetery any undertaker, in his official capacity, who<span class='line-break'> </span>shall have been reported as delinquent in complying with the regulations<span class='line-break'> </span>relating to Interments".</p>
<p>And it appearing <a href='/pages/subjects/55348' title='Jones, Lewis'>Lewis Jones</a>, an undertaker, <span class='line-break'> </span>of <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a>, has repeatedly violated the foregoing by-law, you will<span class='line-break'> </span>notify the said Jones that for another violation he will be immediately<span class='line-break'> </span>excluded from the Cemetery, in his official capacity, and particularly require, in<span class='line-break'> </span>his case, that he shall not pass the Gate with a funeral until the proper papers are<span class='line-break'> </span>furnished.</p>
<p>Committee<span class='line-break'> </span>on Interments</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133694">
<h3><a name="page-1133694">CB01_0205</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><date when='1865-01-16'>Jan.y 16, [186]5</date></p>
<p>To the Committee on Interments</p>
<p>Gentlemen,</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/55348' title='Jones, Lewis'>Lewis Jones</a>, an undertaker<span class='line-break'> </span>of this City, has repeatedly violated the 16<sup>th</sup> Art.<span class='line-break'> </span>of the By-laws requiring proper orders for interment from<span class='line-break'> </span>the proprietor, and burial permits from the city or town to<span class='line-break'> </span>be furnished prior to the interment. He has been cau<span class='line-break'></span>tioned and remonstrated with, and has more than once<span class='line-break'> </span>spoken in disrespectful terms of the requirement.</p>
<p>On the 8<sup>th</sup> of August last he made an interment<span class='line-break'> </span>in the lot of <a href='/pages/subjects/65730' title='Lamb, Thomas'>Thos. Lamb</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/65729' title='Lot 591'>(591)</a> without any order<span class='line-break'> </span>furnished - without name of person interred or<span class='line-break'> </span>any of the facts. He has been repeatedly asked<span class='line-break'> </span>to make the proper return, and has promised to do so,<span class='line-break'> </span>but has failed: &amp; a blank line stands on the Register<span class='line-break'> </span>therefore. Last week he was notified that unless he<span class='line-break'> </span>should make this return within that week, the Secretary<span class='line-break'> </span>would represent the facts for such action as a vote of<span class='line-break'> </span>the Board ^<sup>of Trustees</sup> had authorized.</p>
<p>Respectfully,</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a> Sec.y</p>
<p><date when='1865-01-16'>Jany. 16, [186]5</date></p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>I am fearful <span class='line-break'> </span>that the fact you wished me<span class='line-break'> </span>to prepare affidavits of title<span class='line-break'> </span>in the case of <a href='/pages/subjects/67136' title='Lot 1849'>lots 1849</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/67137' title='Lot 1850'><!--Lot-->1850</a> has<span class='line-break'> </span>escaped your recollection - but such<span class='line-break'> </span>is the fact, and the papers have<span class='line-break'> </span>been ready for some time. If<span class='line-break'> </span>you will please call and<span class='line-break'> </span>make oath to those, and decide<span class='line-break'> </span>what next, our work will be<span class='line-break'> </span>short.</p>
<p>Very truly yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/67138' title='Renton, Peter'>Dr Peter Renton</a></p>
<p>205<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133695">
<h3><a name="page-1133695">CB01_0206</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>206</p>
<p><date when='1865-01-17'>Jany 17. [186]5</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/57826' title='Shedd &amp; Edson'>Messrs Shedd &amp; Edson</a></p>
<p>Gentlemen,</p>
<p>Please send me tomorrow the<span class='line-break'> </span><ins>inside</ins> measures to lots <a href='/pages/subjects/67191' title='Lot 3498'>3498</a> (Cutter) <a href='/pages/subjects/67156' title='Lot 3517'>3517</a> (Fray) <a href='/pages/subjects/67157' title='Lot 3518'>3518</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/67158' title='Lot 3519'>3519</a><span class='line-break'> </span>(Thompsons) on <a href='/pages/subjects/55284' title='Laurel Avenue'>Laurel Av<sup>e</sup></a>. I send the plans, on<span class='line-break'> </span>which I wish ^<sup>you</sup> to mark the length of inside lines, &amp; the<span class='line-break'> </span>middle ordinates, from which I can make deeds.</p>
<p>Send me also the same for <a href='/pages/subjects/65214' title='Lot 1463'>lot 1463</a>, on <a href='/pages/subjects/61286' title='Thistle Path'>Thistle<span class='line-break'> </span>Path</a> (<a href='/pages/subjects/65211' title='Hemenway, Mary Tileston'>Mrs Hemenway</a>'s) which contains 790 sq. ft.-</p>
<p>It is laid down on plan, but the <ins>exterior</ins> measures are<span class='line-break'> </span>given, so as to be no guide for me in describing.-</p>
<p>I shall have to ask you to send to Mt Auburn<span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; survey some of the irregular lots:-<span class='line-break'> </span>[?]}<span class='line-break'> </span>[?]}<span class='line-break'> </span>each other}</p>
<p>Among these I wish <span class='line-break'> </span><table class='tabular'><thead><span class='line-break'> </span><tr><th><a href='/pages/subjects/67159' title='Lot 3495'>3495</a></th> <th>rear of <a href='/pages/subjects/67160' title='Lot 179'><!--lot-->179</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/60001' title='Walnut Avenue'>Walnut Av.</a></th> <th>contents</th> <th>168f.<span class='line-break'> </span></th></tr></thead> <tbody> <tr><td><a href='/pages/subjects/67161' title='Lot 3516'>3516</a></td> <td>rear of <a href='/pages/subjects/67160' title='Lot 179'><!--lot-->179</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/60001' title='Walnut Avenue'>Walnut Av.</a></td> <td>contents</td> <td>65f</td> </tr> <tr><td><a href='/pages/subjects/67162' title='Lot 3508'>3508</a></td> <td>rear of <a href='/pages/subjects/67163' title='Lot 2204'>2204</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/60001' title='Walnut Avenue'>Walnut Av.</a></td> <td>contents</td> <td>87f.</td> </tr> <tr><td><a href='/pages/subjects/67164' title='Lot 3505'>3505</a></td> <td>Adams - <a href='/pages/subjects/61175' title='Elm Avenue'>Elm Av.</a></td> <td>contents</td> <td>203f</td> </tr> <tr><td><a href='/pages/subjects/67165' title='Lot 3511'>3511</a></td> <td>Sturges - <a href='/pages/subjects/61115' title='Anemone Path'>Anemone P.</a></td> <td>contents</td> <td>370f</td> </tr> <tr><td><a href='/pages/subjects/67166' title='Lot 3512'>3512</a></td> <td>Hill - <a href='/pages/subjects/60001' title='Walnut Avenue'>Walnut Av</a></td> <td>contents</td> <td>200f</td> </tr> <tr><td><a href='/pages/subjects/67167' title='Lot 3513'>3513</a></td> <td>Timson - <a href='/pages/subjects/60001' title='Walnut Avenue'>Walnut Av</a></td> <td>contents</td> <td>200f</td> </tr> <tr><td><a href='/pages/subjects/67168' title='Lot 3514'>3514</a></td> <td>Elliott -<a href='/pages/subjects/60001' title='Walnut Avenue'>Walnut Av</a></td> <td>contents</td> <td>300f</td> </tr> <tr><td><a href='/pages/subjects/67169' title='Lot 3515'>3515</a></td> <td>Ames - <a href='/pages/subjects/60001' title='Walnut Avenue'>Walnut Av</a></td> <td>contents</td> <td>300f</td> </tr> <tr><td><a href='/pages/subjects/67170' title='Lot 3484'>3484</a></td> <td>Prescott <a href='/pages/subjects/59222' title='Larch Avenue'>Larch Av</a></td> <td>contents</td> <td>1846f</td> </tr> <tr><td><a href='/pages/subjects/67171' title='Lot 3499'>3499</a></td> <td>Fines - <a href='/pages/subjects/61169' title='Dianthus Path'>Dianthus P.</a></td> <td>contents</td> <td>133f</td> </tr> </tbody> </table> <span class='line-break'> </span>Remember, I wish the <ins>inside</ins> measures.</p>
<p>There will doubtless <span class='line-break'> </span>be other irregular ones<span class='line-break'> </span>which I shall wish to<span class='line-break'> </span>[?]. Inform me where<span class='line-break'> </span>you will send out &amp; I will<span class='line-break'> </span>[?] the rest ready.</p>
<p>Yours respy</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133696">
<h3><a name="page-1133696">CB01_0207</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><date when='1865-01-17'>Jany 17 [186]5</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/67172' title='Bush, Levi'>Levi Bush</a> Esq<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/60948' title='Brighton, MA'>Brighton Mass</a>.</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>I have extended<span class='line-break'> </span>upon our records the facts nec<span class='line-break'></span>essary to evidence your title<span class='line-break'> </span>to <a href='/pages/subjects/67173' title='Lot 825'>Lot no. 825</a> in the Cemetery,<span class='line-break'> </span>and have only to annex the<span class='line-break'> </span>proper certificate to the deed which<span class='line-break'> </span>you have.--</p>
<p>Send this in and I will<span class='line-break'> </span>furnish you with what is [????]<span class='line-break'> </span>site.</p>
<p>My charge is $3. which you<span class='line-break'> </span>can also enclose.</p>
<p>Respectfully yours<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
<p><date when='1865-01-18'>Jany. 18 [186]5</date><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/67174' title='Blaisdell, John C.'>John C. Blaisdell</a> Esq</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/67110' title='Lot 3394'>Lot no. 3394</a><span class='line-break'> </span>sold to you in the <date when='1863-23'>autumn of 1863</date> still<span class='line-break'> </span>stands on our books to be deeded,<span class='line-break'> </span>on account of a memorandum that<span class='line-break'> </span>you had requested that the making of<span class='line-break'> </span>the deed should be delayed. I have<span class='line-break'> </span>written you before, asking why the delay,<span class='line-break'> </span>but rec<sup>d</sup> no reply.</p>
<p>I must request you now to reply<span class='line-break'> </span>definitely whether there is further occa<span class='line-break'></span>sion for waiting, as we must fin<span class='line-break'></span>ish up our matters for the year.</p>
<p>If there is no good reason for delay <span class='line-break'> </span>I shall make the deed to you.--</p>
<p>Yours Resp.y</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
<p>207</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133697">
<h3><a name="page-1133697">CB01_0208</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>208</p>
<p><date when='1865-01-18'>Jany 18. 5 [1865]</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'>Geo. W<sup>m</sup> Bond</a> Esq<sup>r</sup><span class='line-break'> </span>Treas<sup>r</sup> &amp;c</p>
<p>Dear Sir, I return deeds of lots</p>
<p>Numbered<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/67175' title='Lot 3493'>3493</a><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/67175' title='Lot 3493'>3494</a><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/67176' title='Lot 3500'>3500</a><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/67177' title='Lot 3501'>3501</a><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/67178' title='Lot 3502'>3502</a><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/67179' title='Lot 3503'>3503</a><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/67180' title='Lot 3504'>3504</a><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/67181' title='Lot 3509'>3509</a><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/67182' title='Lot 3510'>3510</a><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/67183' title='Lot 3520'>3520</a><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/67184' title='Lot 3523'>3523</a><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/67185' title='Lot 3528'>3528</a><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/67186' title='Lot 3530'>3530</a></p>
<p>I have not yet responded<span class='line-break'> </span>to your orders for<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/64020' title='Lot 21'>Lot 21</a><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/67187' title='Lot 2582'>2582</a><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/67110' title='Lot 3394'>3394</a><span class='line-break'> </span>new deeds {<a href='/pages/subjects/67188' title='Lot 3437'>3437</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/67189' title='Lot 3442'>3442</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/67190' title='Lot 3450'>3450</a>}<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/67170' title='Lot 3484'>3484</a><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/67159' title='Lot 3495'>3495</a><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/67191' title='Lot 3498'>3498</a><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/67171' title='Lot 3499'>3499</a><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/67164' title='Lot 3505'>3505</a><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/67162' title='Lot 3508'>3508</a><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/67165' title='Lot 3511'>3511</a><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/67166' title='Lot 3512'>3512</a><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/67167' title='Lot 3513'>3513</a><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/67168' title='Lot 3514'>3514</a><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/67169' title='Lot 3515'>3515</a><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/67161' title='Lot 3516'>3516</a><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/67156' title='Lot 3517'>3517</a><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/67157' title='Lot 3518'>3518</a><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/67158' title='Lot 3519'>3519</a><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/67192' title='Lot 3526'>3526</a><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/67193' title='Lot 3527'>3527</a></p>
<p>I have yet no<span class='line-break'> </span>orders for<span class='line-break'> </span>[Jus. Recd?] &amp; al. {<a href='/pages/subjects/65993' title='Lot 3419'>3419</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/65994' title='Lot 3420'>3420</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/65995' title='Lot 3421'>3421</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/65996' title='Lot 3422'>3422</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/65991' title='Lot 3423'>3423</a>}<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/67194' title='Lot 3496'>3496</a><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/67195' title='Lot 3497'>3497</a><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/67196' title='Lot 3521'>3521</a><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/67197' title='Lot 3524'>3524</a><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/67198' title='Lot 3529'>3529</a><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/67199' title='Lot 3531'>3531</a><span class='line-break'> </span>and all after <a href='/pages/subjects/67199' title='Lot 3531'>3531</a>.</p>
<p>If you will complete<span class='line-break'> </span>your orders for what<span class='line-break'> </span>remains. I will endeavor<span class='line-break'> </span>to complete the deeds within<span class='line-break'> </span>a week so as to be in--<span class='line-break'> </span>season for your [?].</p>
<p>I shall be able to furnish<span class='line-break'> </span>what I have on hand, as soon<span class='line-break'> </span>as I receive some items from<span class='line-break'> </span>the Surveyor &amp; Sup<sup>t</sup>— Please be<span class='line-break'> </span>correct in transcribing <a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'>Capt. Winsor's</a><span class='line-break'> </span>sketches &amp; figures.</p>
<p>Resp yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133698">
<h3><a name="page-1133698">CB01_0209</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><date when='1865-01-19'>Jany. 19, [186]5</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/55342' title='Adams, Edwin F.'>Edwin F. Adams</a> Esq</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>I send you<span class='line-break'> </span>the instruments to be executed by<span class='line-break'> </span>yourself, and others in the matter<span class='line-break'> </span>of endowing <a href='/pages/subjects/56687' title='Lot 1875-1878'>lots 1875-8</a> in--<span class='line-break'> </span>clusive, in Mt Auburn.</p>
<p>I marked in pencil the<span class='line-break'> </span>way the paper should be<span class='line-break'> </span>executed. You can rub out<span class='line-break'> </span>my pencil marks, or write<span class='line-break'> </span>over them, and I will erase them.—</p>
<p>I did not know whether<span class='line-break'> </span>Mr Forster's residence is <a href='/pages/subjects/55343' title='Somerville, MA'>Som<span class='line-break'></span>erville</a> or <a href='/pages/subjects/54284' title='Charlestown, MA'>Charlestown</a>, &amp; left<span class='line-break'> </span>it blank.</p>
<p>When the parties have signed, I will<span class='line-break'> </span>help you through with the rest.</p>
<p>Truly yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a> Sec.</p>
<p><date when='1865-01-20'>Jany. 20 [186]5</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'>Capt. Winsor</a>,</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>Will you, if<span class='line-break'> </span>you have time in the morning, fill<span class='line-break'> </span>up and bring in a Report upon <a href='/pages/subjects/56688' title='Lot 1397'>lot<span class='line-break'> </span>1397</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/55346' title='Asclepias Path'>Asclepias Path</a>, Sol. Sargent,<span class='line-break'> </span>for Perpetual Repair?—</p>
<p>I wish also the <ins>inside</ins> measures of the<span class='line-break'> </span>Cutter, Fay &amp; Thompson lots on <a href='/pages/subjects/55347' title='Laurel Hill'>Laurel<span class='line-break'> </span>Hill</a>. Mr Shedd has not got them, but says<span class='line-break'> </span>you have them. And if you have your dia<span class='line-break'></span>gram of irregular lots in such shape<span class='line-break'> </span>as to bring them in and clear obstructions<span class='line-break'> </span>I should like it.</p>
<p>I will try to give you a<span class='line-break'> </span>report upon the Interments.</p>
<p>By the way <ins>(privately)</ins> if <a href='/pages/subjects/55348' title='Jones, Lewis'>Lewis Jones</a> has<span class='line-break'> </span>not taken away that August order of interment, please get<span class='line-break'> </span>it of Mr. Safford, &amp; bring it in. It will not alter the situ<span class='line-break'></span>ation of matters with Jones.</p>
<p>Respectfully yours,</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
<p>209</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133699">
<h3><a name="page-1133699">CB01_0210</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>210</p>
<p><date when='1865-01-23'>Jany. 23 [186]5</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'>Capt. Winsor</a>,</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>There is an error in casting<span class='line-break'> </span>the contents of <a href='/pages/subjects/67171' title='Lot 3499'>lot no. 3499</a>  on <a href='/pages/subjects/61169' title='Dianthus Path'>Dianthus Path</a>, that of<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/67202' title='Fines, Norris'>Norris Fines</a>, which I think you will, percieve on<span class='line-break'> </span>a moment's reflection,  [Image: diagram with measurments] You have given the<span class='line-break'> </span>contents as 123 feet, which figures can be obtained <span class='line-break'> </span>only be adding the opposite sides, and multiplying<span class='line-break'> </span>the halves together, ie, 14 x 9 &amp; one-half = 133.  But in a figure of [duel?]<span class='line-break'> </span>unequal sides, this makes a considerable error, as you see<span class='line-break'> </span>if you divide the lot into a rectangle and triangle, which gives<span class='line-break'> </span>you but 123 &amp; one-half feet, or 9 &amp; one-half less than you returned.-</p>
<p>This figure is a trapezoid, i.e, one with four sides<span class='line-break'> </span>only two of which are parallel.  The rule for finding the<span class='line-break'> </span>area of a trapezoid is:-</p>
<p>"Multiply half the sum of its parallel sides by the dis<span class='line-break'></span>tance between them:" - for it is equal to two triangles whose bases<span class='line-break'> </span>are the two parallel sides of the trapezoid, and whose altitude is the distance<span class='line-break'> </span>between them. To prove it in this case, - the lot<span class='line-break'> </span>[Image: Trapezoid diagram with figures.] <span class='line-break'> </span>A.B.C.D. is divided into the two triangles A.B.C and<span class='line-break'> </span>A.C.D - The base of A.B.C is A.B., it's altitude is B.C,<span class='line-break'> </span>The base of A.C.D. is A.D its altitude E.D.-<span class='line-break'> </span>A.B.C = 13 x 3 = 39. A.C.D = 13 x 6 &amp; one-half = 84 &amp; one-half total  123 &amp; one-half<span class='line-break'> </span>Or take A.B.C.E as a rectangle and the area is 13 x 6 = 78.<span class='line-break'> </span>Add triangle C.E.D = 13 x 3 &amp; one-half = 45 &amp; one-half - total 123 and one-half ft.<span class='line-break'> </span>But the bases of the triangles must always be the parallel sides of the traphezoid.</p>
<p>What will you do?  report say 124f and let the Treas<sup>r</sup> refund $9.?</p>
<p>Yours Respectfully</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A. J. Coolidge</a></p>
<p>The above rule is an excellent one.  In this case where the parallel sides are A.D. and B.C <span class='line-break'> </span>"half the distance betwen them" ( meaning of course the shortest distance) is either A.B or the dotted line E.C-</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133700">
<h3><a name="page-1133700">CB01_0211</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>(see next page)</p>
<p><del>entire page</del></p>
<p><date when='1865-01-30'>Jany. 30 [186]5</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/67203' title='Hill, Cryus'>Cyrus Hill</a> Esq<span class='line-break'> </span>353 Broad St</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>Will you please<span class='line-break'> </span>send me word how you &amp;<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/67204' title='Timson, Mr.'>Mr Timson</a> divide your lots <span class='line-break'> </span>as to relative position. As they <span class='line-break'> </span>are on the westerly side of <a href='/pages/subjects/60001' title='Walnut Avenue'>Wal<span class='line-break'></span>nut Avenue</a>, fronting to the east, <span class='line-break'> </span>of course one of them is <ins>north</ins> &amp;<span class='line-break'> </span>one <ins>south</ins> of the other.</p>
<p>Just tell me which takes the<span class='line-break'> </span>north &amp; which the south lot, if you<span class='line-break'> </span>divide them so. - As they are very long<span class='line-break'> </span>east &amp; west, I don't know but you divide the<span class='line-break'> </span>other way one taking the east &amp; one the west<span class='line-break'> </span>or back lot.</p>
<p>[diagram: measurements &amp; orientation]</p>
<p>I don't know how near<span class='line-break'> </span>this is to the form, but<span class='line-break'> </span>these are the measure<span class='line-break'></span>ments given by the<span class='line-break'> </span>Superintendent.</p>
<p>Please inform me as soon as you can.</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A. J. Coolidge</a> Secretary</p>
<p><date when='1865-01-31'>Jany. 31 [186]5</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/67203' title='Hill, Cryus'>Cyrus Hill</a> Esq<sup>r</sup><span class='line-break'> </span>353 Broad St</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>Will you please<span class='line-break'> </span>send me word how you and <a href='/pages/subjects/67204' title='Timson, Mr.'>Mr Timson</a><span class='line-break'> </span>divide your lots as to relative posi<span class='line-break'></span>tion. As they are on the westerly side<span class='line-break'> </span>of <a href='/pages/subjects/60001' title='Walnut Avenue'>Walnut Avenue</a>, fronting to the<span class='line-break'> </span>east, of course one of them is<span class='line-break'> </span><ins>north</ins> and one <ins>south</ins> of the other.</p>
<p>The following is nearly the form of<span class='line-break'> </span>the lots according to the sketch sent me.</p>
<p>[Diagram: measurements &amp; orientation]</p>
<p>Which takes the north and which<span class='line-break'> </span>the south? And then again,<span class='line-break'> </span>as the sides are unequal, are<span class='line-break'> </span>we to run the line between<span class='line-break'> </span>you so as to give you<span class='line-break'> </span>each equal quantity?</p>
<p>Please reply as soon as you can.</p>
<p>Yours Resp.y</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a> Sec.y</p>
<p>211<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133701">
<h3><a name="page-1133701">CB01_0212</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>212</p>
<p><date when='1865-01-31'>Jany. 31. 5 [1865]</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/67206' title='Ames, Philander'>Philander Ames</a> Esq<sup>r</sup><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/67207' title='Stoneham, MA'>Stoneham Mass.</a></p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>Yourself and <a href='/pages/subjects/67208' title='Elliott, Charles D.'>Mr Chas.<span class='line-break'> </span>D. Elliott</a> of <a href='/pages/subjects/53203' title='Cambridge, MA'>Cambridge</a> purchased two lots in<span class='line-break'> </span>September on <a href='/pages/subjects/61288' title='Trefoil Path'>Trefoil Path</a>, and we are ignorant<span class='line-break'> </span>of your intentions as to how to divide the<span class='line-break'> </span>lots between you. I looked in a Cambridge Direc<span class='line-break'></span>tory for Mr Elliott and did not find his name.<span class='line-break'> </span>I live there myself, but do not know him. As there<span class='line-break'> </span>are four post offices in <a href='/pages/subjects/53203' title='Cambridge, MA'>Cambridge</a>, I prefer to address<span class='line-break'> </span>you my inquiry.</p>
<p>The sketch of the lots, as nearly as I can<span class='line-break'> </span>give it from the dimensions sent me is represented<span class='line-break'> </span>by the following figure: --</p>
<p>[diagram: measurements &amp; orientation]</p>
<p>It is fairly to be presumed that<span class='line-break'> </span>your division line will not run<span class='line-break'> </span>east and west, as that gives you two<span class='line-break'> </span>long and narrow lots. If it runs north and south,<span class='line-break'> </span>of course one takes the front and one the rear.</p>
<p>Will you please ^<sup>state</sup> if you divide by lines running north<span class='line-break'> </span>and south, which of you takes the east and which the west<span class='line-break'> </span>part: or how you divide in any case. --</p>
<p>Your speedy reply will oblige.</p>
<p>Yours Resp.y</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a> Secretary.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133702">
<h3><a name="page-1133702">CB01_0213</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><date when='1865-02-02'>Feby 2<sup>d</sup> [186]5</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'>Capt Winsor</a>,</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/67213' title='Collier, Mr.'>Mr Collier</a> has de<span class='line-break'></span>cided to take the deed of his other lot now, &amp;<span class='line-break'> </span>he can transfer it to the person to whom you<span class='line-break'> </span>may sell. Will you therefore please report<span class='line-break'> </span>a number for it on Saturday.</p>
<p>Will you be kind enough to send and<span class='line-break'> </span>measure the diameter or chord of the front end<span class='line-break'> </span>of Hobbs' lot on <a href='/pages/subjects/61235' title='Mound Avenue'>Mound Ave<sup>e</sup></a>. You said it was<span class='line-break'> </span>twice the radius -- that makes but 4f 6 which<span class='line-break'> </span>makes a lot of this shape.</p>
<p>[diagram: measurements]</p>
<p>Now if the side come out nearly <span class='line-break'> </span>straight and make the front less tapering, the chord<span class='line-break'> </span>of that segment must be more than 4f 6 -- and if<span class='line-break'> </span>it tapers off as above, it is not an easy thing to measure<span class='line-break'> </span>the lot. I cannot make the deed well without know<span class='line-break'></span>ing the length of both this chord, and the distance from<span class='line-break'> </span>it round the front.</p>
<p>Respy yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a> Sec.y</p>
<p><date when='1865-02-04'>Feby. 4 [186]5</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/65964' title='Livermore, George'>Geo. Livermore</a> Esq, Ex<sup>or</sup> &amp;c</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>By vote of the<span class='line-break'> </span>Trustees passed <date when='1865-01-30'>Jany. 30<sup>th</sup>, 1865</date>,<span class='line-break'> </span>I am directed to give notice <span class='line-break'> </span>to the Ex<sup>ors</sup> of the late <a href='/pages/subjects/62002' title='Dowse, Thomas'>Thomas<span class='line-break'> </span>Dowse</a> that <a href='/pages/subjects/67214' title='Lot 1809'>lots 1809</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/64044' title='Lot 1810'>&amp; 1810</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>held by this Corporation in trust under<span class='line-break'> </span>a conveyance from <a href='/pages/subjects/62002' title='Dowse, Thomas'>Mr Dowse</a>, are<span class='line-break'> </span>out of repair, and that the<span class='line-break'> </span>funds provided are insufficient<span class='line-break'> </span>for the purpose of keeping them in <span class='line-break'> </span>repair -- and to request the<span class='line-break'> </span>Ex<sup>ors</sup> to give the subject their<span class='line-break'> </span>early attention. --</p>
<p>Very Resp.y</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Secretary</p>
<p>213</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133703">
<h3><a name="page-1133703">CB01_0214</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><date when='1865-02-04'>Feby 4 [186]5</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/55342' title='Adams, Edwin F.'>Edwin F. Adams</a> Esq</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>I send you<span class='line-break'> </span>the Instrument of Donation in<span class='line-break'> </span>Trust for <a href='/pages/subjects/56687' title='Lot 1875-1878'>lots 1875-8</a>, duly<span class='line-break'> </span>recorded.</p>
<p>You can send me, if you<span class='line-break'> </span>please, at your convenience, for<span class='line-break'> </span>my personal services in the matter,<span class='line-break'> </span>drawing instruments and re<span class='line-break'></span>cording five dollars ($5).</p>
<p>Very Resp.y yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
<p>214</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
