<p><a href='/pages/subjects/70552' title='Richards, Anne'>Mrs Anne Richards</a><span class='line-break'> </span>who purchased a little lot of 50 ft. on <a href='/pages/subjects/61223' title='Linden Path'>Linden Path</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>(no <a href='/pages/subjects/67303' title='Lot 3545'>3545</a>) last fall, wishes to remove the body of<span class='line-break'> </span>her husband from <a href='/pages/subjects/70553' title='Lot 1254'>Lot no. 1254</a> to that lot -- together<span class='line-break'> </span>with the headstone. His name was <a href='/pages/subjects/70554' title='Bates, Thomas'>Thomas Bates</a>.<span class='line-break'> </span>She is in very modest circumstances, and as<span class='line-break'> </span>the remains have been desposited about 16 yrs.<span class='line-break'> </span>a rough ^<sup>small</sup> board box will be sufficient.</p>
<p>1<sup>st</sup> Can you make one at the shop?<span class='line-break'> </span>2<sup>d</sup> Will you please look at the stone before<span class='line-break'> </span>you come in tomorrow, and estimate the<span class='line-break'> </span>whole expense, and inform me when you<span class='line-break'> </span>come in, &amp; she will send in for the same --</p>
<p>If the <del>rule</del> ^<sup>case</sup> will admit, make the charge for removal<span class='line-break'> </span>less than price of two interments, &amp; other expenses as<span class='line-break'> </span>low as possible. She intends to pay the bill of grading in a few days.</p>
<p>Yours truly</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/70555' title='Murdock, Mr.'>Mr Murdock</a> will meet<span class='line-break'> </span>you here tomorrow at <ins>1 o'clock</ins><span class='line-break'> </span>on the subject of your note to him.</p>
<p>251<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133743">
<h3><a name="page-1133743">CB01_0252</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><date when='1865-04-15'>April 15 [186]5</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/57826' title='Shedd &amp; Edson'>Messrs Shedd &amp; Edson</a></p>
<p>Gentlemen,</p>
<p>Your contract<span class='line-break'> </span>to survey and put lots on the plan<span class='line-break'> </span>quarterly will get stretched somewhat<span class='line-break'> </span>unless you go out and finish up<span class='line-break'> </span>your last year's work, and give us<span class='line-break'> </span>a chance to begin this year clean.</p>
<p>Please proceed as soon as<span class='line-break'> </span>possible, or we shall be "in a<span class='line-break'> </span>heap".</p>
<p>Yours truly</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
<p><date when='1865-05-15'>April 15 [186]5</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/70552' title='Richards, Anne'>Mrs Anne Richards</a></p>
<p>Dear Madam,</p>
<p>I rec<sup>d</sup> answer<span class='line-break'> </span>from <a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'>Capt. Winsor</a> today on<span class='line-break'> </span>the matter of removing grave and head<span class='line-break'></span>stone of your husband to lot bought<span class='line-break'> </span>by you last fall.</p>
<p>He says I may inform<span class='line-break'> </span>you it will not cost more<span class='line-break'> </span>than $15 or $16: he will do it<span class='line-break'> </span>for you as low as can be.</p>
<p>Yours Respy</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a></p>
<p>252</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133744">
<h3><a name="page-1133744">CB01_0253</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><date when='1865-05-18'>April 18 [186]5</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/64830' title='Gassett, Henry'>Henry Gassett</a> Esq<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/70556' title='North Wrentham, MA'>North Wrentham Mass.</a></p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>Yours of the 17<sup>th</sup>is<span class='line-break'> </span>before me. Agreeably by your request<span class='line-break'> </span>I send you the instrument of dona<span class='line-break'></span>tion in trust for the perpetual re<span class='line-break'></span>pair &amp; preservation of your <a href='/pages/subjects/64829' title='Lot 2113'>lot no 2113</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>on payment of the sum named $600.</p>
<p>Please sign and return the paper --<span class='line-break'> </span>when I will procure the signatures<span class='line-break'> </span>of the Com. on Lots, of the Treasurer,<span class='line-break'> </span>and record and return the document<span class='line-break'> </span>to you.</p>
<p>You can send a check pay<span class='line-break'></span>able to the order of our Treas<sup>r</sup>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'>Geo.<span class='line-break'> </span>W<sup>m</sup> Bond</a>, the receipt of which I<span class='line-break'> </span>will acknowledge &amp; return you the<span class='line-break'> </span>Instrument in a few days.</p>
<p>Very Respectfully yours,</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
<p><date when='1865-04-21'>April 21. [186]5</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'>Capt. D.L. Winsor</a></p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>Mr <a href='/pages/subjects/64830' title='Gassett, Henry'>Henry Gassett</a><span class='line-break'> </span>yesterday paid the Treas<sup>r</sup> the sum of <ins>$600.</ins><span class='line-break'> </span>the am<sup>t</sup> required by the Com. on Lots for the<span class='line-break'> </span>perpetual care of <a href='/pages/subjects/64829' title='Lot 2113'>Lot no. 2113</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/61222' title='Lime Avenue'>Lime Av.<sup>e</sup></a><span class='line-break'> </span>I think the fund will yield enough for<span class='line-break'> </span>the bills of the present year, with judicious<span class='line-break'> </span>application of labor -- prob. not less than $25<span class='line-break'> </span>up to 31<sup>st</sup> Dec.<sup>r</sup> -- perhaps more. --</p>
<p>I send you back the report. <a href='/pages/subjects/64830' title='Gassett, Henry'>Mr<span class='line-break'> </span>Gassett</a> says there is some small shrubbery<span class='line-break'> </span>in front, which he would like to have<span class='line-break'> </span>you state on the report, -- that was <span class='line-break'> </span>his understanding -- that our care<span class='line-break'> </span>covers his shrubbery. I think it is<span class='line-break'> </span>so trifling an item, that it should<span class='line-break'> </span>be included. Our printed contracts cover<span class='line-break'> </span>shrubbery. Please bring in the report to<span class='line-break'></span>morrow.</p>
<p>Resp.y yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a></p>
<p>253</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133745">
<h3><a name="page-1133745">CB01_0254</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>254</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a> <date when='1865-05-05'>May 5, 1865</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/70557' title='Wakefield, T. L.'>T.L. Wakefield</a> Esq</p>
<p>My dear Sir,</p>
<p>Will you have the<span class='line-break'> </span>kindness to get the accompanying bill before the<span class='line-break'> </span>Judiciary Com<sup>ee</sup>.</p>
<p>The <ins>first</ins> reason for its passage is that uni<span class='line-break'></span>versal custom as well as the fitness of the thing has<span class='line-break'> </span>made the office of Cemetery Corporations the only place for<span class='line-break'> </span>the record of its deeds.</p>
<p>The <ins>second</ins> reason is that, in the absence of any<span class='line-break'> </span>general law authorizing such record there always has<span class='line-break'> </span>been and will continue to be a considerable solic<span class='line-break'></span>itude in the minds of lot owners, as to their rights<span class='line-break'> </span>without county registration, and the more timid ones often<span class='line-break'> </span>dispel their doubts by sending their deeds to the county records.</p>
<p>The <ins>third</ins> reason is that there is already a large<span class='line-break'> </span>^<sup>and constantly increasing</sup> aggregation of interest in Cemetery lots in this Common<span class='line-break'></span>wealth, at stake, if the validity of title can be called in<span class='line-break'> </span>question for want of proper registration. -- These lots being<span class='line-break'> </span><ins>real estate</ins>, the act would be essentially a question of<span class='line-break'> </span>titles, and I am not aware of any objection that can be <span class='line-break'> </span>raised.</p>
<p>The State of <a href='/pages/subjects/70558' title='Maine'>Maine</a> has passed a similar act: what other<span class='line-break'> </span>states, if any, I am not aware.</p>
<p>I hand you a bound book containing our Charter, also the form of deed.</p>
<p>Very Resp.y yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a> Sec.y of Mt Aub<span class='line-break'> </span>Cem.y</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133746">
<h3><a name="page-1133746">CB01_0255</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><date when='1865-05-12'>May 12, [186]5</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/67889' title='Marett, Philip H.'>Philip Marett</a> Esq<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/67890' title='New Haven, CT'>New Haven, Conn.</a></p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>Yours of 8<sup>th</sup> last<span class='line-break'> </span>is at hand. I had not completed the<span class='line-break'> </span>requisite preliminaries at the date of<span class='line-break'> </span>its reception.</p>
<p>I am now directed by the Com<sup>ee</sup> <span class='line-break'> </span>on Lots, who have considered your appli<span class='line-break'></span>cation, to inform you that the Corpor<span class='line-break'></span>ation will assume the <ins>perpetual</ins><span class='line-break'> </span>care and preservation of <a href='/pages/subjects/68000' title='lot 794'>lot 794</a> alone for $350.<span class='line-break'> </span>but as this lot is enclosed with lot 462,<span class='line-break'> </span>so that both can be better managed together,<span class='line-break'> </span>they will assume the care of both for $600. --</p>
<p>This estimate will not, of course, form<span class='line-break'> </span>any basis for future negotiations, or bind<span class='line-break'> </span>the Corporation, if the am<sup>t</sup> named is left by all,<span class='line-break'> </span>as a Board of Trustees chosen annually cannot<span class='line-break'> </span>bind their successors. It is only a present estimate. --</p>
<p>Very Resp.y yours,</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a>, Sec.y</p>
<p><date when='1865-05-19'>May 19, 1865</date></p>
<p>Miss <a href='/pages/subjects/70559' title='Quincy, Eliza S.'>Eliza S. Quincy</a></p>
<p>Dear Madam</p>
<p>Our surveyors <a href='/pages/subjects/57826' title='Shedd &amp; Edson'>Messrs<span class='line-break'> </span>Shedd &amp; Edson</a> have sent me a<span class='line-break'> </span>sketch of your family lot from which the <span class='line-break'> </span>following is copied:</p>
<p>[diagram: measurements]</p>
<p>This would make a very beauti<span class='line-break'></span>ful lot, if the heirs would incline to remove<span class='line-break'> </span>the iron fence &amp; enclose the whole with <span class='line-break'> </span>a granite border. Iron fences must in the nature<span class='line-break'> </span>of things be temporary. An iron fence will look stiff<span class='line-break'> </span>and angular here, while a graceful could</p>
<p>255<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133747">
<h3><a name="page-1133747">CB01_0256</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>be given to granite curb-stones.</p>
<p>I am at your service to direct<span class='line-break'> </span>what further shall be done.</p>
<p>Very Respectfully yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
<p><date when='1865-05-24'>May 24 [186]5</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/70562' title='Baldwin, A. C.'>A.C. Baldwin</a> Esq<span class='line-break'> </span>16 Essex St</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>Mr <a href='/pages/subjects/67889' title='Marett, Philip H.'>Philip Marett</a> is<span class='line-break'> </span>anxious to have the "lot" in Mt Auburn<span class='line-break'> </span>belonging to him taken charge of by the Corporation<span class='line-break'> </span>for <ins>perpetual</ins> repair. The Committee on Lots have<span class='line-break'> </span>replied that the Corporation will assume the guar<span class='line-break'></span>anty for $350 for his lot alone, or if taken with<span class='line-break'> </span>yours, they will take them for $300 each. -- Where<span class='line-break'> </span>two lots are in one enclosure, as in this case,<span class='line-break'> </span>the Trustees prefer not to take one alone. --</p>
<p>If you will entertain the idea of giving<span class='line-break'> </span>this amount for your lot now, please<span class='line-break'> </span>inform me. It certainly will remove<span class='line-break'> </span>all uncertainty about it but if the matter<span class='line-break'> </span>is left to be provided for in one's will, it<span class='line-break'> </span>is quite generally overlooked &amp; forgotten, and<span class='line-break'> </span>few persons find sufficient motion for doing<span class='line-break'> </span>what the prop<sup>r</sup> neglected. -- Your early reply<span class='line-break'> </span>will oblige.</p>
<p>Yours Resp.y</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a></p>
<p>256</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133748">
<h3><a name="page-1133748">CB01_0257</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><date when='1865-05-23'>May 23. [186]5</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/70563' title='Lovejoy, Loyal'>Loyal Lovejoy</a> Esq</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>I am directed by the<span class='line-break'> </span>Committee on Lots to inform you,<span class='line-break'> </span>that they will recommend the Trustees<span class='line-break'> </span>to <ins>guarantee</ins> the perpetual care of your<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/70564' title='Lot 561'>lot no. 561</a> on <a href='/pages/subjects/58791' title='Central Avenue'>Central Avenue</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>for the sum of four hundred<span class='line-break'> </span>and fifty dollars. --</p>
<p>This concurrence is a matter of<span class='line-break'> </span>form, and is always given. --</p>
<p>Whenever you may determine<span class='line-break'> </span>to accept the proposition, I will<span class='line-break'> </span>prepare the necessary papers.</p>
<p>Very Respectfully yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
<p><date when='1865-05-23'>May 23 [186]5</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/66747' title='Dana, Charles B.'>Cha<sup>s</sup> B. Dana</a> Esq<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/70565' title='Wellesley, MA'>Wellesley, Mass</a></p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>I am directed<span class='line-break'> </span>by the Committee on Lots before whom I have<span class='line-break'> </span>laid your application, ^<sup>to say</sup> that they will<span class='line-break'> </span>recommend the Trustees to <ins>guarantee</ins><span class='line-break'> </span>the perpetual care of lots numbered<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/66746' title='Lot 1393'>1393</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/70566' title='Lot 1394'>1394</a> belonging respectively to the<span class='line-break'> </span>estate of your late father &amp; to yourself,<span class='line-break'> </span>for the sum of three hundred<span class='line-break'> </span>dollars for each lot -- say</p>
<p>six hundred dollars. --</p>
<p>Should these terms, which<span class='line-break'> </span>are the lowest allowed by the by-laws<span class='line-break'> </span>be acceptable, I will at your request,<span class='line-break'> </span>prepare the necessary<span class='line-break'> </span>papers. --</p>
<p>Very Resp.y yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a>, Sec.y</p>
<p>257</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133749">
<h3><a name="page-1133749">CB01_0258</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><date when='1865-05-25'>May 25 [186]5</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'>Capt. D.L. Winsor</a>,</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/71279' title='Howard, Henry G.'>Mr Henry G. Howard</a><span class='line-break'> </span>of <a href='/pages/subjects/70999' title='San Francisco, CA'>San Francisco</a> has arranged to sell<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/25004308' title='Lot 332'>Lot no 332</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/61108' title='Alder Path'>Alder Path</a> with half of the "Howard<span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; Merry tomb" to his uncle <a href='/pages/subjects/71281' title='Howard, George H.'>Geo. H. Howard</a><span class='line-break'> </span>of that place: and they propose to buy more<span class='line-break'> </span>land &amp; make some improvements.</p>
<p>There is quite an amount of land<span class='line-break'> </span>on the rear -- perhaps 300 feet or more,<span class='line-break'> </span>of which they wish to know just how<span class='line-break'> </span>much, and the price.</p>
<p>There is also a piece of land between<span class='line-break'> </span>the South lot and <a href='/pages/subjects/71282' title='Greenleaf, Gardner'>Gardner Greenleaf's</a><span class='line-break'> </span>which they might desire to include. I<span class='line-break'> </span>wish therefore you would survey this in<span class='line-break'></span>cluding what is in the rear extending it back<span class='line-break'> </span>as far as you would the line in rear of<span class='line-break'> </span>tomb. On the plan there appears to be<span class='line-break'> </span>here about 300 feet. strong -- i.e. 10 wide,<span class='line-break'> </span>and 30 deep -- I have made<span class='line-break'> </span>a tracing from the sectional sur<span class='line-break'></span>vey which I propose to send<span class='line-break'> </span>out to California to enable<span class='line-break'> </span>them to see the surroundings<span class='line-break'> </span>as far as to <a href='/pages/subjects/60335' title='Poplar Avenue'>Poplar<!--Ave--></a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/60336' title='Willow Avenue'>Willow<span class='line-break'> </span>Avenues</a>. If they can be in<span class='line-break'></span>duced to enlarge and fit up<span class='line-break'> </span>this, it will make quite an <span class='line-break'> </span>improvement.</p>
<p>Please then give me the width<span class='line-break'> </span>on the back of the two lots which<span class='line-break'> </span>you could add leaving a suffic<span class='line-break'></span>ient passageway to the lots on <a href='/pages/subjects/60336' title='Willow Avenue'>Willow<!--Ave--></a>.<span class='line-break'> </span>(By the plan there appears to be 10 ft or more),<span class='line-break'> </span>also the width &amp; length of the strip<span class='line-break'> </span>next to Greenleaf. I should say 10 x 30.</p>
<p>State the price at which you<span class='line-break'> </span>would sell. --</p>
<p>Please reply in person on<span class='line-break'> </span>Saturday -- that will answer Mr<span class='line-break'> </span>Howard's purpose as he wishes to<span class='line-break'> </span>send to his brother by next steamer. --</p>
<p>Yours truly</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a></p>
<p>258</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133750">
<h3><a name="page-1133750">CB01_0259</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><date when='1865-05-21'>May 21 [186]5</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'>Capt. D.L. Winsor</a></p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>Your survey ^<sup><a href='/pages/subjects/71281' title='Howard, George H.'>of Howard lots</a></sup> was just<span class='line-break'> </span>in season. <a href='/pages/subjects/71283' title='Kettle, Mr.'>Mr Kettle</a> came for it as soon as<span class='line-break'> </span>I reached town. I thank you much.</p>
<p>Please bring on Saturday a report<span class='line-break'> </span>upon lot of <a href='/pages/subjects/71284' title='Morey, George'>Geo. Morey</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/71285' title='Lot 1211'>1211</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/59585' title='Pine Avenue'>Pine Av<sup>e</sup></a><span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; include in estimate of sum needed<span class='line-break'> </span>these facts. --</p>
<p>Mr Morey is within one year to enclose<span class='line-break'> </span>said lot with a granite curb costing not<span class='line-break'> </span>less than $800 nor more than $1500. --<span class='line-break'> </span>and that he shall have the right to<span class='line-break'> </span>erect ^<sup>either</sup> such mon<sup>t</sup> <ins>or</ins> headstones, as the Trustees<span class='line-break'> </span>shall approve, costing not less than $400 nor<span class='line-break'> </span>more than $800. Mr M. is ill, and wishes<span class='line-break'> </span>to make contract now, &amp; leave provision for car<span class='line-break'></span>rying out the rest of his intentions, whether living or not.</p>
<p>Please ^<sup>also</sup> report upon the other matters<span class='line-break'> </span>before requested.</p>
<p>Truly yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a></p>
<p><date when='1865-05-31'>May 31 [186]5</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/71286' title='Converse, James C.'>Jas. C. Converse</a> Esq</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>Please get <a href='/pages/subjects/71287' title='Poor, Mr.'>Mr<span class='line-break'> </span>Poor's</a> signature to the within<span class='line-break'> </span>paper -- pass in the funds<span class='line-break'> </span>with it, and I will have<span class='line-break'> </span>it completed, recorded &amp;<span class='line-break'> </span>returned to you &amp; the contract<span class='line-break'> </span>extend upon --</p>
<p>Very respectfully yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
<p>259</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133751">
<h3><a name="page-1133751">CB01_0260</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><date when='1865-06-05'>June 5, [186]5</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'>Geo W<sup>m</sup> Bond Esq</a><sup>re</sup></p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>The Trustees at<span class='line-break'> </span>their meeting this day adopted<span class='line-break'> </span>the recommendation of the Committee<span class='line-break'> </span>on Finance that a grant of two<span class='line-break'> </span>hundred dollars should be made<span class='line-break'> </span>to the Secretary for the present year.</p>
<p>Truly yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
<p><date when='1865-06-06'>June 6<sup>th</sup></date></p>
<p>P.S. The by-laws as proposed in<span class='line-break'> </span>printed form with two or three simple<span class='line-break'> </span>amendments have been adopted. Please<span class='line-break'> </span>send me as early as convenient the<span class='line-break'> </span>list of lots reported to you this year by the<span class='line-break'> </span>Sup<sup>t</sup>. Also my copies loaned to you last year.</p>
<p>Yours truly</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a></p>
<p><date when='1865-06-06'>June 6, [186]5</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'>Capt. D.L. Winsor</a>,</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>Please report upon<span class='line-break'> </span>lot of <a href='/pages/subjects/71292' title='Jellison, Zachariah'>Zachariah Jellison</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/71293' title='Lot 337'><!--Lot-->337</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/61262' title='Primrose Path'>Primrose<span class='line-break'> </span>Path</a> for perpetual repair. --</p>
<p>I think there are due from you<span class='line-break'> </span>reports upon <a href='/pages/subjects/71294' title='Lot 1124'>lot 1124</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/61107' title='Ailanthus Path'>Ailanthus P.</a> (<a href='/pages/subjects/71295' title='Plympton, Henry'>Henry<span class='line-break'> </span>Plympton's</a>) <a href='/pages/subjects/71296' title='Lot 2800'>2800</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/60000' title='Sylvan Path'>Sylvan P.</a> (<a href='/pages/subjects/71311' title='Constant, S. S., Mr.'>S.S. Constantin</a>)<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/71298' title='Lot 541'><!--Lot-->541</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/61127' title='Beech Avenue'>Beech Av.</a> (<a href='/pages/subjects/71299' title='Bradley, Benjamin'>Benj. Bradley's</a>) -- I<span class='line-break'> </span>don't remember whether any other<span class='line-break'> </span>now.</p>
<p>Please notify any of the outside<span class='line-break'> </span>workmen whom you may see,<span class='line-break'> </span>that ^<sup>by order of the Trustees,</sup> no more permits will be<span class='line-break'> </span>given to work, unless the proprietor<span class='line-break'> </span>applies in person at the Secretary's<span class='line-break'> </span>office.</p>
<p>Yours truly</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
<p>260</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133752">
<h3><a name="page-1133752">CB01_0261</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><date when='1865-06-06'>June 6 [186]5</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/71343' title='Franklin Smith &amp; Son'>F. Smith &amp; Son</a></p>
<p>Gentlemen,</p>
<p>Please send<span class='line-break'> </span>to me the order for the<span class='line-break'> </span>interment of <ins>     </ins><span class='line-break'> </span>Goddard in <a href='/pages/subjects/71301' title='Lot 1817'>lot 1817</a> owned<span class='line-break'> </span>heirs of late <a href='/pages/subjects/71302' title='Phinney, Catherine'>Catherine Phinney</a> &amp;<span class='line-break'> </span>represented by <a href='/pages/subjects/71344' title='Goodall, Catherine B.'>Mrs Cath. B.<span class='line-break'> </span>Goodale</a> of <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a>. -- made<span class='line-break'> </span>on 28<sup>th</sup> of April, by you.</p>
<p>No facts have come to me<span class='line-break'> </span>for record -- only this sur<span class='line-break'></span>name from <a href='/pages/subjects/52579' title='Safford, Truman H.'>Mr Safford</a>.</p>
<p>Please not delay it longer<span class='line-break'> </span>than absolutely necessary.</p>
<p>Truly yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
<p><date when='1865-06-06'>June 6 [186]5</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/65294' title='John Peak &amp; Son'>John Peak</a> Esq</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>I did<span class='line-break'> </span>not think, after calling<span class='line-break'> </span>twice at your place,<span class='line-break'> </span>I should have to ask<span class='line-break'> </span>you again for the returns<span class='line-break'> </span>of the four interments<span class='line-break'> </span>and two removals made<span class='line-break'> </span>by you on <date when='1865-04-28'>April 28<sup>th</sup></date> --<span class='line-break'> </span>but so it is.</p>
<p>Will you be so kind<span class='line-break'> </span>as to forward them at<span class='line-break'> </span>once, to oblige</p>
<p>Yours Resp.y</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a></p>
<p>261</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133753">
<h3><a name="page-1133753">CB01_0262</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><date when='1865-06-09'>June 9 [186]5</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/71310' title='Richards, Joel'>Joel Richards Esq</a></p>
<p>My dear Sir,</p>
<p>The Committee<span class='line-break'> </span>on Lots have instructed me<span class='line-break'> </span>to inform you that this Cor<span class='line-break'></span>poration will <ins>guarantee</ins> the<span class='line-break'> </span>perpetual repair of <a href='/pages/subjects/71296' title='Lot 2800'>lot no. 2800</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>on <a href='/pages/subjects/60000' title='Sylvan Path'>Sylvan Path</a>, belonging to<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/71311' title='Constant, S. S., Mr.'>Mr S.S. Constant</a>, on payment<span class='line-break'> </span>of four hundred dollars. --</p>
<p>If this shall be acceptable to<span class='line-break'> </span>Mr Constant, I will prepare<span class='line-break'> </span>the papers upon being so notified.</p>
<p>If you desire, you can see the<span class='line-break'> </span>Superintendent's Report upon the<span class='line-break'> </span>lot by calling here. --</p>
<p>Truly yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
<p><date when='1865-06-09'>June 9 [186]5</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/71292' title='Jellison, Zachariah'>Z. Jellison Esq.</a></p>
<p>My dear Sir,</p>
<p>The Committee<span class='line-break'> </span>on Lots have instructed<span class='line-break'> </span>me to inform you that this<span class='line-break'> </span>Corporation will <ins>guarantee</ins> the<span class='line-break'> </span>perpetual repair of the <a href='/pages/subjects/71293' title='Lot 337'>lot <span class='line-break'> </span>numbered 337</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/61262' title='Primrose Path'>Primrose Path</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>belonging to the estate of the late <a href='/pages/subjects/71292' title='Jellison, Zachariah'>Zach<span class='line-break'></span>ariah Jellison</a> on payment<span class='line-break'> </span>of three hundred dollars.</p>
<p>When notified by you<span class='line-break'> </span>of your readiness to do so,<span class='line-break'> </span>I will prepare the neces<span class='line-break'></span>sary papers.</p>
<p>Truly yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
<p>262</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133754">
<h3><a name="page-1133754">CB01_0263</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><date when='1865-06-09'>June 9 [186]5</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/71312' title='Plympton, Charles H. P.'>CH. P. Plympton</a> Esq.</p>
<p>My dear Sir,</p>
<p>The Committee<span class='line-break'> </span>on Lots, have instructed me to<span class='line-break'> </span>inform you that this Corporation<span class='line-break'> </span>will <ins>guarantee</ins> the perpetual<span class='line-break'> </span>repair of <a href='/pages/subjects/71294' title='Lot 1124'>lot no 1124</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/61107' title='Ailanthus Path'>Ailanthus<span class='line-break'> </span>Path</a>, belonging to your late father's<span class='line-break'> </span>Estate, on payment of four<span class='line-break'> </span>hundred and fifty dollars.</p>
<p>When notified by you of<span class='line-break'> </span>your acceptance of this sum,<span class='line-break'> </span>I will prepare the necessary<span class='line-break'> </span>papers.</p>
<p>Truly yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
<p><date when='1865-06-16'>June 16 [186]5</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/71313' title='Warren, Susan Cornelia'>Mrs. S.D. Warren</a><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/64824' title='Waltham, MA'>Waltham Mass</a>,</p>
<p>I have seen<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/71314' title='Ayer, Don Carlos'>Mr Don Carlos Ayer</a>, a jeweler<span class='line-break'> </span>in Hanover St., who is the propri<span class='line-break'></span>etor of the lot you refer to as<span class='line-break'> </span>at the left of your own -- <a href='/pages/subjects/71315' title='Lot 2094'>no. 2094</a>.</p>
<p>He says he is willing the branch<span class='line-break'> </span>which extends over your own lot<span class='line-break'> </span>should be cut off, or that the tree<span class='line-break'> </span>should be trimmed up as much<span class='line-break'> </span>as the Superintendent may think<span class='line-break'> </span>necessary; but he does not wish<span class='line-break'> </span>at present, to entirely part with<span class='line-break'> </span>the tree. When the roots get more<span class='line-break'> </span>extended, and it interferes with<span class='line-break'> </span>burial purposes, he thinks, it may<span class='line-break'> </span>have to be cut down. --</p>
<p>Very truly yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
<p>263<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133755">
<h3><a name="page-1133755">CB01_0264_1</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>264</p>
<p><date when='1865-06-16'>June 16, [186]5</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'>Capt. D. L. Winsor</a></p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>Since last October the<span class='line-break'> </span>following contract have been made for<span class='line-break'> </span>the <ins>perpetual</ins> repair of lot -- guaranteed.</p>
<p><table class='tabular'><thead><span class='line-break'> </span><tr><th><a href='/pages/subjects/70543' title='Lot 726'><!--Lot-->726</a></th> <th><a href='/pages/subjects/71324' title='Cedar Path'>Cedar Path</a></th> <th><a href='/pages/subjects/70544' title='Peabody, Catherine'>Catherine Peabody</a></th> <th><date when='1865-06-06'>June 6, 1865</date></th> <th>450</th></tr></thead> <tbody> <tr><td> <a href='/pages/subjects/67074' title='Lot 1250'><!--Lot-->{1250</a></td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/71325' title='Elm Path'>Elm Path</a></td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Isaac Parker</a>}</td> <td/> <td/> </tr> <tr><td> <a href='/pages/subjects/67075' title='Lot 1315'>{1315</a></td> <td>" "</td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/71326' title='Parker, Mary J.'>Mary J. Parker}</a></td> <td><date when='1864-12-01'>Dec. 1. 1864</date></td> <td>1000. </td> </tr> <tr><td> <a href='/pages/subjects/67076' title='Lot 1333'>{1333</a></td> <td>" "</td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/71327' title='Parker, Fanny C.'>Fanny C. Parker}</a></td> <td/> <td/> </tr> <tr><td> <a href='/pages/subjects/64120' title='Lot 1875'><!--Lot-->(1875</a></td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/59902' title='Hibiscus Path'>Hibiscus "</a></td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/66276' title='Webb, Nathan'>Nathan Webb)</a></td> <td/> <td/> </tr> <tr><td> <a href='/pages/subjects/71328' title='Lot 1876'><!--Lot-->(1876</a></td> <td>" "</td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/71329' title='Forster, Charles'>Charles Forster)</a></td> <td><date when='1865-01-25'>Jany. 25. 1865</date>.</td> <td>$1200. </td> </tr> <tr><td> <a href='/pages/subjects/67376' title='Lot 1877'><!--Lot-->(1877</a></td> <td>" "</td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/67378' title='Foster, Jacob'>Jacob Forster)</a></td> <td/> <td/> </tr> <tr><td> <a href='/pages/subjects/64121' title='Lot 1878'><!--Lot-->(1878</a></td> <td>" "</td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/55342' title='Adams, Edwin F.'>Edwin F. Adams</a>)</td> <td/> <td/> </tr> <tr><td> <a href='/pages/subjects/64829' title='Lot 2113'><!--Lot-->2113</a></td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/61222' title='Lime Avenue'>Lime Av.</a></td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/64830' title='Gassett, Henry'>Henry Gassett</a></td> <td><date when='1865-04-20'>Apr. 20. 1865</date>.</td> <td>600.– </td> </tr> <tr><td> <a href='/pages/subjects/55279' title='Lot 2820'>2820</a></td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/55287' title='Lawn Avenue'>Lawn <!--Avenue-->"</a></td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/71331' title='Powars, Deborah C.'>Deborah C. Powars</a></td> <td><date when='1864-10-21'>Oct. 21. 1864</date></td> <td>200.– </td> </tr> </tbody> </table> The following is not guaranteed:<span class='line-break'> </span><table class='tabular'><thead><span class='line-break'> </span><tr><th><a href='/pages/subjects/71332' title='Lot 212'><!--Lot-->212</a></th> <th><a href='/pages/subjects/61127' title='Beech Avenue'>Beech Av.</a></th> <th><a href='/pages/subjects/58388' title='Steele, Gurdon'>Gurdon Steele</a></th> <th><date when='1865-05-04'>May 4. 1865</date>.</th> <th>100.–</th></tr></thead> <tbody> <tr><td> <a href='/pages/subjects/71333' title='Lot 659'><!--Lot-->659</a></td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/61194' title='Greenbrier Path'>Greenbrier P.</a></td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/71334' title='Fairbanks, Otis'>Otis Fairbanks</a></td> <td><date when='1865-11-21'>Nov. 21 "</date></td> <td>100. </td> </tr> </tbody> </table> Very Resp. y Yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A. J. Coolidge</a></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133756">
<h3><a name="page-1133756">CB01_0265</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>265</p>
<p><date when='1865-06-20'>June 20 [186]5</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/65294' title='John Peak &amp; Son'>John Peak</a> Esq<span class='line-break'> </span>Funeral Undertaker 146 Friend St</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>I rec<sup>d</sup> from you within a week,<span class='line-break'> </span>a list of names porporting to be the names of the four members<span class='line-break'> </span>of the Fowle family interred somewhere in Mt Auburn, with age,<span class='line-break'> </span>and date of decease, as also two names of persons previously<span class='line-break'> </span>deposited in your tomb and removed to another lot,<span class='line-break'> </span>in which list according to the books at the City Registrar's<span class='line-break'> </span>there were four mistakes -- one of name and three of dates.</p>
<p>I confess I was never more astonished than to receive from<span class='line-break'> </span>an old undertaker of thirty years practice, and whose capacity<span class='line-break'> </span>to make correct returns in conformity with the laws cannot<span class='line-break'> </span>be called in question, this lame substitute for the orders<span class='line-break'> </span>properly filled and signed by the proprietor accompanied by<span class='line-break'> </span>the City permits. What makes the matter worse in this case<span class='line-break'> </span>is that <a href='/pages/subjects/71337' title='Apollonio, Mr.'>Mr Apollonio</a> had given you every one of the permits,<span class='line-break'> </span>none of which were sent us. --</p>
<p>I called at your place twice in person for the papers,<span class='line-break'> </span>and you promised to get them executed and sent to me.<span class='line-break'> </span>I wrote after waiting some time, and instead of the papers, I<span class='line-break'> </span>have rec<sup>d</sup> nothing but the above named list. I must have those pa<span class='line-break'></span>pers in full. I have always got along well with you, but you must<span class='line-break'> </span>not make me trouble again -- or I shall have to represent the case.</p>
<p>I send you a circular which was once sent &amp; is still the law.</p>
<p>Yours Respy.</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a></p>
<p>Finally -- it is a wonder your note reached me at all -- as you addressed it "<ins>C.</ins> J. Coolidge."</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133757">
<h3><a name="page-1133757">CB01_0266</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><date when='1865-06-20'>June 20 [186]5</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/71343' title='Franklin Smith &amp; Son'>Messrs Franklin Smith &amp; Son</a></p>
<p>Gentlemen,</p>
<p>I regret that I should<span class='line-break'> </span>be obliged to ask you again if you, who<span class='line-break'> </span>have borne so high a character for<span class='line-break'> </span>promptness in making your returns,<span class='line-break'> </span>the order for interment, with facts,<span class='line-break'> </span>of a body ^<sup>interred</sup> on 27<sup>th</sup> of April 1865 in<span class='line-break'> </span>lot of late <a href='/pages/subjects/71302' title='Phinney, Catherine'>Catherine Phinney</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/71301' title='Lot 1817'>no 1817</a><span class='line-break'> </span>on <a href='/pages/subjects/61278' title='Sorrel Path'>Sorrel Path</a>. The <ins>lot</ins> is the only memo.<span class='line-break'> </span>I have as yet, if that is correct. All<span class='line-break'> </span>else on the record -- name, age &amp;c, &amp;c --<span class='line-break'> </span>stands as blank.</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/71344' title='Goodall, Catherine B.'>Mrs Catherine B. Goodall</a> of <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>a daughter, is a daughter.</p>
<p>Please do not delay this matter<span class='line-break'> </span>longer --</p>
<p>Yours truly</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
<p><date when='1865-06-22'>June 22 [186]5</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/71312' title='Plympton, Charles H. P.'>C.H.P. Plympton</a> Esq</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>I send you the <span class='line-break'> </span>contract ready for your signature<span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; for paying over the amount<span class='line-break'> </span>mentioned therein. Not thinking<span class='line-break'> </span>you were absent from town, I added<span class='line-break'> </span>the lot to the Committee list for the<span class='line-break'> </span>semi-annual inspection today, for<span class='line-break'> </span>which reason only I desire an<span class='line-break'> </span>early payment.</p>
<p>In reply to your question, I<span class='line-break'> </span>will say that the amount is intended<span class='line-break'> </span>to cover the lot and "all" its appartenan<span class='line-break'></span>ces. It is the <ins>appartenances</ins> -- such<span class='line-break'> </span>as an expensive monument --which,<span class='line-break'> </span>in the judgment of the Committee re<span class='line-break'></span>quired rather more than you antic<span class='line-break'></span>ipated.</p>
<p>Very truly yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a></p>
<p>I wish it settled as early as 1<sup>st</sup> July, if convenient.</p>
<p>266</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133758">
<h3><a name="page-1133758">CB01_0267</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><date when='1865-06-27'>June 27 [186]5</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'>Capt D.L. Winsor</a></p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>Please let <a href='/pages/subjects/79942' title='Safford, Frederick Marcy'>Fred</a><span class='line-break'> </span>[?] over the order books since<span class='line-break'> </span>Jany. of this year, and see<span class='line-break'> </span>where the proprietors have ordered<span class='line-break'> </span>the <ins>fences to be painted</ins>, and<span class='line-break'> </span>give me a list of them. There<span class='line-break'> </span>cannot be many. I wish to<span class='line-break'> </span>correct the list of dilapidated<span class='line-break'> </span>lots, on which I am just<span class='line-break'> </span>sending the proprietors notice.<span class='line-break'> </span>As it cannot take him half an<span class='line-break'> </span>hour to do this, I should like to<span class='line-break'> </span>have him do it tomorrow. -</p>
<p>I have a list of those orders<span class='line-break'> </span>to be done by outsiders. Let him send<span class='line-break'> </span>me those, ordered of the Corporation<span class='line-break'> </span>and my list will be complete.</p>
<p>Truly Yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a></p>
<p>Please inform me what <a href='/pages/subjects/52579' title='Safford, Truman H.'>Mr Safford</a> handed me. <a href='/pages/subjects/71345' title='Fuller, Daniel D.'>Daniel D Fuller</a>'s<span class='line-break'> </span>certificate fee? Is it for anything, besides to make his deed? - dated <date when='186X-10-26'>Oct 26, 186[?]</date></p>
<p>June 27</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/71286' title='Converse, James C.'>J. C. Converse</a> Esq</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>Enclosed you<span class='line-break'> </span>have the contract made between<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/71287' title='Poor, Mr.'>Mr Poor</a> and our Corporation<span class='line-break'> </span>for the perpetual care of<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/70543' title='Lot 726'>lot no. 726</a> in this Cemetery,<span class='line-break'> </span>which has been duly recorded.</p>
<p>At your convenience, please<span class='line-break'> </span>[?] me $5. for preparing<span class='line-break'> </span>papers &amp; getting execution &amp; re<span class='line-break'></span>cording.</p>
<p>Very Respy</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A. J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
<p>267</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133759">
<h3><a name="page-1133759">CB01_0268_1</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><date when='1865-07-08'>July 8 [186]5</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'>Capt D.L. Winsor</a></p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>At the meeting of<span class='line-break'> </span>the Trustees held on Monday<span class='line-break'> </span>last it was  --</p>
<p>Voted that the Super<span class='line-break'></span>intendent be authorized to<span class='line-break'> </span>have the necessary repairs<span class='line-break'> </span>done to the "Superintendent's<span class='line-break'> </span>house."</p>
<p>Very truly yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a> Sec.y</p>
<p>July [?]</p>
<p>[several lines undecipherable]</p>
<p>[2517?] If convenient,<span class='line-break'> </span>I prefer you would <ins>send it before</ins><span class='line-break'> </span>Saturday by mail.</p>
<p>What course do you desire to be<span class='line-break'> </span>[letter?] with [?] to <a href='/pages/subjects/67174' title='Blaisdell, John C.'>John C. Blais<span class='line-break'></span>dell</a> prop<sup>r</sup> of lot <a href='/pages/subjects/67110' title='Lot 3394'>3394</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/59904' title='Spruce Avenue'>Spruce Av<sup>e</sup></a><span class='line-break'> </span>as to enforcing condition abt granite curb.<span class='line-break'> </span>Was your agreement with him [deleted word] definite<span class='line-break'> </span>as to time of erecting curb? If so, I can<span class='line-break'> </span>[find?] it in deeds &amp;  records as I have the<span class='line-break'> </span>deed not delivered yet. The deed contains<span class='line-break'> </span>a stipulation for granite curb but without <ins>time</ins>.</p>
<p>I return the order he sent me this morn.</p>
<p>Truly yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A. J. Coolidge</a></p>
<p>268<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133760">
<h3><a name="page-1133760">CB01_0269</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><date when='1865-07-17'> July 17 , [186]5</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/71349' title='Daniel, Otis'>Otis Daniel</a> Esq.<span class='line-break'> </span>15 Congress St - <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a>,</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>The Committee<span class='line-break'> </span>on Lots have considered your<span class='line-break'> </span>application and the report of the <span class='line-break'> </span>Sep<sup>t</sup> of the Cemetery upon your<span class='line-break'> </span>lot, and have directed me<span class='line-break'> </span>to inform you that the<span class='line-break'> </span>Corporation will guarantee<span class='line-break'> </span>the perpetual repair of your<span class='line-break'> </span>lot for four hundred &amp; fifty<span class='line-break'> </span>dollars.</p>
<p>If this offer meets your ap<span class='line-break'></span>proval, I will prepare the<span class='line-break'> </span>necessary papers.</p>
<p>Very Resp yours,</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Secretary</p>
<p><date when='1865-07-21'>July 21  [186]5</date><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54832' title='Austin, Edward'>Edw Austin</a> Esq -</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>I have tried twice<span class='line-break'> </span>to see you, and as I leave today<span class='line-break'> </span>for a week, &amp; fearing you may be<span class='line-break'> </span>absent by the time I return. I<span class='line-break'> </span>write to inquire if you acted indefan<span class='line-break'></span>dently of <a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'>Capt. Winsor's</a> suggestion in<span class='line-break'> </span>fixing <ins>Eleven</ins> hundred dollars for the<span class='line-break'> </span>Vose lot, or whether you read his<span class='line-break'> </span>1000, which he suggested, as 1100, as<span class='line-break'> </span>the figures looked more like 1100 than<span class='line-break'> </span>the hundred, in a note which he wrote<span class='line-break'> </span>me. As he suggests to $140 referred first,<span class='line-break'> </span>it makes the $1000 up to $1140 very near<span class='line-break'> </span>the figures which you thought too high.</p>
<p>I will wait your reply before noti<span class='line-break'></span>fying <a href='/pages/subjects/71351' title='Vose, Ann'>Mrs Vose</a>.</p>
<p>Very Respy Yours<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a></p>
<p>269<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133761">
<h3><a name="page-1133761">CB01_0270_1</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><date when='1865-07-21'>July 21 [186]5</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/65998' title='Lears, William C.'>W<sup>m</sup> C. Lears</a> Esq</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>I thought I<span class='line-break'> </span>should long since have sent you<span class='line-break'> </span>a copy of the deed of reconveyances<span class='line-break'> </span>in trust which I prepared for you<span class='line-break'> </span>to reconvey the Spring Lot - but have<span class='line-break'> </span>been unable to do so until now that I<span class='line-break'> </span>have an assistant.</p>
<p>I think its terms will prove<span class='line-break'> </span>satisfactory to you.</p>
<p>Yours truly</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Secretary</p>
<p><date when='1865-07'>July [186]5</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/71351' title='Vose, Ann'>Mrs. Josiah Vose</a></p>
<p>Dear Madam,</p>
<p>I am instructed<span class='line-break'> </span>by the Committee on Lots to<span class='line-break'> </span>notify you that this Corporation<span class='line-break'> </span>will guarantee the perpetual re<span class='line-break'></span>pair and preservation of <a href='/pages/subjects/71352' title='Lot 2517'>lot num<span class='line-break'></span>bered 2517</a> belonging to the estate<span class='line-break'> </span>of your late husband for the<span class='line-break'> </span>sum of eleven hundred<span class='line-break'> </span>dollars, after the repairs suggested<span class='line-break'> </span>by the Superintendent, shall have<span class='line-break'> </span>been made. -</p>
<p>Very Resp.y. yours,</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>Austin J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Secretary</p>
<p>270</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133762">
<h3><a name="page-1133762">CB01_0271_1</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><date when='1865-09-04'>Aug 4 [186]5</date></p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>In notifying me of payment<span class='line-break'> </span>for lot reported to <a href='/pages/subjects/71354' title='Sturgis, Henry P.'>Henry P. Sturgis</a> you passed down<span class='line-break'> </span>the following. I presume most of them have been<span class='line-break'> </span>paid for. --</p>
<p><table class='tabular'><thead><span class='line-break'> </span><tr><th><a href='/pages/subjects/71355' title='Lot 3574'>3574</a></th> <th><a href='/pages/subjects/71356' title='Stone, Annie E.'>Annie E Stone</a></th> <th>$127</th></tr></thead> <tbody> <tr><td><a href='/pages/subjects/71357' title='Lot 3577'>3577</a></td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/71358' title='Fellows, Charles M.'>Charles M. Fellows</a></td> <td>$256 </td> </tr> <tr><td><a href='/pages/subjects/71359' title='Lot 3582'>3582</a></td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/71360' title='Wingate, William'>W<sup>m</sup> Wingate</a></td> <td>330. </td> </tr> <tr><td><a href='/pages/subjects/71361' title='Lot 3583'>3583</a></td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/71362' title='Slater, Luther'>Luther Slater</a></td> <td>375. </td> </tr> <tr><td><a href='/pages/subjects/71363' title='Lot 3584'>3584</a></td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/71364' title='Steele, Jacob T.'>Jacob T. Steele</a></td> <td>375 </td> </tr> <tr><td><a href='/pages/subjects/71365' title='Lot 3585'>3585</a></td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/71366' title='Martin, Ellen'>Ellen Martin</a></td> <td>127 </td> </tr> <tr><td><a href='/pages/subjects/71367' title='Lot 3586'>3586</a></td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/71368' title='Burroughs, Charles, Rev.'>Rev Chas Burroughs</a></td> <td>500 </td> </tr> <tr><td><a href='/pages/subjects/71369' title='Lot 3587'>3587</a></td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/71370' title='Hubbard, William J.'>Mr W<sup>m</sup> J. Hubbard</a></td> <td>225 </td> </tr> <tr><td><a href='/pages/subjects/71371' title='Lot 3588'>3588</a></td> <td>Chaplain</td> <td>225 </td> </tr> </tbody> </table> By notifying me who of the foregoing<span class='line-break'> </span>have paid you will oblige.</p>
<p>Yours truly</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A. J. Coolidge</a> Sec.y</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'>Geo W<sup>m</sup> Bond Esq</a>  Treas<sup>re</sup></p>
<p><date when='1865-08-21'>Aug 21 [186]5</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/65961' title='Safford, William H.'>Mr W<sup>m</sup> V C Safford</a></p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>A litte informa<span class='line-break'></span>tion is needed respecting interments<span class='line-break'> </span>for June &amp; July.</p>
<p><date when='1865-06-05'>June 5.</date> Was <a href='/pages/subjects/71373' title='Coolidge, Lucy G.'>Lucy G. Coolidge</a> int<sup>d</sup><span class='line-break'> </span>in <a href='/pages/subjects/71374' title='Lot 154'>Lot 154</a> or R. T.? The papers do not<span class='line-break'> </span>agree.</p>
<p>What was the int. of St. B. child on<span class='line-break'> </span><date when='1865-06-26'>June 26<sup>th</sup></date> - "no return rec<sup>d</sup>." There<span class='line-break'> </span>you had no right to make the inter<span class='line-break'></span>ment. I said to have been int<sup>d</sup> in <a href='/pages/subjects/71375' title='Lot 3346'>lot<span class='line-break'> </span>"3346"</a> which would be ^<sup>of</sup> <a href='/pages/subjects/71376' title='Putnam, Benjamin'>Benj. Putnam</a> of<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/55343' title='Somerville, MA'>Somerville</a>.</p>
<p>In what lot was <a href='/pages/subjects/71377' title='Harvey, Sarah Frances'>Sarah Frances<span class='line-break'> </span>Harvey</a> int<sup>d</sup> <date when='1865-07-19'>19<sup>th</sup> July</date>. No number<span class='line-break'> </span>appears either on face or back of<span class='line-break'> </span>permits.</p>
<p>(over)</p>
<p>271</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133763">
<h3><a name="page-1133763">CB01_0272_1</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>No order was sent for the int. of<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/71378' title='Bancroft, Edward P.'>Edward P. Bancroft</a> on the <date when='1865-07-10'>10<sup>th</sup> of<span class='line-break'> </span>July</date> - consequently the record was<span class='line-break'> </span>omitted in the regular place.</p>
<p>Among the removal orders was found<span class='line-break'> </span>one for removal of E. P. B. on the<span class='line-break'> </span><date when='1865-07-13'>13<sup>th</sup> July</date>, but as this is in the<span class='line-break'> </span>regular form for removal order,<span class='line-break'> </span>we are without the official voucher<span class='line-break'> </span>for - Late Residence - Place &amp; date of<span class='line-break'> </span>death &amp; age. -</p>
<p>The removal order is signed by<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/71379' title='Bancroft, Clara E.'>Clara E. Bancroft</a></p>
<p><date when='1865-07-31'>July 31</date> - <a href='/pages/subjects/71380' title='Aurelis, Sarah G.'>Sarah G. Aurelis</a> - No regular<span class='line-break'> </span>order was rec<sup>d</sup> - Cons. we are without<span class='line-break'> </span>late residence &amp; age. The inst. was in<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/71381' title='Austin, Loring H.'>Loring H. Austin</a>'s <a href='/pages/subjects/71382' title='Lot 237'>lot 237</a>.</p>
<p>I am sorry to see so many<span class='line-break'> </span>slips, indicating "progress backwards" -<span class='line-break'> </span>but trust you will put your <span class='line-break'> </span>foot down to stop it - facts<span class='line-break'> </span>can be [...] [...] its, if you<span class='line-break'> </span>do not receive the proper order until<span class='line-break'> </span>the funeral enters, &amp; have to detain the<span class='line-break'> </span>funeral at the gate until you have<span class='line-break'> </span>seen whether the paper contains all<span class='line-break'> </span>the facts necessary. One minute<span class='line-break'> </span>is sufficient. If it does not, see<span class='line-break'> </span>the proprietor of the lot or the person<span class='line-break'> </span>who has charge of the funeral in his<span class='line-break'> </span>stead, and state what is wanted, &amp;<span class='line-break'> </span>give him the proper blank to fill &amp;<span class='line-break'> </span>return. If on the other hand, the<span class='line-break'> </span>order comes in advance of the funeral<span class='line-break'> </span>note down what is deficient, &amp; make<span class='line-break'> </span>provision for it before the friends leave.</p>
<p>There is <ins>never</ins> in my judgment, a justi<span class='line-break'></span>fication of ignorance of the name of the<span class='line-break'> </span>person concerned, or (if a child) of the parents<span class='line-break'> </span>and I believe proper method will secure nearly<span class='line-break'> </span>all the other facts.</p>
<p>Hereafter, please not double<span class='line-break'> </span>the order of int<sup>t</sup> in filing. Lay them flat<span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; attach the city &amp; town permits with [gluten?].</p>
<p>I have ^<sup>so</sup> refiled all orders from the beinning.</p>
<p>Truly yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a> Sec.y</p>
<p>272<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133764">
<h3><a name="page-1133764">CB01_0273</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><date when='1865-08-23'>Aug 23 [186]5</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/67889' title='Marett, Philip H.'>P.H. Marett</a> Esq<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/67890' title='New Haven, CT'>New Haven, Ct.</a></p>
<p>My dear Sir,</p>
<p>I am sorry that<span class='line-break'> </span>I seem to have neglected you. I have<span class='line-break'> </span>been trying for three or four days<span class='line-break'> </span>past to find time to write you: before<span class='line-break'> </span>that, I was not prepared to do so.</p>
<p>The delay has been through my en<span class='line-break'></span>deavor to learn from <a href='/pages/subjects/71384' title='Baldwin, Mr.'>Mr Baldwin</a><span class='line-break'> </span>whether he would join you in<span class='line-break'> </span>the arrangement for keeping both<span class='line-break'> </span>lots in order. I wrote him at<span class='line-break'> </span>once, upon your request to know<span class='line-break'> </span>if the Com. would not accept $300:<span class='line-break'> </span>and I wrote by advice of the Com<sup>ee</sup>.<span class='line-break'> </span>I waited long, but, <a href='/pages/subjects/71384' title='Baldwin, Mr.'>Mr Baldwin</a><span class='line-break'> </span>did not reply. At last I thought<span class='line-break'> </span>he might be absent, &amp; went to his<span class='line-break'> </span>house to inquire. Finding that he was<span class='line-break'> </span><ins>not</ins> away from home (although out of the<span class='line-break'> </span>house, &amp; I did not see him) I wrote<span class='line-break'> </span>another note reminding him of my<span class='line-break'> </span>former. He replied by mail that<span class='line-break'> </span>he did not care to enter into an<span class='line-break'> </span>arrangement at present for perpet<span class='line-break'></span>ual care. I then waited to see<span class='line-break'> </span>the Chairman of the Com<sup>ee</sup>. This<span class='line-break'> </span>is the month when people are<span class='line-break'> </span>easy at business, and I did not<span class='line-break'> </span>see him until three or four days<span class='line-break'> </span>ago. I asked him if the Com<sup>ee</sup><span class='line-break'> </span>could approve of $300 independently<span class='line-break'> </span>of the arrangement for both lots, and<span class='line-break'> </span>rec<sup>d</sup> a negative reply: that $350 is not<span class='line-break'> </span>too much in your case. In times when<span class='line-break'> </span>a paper dollar was worth a dollar in gold,<span class='line-break'> </span>no <ins>less</ins> than $300 would have been asked<span class='line-break'> </span>of you. I regret you have had <span class='line-break'> </span>to wait so long, but you perceive it has<span class='line-break'> </span>not been <ins>my</ins> neglect. -- I return you one of our<span class='line-break'> </span>forms of contract, in case you wish to carry through the<span class='line-break'> </span>arrangement at once, it will save you the trouble of visiting again before reading the contract.<span class='line-break'> </span>Sign it -- Enclose a draft payable to my order (the Treas<sup>r</sup> is absent just now) &amp; will acknowledge the rec<sup>t</sup> of it, &amp; get contract completed as soon as possible.</p>
<p>Very Resp.y yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
<p>273</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133765">
<h3><a name="page-1133765">CB01_0274</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><date when='1865-09-25'>Aug. 25 [186]5</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/71385' title='Stevenson, J. T.'>J.T. Stevenson</a> Esq</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>I return the deed<span class='line-break'> </span>of <a href='/pages/subjects/71386' title='Lot 920'>lot no. 920</a> which has been duly recorded.</p>
<p>I do <ins>not</ins> "err in supposing that<span class='line-break'> </span>it was not left with me for record on the<span class='line-break'> </span><date when='1864-05-28'>28<sup>th</sup> of May 1864</date>". I don't know what<span class='line-break'> </span>impression <a href='/pages/subjects/71387' title='Appleton, Mr.'>Mr Appleton</a> may have<span class='line-break'> </span>given you, if any, in making the transfer<span class='line-break'> </span>but <ins>do</ins> know that he only desired the<span class='line-break'> </span>deed to be prepared for delivery. I sent<span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; got a stamp for him &amp; he executed it in<span class='line-break'> </span>my presence and acknowledged it before<span class='line-break'> </span>me, and I am ^<sup>as</sup> sure that he did not<span class='line-break'> </span>wish it recorded before delivery, as I am of<span class='line-break'> </span>any past event. If I had no distinct<span class='line-break'> </span>recollections about it, it is my custom<span class='line-break'> </span>to acquaint parties transferring<span class='line-break'> </span>lots of the necessity of recording<span class='line-break'> </span>the transfers; and almost in<span class='line-break'></span>variably, unless grantor &amp; grantee<span class='line-break'> </span>are present together at the same<span class='line-break'> </span>time, the grantor takes away<span class='line-break'> </span>the deed with the remark<span class='line-break'> </span>that he will let the grantee<span class='line-break'> </span>attend to that -- which prac<span class='line-break'></span>tice, you are aware prevails<span class='line-break'> </span>in all conveyancing. --</p>
<p>You will please send<span class='line-break'> </span>at your convenience, the<span class='line-break'> </span>fee for recording, viz <ins>$2.00</ins>.</p>
<p>Very Resp.y</p>
<p>Your Ob<sup>t</sup> Serv<sup>t</sup></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a></p>
<p>274</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133766">
<h3><a name="page-1133766">CB01_0275_1</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><date when='1865-08-30'>Aug 30 [186]5</date></p>
<p>My dear Sir,</p>
<p>Your draft for<span class='line-break'> </span>three hundred &amp; fifty dollars<span class='line-break'> </span>payable to the order of <a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'><!--Bond-->our Treas</a>, together<span class='line-break'> </span>with the instrument of donation was rec<sup>d</sup><span class='line-break'> </span>this morning, &amp; handed in at the Gate<span class='line-break'> </span>office. <a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'><!--Bond-->The Treas<sup>r</sup></a> is expected back<span class='line-break'> </span>within a week, when the funds can be<span class='line-break'> </span>made available. It being vacation<span class='line-break'> </span>month, &amp; members of our Com<sup>ee</sup> being<span class='line-break'> </span>away, I may be unable to return<span class='line-break'> </span>your document executed within<span class='line-break'> </span>three or four weeks but will do so<span class='line-break'> </span>as soon as possible.</p>
<p>Very respy<span class='line-break'> </span>Your Ob<sup>t</sup> Serv<sup>t</sup></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A. J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/67889' title='Marett, Philip H.'>Philip Marett</a> Esq.</p>
<p><date when='1865-09-07'>Sept<sup>r</sup> 7, [186]5</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'>Capt. D. L. Winsor</a></p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/67889' title='Marett, Philip H.'>Mr Philip<span class='line-break'> </span>Marett</a>, prop<sup>r</sup> of <a href='/pages/subjects/68000' title='Lot 794'>lot 794</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/60336' title='Willow Avenue'>Willow Av</a>.<span class='line-break'> </span>has paid the $350 required on his lot,<span class='line-break'> </span>but I find that, through inadvertence, I said<span class='line-break'> </span>nothing to him about repairs antecedent<span class='line-break'> </span>to the contract: and he will no doubt<span class='line-break'> </span>think he has paid enough.</p>
<p>Will you be so kind as to examine<span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; inform me what these necessary re<span class='line-break'></span>pairs will cost, at the lowest estimate.</p>
<p>There appears to be a disposition with<span class='line-break'> </span>some of the Com<sup>ee</sup>, if they will not cost too<span class='line-break'> </span>much, <del>to</del> not ^<sup>to</sup> open the matter to him again.</p>
<p>As he has only two headstones, I am inclined<span class='line-break'> </span>to think we can get along well enough with <span class='line-break'> </span>it.</p>
<p>Truly yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A. J. Coolidge</a></p>
<p>275</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133767">
<h3><a name="page-1133767">CB01_0276</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><date when='1865-09-09'>Sept 9 [186]5</date></p>
<p>Dea. <a href='/pages/subjects/71393' title='Gould, Charles D'>Chas D Gould</a></p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>I find from ref<span class='line-break'></span>erence to the clause of the late <a href='/pages/subjects/71299' title='Bradley, Benjamin'>Benj.<span class='line-break'> </span>Bradley's</a> will relating to the lot at Mt<span class='line-break'> </span>Auburn, the guaranty is not required<span class='line-break'> </span>of the Corporation, but to expend the in<span class='line-break'></span>come as may be needed.</p>
<p>There is no objection there to the<span class='line-break'> </span>acceptance of the $500 now, if the<span class='line-break'> </span>ex<sup>rs</sup> are ready to pay it.</p>
<p>Please show me a copy of the<span class='line-break'> </span>will, and I will prepare the con<span class='line-break'></span>tract.</p>
<p>If the monument is added at any<span class='line-break'> </span>time it will make no difference.<span class='line-break'> </span>The Corporation is only obliged to expend<span class='line-break'> </span>the income.</p>
<p>Please give me the names of the ex<sup>rs</sup>.</p>
<p>Truly yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
<p><date when='1865-09-15'>Sept<sup>r</sup> 15 [186]5</date></p>
<p>Rec<sup>d</sup> of <a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'>Geo. W<sup>m</sup> Bond</a> being<span class='line-break'> </span>Treas<sup>r</sup> fifty dollars for<span class='line-break'> </span>stamps for deeds of this Cor<span class='line-break'></span>poration to sundry proprietors<span class='line-break'> </span>to wit -- for deeds already made<span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; returned to Treas<sup>r</sup> for delivery &amp;<span class='line-break'> </span>transf<sup>r</sup> to Sec.y under by-law for delivery<span class='line-break'> </span>but not before stamped 7.50<span class='line-break'> </span>for deeds to be made &amp;<span class='line-break'> </span>deliv<sup>d</sup> -- lots already sold -- <span class='line-break'> </span><ins>42.50</ins><span class='line-break'> </span>$50 --</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a> Sec.y</p>
<p>276</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133768">
<h3><a name="page-1133768">CB01_0277</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><date when='1865-09-22'>Sept 22 [186]5</date></p>
<p>Misser <a href='/pages/subjects/72707' title='Kennard, E. L.'>E.L.<!--Kennard--></a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/74541' title='Kennard, Henry C.'>H.C. Kennard</a><span class='line-break'> </span>943 Washington St</p>
<p>I am informed by <a href='/pages/subjects/74541' title='Kennard, Henry C.'>H. Kennard Esq</a><span class='line-break'> </span>that <a href='/pages/subjects/65295' title='Kennard, Michael'>Michael Kennard</a>, prop<sup>r</sup> of <a href='/pages/subjects/65296' title='Lot 974'>lot<span class='line-break'> </span>no. 974</a> in Mt Auburn was your<span class='line-break'> </span>father, and that he died many years since.</p>
<p>I find upon reference to our interment<span class='line-break'> </span>records that <a href='/pages/subjects/65295' title='Kennard, Michael'>Michael Kennard</a> died<span class='line-break'> </span>on the <date when='1845-08-15'>15<sup>th</sup> of August 1845</date>, but unfortu<span class='line-break'></span>nately for title to this lot that event was<span class='line-break'> </span>15 days before the date of the deed<span class='line-break'> </span>to the proprietor, in that if he was<span class='line-break'> </span>the person intended the deed would<span class='line-break'> </span>be void.</p>
<p>Will you please to call and see<span class='line-break'> </span>me, as we are making up a new<span class='line-break'> </span>catalogue, and should like to<span class='line-break'> </span>get this matter right.</p>
<p>Yours resp.y</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a></p>
<p><date when='1865-10-28'>Octo. 28 [186]5</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'>Capt D. L. Winsor</a></p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>Agreeably to good<span class='line-break'> </span>request I return you four of<span class='line-break'> </span>the numbers I sent you to stand<span class='line-break'> </span>against the four lots reported today,<span class='line-break'> </span>viz -</p>
<p><table class='tabular'><thead><span class='line-break'> </span><tr><th><a href='/pages/subjects/71406' title='Lot 45'><!--Lot-->45.</a></th> <th><a href='/pages/subjects/61116' title='Angelica Path'>Angelica P.</a></th> <th>22 of</th> <th><a href='/pages/subjects/71407' title='Plumley, Mary'>Mrs Mary Plumley</a> -</th> <th><a href='/pages/subjects/59911' title='Chelsea, MA'>Chelsea</a></th></tr></thead> <tbody> <tr><td> <a href='/pages/subjects/71408' title='Lot 165'><!--Lot-->165.</a></td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/61235' title='Mound Avenue'>Mound Av.</a></td> <td>400f  -</td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/101517' title='Bowker, Ediwn'>Edwin Bowker</a>,</td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/64824' title='Waltham, MA'>Waltham</a> </td> </tr> <tr><td> <a href='/pages/subjects/71409' title='Lot 723'><!--Lot-->723</a></td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/61147' title='Celastrus Path'>Celastrus P.</a></td> <td>102 f</td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/71410' title='Wilson, Isabella'>Isabella Wilson</a></td> <td>- <a href='/pages/subjects/53204' title='Watertown, MA'>Water<sup>tn</sup></a> </td> </tr> <tr><td> <a href='/pages/subjects/71411' title='Lot 1210'><!--Lot-->1210</a></td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/61232' title='Mimosa Path'>Mimosa<!--Path--></a> <a href='/pages/subjects/71412' title='Lot 1983'>rear 1983.</a></td> <td>133f</td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/71413' title='Judkins, Eliza M.'>E.M. Judkins</a></td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/60036' title='Medford, MA'>Medford</a> </td> </tr> </tbody> </table> I have passed over <a href='/pages/subjects/71414' title='Lot 536'>lots<span class='line-break'> </span>536</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/59227' title='Lot 537'><!--Lot-->537</a> on your list, which<span class='line-break'> </span>with <a href='/pages/subjects/71415' title='Lot 3037'><!--Lot-->3037</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/71416' title='Lot 3038'><!--Lot-->3038</a> later on the<span class='line-break'> </span>list will be very convenient<span class='line-break'> </span>in case you sell two lots side<span class='line-break'> </span>by side. Please correct books &amp; <span class='line-break'> </span>lots.</p>
<p>Truly yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a></p>
<p>277</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133769">
<h3><a name="page-1133769">CB01_0278_1</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>278</p>
<p><date when='1865-09-26'>Sept<sup>r</sup> 26, [186]5</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54774' title='Little, Charles C.'>Chas. C. Little</a> Esq</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>At a meeting of the Trus<span class='line-break'></span>tees of the Corporation held <date when='1865-09-04'>Sept 4, 1865</date>, the follow<span class='line-break'></span>ing vote was adopted --</p>
<p>"Voted that the [word missing]<span class='line-break'> </span>by a Committee of Trustees [missing words] municipal<span class='line-break'> </span>and [?] <a href='/pages/subjects/53203' title='Cambridge, MA'>Cambridge</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/53204' title='Watertown, MA'>Watertown</a> , in relation<span class='line-break'> </span>to the acceptance of such portion of said road<span class='line-break'> </span>and report thereon."</p>
<p>I enclose here with copy of a report made<span class='line-break'> </span>by a Committee of the Trustees <date when='1862-01-27'>Jany. 27, 1862</date> on [those?]<span class='line-break'> </span>rights and liabilities of this Corporation respecting the<span class='line-break'> </span>way called <a href='/pages/subjects/62104' title='Coolidge Avenue'>Coolidge Avenue</a>:</p>
<p>Also, a plan of the lands conveyed<span class='line-break'> </span>to this corporation including said road.</p>
<p>Please preserve &amp; return this plan to<span class='line-break'> </span>our files.</p>
<p>Very Resp.y yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A. J. Coolidge</a>  Secretary</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133770">
<h3><a name="page-1133770">CB01_0279_1</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><date when='1865-10-09'>Octo. 9 [186]5</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/67889' title='Marett, Philip H.'>P. Marett</a> Esq<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/67890' title='New Haven, CT'>New Haven, Conn.</a></p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>I return the<span class='line-break'> </span>contract for perpetual repair of <a href='/pages/subjects/68000' title='Lot 794'>lot 794</a><span class='line-break'> </span>at last, duly executed. I do not wonder<span class='line-break'> </span>that you thought there was unnecessary<span class='line-break'> </span>delay: but so it has happened. At first,<span class='line-break'> </span>there was a question about repairs upon<span class='line-break'> </span>the lot -- That having been settled, one<span class='line-break'> </span>of the Com<sup>ee</sup> was absent, another had<span class='line-break'> </span>death in his family, &amp; so I return<span class='line-break'> </span>it as soon as I have been able to do<span class='line-break'> </span>so. --</p>
<p>Please forward me five dollars<span class='line-break'> </span>as the fee for making &amp; recording papers<span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; oblige</p>
<p>Your<span class='line-break'> </span>Ob<sup>t</sup> Serv<sup>t</sup></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a></p>
<p><date when='1865-10-09'>Octo. 9 [186]5</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/66867' title='Murdock, William C.'>W<sup>m</sup>. C. Murdock</a> Esq</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
