<p>I am directed by the<span class='line-break'> </span>Com<sup>ee</sup> on Lots to inform you that they<span class='line-break'> </span>will recommend the Trustees to guar<span class='line-break'></span>antee the perpetual repair of your own<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/102110' title='Lot 3000'>lot no 3000</a> -- on payment of<span class='line-break'> </span>four hundred dollars: --<span class='line-break'> </span>and of lot belonging to the heirs<span class='line-break'> </span>of <a href='/pages/subjects/66868' title='Ward, James O.'>Jas. O. Ward</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/66866' title='Lot 1502'>no. 1502</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>on payment of four hun<span class='line-break'></span>dred and fifty dollars.</p>
<p>Very Resp.y yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
<p>279</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133771">
<h3><a name="page-1133771">CB01_0280_1</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><date when='1865-10-14'>Octo. 14 [186]5</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/74572' title='Jenks, John H.'>J.H. Jenks</a> Esq</p>
<p>My dear Sir,</p>
<p>I have seen<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/74571' title='Markham, W. B., Mr.'>Mr Markham</a> today, &amp; he<span class='line-break'> </span>has since spent an hour or more<span class='line-break'> </span>time with me in looking over the<span class='line-break'> </span>plan. He seems very favorably<span class='line-break'> </span>disposed -- wishes to avoid all<span class='line-break'> </span>personal feeling, and will go<span class='line-break'> </span>out at once to see what he can<span class='line-break'> </span>find to suit the case. I think <span class='line-break'> </span>he is very gentlemanly in his dis<span class='line-break'></span>position, and will do what you<span class='line-break'> </span>desire, if he can see his way clear.</p>
<p>You shall hear from me again<span class='line-break'> </span>as soon as I can report progress.</p>
<p>Very Resp.y yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a></p>
<p><date when='1865-10-16'>Octo. 16, [186]5</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/71430' title='Wilson, Alexander'>Alex. Wilson</a> Esq</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/71431' title='Lot 3609'>Lot no. 3609</a><span class='line-break'> </span>which is in the <a href='/pages/subjects/71432' title='Lot 1650'>rear of 1650</a> on<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/59904' title='Spruce Avenue'>Spruce Avenue</a>, was reported as<span class='line-break'> </span>sold to you on the 2<sup>d</sup> of September<span class='line-break'> </span>last.</p>
<p>The lot contains 102 square<span class='line-break'> </span>feet at 75 cts per foot, which<span class='line-break'> </span>makes $76.50 for the land, to<span class='line-break'> </span>which is added $2 for the deed,<span class='line-break'> </span>making $78.50. &amp; which is always<span class='line-break'> </span>payable within five days from the bargaining<span class='line-break'> </span>for the lot. --</p>
<p>I dont know what arrangements<span class='line-break'> </span>you made with the Superintendent about<span class='line-break'> </span>grading, but that always constitutes<span class='line-break'> </span>a separate bill.</p>
<p>All bills payable to <a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'>Geo. W<sup>m</sup> Bond</a>, Treas<sup>r</sup> 167 Congress St</p>
<p>Respectfully yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a></p>
<p>280</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133772">
<h3><a name="page-1133772">CB01_0281</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><date when='1865-10-19'>Octo. 19, [186]5</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/66068' title='Tenney, Amos'>Amos Tenney</a> Esq<span class='line-break'> </span>37 William St. <a href='/pages/subjects/64140' title='New York, NY'>New York</a></p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>The remains of<span class='line-break'> </span>your wife were temporarily depos<span class='line-break'></span>ited in the <a href='/pages/subjects/57656' title='Receiving Tomb'>Receiving Tomb</a> on the<span class='line-break'> </span><date when='1864-09-25'>25<sup>th</sup> of Sept. 1864</date> -- more than a<span class='line-break'> </span>year ago -- with your promise<span class='line-break'> </span>to remove them to <a href='/pages/subjects/64140' title='New York, NY'>New York</a> ^<sup>or elsewhere</sup> in<span class='line-break'> </span>a few days.</p>
<p>I shall have to request<span class='line-break'> </span>your immediate attention to<span class='line-break'> </span>such removal, as it is abso<span class='line-break'></span>lutely necessary to keep the re<span class='line-break'></span>ceiving tomb free for other deposits.</p>
<p>Respectfully yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
<p><date when='1865-10-27'>Octo. 27 [186]5</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'>Capt. D.L. Winsor</a>,</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>I send you<span class='line-break'> </span>the following numbers which have<span class='line-break'> </span>no location, which please use in all<span class='line-break'> </span>future sales until exhausted, as we<span class='line-break'> </span>propose soon to issue a new catalogue<span class='line-break'> </span>and do not wish to have blank<span class='line-break'> </span>numbers in catalogue: --</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/71406' title='Lot 45'><!--Lot-->45</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/71408' title='Lot 165'><!--Lot-->165</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/71414' title='Lot 536'><!--Lot-->536</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/59227' title='Lot 537'><!--Lot-->537</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/71409' title='Lot 723'><!--Lot-->723</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/71411' title='Lot 1210'><!--Lot-->1210</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/65212' title='Lot 2297'><!--Lot-->2297</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/65316' title='Lot 2326'><!--Lot-->2326</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/71434' title='Lot 2419'><!--Lot-->2419</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/71435' title='Lot 2625'><!--Lot-->2625</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/71436' title='Lot 2841'><!--Lot-->2841</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/71437' title='Lot 2712'><!--Lot-->2712</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/71438' title='Lot 2936'><!--Lot-->2936</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/71439' title='Lot 2960'><!--Lot-->2960</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/71415' title='Lot 3037'><!--Lot-->3037</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/71416' title='Lot 3038'><!--Lot-->3038</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/71440' title='Lot 3081'><!--Lot-->3081</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/71441' title='Lot 3554'><!--Lot-->3554</a>.</p>
<p>Truly yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a></p>
<p>281</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133773">
<h3><a name="page-1133773">CB01_0282</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><date when='1865-10-30'>Octo. 30 [186]5</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/71442' title='Burroughs, Dr., Rev.'>Rev<sup>d</sup> Dr. Burroughs</a></p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>Your brother brought<span class='line-break'> </span>in a note from you a few days <span class='line-break'> </span>since in which you were pleased to refer<span class='line-break'> </span>to my judgment respecting the improve<span class='line-break'></span>ment of your lot at Mount Auburn<span class='line-break'> </span>in terms of confidence, and asking<span class='line-break'> </span>him to advise with me as to the kind<span class='line-break'> </span>of fense &amp;c. to be erected.</p>
<p>I have since learned from the Super<span class='line-break'></span>intendent that nothing has been done<span class='line-break'> </span>to the lot, as he waited for instructions<span class='line-break'> </span>from somebody, and supposed he should<span class='line-break'> </span>soon receive them. He does not usually<span class='line-break'> </span>put parties to unnecessary expense,<span class='line-break'> </span>as he would do in enforcing at once<span class='line-break'> </span>what you will perceive from your<span class='line-break'> </span>deed is the rule -- i.e. within sixty days<span class='line-break'> </span>grade bound &amp; number the lot, unless<span class='line-break'> </span>the proprietor proceeds to do so,<span class='line-break'> </span>where he supposes they intend to enclose<span class='line-break'> </span>the lots with granite curb, or even<span class='line-break'> </span>iron fence. No expense has therefore<span class='line-break'> </span>been incurred, and if you intend<span class='line-break'> </span>to go on with the erection of a fence<span class='line-break'> </span>it is best to let the grading of<span class='line-break'> </span>the lot remain until that is done.</p>
<p>Now, as to the style of fence.<span class='line-break'> </span>Whether you have iron or stone -- there<span class='line-break'> </span>are so many varieties, and it is so much<span class='line-break'> </span>a question of taste for the proprietor to<span class='line-break'> </span>decide upon himself, that it is unwise<span class='line-break'> </span>for anyone to undertake that task<span class='line-break'> </span>for him. Iron fences are liable to<span class='line-break'> </span>rust, unless frequently painted, and<span class='line-break'> </span>are rather out of date now, as there is<span class='line-break'> </span>a growing feeling that a cemetery while<span class='line-break'> </span>is well protected with a high iron en<span class='line-break'></span>closure does not need the additional<span class='line-break'> </span>protection to it, small subdivisions<span class='line-break'> </span>or lots in the form of other iron fences,<span class='line-break'> </span>though this feeling, &amp; the finding</p>
<p>282</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133774">
<h3><a name="page-1133774">CB01_0283</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>that the granite curb-stone, which<span class='line-break'> </span>is usually 15 or 16 inches in height, &amp;<span class='line-break'> </span>is filled up inside with good earth,<span class='line-break'> </span>like a flower pot, &amp; grassed over --<span class='line-break'> </span>is a practical protection to<span class='line-break'> </span>all intents and purposes against<span class='line-break'> </span>the intrusion of persons wishing<span class='line-break'> </span>to cross from path to path, --<span class='line-break'> </span>the granite enclosure has come<span class='line-break'> </span>to be the almost universal fashion.<span class='line-break'> </span>Where we now erect one iron<span class='line-break'> </span>fence, we probably put in twenty<span class='line-break'> </span>granite curbs. The first cost of<span class='line-break'> </span>this kind of fence is greater than iron -- at<span class='line-break'> </span>most double. A lot like yours would<span class='line-break'> </span>probably <ins>now</ins> cost to put in such style ^<sup>of granite</sup> as<span class='line-break'> </span>you would be willing to have, $600 or $700. It<span class='line-break'> </span>can not be set in cold weather after the<span class='line-break'> </span>frost is in the ground, but winter is a good time<span class='line-break'> </span>to have the stone cut, as it can generally be<span class='line-break'> </span>done for less money where the work does not drive.</p>
<p>Your best plan is to come up, if possible while<span class='line-break'> </span>the weather is pleasant, -- say early in Nov<sup>r</sup> --and go to Mt<span class='line-break'> </span>Auburn &amp; our Sup<sup>t</sup>, <a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'>Capt Winsor</a>, will show you<span class='line-break'> </span>any thing you desire.</p>
<p>Very truly yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a> Sec.y</p>
<p><date when='1865-11-06'>Nov<sup>r</sup> 6 [1865]</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/71445' title='Southack, George P.'>Mr Geo. P. Southack</a><span class='line-break'> </span>188 Harrison Av<sup>e</sup></p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>The Committee of<span class='line-break'> </span>the Trustees of this Corporation, to<span class='line-break'> </span>whom is referred the selection of<span class='line-break'> </span>a candidate for the the office of<span class='line-break'> </span>Gatekeeper request you to meet<span class='line-break'> </span>them at this office on<span class='line-break'> </span>Wednesday morning next,<span class='line-break'> </span>at half past 9 o'clock.</p>
<p><date when='1865-11-08T09:30:00'>Wednesday Nov. 8<sup>th</sup> at 9 1/2 a.m.</date></p>
<p>Respectfully yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Secretary</p>
<p>283</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133775">
<h3><a name="page-1133775">CB01_0284</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><date when='1865-11-06'>Nov<sup>r</sup> 6, [186]5</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/58435' title='Francis, Nathaniel '>Nath<sup>l</sup> Francis</a> Esq</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>I am directed <span class='line-break'> </span>by the Committee on Lots<span class='line-break'> </span>to inform you that this Cor<span class='line-break'></span>poration will guarantee the<span class='line-break'> </span>perpetual care of your <a href='/pages/subjects/71446' title='Lot 333'>lot<span class='line-break'> </span>no 333</a> in the Cemetery situa<span class='line-break'></span>ted upon <a href='/pages/subjects/54338' title='Indian Ridge Path'>Indian Ridge Path</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>on payment to the Treasurer<span class='line-break'> </span>of three hundred and<span class='line-break'> </span>seventy five dollars. ($375.)</p>
<p>Whenever, you may so signify,<span class='line-break'> </span>I will prepare the necessary<span class='line-break'> </span>papers.</p>
<p>Very Respectfully yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
<p><date when='1865-11-06'>Nov<sup>r</sup> 6 [186]5</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'>Capt. D.L. Winsor</a></p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>The subject of<span class='line-break'> </span>selecting a candidate for a Gate<span class='line-break'></span>keeper was today referred to a <span class='line-break'> </span>Committee consisting of Messrs<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Rand</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/56312' title='Norcross, Otis'>Norcross</a> -- and they were<span class='line-break'> </span>authorized to employ temporarily<span class='line-break'> </span>a suitable person. They have<span class='line-break'> </span>a meeting on Wednesday morning<span class='line-break'> </span>to consider the various applica<span class='line-break'></span>tions -- at 9 1/2 o'clock at my<span class='line-break'> </span>office, where they expect some of<span class='line-break'> </span>the applicants to appear in person: &amp;<span class='line-break'> </span>they have asked me to invite you to<span class='line-break'> </span>be present.</p>
<p>Meanwhile, they wish you to place<span class='line-break'> </span>any suitable man of your force at the<span class='line-break'> </span>Gate.</p>
<p>Respectfully yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a></p>
<p>284</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133776">
<h3><a name="page-1133776">CB01_0285</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>Nov. 9 [186]5</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/71447' title='Wheeler, Gardner'>Gardner Wheeler</a> Esq</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>We are making a<span class='line-break'> </span>new lithographic map of the Cemetery<span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; wish to know what is the divis<span class='line-break'></span>ion line between your <a href='/pages/subjects/71450' title='Lot 1889'>lot 1889</a><span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; your brother's <a href='/pages/subjects/71449' title='Lot 2739'>2739</a> -- equal<span class='line-break'> </span>in contents -- if you have an<span class='line-break'> </span>ideal line between you.</p>
<p>You may get along well<span class='line-break'> </span>enough while you both live, but<span class='line-break'> </span>it will be better to show the line,<span class='line-break'> </span>then <ins>heirs</ins> will see how it was<span class='line-break'> </span>always understood.</p>
<p>Please see or inform me.</p>
<p>Respectfully yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
<p>Nov. 13 [186]5</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/60717' title='Hubbard, Gardner G.'>Gardner G. Hubbard</a> Esq.</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>Some weeks since<span class='line-break'> </span>you promised to give your im<span class='line-break'></span>mediate attention to the matter<span class='line-break'> </span>of the Chaplain lot -- no. <a href='/pages/subjects/71371' title='Lot 3588'>3588</a> --<span class='line-break'> </span>on <a href='/pages/subjects/61217' title='Lantana Path'>Lantana Path</a> in the Cemetery.</p>
<p>We shall have to ask your<span class='line-break'> </span>immediate attention to this.<span class='line-break'> </span>Indeed I cannot see that any<span class='line-break'></span>thing is to be decided, as the <span class='line-break'> </span>position of both lots is fixed.</p>
<p>You are very near Mt Auburn<span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; can see the Sup<sup>t</sup> any day in<span class='line-break'> </span>ten minutes.</p>
<p>Respectfully yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
<p>285</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133777">
<h3><a name="page-1133777">CB01_0286</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><date when='1865-11-14'>Nov.<sup>r</sup> 14 [186]5</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/72167' title='Gurney, Henry'>Henry Gurney</a> Esq</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>The Committee<span class='line-break'> </span>on Lots have directed me to inform<span class='line-break'> </span>you that this Corporation will<span class='line-break'> </span>accept the trust for the perpetual<span class='line-break'> </span>repair of your <a href='/pages/subjects/72168' title='Lot 1014'>lot no. 1014</a> on<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/60651' title='Fir Avenue'>Fir Avenue</a>, in its present con<span class='line-break'></span>dition for the sum of four<span class='line-break'> </span>hundred dollars ($400.)</p>
<p>The Superintendent reports that<span class='line-break'> </span>the lot is wanting new grading &amp;<span class='line-break'> </span>sodding. If the Corporation under<span class='line-break'></span>take to do this, you will not <span class='line-break'> </span>have to wait until another year,<span class='line-break'> </span>when it can be done.</p>
<p>Very Resp.y yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>Austin J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
<p><date when='1865-11-14'>Nov. 14 [186]5</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/72169' title='Cunningham, D. W.'>D. W. Cunningham</a> Esq<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/66040' title='Worcester, MA'>Worcester, Mass.</a></p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>Yours of yester<span class='line-break'></span>day inquiring if grave can be opened<span class='line-break'> </span>as late as <date when='1865-12-04'>Dec<sup>r</sup> 4</date> is before me.<span class='line-break'> </span>I say without doubt -- yes!<span class='line-break'> </span>It would be very unusual for more<span class='line-break'> </span>than two or three inches of frost to get<span class='line-break'> </span>in before that, and often not much<span class='line-break'> </span>till near Christmas. We should<span class='line-break'> </span>not mind a few inches. You must<span class='line-break'> </span>run your own risk of weather.</p>
<p>The point of residence I believe<span class='line-break'> </span>you settled in favor of <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a>. If you have<span class='line-break'> </span>occasion to change it, please inform me,<span class='line-break'> </span>as we are rapidly making up the cata<span class='line-break'></span>logue.</p>
<p>Truly yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a></p>
<p>286</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133778">
<h3><a name="page-1133778">CB01_0287</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><date when='1865-11-15'>Nov. 15 [186]5</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/104067' title='Maynard, Messers'>Messrs Maynard</a></p>
<p>Gentlemen,</p>
<p>I have the<span class='line-break'> </span>impression that you have pur<span class='line-break'></span>chased <a href='/pages/subjects/72172' title='Lot 60'>lot 60</a> on <a href='/pages/subjects/61146' title='Cedar Avenue'>Cedar Av</a> -- [indecipherable]<span class='line-break'> </span>standing on our record, in the<span class='line-break'> </span>name of <a href='/pages/subjects/72173' title='Parsons, Usher'>Usher Parsons</a>. --</p>
<p>We are preparing a new cat<span class='line-break'></span>alogue, and if you are not yet<span class='line-break'> </span>prepared to take the new deed,<span class='line-break'> </span>if such is the course proposed<span class='line-break'> </span>by you, as I have heard that you<span class='line-break'> </span>wish the additional land, you<span class='line-break'> </span>had better bring in your deed &amp;<span class='line-break'> </span>transfer back to the Corp<sup>n</sup> &amp; have<span class='line-break'> </span>the Sup<sup>t</sup> report the additional<span class='line-break'> </span>land, so that I may enter the<span class='line-break'> </span>matter correctly in the new catalogue.</p>
<p>It will be several years before another<span class='line-break'> </span>will be issued.</p>
<p>Respy yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a></p>
<p><date when='1865-11-15'>Nov<sup>r</sup> 15 [186]5</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/72174' title='Albree, John'>John Albree</a> Esq</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>The late <a href='/pages/subjects/72174' title='Albree, John'>John Albree</a><span class='line-break'> </span>who was prop<sup>r</sup> of <a href='/pages/subjects/72175' title='Lot 129'>lot no. 129</a>, on <a href='/pages/subjects/60336' title='Willow Avenue'>Willow<span class='line-break'> </span>Av.<sup>e</sup></a>, I was informed (or have seen)<span class='line-break'> </span>by his will made such disposition of the <ins>res<span class='line-break'></span>idue</ins> of his estate as to give this lot to<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/72176' title='Albree, George'>Geo. Albree</a> of <a href='/pages/subjects/72177' title='Pittsburgh, PA'>Pittsburgh Pa</a>. -- his brother.<span class='line-break'> </span>You or someone called here two or three<span class='line-break'> </span>years since, &amp; I prepared some forms of<span class='line-break'> </span>transfer, on the supposition that 2<sup>d</sup> <a href='/pages/subjects/72176' title='Albree, George'>Geo. Albree</a><span class='line-break'> </span>would release to the widow. I have since been<span class='line-break'> </span>informed indirectly that he was unwilling to do so.</p>
<p>The title still stands on our records in the<span class='line-break'> </span>name of <a href='/pages/subjects/72174' title='Albree, John'>John Albree</a>. I was about to write<span class='line-break'> </span>G.A., but thought I would first write you<span class='line-break'> </span>to learn if any conclusion has been arrived<span class='line-break'> </span>at. I have the impression you are a nephew<span class='line-break'> </span>or relative. I dont know where the widow is.</p>
<p>Your early reply will oblige.</p>
<p>Yours truly</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a> Sec.y</p>
<p>287</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133779">
<h3><a name="page-1133779">CB01_0288</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><date when='1865-11-17'>Nov. 17. [186]5</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/72176' title='Albree, George'>Geo. Albree</a> Esq<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/72177' title='Pittsburgh, PA'>Pittsburgh, Pa.</a></p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>We are preparing a<span class='line-break'> </span>new catalogue of the lots and proprietors in<span class='line-break'> </span>the Cemetery. I have been informed<span class='line-break'> </span>that your brother John made such<span class='line-break'> </span>disposition of his estate (the residuasm)<span class='line-break'> </span>as to carry his <a href='/pages/subjects/72175' title='Lot 129'>lot no. 129</a> (which<span class='line-break'> </span>is real estate) to you.</p>
<p>The only evidence one has of title<span class='line-break'> </span>to a lot should appear upon our record<span class='line-break'> </span>and this always made in such cases<span class='line-break'> </span>as this by reference to the original<span class='line-break'> </span>will or the record. I can get at these<span class='line-break'> </span>here. But if you wish it to appear<span class='line-break'> </span>as it should upon the deed, you<span class='line-break'> </span>will send me the deed which I will<span class='line-break'> </span>return by mail. Please also enclose<span class='line-break'> </span>$3, the charge in the matter.</p>
<p>Yours Resp.y</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
<p><date when='1865-11-17'>Nov. 17 [186]5</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'>Capt. D.L. Winsor</a></p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>In making a more<span class='line-break'> </span>thorough revision of the plans, &amp; by<span class='line-break'> </span>striking from the catalogue all ^<sup>numbers of</sup> lots<span class='line-break'> </span>said to be located (yet unsold) where<span class='line-break'> </span>the location is obviously impracticable,<span class='line-break'> </span>we obtained the following numbers <span class='line-break'> </span>for your use, which you can apply to<span class='line-break'> </span>lots made up and that must be sold in<span class='line-break'> </span>that form, as well as to lots sold: --</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/72178' title='Lot 238'><!--Lot-->238</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/72179' title='Lot 239'><!--Lot-->239</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/72180' title='Lot 279'><!--Lot-->279</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/72181' title='Lot 284'><!--Lot-->284</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/71554' title='Lot 341'><!--Lot-->341</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/72182' title='Lot 342'><!--Lot-->342</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/71556' title='Lot 344'><!--Lot-->344</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/71556' title='Lot 344'><!--Lot-->344</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/72183' title='Lot 373'><!--Lot-->373</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/72184' title='Lot 374'><!--Lot-->374</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/72185' title='Lot 450'><!--Lot-->450</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/72186' title='Lot 456'><!--Lot-->456</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/72187' title='Lot 531'><!--Lot-->531</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/71414' title='Lot 536'><!--Lot-->536</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/59227' title='Lot 537'><!--Lot-->537</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62009' title='Lot 567'><!--Lot-->567</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/72188' title='Lot 576'><!--Lot-->576</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/72189' title='Lot 579'><!--Lot-->579</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/72190' title='Lot 589'><!--Lot-->589</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/72191' title='Lot 763'><!--Lot-->763</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/72192' title='Lot 2532'><!--Lot-->2532</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/71438' title='Lot 2936'><!--Lot-->2936</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/71439' title='Lot 2960'><!--Lot-->2960</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/72193' title='Lot 3012'><!--Lot-->3012</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/71415' title='Lot 3037'><!--Lot-->3037</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/71416' title='Lot 3038'><!--Lot-->3038</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/71440' title='Lot 3081'><!--Lot-->3081</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/71441' title='Lot 3554'><!--Lot-->3554</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/72194' title='Lot 3599'><!--Lot-->3599</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/72195' title='Lot 3600'><!--Lot-->3600</a> -- = 30 numbers.</p>
<p>All the above are exclusive<span class='line-break'> </span>of numbers recently reported by<span class='line-break'> </span>you.</p>
<p>Resp.y yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
<p>288</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133780">
<h3><a name="page-1133780">CB01_0289</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><date when='1865-11-20'>Nov. 20 [186]5</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/63912' title='Lowell, Charles Russell, II'>Chas. R. Lowell</a> Esq</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>We are finishing<span class='line-break'> </span>up a new lithographic plan of<span class='line-break'> </span>the Cemetery on a large scale, and,<span class='line-break'> </span>in order to represent <a href='/pages/subjects/63913' title='Lot 323'>lot nos. 323</a><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/63914' title='Lot 1443'>&amp; 1443</a> thereon, shall be com<span class='line-break'></span>pelled to put in the granite boun<span class='line-break'></span>dary posts at the expense of<span class='line-break'> </span>the parties interested: and I<span class='line-break'> </span>have requested the Superintendent<span class='line-break'> </span>to have this done.</p>
<p>As I understood you were<span class='line-break'> </span>contemplating some further perma<span class='line-break'></span>nent improvement, I had hoped you<span class='line-break'> </span>would have been in season to save this<span class='line-break'> </span>trouble. However the expense will not<span class='line-break'> </span>be material, and you will be allowed<span class='line-break'> </span>the value of the posts to the Corporation when<span class='line-break'> </span>you are ready to erect a fence.</p>
<p>Respectfully yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a>, <date when='1865-11-20'>Nov. 20. 1865</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/81482' title='Shedd, J. H., Mr.'>J.H. Shedd</a> Esq</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>I should<span class='line-break'> </span>like to have <a href='/pages/subjects/72198' title='Perkins, Mr.'>Mr Perkins</a> sur<span class='line-break'></span>vey &amp; give in feet the areas<span class='line-break'> </span>of several pieces of ground<span class='line-break'> </span>entered in the catalogue as <ins>"Mon<span class='line-break'></span>uments"</ins> to this or that individ<span class='line-break'></span>ual --</p>
<p>Such are</p>
<p><table class='tabular'><thead><span class='line-break'> </span><tr><th><a href='/pages/subjects/72199' title='Lot 180'><!--Lot-->180</a> --</th> <th><a href='/pages/subjects/57672' title='Central Square'>Central Square</a></th> <th>to</th> <th><a href='/pages/subjects/57084' title='Adams, Hannah'>Hannah Adams</a><span class='line-break'> </span></th></tr></thead> <tbody> <tr><td><a href='/pages/subjects/72200' title='Lot 181'><!--Lot-->181</a> --</td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/58791' title='Central Avenue'>Central Ave</a></td> <td>"</td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/72201' title='Sparzheim, Johann'>Sparzheim</a></td> </tr> <tr><td><a href='/pages/subjects/72202' title='Lot 433'><!--Lot-->433</a> --</td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/55273' title='Narcissus Path'>Narcissus P.</a></td> <td>"</td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/72203' title='Durgin, Clement'>C. Durgin</a></td> </tr> <tr><td><a href='/pages/subjects/72204' title='Lot 680'><!--Lot-->680</a> --</td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/61304' title='Yarrow Path'>Yarrow P.</a></td> <td>"</td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/58800' title='Fessenden, Thomas Green'>Thos. G. Fessenden</a></td> </tr> <tr><td><a href='/pages/subjects/72205' title='Lot 724'><!--Lot-->724</a></td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/60001' title='Walnut Avenue'>Walnut Av.</a></td> <td>"</td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/58803' title='Worcester, Noah'>Noah Worcester</a></td> </tr> <tr><td><a href='/pages/subjects/72206' title='Lot 899'><!--Lot-->899</a></td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/58791' title='Central Avenue'>Central Av.</a></td> <td>"</td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/72207' title='United States Exploring Expedition'>Officers Explor. Exped.</a></td> </tr> </tbody> </table> <span class='line-break'> </span>I should like just to have you<span class='line-break'> </span>or he make out with me a list of the<span class='line-break'> </span>avenues &amp; paths as upon the plan.</p>
<p>Yours truly</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a></p>
<p>289</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133781">
<h3><a name="page-1133781">CB01_0290</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><date when='1865-11-21'>Nov. 21, [186]5</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/103993' title='Knapp, Jesse, Mrs.'>Mrs Jesse Knopp</a><span class='line-break'> </span>249 Hanover St.</p>
<p>D<sup>r</sup> - Madam,</p>
<p>Please inform me<span class='line-break'> </span>if your husband is deceased. If so,<span class='line-break'> </span>when he died, &amp; where he was interred: as<span class='line-break'> </span>I do not find his interment anywhere on<span class='line-break'> </span>our records, although he was proprie<span class='line-break'></span>tor of <a href='/pages/subjects/72210' title='Lot 298'>lot no. 298</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/59222' title='Larch Avenue'>Larch Ave.</a> I see<span class='line-break'> </span>your name instead of his has been<span class='line-break'> </span>in the Directory since 1863.</p>
<p>If he is living, please state<span class='line-break'> </span>where he resides.</p>
<p>Respectfully yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a> Sec.y</p>
<p>P.S. I am making up for press a new<span class='line-break'> </span>catalogue of lots &amp; proprietors.</p>
<p><date when='1865-11-22'>Nov. 22 [186]5</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/72211' title='Southwick, John, Mrs.'>Mrs John Southwick</a>,</p>
<p>Dear Madam,</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/72212' title='Southwick, John'>Mr John South<span class='line-break'></span>wick</a> (whom I suppose to have been your<span class='line-break'> </span>husband) purchased a lot in the Cem<span class='line-break'></span>etery in 1840. I see that the Charles<span class='line-break'></span>town Directory ^<sup>for 1860</sup> puts down Mrs John<span class='line-break'> </span>Southwick of [?] Winthrop St. &amp; a John<span class='line-break'> </span>Southwick (whom I have supposed might be<span class='line-break'> </span>your son) of the U.S.N. as boarding at 2 Sex<span class='line-break'></span>[?] St.</p>
<p>We have no record of the death or<span class='line-break'> </span>interment of the proprietor of this lot.</p>
<p>We are making a new catalogue, &amp;<span class='line-break'> </span>if you can give me the requisite<span class='line-break'> </span>information you will oblige.</p>
<p>Yours Respectfully</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a> Secretary</p>
<p>290</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133782">
<h3><a name="page-1133782">CB01_0291</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><date when='1865-11-22'>Nov. 22 [186]5</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/72213' title='Oliver, Edward B.'>Edw<sup>d</sup> B. Oliver</a><span class='line-break'> </span>26 Oak St.</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>We are making<span class='line-break'> </span>a new catalogue of the Proprietors and<span class='line-break'> </span>Lots in the Cemetery, and wish to keep a<span class='line-break'> </span>knowledge of the place of residence of each.</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/60388' title='Oliver, Henry J.'>Henry J. Oliver</a> who was proprietor of<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/60386' title='Lot 67'>lot 67</a> died in 1849, and his widow<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/60387' title='Oliver, Sarah H.'>Sarah H.</a> was appointed to represent the<span class='line-break'> </span>the lot. From the papers, I infer<span class='line-break'> </span>that you may be a son. If<span class='line-break'> </span>so, please inform me of Mrs<span class='line-break'> </span>Oliver's present residence &amp;<span class='line-break'> </span>oblige.</p>
<p>Yours truly</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
<p><date when='1865-11-22'>Nov<sup>r</sup> 22 [186]5</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/97385' title='Barnard, George M.'>G.M. Barnard</a> Esq</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>We are making<span class='line-break'> </span>up a new catalogue of the Lots &amp;<span class='line-break'> </span>Proprietors. <a href='/pages/subjects/58333' title='Adams, Abel'>Abel Adams</a>, the<span class='line-break'> </span>proprietor of <a href='/pages/subjects/72215' title='Lot 49'>lot no. 49</a> disappears<span class='line-break'> </span>from the <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a> ^<sup>Directory</sup> after 1855 &amp; was<span class='line-break'> </span>formerly of your firm.</p>
<p>If you can give his present<span class='line-break'> </span>residence, you will much<span class='line-break'> </span>oblige.</p>
<p>Yours truly</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Secretary</p>
<p>291</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133783">
<h3><a name="page-1133783">CB01_0292</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><date when='1865-11-22'>Nov. 22 [186]5</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/72216' title='Davis, Ebenezer, Mrs.'>Mrs Ebenezer Davis</a><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54284' title='Charlestown, MA'>Charlestown</a></p>
<p>Dear Madam,</p>
<p>We are<span class='line-break'> </span>making a new catalogue of the Lots &amp;<span class='line-break'> </span>Proprietors in the Cemetery, and wish<span class='line-break'> </span>to give the residences. You<span class='line-break'> </span>were stated to be of <a href='/pages/subjects/54284' title='Charlestown, MA'>Charlestown</a><span class='line-break'> </span>in 1841 when the lot was<span class='line-break'> </span>conveyed to you.</p>
<p>If you still reside<span class='line-break'> </span>there, please inform me.</p>
<p>Respectfully yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Secretary</p>
<p><date when='1865-11-22'>Nov. 22, [186]5</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/72217' title='Forbush, Calvin W.'>Calvin W. Forbush</a> Esq<span class='line-break'> </span>92 Pearl St.</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>We are making<span class='line-break'> </span>up a new catalogue of the Lots<span class='line-break'> </span>and Proprietors in the Cemetery.<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/72218' title='Forbush, Jonathan W.'>Jona. W. Forbush</a> who was the<span class='line-break'> </span>proprietor of <a href='/pages/subjects/72219' title='Lot 282'>lot no. 282</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>appeared by the <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a> Directory to<span class='line-break'> </span>have removed to Bolton in 1848<span class='line-break'> </span>or 1849: and afterwards disappears<span class='line-break'> </span>from the Directory.</p>
<p>Will you be so kind as to<span class='line-break'> </span>inform me whether he still lives<span class='line-break'> </span>at Bolton, &amp; if not, where.</p>
<p>Respectfully yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
<p>292</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133784">
<h3><a name="page-1133784">CB01_0293</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>Nov. [?] [186]5</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/104078' title='Reynolds, W. B.'>[W^m^?] B. Reynolds</a> Esq<sup>r</sup><span class='line-break'> </span>206 State St.</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>I am making<span class='line-break'> </span>up a new catalogue of the lots<span class='line-break'> </span>and proprietors in the Cemetery.<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/72244' title='Carter, George D.'>Geo. D. Carter</a>, who purchased<span class='line-break'> </span>a <a href='/pages/subjects/67099' title='Lot 1833'>lot in 1833</a>, &amp; was represented<span class='line-break'> </span>to be in <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a>, although I believe<span class='line-break'> </span>he does not appear in the Direc<span class='line-break'></span>tory, &amp; has not. But I find<span class='line-break'> </span>that one or more interments<span class='line-break'> </span>in the lot have been ordered<span class='line-break'> </span>by you.</p>
<p>If therefore you will give<span class='line-break'> </span>me his place of residence<span class='line-break'> </span>you will much oblige.</p>
<p>Yours truly</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Secretary</p>
<p><date when='1865-11-22'>Nov. 22 [186]5</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/64299' title='Tucker, William W.'>W<sup>m</sup> W. Tucker</a> Esq.<span class='line-break'> </span>33 School St.</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>Your favor of this<span class='line-break'> </span>date is rec<sup>d</sup>. I send the card<span class='line-break'> </span>as requested, and will lay your<span class='line-break'> </span>request before the Committee on<span class='line-break'> </span>Lots as soon as I can<span class='line-break'> </span>obtain the regular report<span class='line-break'> </span>upon the condition of the several<span class='line-break'> </span>lots embraced within the Law<span class='line-break'></span>rence enclosure, with such<span class='line-break'> </span>minuteness of description as<span class='line-break'> </span>will enable them to form<span class='line-break'> </span>a decision.</p>
<p>Very Resp.y yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a> Sec.y</p>
<p>293</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133785">
<h3><a name="page-1133785">CB01_0294</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><date when='1865-11-22'>Nov<sup>r</sup> 22 [186]5</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/72245' title='Gray, Horace'>Horace Gray</a> Esq<span class='line-break'> </span>Summer St. Cor. Kingston</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>We are making<span class='line-break'> </span>up a new catalogue of the Lots &amp;<span class='line-break'> </span>Proprietors, &amp; will feel greatly<span class='line-break'> </span>obliged if you can give me<span class='line-break'> </span>the <ins>residence of</ins> <a href='/pages/subjects/72246' title='Dow, Samuel, Jr.'><ins>Sam<sup>l</sup> Dow Jr.</ins></a><span class='line-break'> </span>who appears to have formerly been<span class='line-break'> </span>a partner in your firm, but<span class='line-break'> </span>who disappears from the <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Directory after 1846.</p>
<p>Very Resp.y yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
<p><date when='1865-11-22'>Nov. 22 [186]5</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/72247' title='Gray, F. A.'>F.A. Gray</a> Esq<span class='line-break'> </span>114 State St.</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/61544' title='Gray, Samuel C.'>Sam<sup>l</sup> C. Gray</a><span class='line-break'> </span>was appointed in 1860 at your request<span class='line-break'> </span>to represent the lot of his late father<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/61544' title='Gray, Samuel C.'>Sam<sup>l</sup> C. Gray</a>; but I do not find<span class='line-break'> </span>him in the Bost. Directory, although<span class='line-break'> </span>he was represented to be of <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a>.</p>
<p>As we are making up a new<span class='line-break'> </span>catalogue, will you be so kind<span class='line-break'> </span>as to give me his residence.</p>
<p>Very Respy. yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
<p>294</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133786">
<h3><a name="page-1133786">CB01_0295</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><date when='1865-11-22'>Nov<sup>r</sup> 22 [186]5</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/72253' title='Luce, Leonard'>Rev.<sup>d</sup> Leonard Luce</a>, Town Clerk<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/72254' title='Westford, MA'>Westford, Mass.</a></p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>I am referred to you<span class='line-break'> </span>for information respecting <a href='/pages/subjects/72255' title='Adams, John'>John Adams</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>who stands on the records of our Corpor<span class='line-break'></span>ation as the proprietor of <a href='/pages/subjects/72256' title='Lot 427'>lot no. 427</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>on <a href='/pages/subjects/61237' title='Myrtle Path'>Myrtle Path</a> in the Cemetery. He disap<span class='line-break'></span>peared from the <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a> Directory in<span class='line-break'> </span>1844 and I am informed by Mr<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/72257' title='Adams, Paul'>Paul Adams</a> that he removed to<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/72254' title='Westford, MA'>Westford</a> &amp; has since died. As<span class='line-break'> </span>his name does not appear on our<span class='line-break'> </span>interment records, I can only infer<span class='line-break'> </span>that his remains were not brought<span class='line-break'> </span>to Mt Auburn.</p>
<p>Will you please give me<span class='line-break'> </span>the facts in the case --</p>
<p>1<sup>st</sup> Was <a href='/pages/subjects/72254' title='Westford, MA'>Westford</a> his residence,<span class='line-break'> </span>and is it still the residence<span class='line-break'> </span>of his family?</p>
<p>If he is dead, when did<span class='line-break'> </span>he die? And where was he<span class='line-break'> </span>buried?</p>
<p>Who are his family remaining?<span class='line-break'> </span>I should not feel at liberty<span class='line-break'> </span>to trouble you, but <a href='/pages/subjects/59579' title='Adams, Mr.'>Mr<span class='line-break'> </span>Adams</a> said you married<span class='line-break'> </span>into the same family, and<span class='line-break'> </span>would cheerfully give<span class='line-break'> </span>me the information.</p>
<p>An early reply will<span class='line-break'> </span>much oblige.</p>
<p>Yours Respectfully</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
<p>295</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133787">
<h3><a name="page-1133787">CB01_0296</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><date when='1865-11-22'>Nov. 22 [186]5</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/72265' title='Channing, Walter, Dr.'>Dr Walter Channing</a><span class='line-break'> </span>39 Mt Vernon St</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>We are making <span class='line-break'> </span>up a new catalogue of lots<span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; proprietors in Mt Auburn.<span class='line-break'> </span>Will you be so kind as<span class='line-break'> </span>to inform me what is the<span class='line-break'> </span>present residence of<span class='line-break'> </span><table class='tabular'><thead><span class='line-break'> </span><tr><th><a href='/pages/subjects/58496' title='Channing, George G.'>Geo. G. Channing</a>,</th> <th>prop<sup>r</sup> of</th> <th><a href='/pages/subjects/72266' title='Lot 677'> lot 677</a><span class='line-break'> </span></th></tr></thead> <tbody> <tr><td><a href='/pages/subjects/72267' title='Channing, Ruth'>Mrs W<sup>m</sup> Ellery Channing</a></td> <td>" "</td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/72268' title='Lot 678'> 678</a></td> </tr> <tr><td>&amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/72272' title='Channing, Henrietta A. S.'>Mrs Edw<sup>d</sup> T. Channing</a></td> <td>" "</td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/72269' title='Lot 1145'> 1145.</a></td> </tr> </tbody> </table> <span class='line-break'> </span>And you will greatly oblige.</p>
<p>Yours Very Resp.y</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Secretary</p>
<p><date when='1865-11-22'>Nov. 22 [186]5</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/104068' title='Marshall, Caleb S.'>Caleb S. Marshall Esq</a><span class='line-break'> </span>3 Nor. Market St</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>We are making<span class='line-break'> </span>up for press a new catalogue of<span class='line-break'> </span>lots &amp; proprietors &amp; wish to obtain<span class='line-break'> </span>their residences correctly.</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/67827' title='Simonds, James S.'>James S. Simonds</a>, the proprietor<span class='line-break'> </span>of <a href='/pages/subjects/67826' title='Lot 740'>lot no. 740</a> disappears from the <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a> Directory in 1860 -- was <span class='line-break'> </span>said to reside at <a href='/pages/subjects/53204' title='Watertown, MA'>Watertown</a>.</p>
<p>By giving me his present<span class='line-break'> </span>residence you will much<span class='line-break'> </span>oblige.</p>
<p>Yours Respectfully</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
<p>296</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133788">
<h3><a name="page-1133788">CB01_0297</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>297</p>
<p><date when='1865-11-23'>Nov<sup>r</sup> 23, [186]5</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'>Capt D.L. Winsor</a></p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>I have rec<sup>d</sup> a note from<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/64299' title='Tucker, William W.'>W<sup>m</sup> W. Tucker</a> in which he wishes to know<span class='line-break'> </span>for what sum the Corporation will assume<span class='line-break'> </span>the perpetual care of the Lawrence enclosure<span class='line-break'> </span>which embraces:</p>
<p><table class='tabular'><thead><span class='line-break'> </span><tr><th><a href='/pages/subjects/64298' title='Lot 489'>Lot 489</a> --</th> <th>625 ft</th> <th>Bor<sup>t</sup> up</th> <th>2500<span class='line-break'> </span></th></tr></thead> <tbody> <tr><td><a href='/pages/subjects/64300' title='Lot 490'>"  490</a> --</td> <td>625</td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/72273' title='Lot 903'>Lot 903</a></td> <td>600 f.</td> </tr> <tr><td><a href='/pages/subjects/64301' title='Lot 491'>"  491</a> --</td> <td>625</td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/62683' title='Lot 1309'>" 1309</a></td> <td><u>300</u></td> </tr> <tr><td><a href='/pages/subjects/72274' title='Lot 492'>" 492</a> --</td> <td><u>625</u></td> <td/> <td>3700 f</td> </tr> <tr><td/> <td>2500 sf</td> <td/> </tr> </tbody> </table> Will you please go over the matter carefully &amp; make up<span class='line-break'> </span>a report for Saturday, if you can. There is but one<span class='line-break'> </span><ins>considerable</ins> monument, i.e. of excesive cost. --</p>
<p>The Com. on Lots are getting cautious. They have <span class='line-break'> </span>signed the contract to take <a href='/pages/subjects/72168' title='lot 1014'>lot 1014</a> of <a href='/pages/subjects/72167' title='Gurney, Henry'>Henry Gurney</a> for $400,<span class='line-break'> </span>but <a href='/pages/subjects/56312' title='Norcross, Otis'>Mr Norcross</a> adds in final,-"Does <a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'>Capt. W. </a>understand that<span class='line-break'> </span>we take it at <ins>400 as it is Brimstone posts &amp; all</ins> - Please have <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'>Capt W's</a> answer in the affirmative before settlement."</p>
<p>Then on <a href='/pages/subjects/72276' title='Coggswell, Sophia'>Sophia Coggswell</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/72277' title='Lot 1142'>Lot 1142</a> - They have signed<span class='line-break'> </span>the contract for 300 -- but  <a href='/pages/subjects/56312' title='Norcross, Otis'>O.N.<!--Norcross--></a> add a note -- "The price 300,<span class='line-break'> </span>seems very low, please call attention of <a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'>Capt. W.</a> to this before you deliver<span class='line-break'> </span>the papers or notify the parties."</p>
<p>I send note from <a href='/pages/subjects/54832' title='Austin, Edward'>Mr Austin</a> on <a href='/pages/subjects/70544' title='Peabody, Catherine'>Cath. Peabody's</a> lot,<span class='line-break'> </span>also note from <a href='/pages/subjects/72278' title='Coburn, D. J.'>D.J. Coburn</a>.</p>
<p>Yours truly</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133789">
<h3><a name="page-1133789">CB01_0298</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><date when='1865-11-24'>Nov. 24 [186]5</date></p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>In reply to<span class='line-break'> </span>your favor of <date when='1865-11-20'>Nov. 20<sup>th</sup></date><span class='line-break'> </span>I have to reply that<span class='line-break'> </span>all communications for work<span class='line-break'> </span>to be done in the Cemetery<span class='line-break'> </span>should be addressed to<span class='line-break'> </span>"<a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'>Capt. D. L. Winsor</a>, Sup<sup>t</sup>,<span class='line-break'> </span>Mount Auburn<span class='line-break'> </span>Mass."</p>
<p>The men under him who has <span class='line-break'> </span>the special charge of funerals, <span class='line-break'> </span><del>removals</del> internments &amp; removals <span class='line-break'> </span>is <a href='/pages/subjects/65961' title='Safford, William H.'>W<sup>m</sup> K. Safford</a>, for whom<span class='line-break'> </span>when you come down you will<span class='line-break'> </span>naturally inquire, after being<span class='line-break'> </span>directed about your business<span class='line-break'> </span>by letter.</p>
<p>Truly yours,</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A. J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/72169' title='Cunningham, D. W.'>D.W. Cunningham</a> Esq</p>
<p><date when='1865-11-24'>Nov. 24 [186]5</date></p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>I have past rec<sup>d</sup> a letter<span class='line-break'> </span>from <a href='/pages/subjects/72280' title='Dowley, John'>John Dowley</a>, dated "<a href='/pages/subjects/63804' title='New Orleans, LA'>New Orleans</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span><date when='1865-11-10'>10<sup>th</sup> Nov. 1865</date>" in reply to a note ad<span class='line-break'></span>dressed to him at <a href='/pages/subjects/64140' title='New York, NY'>New York</a>, answering<span class='line-break'> </span>my inquiry.  The letter is silent<span class='line-break'> </span>as to whether <a href='/pages/subjects/63804' title='New Orleans, LA'>New Orleans</a> is now<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/72280' title='Dowley, John'>Mr Dowley's</a> place of residence.</p>
<p>As we are making up a new<span class='line-break'> </span>catalogue of the Prop<sup>rs</sup> of lot in our<span class='line-break'> </span>Cemetery, &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/72280' title='Dowley, John'>Mr Dowley</a>, is prop<sup>r</sup><span class='line-break'> </span>of <a href='/pages/subjects/64141' title='Lot 1789'>lot 1789</a>, will the person<span class='line-break'> </span>who may open this in <a href='/pages/subjects/64140' title='New York, NY'>New York</a><span class='line-break'> </span>be so kind as to inform me,<span class='line-break'> </span>whether Mr D's residence shall<span class='line-break'> </span>be still entered "<a href='/pages/subjects/64140' title='New York, NY'>New York</a>" or<span class='line-break'> </span>whether it is <a href='/pages/subjects/63804' title='New Orleans, LA'>New Orleans</a>.</p>
<p>Respectfully<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A. J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/72280' title='Dowley, John'>John Dowley</a>, Esq</p>
<p>298</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133790">
<h3><a name="page-1133790">CB01_0299</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><date when='1865-11-24'>Nov. 24 [186]5</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/72283' title='Heard, John T.'>John T. Heard</a> Esq</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>I will pre<span class='line-break'></span>sent your paper-extract from<span class='line-break'> </span>will of <a href='/pages/subjects/72284' title='Gurney, Mrs.'>Mrs Gurney</a> -- to the Trus<span class='line-break'></span>tees, if you desire, but it is<span class='line-break'> </span>nothing on which they can act.</p>
<p>As I suggested to you, the<span class='line-break'> </span>only feasible plan I can see<span class='line-break'> </span>(if it can be accomplished, of which<span class='line-break'> </span>I am by no means certain) is<span class='line-break'> </span>to have the parties release enough<span class='line-break'> </span>from the income to enable you<span class='line-break'> </span>to make a perpetual contract<span class='line-break'> </span>with our Corporation for the care of the lot<span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; get the <a href='/pages/subjects/72285' title='Massachusetts Supreme Judicial Court'>S.J. Court</a> to decree accordingly.</p>
<p>Then the subject comes up in<span class='line-break'> </span>shape for action by our board. Now<span class='line-break'> </span>they have no power.</p>
<p>Very Resp.y yrs.</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
<p><date when='1865-11-24'>Nov<sup>r</sup> 24, [186]5</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/72286' title='Bacon, H. D.'>H.D. Bacon</a> Esq<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/70999' title='San Francisco, CA'>San Francisco, Cal.</a></p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>Your favor of <date when='1865-10-20'>Oct 20<sup>th</sup></date><span class='line-break'> </span>from <a href='/pages/subjects/72287' title='St. Louis, MO'>St. Louis</a> respecting the dispo<span class='line-break'></span>sition which <a href='/pages/subjects/72288' title='Jones, Sophia L. B.'>Mrs Sophia L.B. Jones</a> <span class='line-break'> </span>is alleged to have made in her will<span class='line-break'> </span>of <a href='/pages/subjects/72289' title='Lot 1131'>lot no. 1131</a> in Mt Auburn<span class='line-break'> </span>was duly rec<sup>d</sup>.</p>
<p>In reply, I have to say that Mrs<span class='line-break'> </span>Jones was on the <date when='1860-03-05'>5<sup>th</sup> of March 1860</date>,<span class='line-break'> </span>upon her own request designated to<span class='line-break'> </span>"represent" said lot under the Charter,<span class='line-break'> </span>an extract from which I send you.<span class='line-break'> </span>If <a href='/pages/subjects/72290' title='Jones, Thomas'>Mr Thos. Jones</a> devised this lot<span class='line-break'> </span>to his wife by will, it was hers<span class='line-break'> </span>to convey or devise again: but<span class='line-break'> </span>as she represents herself to be <ins>"admin<span class='line-break'></span>istratrix"</ins> in the petition for the above<span class='line-break'></span>mentioned designation, I can only<span class='line-break'> </span>infer that Mrs Jones left no will.</p>
<p>299</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133791">
<h3><a name="page-1133791">CB01_0300</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>The consequence of which is --<span class='line-break'> </span>as lots in our Cemetery are<span class='line-break'> </span>declared in the Charter to be real<span class='line-break'> </span>estate, the lot descended to the<span class='line-break'> </span>next of kin of <a href='/pages/subjects/72290' title='Jones, Thomas'>Thomas Jones</a>. If he<span class='line-break'> </span>left more than one such next of<span class='line-break'> </span>kin, it would fall to them in common,<span class='line-break'> </span>and it would be proper for one of them<span class='line-break'> </span>to be designated to represent it. If the<span class='line-break'> </span>nephew alluded to was the only heir,<span class='line-break'> </span>it would be inherited by him. <a href='/pages/subjects/72288' title='Jones, Sophia L. B.'>Mrs Jones'</a><span class='line-break'> </span>will cannot affect the title -- it would<span class='line-break'> </span>go as I have said. But if there are<span class='line-break'> </span>others, and they are desirous of carrying<span class='line-break'> </span>out her request, they can do so by releasing<span class='line-break'> </span>to <a href='/pages/subjects/72294' title='Jones, George H.'>Geo. H. Jones</a>. I am sorry the<span class='line-break'> </span>subject was not better understood<span class='line-break'> </span>by Mrs J., but it cannot be helped<span class='line-break'> </span>now. If you desire, I will do what<span class='line-break'> </span>I can to bring about her wishes by<span class='line-break'> </span>preparing any such conveyance, if you<span class='line-break'> </span>can reach the parties.</p>
<p>Truly yours,</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Secretary</p>
<p><date when='1865-11-25'>Nov.<sup>r</sup> 25, [186]5</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/72295' title='Cogswell, William Lambert'>W<sup>m</sup> L. Coggswell</a> Esq<span class='line-break'> </span>27 E. 26<sup>th</sup> St., <a href='/pages/subjects/64140' title='New York, NY'>New York</a>,</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>I have obtained a<span class='line-break'> </span>report upon the condition of your lot<span class='line-break'> </span>standing in the name of <a href='/pages/subjects/72296' title='Cogswell, Sophia M.'>Sophia M.<span class='line-break'> </span>Coggswell</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/72277' title='Lot 1142'>no. 1142</a>, and have laid<span class='line-break'> </span>the same before the Committee on<span class='line-break'> </span>Lots: and they have instructed<span class='line-break'> </span>me to notify you that the<span class='line-break'> </span>Corporation will contract for<span class='line-break'> </span>the <ins>perpetual</ins> repair of your<span class='line-break'> </span>lot on the payment of three<span class='line-break'> </span>hundred dollars. I expect<span class='line-break'> </span>to pass through your City next<span class='line-break'> </span>Tuesday merely on absence for the<span class='line-break'> </span>week, but I will attend to any<span class='line-break'> </span>request you have to make upon<span class='line-break'> </span>my return. I will prepare the<span class='line-break'> </span>proper papers whenever you are ready.</p>
<p>Very Resp.y yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
<p>300</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133792">
<h3><a name="page-1133792">CB01_0301</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><date when='1865-12-12'>Dec.<sup>r</sup> 12, [186]5</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/72297' title='Richardson, William H.'>W<sup>m</sup> H. Richardson</a> Esq.</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>Our Treasurer holds<span class='line-break'> </span>two bill against you and <a href='/pages/subjects/59579' title='Adams, Mr.'>Mr Adams</a><span class='line-break'> </span>upon your lots in the Cemetery amounting<span class='line-break'> </span>to $193.70 each = 387.50. All<span class='line-break'> </span>such bills are payable at<span class='line-break'> </span>maturity say within a month<span class='line-break'> </span>after the work is done. --</p>
<p>These bills have stood<span class='line-break'> </span>from a year to a year &amp; a half<span class='line-break'> </span>and should now be settled.</p>
<p>Your immediate attention<span class='line-break'> </span>is requested to the same.</p>
<p>Respectfully yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
<p><date when='1865-12-12'>Dec<sup>r</sup> 12, [186]5</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/72298' title='Hovey, A. H.'>A.H. Hovey</a> Esq</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>Will you please<span class='line-break'> </span>call at our Treasurer's --<span class='line-break'> </span>Mr <a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'>Geo W<sup>m</sup> Bond</a>'s 167 Con<span class='line-break'></span>gress St -- and pay for the ex<span class='line-break'></span>change of land of lots in the Cem<span class='line-break'></span>etery for yourself &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/72299' title='Thayer, Mr.'>Mr Thayer</a> --<span class='line-break'> </span>in each case $16.67 = $33.33 1/3<span class='line-break'> </span>then call upon me for the deeds<span class='line-break'> </span>which have been corrected to<span class='line-break'> </span>correspond to the new location.</p>
<p>Truly yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
<p>301</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133793">
<h3><a name="page-1133793">CB01_0302</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><date when='1865-12-15'>Decem. 15 [186]5</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/72295' title='Cogswell, William Lambert'>W.<sup>m</sup> L. Cogswell</a> Esq</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>Excuse the<span class='line-break'> </span>delay in replying to yours of<span class='line-break'> </span><date when='1865-12-03'>Dec<sup>r</sup> 3<sup>d</sup></date>. I have been absent<span class='line-break'> </span>for some days, passing through<span class='line-break'> </span>your City &amp; beyond. --</p>
<p>The contract for perpetual repair<span class='line-break'> </span>embraces the lot and its appurtenan<span class='line-break'></span>ces -- "the monument, fence, trees,<span class='line-break'> </span>shrubbery &amp; said thereon." The Com<span class='line-break'></span>mittee on Lots are charged with the<span class='line-break'> </span>duty of seeing that these funded<span class='line-break'> </span>lots shall be kept in good order.<span class='line-break'> </span>Consequently they, in accordance with<span class='line-break'> </span>the By laws visit and inspect<span class='line-break'> </span>the lots twice a year. If anything<span class='line-break'> </span>does not appear to be in good<span class='line-break'> </span>condition they at once direct<span class='line-break'> </span>the Superintendent to put the<span class='line-break'> </span>lot in good repair. [This review?]<span class='line-break'> </span>applies to the <ins>guaranteed</ins> lots and<span class='line-break'> </span>not to all who may deposited money,<span class='line-break'> </span>because, in some cases, the income<span class='line-break'> </span>of the funds may be insufficient<span class='line-break'> </span>for the purpose. But if the<span class='line-break'> </span>Corporation once gives the guaranty,<span class='line-break'> </span>it matters not whether the funds<span class='line-break'> </span>are sufficient or not, they are<span class='line-break'> </span>bound to take good care of it.<span class='line-break'> </span>It is customary to paint fences<span class='line-break'> </span>about every three years: this is<span class='line-break'> </span>usually found sufficient. <ins>Good</ins> paint<span class='line-break'> </span>will look very well for that time.</p>
<p>As to any future erections upon<span class='line-break'> </span>the lot -- that would have to be con<span class='line-break'></span>sidered. The Trustees might or might<span class='line-break'> </span>not require any additional payment,<span class='line-break'> </span>according to this view of the increased<span class='line-break'> </span>risk. A granite curb would not<span class='line-break'> </span>probably require much addition.</p>
<p>Trusting this may be satisfactory, I<span class='line-break'> </span>am very Respy Your Obt Servt</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a></p>
<p>302</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133794">
<h3><a name="page-1133794">CB01_0303</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><date when='1865-12-21'>Dec<sup>r</sup>  21 [186]5</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/65961' title='Safford, William H.'>W.<sup>m</sup>  H. Safford</a> Esq</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>Please bring<span class='line-break'> </span>me in tomorrow or Saturday<span class='line-break'> </span>the November Interments.</p>
<p>I wish also you would <span class='line-break'> </span>give me as promptly as pos<span class='line-break'></span>sible after Jany 1<sup>st</sup>  as possible<span class='line-break'> </span>the Dec.<sup>r</sup> interments, &amp; I will<span class='line-break'> </span>endeavor to have the record<span class='line-break'> </span>made up with index &amp;<span class='line-break'> </span>send you out the duplicate<span class='line-break'> </span>copy of record</p>
<p>Resp.y yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
<p>303</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133795">
<h3><a name="page-1133795">CB01_0304</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><date when='1865-12-21'>Dec<sup>r</sup> 21 [186]5</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'>Capt Winsor</a></p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>I have examined the<span class='line-break'> </span>report of lots sold in the hand of <a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'>Mr<span class='line-break'> </span>Bond</a>, and find you have never reported<span class='line-break'> </span>the lot on <a href='/pages/subjects/61272' title='Saffron Path'>Saffron P.</a> to <a href='/pages/subjects/72309' title='William, Joseph P.'>Jos. P. Williams</a>. The <ins>"dupli-</ins><span class='line-break'> </span>cate" report which you find among your papers<span class='line-break'> </span>does <ins>not</ins> correspond with <a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'>Mr Bond</a>'s --</p>
<p>It appears that you first reported <a href='/pages/subjects/71441' title='Lot 3554'>lot<span class='line-break'> </span>3554</a> on <a href='/pages/subjects/61272' title='Saffron Path'>Saffron P.</a> (not the same no. of feet<span class='line-break'> </span>however) to <a href='/pages/subjects/72310' title='Lowry, William'>W<sup>m</sup> Lowry</a>, &amp; in the next report<span class='line-break'> </span>changed Lowry to Primrose &amp; gave him a<span class='line-break'> </span>new <a href='/pages/subjects/72311' title='Lot 3559'>no. ^<sup>(3559)</sup></a> The old number is the one<span class='line-break'> </span>which you appear to have ^<sup>given</sup> J.P.W. <a href='/pages/subjects/71441' title='Lot 3554'>-- 3554 --</a></p>
<p>Please add it to Mr B's reports --</p>
<p>Will you bring in a report upon<span class='line-break'> </span>the lot of <a href='/pages/subjects/72312' title='Tebbetts, John C.'>John C. Tebbetts</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/72313' title='Lot 731'>731</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/61234' title='Moss Path'>Moss P.</a></p>
<p>Please give <a href='/pages/subjects/52579' title='Safford, Truman H.'>Mr Safford</a> the <span class='line-break'> </span>enclosed.</p>
<p>Respectfully yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a></p>
<p><date when='1865-12-26'>Dec<sup>r</sup> 26 [186]5</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/66867' title='Murdock, William C.'>W<sup>m</sup> C Murdock</a> Esq</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>I enclose you the<span class='line-break'> </span>contract for <a href='/pages/subjects/66866' title='Lot 1502'>lot 1502</a>. When you <span class='line-break'> </span>have signed it -- paid the money<span class='line-break'> </span>top <a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'>Geo. W<sup>m</sup> Bond</a> Treas<sup>r</sup> -- 167<span class='line-break'> </span>Congress, and obtained his signa<span class='line-break'></span>ture to the paper, return it to<span class='line-break'> </span>me, and I will have it com<span class='line-break'></span>pleted and recorded for you.<span class='line-break'> </span>The next meeting of the Trustees<span class='line-break'> </span>occurs next Monday, and if the<span class='line-break'> </span>paper shall have been returned me <span class='line-break'> </span>before then, I will get the assent<span class='line-break'> </span>of the Board. --</p>
<p>I had hoped you might<span class='line-break'> </span>bring the other matters into the<span class='line-break'> </span>this year's operations.</p>
<p>Truly yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a></p>
<p>Sec.y</p>
<p>304<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133796">
<h3><a name="page-1133796">CB01_0305</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><date when='1865-12-26'>Dec<sup>r</sup> 26 [186]5</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'>Capt. Winsor</a></p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>I wish a<span class='line-break'> </span>report on <a href='/pages/subjects/72314' title='Lot 3031'>Lot 3031</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/72315' title='Fountain Avenue'>Fountain Ave.</a><span class='line-break'> </span>(<a href='/pages/subjects/72316' title='Wyeth, Elizabeth J.'>Mrs N. J. Wyeth</a>'s) for which $500<span class='line-break'> </span>has been paid.</p>
<p>Please send it together with the<span class='line-break'> </span>report which I requested of<span class='line-break'> </span>you last week on <a href='/pages/subjects/72317' title='Tibbetts, John C.'>John C. Tibbetts</a><span class='line-break'> </span>lot on <a href='/pages/subjects/61234' title='Moss Path'>Moss Path</a>, tomorrow or Thursday.</p>
<p>Will you also furnish <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>Mr<span class='line-break'> </span>Reed</a> his bills [(surveys &amp;c)?] to settle.<span class='line-break'> </span>He also wishes to settle the matter of<span class='line-break'> </span>the steps at next Monday's meeting.</p>
<p>Resp.y yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
<p><date when='1865-12-28'>Dec 28 [186]5</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/72318' title='Clark, Pickering'>Pickering Clark</a> Esq<span class='line-break'> </span>28 Beaver St. <a href='/pages/subjects/64140' title='New York, NY'>New York</a></p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>I have just rec<sup>d</sup><span class='line-break'> </span>for our interment records three orders for<span class='line-break'> </span>int. of <a href='/pages/subjects/72319' title='Clark, Maria F.'>Maria F. Clark</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/72320' title='Clark, Caroline P.'>Caroline P. Clark</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/72321' title='Clark, Caroline Maria'>Caroline Maria Clark</a> -- three infants.</p>
<p>Respecting the first you did not give the<span class='line-break'> </span>place of residence but said "died at <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a>".<span class='line-break'> </span>If you know please give it.</p>
<p>I send blank for the order of int.<span class='line-break'> </span>for <a href='/pages/subjects/72322' title='Clark, John'>John Clark</a>. The town permits from<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/64824' title='Waltham, MA'>Waltham</a> for "removal to <a href='/pages/subjects/53203' title='Cambridge, MA'>Cambridge</a>," dated<span class='line-break'> </span><date when='1865-11-10'>Nov. 10. 1865</date>, describes "John Clark, aged<span class='line-break'> </span>45, and also three children of the said<span class='line-break'> </span>Clark."</p>
<p>Please fill up the blank and<span class='line-break'> </span>sign &amp; return to me for record.</p>
<p>Respectfully yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
<p>305</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133797">
<h3><a name="page-1133797">CB01_0306</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>306</p>
<p><date when='1865-12-27'>Dec<sup>r</sup> 27 [186]5</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'>Capt D.L. Winsor</a></p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>I omitted yesterday to state<span class='line-break'> </span>that at <a href='/pages/subjects/104069' title='Merrill, James C.'>Mr J.C. Merrill's</a> request for a number with four<span class='line-break'> </span>figures to be given him, for the lot of <a href='/pages/subjects/73633' title='Ward, Henry V.'>Mr <!--Henry-->Ward</a> his<span class='line-break'> </span>brother in law, I gave him <a href='/pages/subjects/73631' title='Lot 3376'><ins>3376</ins></a>. This number was on<span class='line-break'> </span>a little lot which was sold to <a href='/pages/subjects/73632' title='Morse, Hannah A.'>Hannah A. Morse</a>, in rear of<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/59204' title='Lot 888'><!--Lot-->888</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/60335' title='Poplar Avenue'>Poplar Av.</a>, and transferred back to the Corp<sup>n</sup> before she died.<span class='line-break'> </span>So, if you have put a stake there to indicate ^<sup>a lot for sale by that no.</sup> please have it<span class='line-break'> </span>changed to the east half of <a href='/pages/subjects/104069' title='Merrill, James C.'>J.C. Merrill's</a> on <a href='/pages/subjects/57829' title='Snowdrop Path'>Snowdrop Path</a>.</p>
<p>That lot will be then - S.E. half <a href='/pages/subjects/73633' title='Ward, Henry V.'>Hen. V. Ward</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/73631' title='Lot 3376'><!--Lot-->3376</a> - N.W. <a href='/pages/subjects/104069' title='Merrill, James C.'>J.C.M.<!--Merrill--></a> <a href='/pages/subjects/67279' title='Lot 3487'>3487</a>.</p>
