<p><a href='/pages/subjects/73634' title='Livermore, George Whitfield'>Geo. <ins>W.</ins> Livermore</a> Esq. of <a href='/pages/subjects/53203' title='Cambridge, MA'>Camb.</a> called in again<span class='line-break'> </span>today, &amp; as he is anxious to settle his bill with the Corp<sup>n</sup> wishes<span class='line-break'> </span>you would correct the report of <a href='/pages/subjects/67181' title='Lot 3509'>lots 3509</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/67182' title='Lot 3510'>3510</a>, -- M.H. Livermore<span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/73635' title='Folsom, Paul Foster'>P.F. Folsom</a>, on <a href='/pages/subjects/61152' title='Clematis Path'>Clematis Path</a>, so that they will stand 300<span class='line-break'> </span>feet each (if that is what they contain, as appears from the book<span class='line-break'> </span>of Shedd's plan) instead of 326 ft. as before: and instruct the<span class='line-break'> </span>Treas<sup>r</sup> to give them a credit of $65 on the bill. I promised him<span class='line-break'> </span>you would bring it in on Saturday.</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/66867' title='Murdock, William C.'>Mr W<sup>m</sup> C. Murdock</a> wishes you to bring in the bill on the<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/73639' title='Vose, Josiah'>Vose lot</a> next Saturday, and would like to meet you here<span class='line-break'> </span>at 12 o'clock. If you can fix the report to include the cap on the<span class='line-break'> </span>monument, he will pay in the fund so as to be included in this year's rep<sup>t</sup>.<span class='line-break'> </span>He p<sup>d</sup> $450 on the <a href='/pages/subjects/66868' title='Ward, James O.'>Ward lot</a> today.</p>
<p>Truly yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133798">
<h3><a name="page-1133798">CB01_0307</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><date when='1866-01-02'>Jany 2. [186]6</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'>Capt D.L. Winsor</a></p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>I wrote you that<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/73634' title='Livermore, George Whitfield'>Mr<!--G. W.--> Livermore</a> is very anxious to <span class='line-break'> </span>settle his bill with the Treas<sup>r</sup> for lots<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/67181' title='Lot 3509'>3509</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/67182' title='Lot 3510'>3510</a>; and can do so the moment<span class='line-break'> </span>you write the Treas<sup>r</sup> that $65 is to be<span class='line-break'> </span>credited for 52 feet land, as that is the<span class='line-break'> </span>amount which appears by the plan to be<span class='line-break'> </span>overpaid for, @ 1.25 per foot.</p>
<p>I also wrote to <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>Mr Reed</a>, that you<span class='line-break'> </span>should report to him your opinion on<span class='line-break'> </span>the steps to Anemone Path.</p>
<p>We have an adjourned meeting of<span class='line-break'> </span>the Trustees next Monday, no business<span class='line-break'> </span>having been done yesterday. The Trustees<span class='line-break'> </span>can then decide on it.</p>
<p>Please have <a href='/pages/subjects/52579' title='Safford, Truman H.'>Mr Safford</a> ascertain<span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; report to me what is the correct<span class='line-break'> </span>position of the members of lot <a href='/pages/subjects/67168' title='Lot 3514'>3514</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/67169' title='Lot 3515'>3515</a><span class='line-break'> </span>if he can do so on the ground.</p>
<p>[diagram: lot diagram of <a href='/pages/subjects/67169' title='lot 3515'>lot 3515</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/67168' title='lot 3514'>lot 3514</a> with dimensions]<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/61288' title='Trefoil Path'>Trefoil<!--Path--></a><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/61120' title='Arethusa Path'>Arethusa <!--Path--></a></p>
<p>The above is the way I understand their rel<span class='line-break'></span>ative position. <a href='/pages/subjects/67208' title='Elliott, Charles D.'>Chas. D. Elliott</a> is prop<sup>r</sup> of <a href='/pages/subjects/67168' title='Lot 3514'>3514</a><span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/67206' title='Ames, Philander'>Philander Ames</a> of <a href='/pages/subjects/67169' title='Lot 3515'>3515</a> --  <a href='/pages/subjects/67208' title='Elliott, Charles D.'>Mr Elliott</a> told<span class='line-break'> </span>me his was the narrow end. But <a href='/pages/subjects/81482' title='Shedd, J. H., Mr.'>Shedd's<span class='line-break'> </span>survey</a> has reversed this, making <a href='/pages/subjects/67169' title='Lot 3515'>3515</a><span class='line-break'> </span>at the narrow end. This I suppose<span class='line-break'> </span>the surveyor got from the stakes. If <a href='/pages/subjects/67208' title='Elliott, Charles D.'>Mr<span class='line-break'> </span>Elliott</a> was right, the stakes and plan<span class='line-break'> </span>are wrong. If there are interments,<span class='line-break'> </span>they will show. --</p>
<p>There are two lots on <a href='/pages/subjects/61217' title='Lantana Path'>Lantana<span class='line-break'> </span>Path</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/72192' title='Lot 2532'>-- 2532</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/71436' title='Lot 2841'>&amp; 2841</a>, each of which<span class='line-break'> </span>you reported as 15/20 lots = 300 feet --<span class='line-break'> </span>By the surveyor's plan, (although the contents<span class='line-break'> </span>are probably the same -- 300 ft) each lot is<span class='line-break'> </span>[diagram: lot diagram with deminsions] so far from a rectangular lot</p>
<p>307</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133799">
<h3><a name="page-1133799">CB01_0308</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>as shown in the sketch -- 14 ft on the<span class='line-break'> </span>west &amp; 16 ft. on the east. Is the plan<span class='line-break'> </span>right?: if so, I will change the deeds.</p>
<p>One thing more.</p>
<p>Will you, as <a href='/pages/subjects/64030' title='McDonald, Alexander'>McDonald</a> is completing the<span class='line-break'> </span>work for the Vose's lot, get from him what<span class='line-break'> </span>is to be the cost of the vase &amp; headstone,<span class='line-break'> </span>and report to me, with your opinion<span class='line-break'> </span>as to whether these things can fairly<span class='line-break'> </span>be included within the $1100 contract.<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/70555' title='Murdock, Mr.'>Mr Murdock</a> thinks the vase is to cost<span class='line-break'> </span>$400 or 450. <a href='/pages/subjects/56312' title='Norcross, Otis'>Mr Norcross</a> will then<span class='line-break'> </span>go to the other members of the Com<sup>ee</sup> &amp; two<span class='line-break'> </span>or three am<sup>ts</sup> will be decided now lying<span class='line-break'> </span>still -- this, the Lawrence &amp; some other.</p>
<p>I am most in haste for this last --<span class='line-break'> </span>but think it will be well for you to<span class='line-break'> </span>come in tomorrow or the next day &amp;<span class='line-break'> </span>report on the several matters &amp; advise with<span class='line-break'> </span>the Com. in person.</p>
<p>Yours Resp.y</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a></p>
<p><date when='1866-01-02'>Jany 2. [186]6</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/65961' title='Safford, William H.'>W<sup>m</sup> H. Safford</a> Esq</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>Please send <span class='line-break'> </span>me forward the interments in<span class='line-break'> </span>Dec<sup>r</sup>. Just as they are, and<span class='line-break'> </span>if there are any not completed,<span class='line-break'> </span>you can make them up as<span class='line-break'> </span>fast as you can get them.<span class='line-break'> </span>But if I have all the names,<span class='line-break'> </span>my assistant can be at work <span class='line-break'> </span>on the index.</p>
<p>Only put slips on to any<span class='line-break'> </span>places that are deficient, if<span class='line-break'> </span>such there are. Your sending<span class='line-break'> </span>them at once will quite facil<span class='line-break'></span>itate our work on them.</p>
<p>Truly yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a></p>
<p>308</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133800">
<h3><a name="page-1133800">CB01_0309</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><date when='1866-01-03'>Jany 3, [186]6</date></p>
<p>Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/54832' title='Austin, Edward'>Austin</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/56312' title='Norcross, Otis'>Norcross</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/54833' title='Bowditch, J. Ingersoll'><!--J. I.-->Bowditch</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Com. on Lots --</p>
<p>Gentlemen,</p>
<p>I enclose a note <span class='line-break'> </span>from <a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'>Capt. Winsor</a>, a paragraph<span class='line-break'> </span>of which relates to the vase to be<span class='line-break'> </span>added to mon.<sup>t</sup> on the <a href='/pages/subjects/73639' title='Vose, Josiah'>Vose lot</a>. The headstone<span class='line-break'> </span>beside this is not likely to cost more<span class='line-break'> </span>than $100 -- perhaps not more than $75. --</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/70555' title='Murdock, Mr.'>Mr Murdock</a> appears to feel strongly<span class='line-break'> </span>that $1100 will be ample to secure<span class='line-break'> </span>the Corporation against all contingencies,<span class='line-break'> </span>including the proposed additions. The<span class='line-break'> </span>lot has been put in first rate order<span class='line-break'> </span>and he feels that there will be little<span class='line-break'> </span>to do besides cutting the grass, &amp; resodding.</p>
<p>I do not believe he will submit to<span class='line-break'> </span>an addition. I should think it probable<span class='line-break'> </span>that there will an accumulation of $200 or<span class='line-break'> </span>500 within ten years.</p>
<p>Very Respy.</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
<p>Jany 10, [186]6</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/73675' title='Pitman, Benjamin'>Benj. Pitman</a> Esq<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/55343' title='Somerville, MA'>Somerville Mass.</a>,</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>Our undertaker<span class='line-break'> </span>at the Cemetery returned me among<span class='line-break'> </span>the interments for last June, one of a<span class='line-break'> </span>still-born child buried in your <a href='/pages/subjects/71375' title='Lot 3346'>lot<span class='line-break'> </span>no. 3346</a> on the <date when='1865-06-26'>26<sup>th</sup> of June</date>: but no<span class='line-break'> </span>other fact was given. I wish the name<span class='line-break'> </span>of child (if any was given) name of parents,<span class='line-break'> </span>date ^<sup>&amp; place</sup> of birth &amp; place of residence of parents.</p>
<p>The undertaker or whoever made the<span class='line-break'> </span>interment was remiss in duty. I am <span class='line-break'> </span>now making up the record &amp; index for<span class='line-break'> </span>the year, and wish you would send<span class='line-break'> </span>me the facts at once on the enclosed<span class='line-break'> </span>blank.</p>
<p>Resp.y yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a></p>
<p>309</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133801">
<h3><a name="page-1133801">CB01_0310</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><date when='1866-01-11'>Jany. 11, [186]6</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'>Capt Winsor</a></p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>Please report Sat<span class='line-break'></span>urday on lot of <ins><a href='/pages/subjects/73678' title='Holbrook, Jesse'>Jesse Holbrook</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/73679' title='Lot 2697'>no [2697] </a></ins><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/58791' title='Central Avenue'><ins>Central</ins> Av.</a> - almost opposite the <a href='/pages/subjects/58802' title='Bowditch Statue'>Bowditch<span class='line-break'> </span>statue</a>. He says his angel cost only [$10?]<span class='line-break'> </span>at auction, but the marble men would<span class='line-break'> </span>make it for less than $1000 perhaps more.</p>
<p>Will you let <a href='/pages/subjects/79942' title='Safford, Frederick Marcy'>Fred</a>. look [after?]<span class='line-break'> </span>these points for me.</p>
<p>See if there is any headstone or [mor?]<span class='line-break'> </span>lot of <a href='/pages/subjects/73683' title='Thayer, Joseph H.'>Jos. H. Thayer</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/73682' title='Lot 221'><!--Lot-->221</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/60336' title='Willow Avenue'>Willow Av</a>.<span class='line-break'> </span>gives date &amp; place of ^<sup>his</sup> death, if so what is [?]</p>
<p>Look at precisely same questions on<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/73700' title='Lot 503'>Lot 503</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/60336' title='Willow Avenue'>Willow Ave.</a> -- <a href='/pages/subjects/73701' title='Haven, Thomas'>Thomas [Haven] </a></p>
<p>The same question too on <a href='/pages/subjects/73702' title='Lot 798'>lot 798</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/61175' title='Elm Avenue'>Elm<span class='line-break'> </span>Av</a> -- <a href='/pages/subjects/73703' title='Norris, Shepherd H.'>Shepherd H. Norris</a>?</p>
<p>All these were proprietors, and<span class='line-break'> </span>said to have died, but the records do [not?]<span class='line-break'> </span>show their death.</p>
<p>Truly yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a></p>
<p><date when='1866-01-13'>Jany. 13 [186]6</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/73704' title='Woods, John'>John Woods</a> Esq</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>I believe you<span class='line-break'> </span>have not yet paid the $300<span class='line-break'> </span>bequeathed to our Corporation<span class='line-break'> </span>by the late <a href='/pages/subjects/73705' title='Whitney, Harriet N.'>Harriet N. Whitney</a><span class='line-break'> </span>for the repair of the lot belonging<span class='line-break'> </span>to her &amp; yourself -- <a href='/pages/subjects/73706' title='Lot 2144'>no 2144</a>.</p>
<p>The Corporation is ready to<span class='line-break'> </span>receive said sum and apply<span class='line-break'> </span>it to the purpose indicated.</p>
<p>Respectfully yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
<p>310</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133802">
<h3><a name="page-1133802">CB01_0311</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><date when='1866-01-10'>Jany. [10?] [186]6</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/66068' title='Tenney, Amos'>Amos Tenney</a> Esq<span class='line-break'> </span>37 William St. N.Y.</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>Last summer<span class='line-break'> </span>I wrote you requesting your<span class='line-break'> </span>attention to the removal of a <span class='line-break'> </span>body from the <a href='/pages/subjects/57656' title='Receiving Tomb'>Receiving Tomb</a><span class='line-break'> </span>which you had placed there<span class='line-break'> </span>when you sold your lot -- &amp;<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/73714' title='Jackson, Mr.'>Mr Jackson</a> wrote me that<span class='line-break'> </span>you were in Europe and was<span class='line-break'> </span>expected back "before the end of<span class='line-break'> </span>the year" and would then attend<span class='line-break'> </span>to it. --</p>
<p>Allow me to repeat our request.</p>
<p>Respectfully yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
<p><date when='1866-01-13'>Jany 13, [186]6</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/64299' title='Tucker, William W.'>W.<sup>m</sup> W. Tucker</a></p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>Your request to be in<span class='line-break'></span>formed for what sum the Corpor<span class='line-break'></span>ation would <ins>guarantee</ins> the per<span class='line-break'></span>petual repair of the Lawrence<span class='line-break'> </span>enclosure consisting of <a href='/pages/subjects/64298' title='Lot 489'><!--Lot-->lots 489</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/64300' title='Lot 490'><!--Lot-->490</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/64301' title='Lot 491'><!--Lot-->491</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/72274' title='Lot 492'><!--Lot-->492</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/72273' title='Lot 903'><!--Lot-->903</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62301' title='Lot 904'><!--Lot-->904</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62683' title='Lot 1309'><!--Lot-->1309</a> and<span class='line-break'> </span>containing 3700 square feet with<span class='line-break'> </span>tomb, monuments, headstone, fence, trees &amp;c<span class='line-break'> </span>has been laid before the proper Committee,<span class='line-break'> </span>and they have directed me to inform<span class='line-break'> </span>you that the Corporation will assume<span class='line-break'> </span>such responsibility on payment of<span class='line-break'> </span>four thousand dollars ($4,000.)</p>
<p>This will not of course cover <span class='line-break'> </span>future structures, as it is impossible<span class='line-break'> </span>to foresee what may be desired.</p>
<p>If however the parties will limit<span class='line-break'> </span>the cost of such to any particular sum,<span class='line-break'> </span>they can be covered.</p>
<p>Very Resp.y</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
<p>311</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133803">
<h3><a name="page-1133803">CB01_0312</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><date when='1866-01-13'>Jany 13, [186]6</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/72312' title='Tebbetts, John C.'>John C. Tebbetts</a> Esq.<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/64140' title='New York, NY'>New York</a> -- 5<sup>th</sup> Av. Hotel</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>I have obtained <span class='line-break'> </span>a report of the Sup<sup>t</sup> upon your lot<span class='line-break'> </span>as requested and have laid the<span class='line-break'> </span>same before the Committee on<span class='line-break'> </span>Lots who have given the subject<span class='line-break'> </span>careful consideration, and have<span class='line-break'> </span>directed me to inform you that<span class='line-break'> </span>this Corporation will assume<span class='line-break'> </span>the <ins>perpetual</ins> care of your lot<span class='line-break'> </span>no. <a href='/pages/subjects/72313' title='Lot 731'>731</a>, with its monument,<span class='line-break'> </span>fence, soil &amp; everything thereon,<span class='line-break'> </span>for the sum of six hundred<span class='line-break'> </span>dollars ($600.) I do not think<span class='line-break'> </span>this sum high at all. I shall await<span class='line-break'> </span>your further orders.</p>
<p>Very Resp.y Yrs.</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>Austin J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
<p><date when='1866-01-13'>Jany 13 [186]6</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/73757' title='Willard, Abel'>Abel Willard</a> Esq</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>The Committee on<span class='line-break'> </span>Lots before whom I laid the sub<span class='line-break'></span>ject of <ins>assuming</ins> the <ins>perpetual</ins><span class='line-break'> </span>repair of <a href='/pages/subjects/72314' title='Lot 3031'>lot 3031</a> -- belonging to the<span class='line-break'> </span>estate of the late <a href='/pages/subjects/72316' title='Wyeth, Elizabeth J.'>Mrs Wyeth</a> -- have<span class='line-break'> </span>considered the matter, and direc<span class='line-break'></span>ted me to inform you that<span class='line-break'> </span>this Corporation will guarantee <span class='line-break'> </span>such repair for the sum given<span class='line-break'> </span>by her -- viz. five hundred<span class='line-break'> </span>dollars. --</p>
<p>I enclose you the contract<span class='line-break'> </span>for your signature. When you ^<sup>shall</sup> have<span class='line-break'> </span>returned it to me, I will have<span class='line-break'> </span>it completed, recorded &amp; returned<span class='line-break'> </span>to you.</p>
<p>Please also enclose the fee of $5. for same.</p>
<p>Truly yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
<p>312</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133804">
<h3><a name="page-1133804">CB01_0313</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><date when='1866-01-15'>Jany 15, [186]6</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54774' title='Little, Charles C.'>C.C. Little</a> Esq</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>At the meeting of the<span class='line-break'> </span>Trustees of the Cemetery held [last Mon<span class='line-break'></span>day? indecipherable].</p>
<p>The Treasurer, <a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'>Mr Bond</a><span class='line-break'> </span>stated that his labors had been<span class='line-break'> </span>increased considerably by the increase<span class='line-break'> </span>of business of the Corporation, and asked<span class='line-break'> </span>instead of the present mode of compensa<span class='line-break'></span>tion for the year he might be<span class='line-break'> </span>allowed to charge two and one half per<span class='line-break'></span>cent on the sales of land.</p>
<p>Upon which, it was</p>
<p>"Voted that the subject be re<span class='line-break'></span>ferred to the Finance Committee,<span class='line-break'> </span>and that they be requested to report<span class='line-break'> </span>thereon at the next meeting of the Board."</p>
<p>Very Resp.y yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
<p><date when='1866-01-15'>Jany. 15, [186]6</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/65961' title='Safford, William H.'>W.<sup>m</sup> H. Safford</a> Esq</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>I enclose a list of<span class='line-break'> </span>removals in ^<sup>&amp; from</sup> the Cem.y since last April -<span class='line-break'> </span>(May 1<sup>st</sup>) of bodies interred prior to<span class='line-break'> </span>1865, &amp; which stand upon the old<span class='line-break'> </span>Int. Record in your safe. I have<span class='line-break'> </span>entered them all on the duplicate at<span class='line-break'> </span>this office, and may have entered<span class='line-break'> </span>some of them on the book at the Gate,<span class='line-break'> </span>but am not sure. All removals<span class='line-break'> </span>made prior to <del>Apr.</del> May 1<sup>st</sup> I have<span class='line-break'> </span>entered on that book as I perceive<span class='line-break'> </span>from checks I made on the orders.</p>
<p>Please go over the list, &amp; make<span class='line-break'> </span>the entries as I have noted.</p>
<p>Truly yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a></p>
<p>Be particular to make the <ins>numbers</ins> of the<span class='line-break'> </span>lots into which the removals are made as plain as possible.</p>
<p>313</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133805">
<h3><a name="page-1133805">CB01_0314</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>314</p>
<p><date when='1866-01-18'>Jany 18 [186]6</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'>Geo W<sup>m</sup> Bond Esq</a>.<sup>r</sup> Treas<sup>r</sup></p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>I send my account as re<span class='line-break'></span>quested.</p>
<p>The Corporation is indebted to me for making<span class='line-break'> </span>deeds of lots as follows: --</p>

<p>Truly yours</p>

<p>Sec.y<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
