<div id="page-1133806">
<h3><a name="page-1133806">CB01_0315</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><date when='1866-01-23'>Jany 23 [186]6</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/74515' title='Lombard, Benjamin'>Benj. Lombard</a> Esq</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>Yours of 28<sup>th</sup> ult. was rec<sup>d</sup>.<span class='line-break'> </span>I enclose you the deed of your lot.<span class='line-break'> </span>We have a receipt book for deeds,<span class='line-break'> </span>but, your acknowledgement of its reception<span class='line-break'> </span>on a single line can be attached<span class='line-break'> </span>to it.</p>
<p>The papers ^<sup>(receipt of bills)</sup> loaned this Corporation by indi<span class='line-break'></span>vidual proprietors were all returned in August<span class='line-break'> </span>1864, and I have no doubt I dealt with yours<span class='line-break'> </span>as with the rest, for I knew your address: but<span class='line-break'> </span>I cannot, this moment lay my hand upon the <span class='line-break'> </span>list which I was careful to preserve of those to<span class='line-break'> </span>whom sent, with dates.</p>
<p>I am not aware whether any bill<span class='line-break'> </span>against you for last year is in the hands<span class='line-break'> </span>of the Treas<sup>r</sup> -- but I will send this to him,<span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; request him to forward the bill with it, if<span class='line-break'> </span>there is one.</p>
<p>Respy yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
<p>There is $1.00 due to the Treas<sup>r</sup> for the deed</p>
<p><date when='1866-01-23'>Jany 23, [186]6</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/74516' title='Dean, Erasmus M.'>Erasmus M. Dean</a> Esq<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/74517' title='Hartford, CT'>Hartford Conn.</a></p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/64082' title='Mumford, Sophia'>Mrs Sophie Mumford</a><span class='line-break'> </span>left in a codicil to her will a writing which<span class='line-break'> </span>in its true &amp; legal effect appears to make you<span class='line-break'> </span>the residuary devisee of her lot in the Cemetery,<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/64083' title='Lot 126'>no. 126</a>. We do not however change the<span class='line-break'> </span>title, except at the request of the person<span class='line-break'> </span>laying such claim: and it is the rule with<span class='line-break'> </span>the Corporation, after making a record of<span class='line-break'> </span>the devise, to annex a certificate thereof<span class='line-break'> </span>to the ^<sup>original</sup> deed. If <a href='/pages/subjects/65277' title='Drake, Jeremy'>Mr Drake</a> has even<span class='line-break'> </span>sent that paper to you, if you will<span class='line-break'> </span>forward it, with $2, the fee for record,<span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; certifying, and entry of name, I will return<span class='line-break'> </span>the paper to you completed. I have seen<span class='line-break'> </span>the original will here, and shall not<span class='line-break'> </span>need a copy.</p>
<p>Your early reply will be in time<span class='line-break'> </span>[to?] enter your name on the new catalogue about<span class='line-break'> </span>[indecipherable].</p>
<p>Resp.y yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a></p>
<p>315</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133807">
<h3><a name="page-1133807">CB01_0316</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><date when='1866-01-24'>Jany. 24 [186]6</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'>Geo W<sup>m</sup> Bond Esq</a></p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>The Trustees on the<span class='line-break'> </span>the <date when='1865-06-05'>5<sup>th</sup> of June</date> last, adopted the following<span class='line-break'> </span>report of the Com<sup>ee</sup> on Finance.</p>
<p>"The Finance Com<sup>ee</sup> to whom was<span class='line-break'> </span>referred the subject of the Secretary's salary,<span class='line-break'> </span>submit the following Report viz. They<span class='line-break'> </span>recommend that the salary remain at<span class='line-break'> </span>$800 per annum as heretofore, and that<span class='line-break'> </span>a grant of $200 be made to him for the cur<span class='line-break'></span>rent year, in addition to his usual<span class='line-break'> </span>fee for making deeds."</p>
<p>(signed)</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54774' title='Little, Charles C.'>Chas C. Little</a>}<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/65944' title='Sleeper, Jacob'>Jacob Sleeper</a>} com.</p>
<p>I find from my letter book I sent<span class='line-break'> </span>you notice of the foregoing action on the<span class='line-break'> </span>next day <date when='1865-06-06'>June 6<sup>th</sup></date> --</p>
<p>Truly yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a></p>
<p>(over)</p>
<p><date when='1866-02-08'>Feby. 8<sup>th</sup> [186]6</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'>Capt Winsor</a></p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/66068' title='Tenney, Amos'>Mr Amos Tenney</a><span class='line-break'> </span>wishes the body of his wife, <a href='/pages/subjects/74519' title='Tenney, Maris'>Maria Tenney</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>now in the R.T. forwarded by <a href='/pages/subjects/74520' title='Adams Express'>Adams Ex<span class='line-break'></span>press</a> to <a href='/pages/subjects/64140' title='New York, NY'>New York</a>. It was removed to<span class='line-break'> </span>the <a href='/pages/subjects/57656' title='Receiving Tomb'>Rec. T.</a> <date when='1864-09-28'>Sept. 28, 1864</date>, and whether then<span class='line-break'> </span>put into a new box for the purpose I don't<span class='line-break'> </span>know -- but if not, I presume it will have<span class='line-break'> </span>to be. <a href='/pages/subjects/66068' title='Tenney, Amos'>Mr Tenney</a> will leave <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a> tomor<span class='line-break'></span>row night, &amp; wishes to pay charges of<span class='line-break'> </span>removal, if he can. He thinks he paid<span class='line-break'> </span>about $10. at the time of the last removal. If<span class='line-break'> </span>he has paid nothing for the deposit in <a href='/pages/subjects/57656' title='Receiving Tomb'>the R.T.</a><span class='line-break'> </span>he should be charged I think a fair price,<span class='line-break'> </span>say [$10?] per month. By reference to your book,<span class='line-break'> </span>you can probably see ^<sup>for</sup> what he was charged.<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/74520' title='Adams Express'>Adams Expr.</a> can pay the <a href='/pages/subjects/74522' title='Watertown Express'>Watertown<span class='line-break'> </span>Express</a> for taking the box to <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a>.</p>
<p>If you can send me the bill, I will<span class='line-break'> </span>collect of him. The box can be sent tomorrow<span class='line-break'> </span>or Saturday.</p>
<p>Respy</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a></p>
<p>I send the order for removal signed by <a href='/pages/subjects/66068' title='Tenney, Amos'>Mr Tenney</a>.</p>
<p>316</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133808">
<h3><a name="page-1133808">CB01_0317</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>317</p>
<p><date when='1866-02-07'>Feb.y 7, [186]6</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/58480' title='Sawyer, Amos'>Amos Sawyer</a> Esq<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/74523' title='Hillsboro, IL'>Hillsboro, Ill.</a></p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>Yours of 31<sup>st</sup> ult. posted Feby 1<sup>st</sup><span class='line-break'> </span>came to hand yesterday. In reply I have to say --</p>
<p>If <a href='/pages/subjects/74524' title='Sawyer, Juliet'>Mrs Sawyer</a> can acquire the title in <a href='/pages/subjects/74525' title='Lot 371'>lot<span class='line-break'> </span>no. 371</a> by deed from all the heirs (they being of<span class='line-break'> </span>full age) there will be no difficulty in placing the evidence<span class='line-break'> </span>thereof upon our records. If the heirs are some of them minor,<span class='line-break'> </span>leave of Probate Court in Middlesex [?] would have to be<span class='line-break'> </span>obtained to make such sale valid. I have forgotten what the<span class='line-break'> </span>facts were, as I do not find any memoranda referring to the<span class='line-break'> </span>paper which I prepared for you.</p>
<p>If you can all transfer to her by deed, you will <del>prepare</del> <sup>fill up</sup><span class='line-break'> </span>the form which you find on the 3<sup>d</sup> page of the deed of said lot --<span class='line-break'> </span>saying after the words "Know all men by those present that" -- we _____<span class='line-break'> </span>of _____ (reciting the name &amp; residence of each one in detail as per example) <a href='/pages/subjects/58480' title='Sawyer, Amos'>Amos,</a><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/74526' title='Sawyer, William'>W<sup>m</sup><!--Sawyer--></a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/74527' title='Sawyer, Robert'>Robert Sawyer</a> of <a href='/pages/subjects/74523' title='Hillsboro, IL'>Hillsboro, Illinois</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/74528' title='Brown, Hane E.'>Jane E.<!--Brown--></a> wife of <a href='/pages/subjects/74529' title='Brown, Isaac'>Isaac Brown</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>of _____ <a href='/pages/subjects/74530' title='Jones, Mary F.'>Mary F.<!--Jones--></a> wife <a href='/pages/subjects/74531' title='Jones, Henry'>Henry Jones</a> of _____ and <a href='/pages/subjects/74532' title='Sawyer, Adelaide'>Adelaide Sawyer</a> of<span class='line-break'> </span>said <a href='/pages/subjects/74523' title='Hillsboro, IL'>Hillsboro</a>, being all the children and heirs of ^<sup>the within named</sup> <a href='/pages/subjects/58480' title='Sawyer, Amos'>Amos Sawyer</a>, in consid. &amp;c --<span class='line-break'> </span>hereby given, grant &amp;c. to _____ widow of said Amos, of said <a href='/pages/subjects/74523' title='Hillsboro, IL'>Hillsboro</a>, lot<span class='line-break'> </span>no. &amp;c. As there is but little room on the deed for what you may need you will have to<span class='line-break'> </span>carry the writing up above the</p>
<p>"Know all men &amp; c. (like this) [diagram: several horizontal lines]<span class='line-break'> </span>Then ^<sup>after acknowledgement before a Mass. Commissioner by one of you -- say yourself,</sup> enclose deed to the [f..?] record, sending<span class='line-break'> </span>with it two dollars for the regular fees in this matter.</p>
<p>If you are unable, for the above reasons, to get a deed, then<span class='line-break'> </span>the lot should be represented: and your mother could be designated<span class='line-break'> </span>to represent it and she would have the active control.</p>
<p>Yours Respy</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133809">
<h3><a name="page-1133809">CB01_0318</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>318</p>
<p><date when='1866-02-07'>Feby. 7 [186]6</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'>Capt. D.L. Winsor</a></p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/74536' title='Tufts, Hannah'>Mrs Charles Tufts</a>, with her husband,<span class='line-break'> </span>is quite anxious to complete the contract for the repair of <a href='/pages/subjects/60204' title='lot 2870'>lot<span class='line-break'> </span>2870</a>, as soon as possible, as <a href='/pages/subjects/60202' title='Tufts, Charles'>Mr Tufts</a> is quite old &amp; rather<span class='line-break'> </span>feeble. You will see by the accompanying documents that that you<span class='line-break'> </span>reported upon them <date when='1862-01-02'>Jany. 2, 1862</date>. Since then a monument has been<span class='line-break'> </span>erected on the lots, which will of course increase the cost, to<span class='line-break'> </span>say nothing of the change of rates made by the Com. on Lots, although<span class='line-break'> </span>I am not prepared to say the Com. would think it necessary to <span class='line-break'> </span>increase the $500 each aside from the monument. However,<span class='line-break'> </span>I wish you to go over the matter again with care and<span class='line-break'> </span>report, or add the mon<sup>t</sup> to your report.</p>
<p>Then please take in another element. Mr Tufts has<span class='line-break'> </span>a piece of ornamental ground containing 300 feet, which Mrs <span class='line-break'> </span>Tufts thinks they might like to sell or let the Corp<sup>n</sup> have in part payment.<span class='line-break'> </span>I have made a sketch from our plan of all the surrounding lots, in order<span class='line-break'> </span>that you may study this over and see whether you can fix up a 300 ft<span class='line-break'> </span>lot there with granite in the shape in which this would have to later and<span class='line-break'> </span>find a ready customer. Probably the ornamental was measured to the in<span class='line-break'></span>side of curb of <a href='/pages/subjects/60204' title='lot 2870'>lot 2870</a>, and you could not get more than 200 to 250 ft<span class='line-break'> </span>but I don't know how that is. It must not encroach on Meacham's --<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/74537' title='Lot 3029'>lot 3029</a>. They have 400 feet in lot -- 440 ft ornamental and 252 ft passage<span class='line-break'></span>ways. I don't quite see where all that land is unless a part of it is<span class='line-break'> </span>in front of lot on <a href='/pages/subjects/55287' title='Lawn Avenue'>Lawn Av.</a> &amp; the rear is measured up to Stevens's <del>curb</del> walk.<span class='line-break'> </span>But please report, and give me your view on taking the 300 ^<sup>feet ornamental,</sup> &amp; at what price.</p>
<p>Respy yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133810">
<h3><a name="page-1133810">CB01_0319</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><date when='1866-02-10'>Feby. 10 [186]6</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/73678' title='Holbrook, Jesse'>Jesse Holbrook</a> Esq</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>The subject of your<span class='line-break'> </span>request has been laid before the Com<span class='line-break'></span>mittee of the Trustees upon whom the<span class='line-break'> </span>matter devolves, after the proper re<span class='line-break'></span>port, and they have directed me<span class='line-break'> </span>to notify you that the Corporation<span class='line-break'> </span>will <ins>guarantee</ins> the perpetual repair<span class='line-break'> </span>of your lot with its appurtenances<span class='line-break'> </span>for the sum of seven hundred<span class='line-break'> </span>dollars: -- which sum I think<span class='line-break'> </span>you will perceive is not ex<span class='line-break'></span>orbitent.</p>
<p>Upon being notified of your<span class='line-break'> </span>acceptance of these terms, I will<span class='line-break'> </span>prepare the proper papers.</p>
<p>Respectfully yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
<p><date when='1866-02-12'>Feby 12, 1866</date></p>
<p>For note to <a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'>Capt<span class='line-break'> </span>Winsor</a></p>
<p>see other letter book p. 88<span class='line-break'> </span>(where it was inserted by mistake)</p>
<p>319</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133811">
<h3><a name="page-1133811">CB01_0320</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><date when='1866-02-13'>Feby. 13 [186]6</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'>Capt. Winsor</a>,</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>I have to request<span class='line-break'> </span>one more report -- upon <a href='/pages/subjects/66436' title='lot 291'>lot 291</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/61211' title='Jasmine Path'>Jasmine Path</a>, estate of <a href='/pages/subjects/66438' title='Hildreth, Charles T.'>Chas. T. Hil<span class='line-break'></span>dreth</a>.</p>
<p>The care of this lot is enjoined<span class='line-break'> </span>upon the <a href='/pages/subjects/74539' title='Boston Fatherless and Widows’ Society'>Widows &amp; Fatherless Society</a> of<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a>, who have certain funds under<span class='line-break'> </span>said [Hildreth, Charles T.|Hildreth's]] will, as an annuity.<span class='line-break'> </span>And if the Corporation will assume<span class='line-break'> </span>it for a sum which they think will<span class='line-break'> </span>cause no loss to them, they will probably<span class='line-break'> </span>prefer to be exhonorated from the care<span class='line-break'> </span>of the lot, and pass it over to the care<span class='line-break'> </span>of the Corporation. As it is a charitable Soc.y<span class='line-break'> </span>you will of course be disposed to put your<span class='line-break'> </span>figures as low as can be safely made for<span class='line-break'> </span>the Corporation.</p>
<p>Truly yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
<p><date when='1866-02-14'>Feby. 14 [186]6</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/74536' title='Tufts, Hannah'>Mrs Charles Tufts</a></p>
<p>Madam,</p>
<p>I have had a report<span class='line-break'> </span>made by the Superintendent upon the lots<span class='line-break'> </span>of <a href='/pages/subjects/60202' title='Tufts, Charles'>Mr Tufts</a> &amp;  <a href='/pages/subjects/60201' title='Packard, Sylvanus'>Mr Packard</a> &amp; laid before<span class='line-break'> </span>the Com<sup>ee</sup> on Lots, and they have<span class='line-break'> </span>approved the making of a contract<span class='line-break'> </span>on both lots for $600 each. -- The<span class='line-break'> </span>former contract price was $500. That <span class='line-break'> </span>was four years ago, since which<span class='line-break'> </span>rates have advanced, and you<span class='line-break'> </span>have each added a monument<span class='line-break'> </span>to the lot. If the Committee had<span class='line-break'> </span>asked more still, I should not have <span class='line-break'> </span>been at all surprised, as they will not<span class='line-break'> </span>take risks for all time as they did three<span class='line-break'> </span>or four years ago: -- and I think they<span class='line-break'> </span>have been quite fair in their estimate.</p>
<p>Now upon the matter of laying<span class='line-break'> </span>out &amp; selling a small to lot out of the</p>
<p>320<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133812">
<h3><a name="page-1133812">CB01_0321</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>ornamental ground. I have ex<span class='line-break'></span>amined the matter very carefully in<span class='line-break'> </span>connection with <a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'>Capt Winsor</a>, &amp;<span class='line-break'> </span>viewing its relative position to other<span class='line-break'> </span>lots in the neighborhood. We found<span class='line-break'> </span>that a lot of about 200 feet could<span class='line-break'> </span>be laid out there enclosed with granite<span class='line-break'> </span>curb, so as not to interfere with<span class='line-break'> </span>your or the other lots. You under<span class='line-break'></span>stand of course, that the 300 feet are<span class='line-break'> </span>measured from the interior line of<span class='line-break'> </span>your curb up to the line of ornamental<span class='line-break'> </span>ground belonging to <a href='/pages/subjects/74540' title='Meacham, George'>Geo. Meacham's</a><span class='line-break'> </span>heirs, and when you come to put<span class='line-break'> </span>only a narrow passage between the<span class='line-break'> </span>exterior lines of the granite which would<span class='line-break'> </span>be erected upon the small lot and<span class='line-break'> </span>your own, &amp; the next neighbor,<span class='line-break'> </span>it would not be more than 200 feet.<span class='line-break'> </span>This would probably sell for $1.50 per<span class='line-break'> </span>foot, &amp; would stand you<span class='line-break'> </span>in about $300, which you could<span class='line-break'> </span>doubtless realize next Spring.</p>
<p>If you make up your [indecipherable]<span class='line-break'> </span>300 feet, or rather as much as it will lay<span class='line-break'> </span>out, there is no doubt it can be done, &amp;<span class='line-break'> </span>may be reckoned as so much eventually<span class='line-break'> </span>to come to you: but I should not<span class='line-break'> </span>advise you to wait until that is sold,<span class='line-break'> </span>for the consummation of the contract <span class='line-break'> </span>for perpetual repair. You would only<span class='line-break'> </span>anticipate the payment of what you would<span class='line-break'> </span>realize for the land sold by only three or<span class='line-break'> </span>four months at most.</p>
<p>I shall say nothing to <a href='/pages/subjects/60201' title='Packard, Sylvanus'>Mr Packard</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>as the proposition did not come from<span class='line-break'> </span>him, but wait to hear from you.</p>
<p>Very Resp.y yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
<p>321</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133813">
<h3><a name="page-1133813">CB01_0322</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><date when='1866-02-19'>Feby. 19 [186]6</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'>Capt D.L. Winsor</a></p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>At the meeting of<span class='line-break'> </span>the Trustees held this day for<span class='line-break'> </span>organization, you were, by a<span class='line-break'> </span>unanimous vote, chosen<span class='line-break'> </span>Superintendent of the Cemetery<span class='line-break'> </span>for the ensuing year. --</p>
<p>The subject of ^<sup>compensation of</sup> all salaried<span class='line-break'> </span>officers was referred to a<span class='line-break'> </span>committee consisting of<span class='line-break'> </span>Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Rand</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/56312' title='Norcross, Otis'>Norcross</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/54833' title='Bowditch, J. Ingersoll'><!--J. I.-->Bowditch</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>to inquire and report thereon.</p>
<p>Yours truly</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
<p><date when='1866-02-19'>Feby 19, [186]6</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/71445' title='Southack, George P.'>Mr Geo. P. Southack</a></p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>At the meeting<span class='line-break'> </span>of the Trustees held this day, for<span class='line-break'> </span>organization and business, you<span class='line-break'> </span>were, by a unanimous vote,<span class='line-break'> </span>chosen Gatekeeper for the<span class='line-break'> </span>ensuing year.</p>
<p>The subject of compensation<span class='line-break'> </span>of all salaried officers was<span class='line-break'> </span>referred to a committee con<span class='line-break'></span>sisting of Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Rand</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/56312' title='Norcross, Otis'>Norcross</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/54833' title='Bowditch, J. Ingersoll'><!--J. I.-->Bowditch</a> to inquire and<span class='line-break'> </span>report thereon.</p>
<p>Truly yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
<p>322</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133814">
<h3><a name="page-1133814">CB01_0323</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><date when='1866-02-19'>Feby 19 [186]6</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'>Capt Winsor</a>,</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>Since "<a href='/pages/subjects/79942' title='Safford, Frederick Marcy'>Fred</a>" was here<span class='line-break'> </span>this afternoon it has occurred to me<span class='line-break'> </span>that I shall be alone tomorrow &amp; per<span class='line-break'></span>haps the next day, and that he can<span class='line-break'> </span>do me a good deal of good by coming<span class='line-break'> </span>in <ins>tomorrow</ins>. I am not quite ready<span class='line-break'> </span>to proceed regularly with what I wish of<span class='line-break'> </span>him, but can give him enough to do for<span class='line-break'> </span>a day or two.</p>
<p>I only wish him for Corporation work.<span class='line-break'> </span>My understanding is that you lend<span class='line-break'> </span>him for that purpose, &amp; return him on<span class='line-break'> </span>the pay roll as heretofore, to which I<span class='line-break'> </span>understand he makes no objection.</p>
<p>It is immaterial to me whether you<span class='line-break'> </span>supply him with tickets, or whether I do.<span class='line-break'> </span>Please say which you prefer.</p>
<p>Yours truly</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a></p>
<p><date when='1866-02-27'>Feby 27, [186]6</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/74541' title='Kennard, Henry C.'>Henry Kennard</a> Esq</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>The proper exam<span class='line-break'></span>ination and report upon your<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/74542' title='Lot 869'>lot no. 869</a> have been made, <span class='line-break'> </span>and the Com<sup>ee</sup> on Lots having<span class='line-break'> </span>considered the matter, have directed<span class='line-break'> </span>me to inform you that the<span class='line-break'> </span>Corporation will assume the<span class='line-break'> </span><ins>perpetual</ins> care of your lot,<span class='line-break'> </span>with guaranty for three hun<span class='line-break'></span>dred and fifty dollars.</p>
<p>Very truly yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Secretary</p>
<p>323</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133815">
<h3><a name="page-1133815">CB01_0324</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>324</p>
<p><date when='1866-02-26'>Feby. 26<sup>th</sup> [186]6</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Edw<sup>d</sup> S. Rand</a> Esq<span class='line-break'> </span>Chairman Com<sup>ee</sup> &amp;c.</p>
<p>D<sup>r</sup> Sir,</p>
<p>At the meeting of the Trustees<span class='line-break'> </span>of Mount Auburn held on <date when='1866-02-19'>19<sup>th</sup></date> inst. it<span class='line-break'> </span>was voted</p>
<p>That Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Rand</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/56312' title='Norcross, Otis'>Norcross</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/54833' title='Bowditch, J. Ingersoll'><!--J. I.-->Bowditch</a><span class='line-break'> </span>be a Committee to inquire and report upon<span class='line-break'> </span>the compensation of all salaried officers of the<span class='line-break'> </span>Corporation.</p>
<p>Very Resp.y yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
<p><date when='1866-01-26'>Feby. 26 [186]6</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>E.S. Rand</a> Esq<sup>r</sup>, of Com<sup>ee</sup> on Salaries</p>
<p>D<sup>r</sup> Sir,</p>
<p>You have requested an<span class='line-break'> </span>account of my receipts for the year 1865<span class='line-break'> </span>proceeding from services in connection with<span class='line-break'> </span>the Cemetery. I submit the following<span class='line-break'> </span>which are as nearly accurate as I could<span class='line-break'> </span>make them, some of which, however cover<span class='line-break'> </span>services rendered previously.</p>
<p><table class='tabular'><thead><span class='line-break'> </span><tr><th>Salary</th> <th>800.<span class='line-break'> </span></th></tr></thead> <tbody> <tr><td>Extra compensation voted</td> <td>200.</td> </tr> <tr><td>For Making &amp; recording deeds &amp; Prop<sup>rs</sup></td> <td>208.</td> </tr> <tr><td>For recording transf<sup>s</sup> and all instruments</td> <td>160.50</td> </tr> <tr><td>For legal services</td> <td>59.--</td> </tr> <tr><td>For Commis<sup>n</sup> on lots sold for prop<sup>rs</sup></td> <td><ins>30.</ins></td> </tr> </tbody> </table> <table class='tabular'><thead><span class='line-break'> </span><tr><th>[total]</th> <th><ins>$1457.50</ins><span class='line-break'> </span></th></tr></thead> </table> <span class='line-break'> </span>Very Resp.y</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133816">
<h3><a name="page-1133816">CB01_0325</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><date when='1866-02-27'>Feby 27 [186]6</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>C.G. Nazro</a> Esq<sup>r</sup></p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>The requisite examina<span class='line-break'></span>tion and report upon the lot<span class='line-break'> </span>of the late <a href='/pages/subjects/66438' title='Hildreth, Charles T.'>Dr C. T. Hildreth</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/66436' title='Lot 291'>no. 291</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>having been made, and the<span class='line-break'> </span>Committee on Lots having<span class='line-break'> </span>considered the same, have<span class='line-break'> </span>directed me to notify the <a href='/pages/subjects/74539' title='Boston Fatherless and Widows’ Society'>Father<span class='line-break'></span>less and Widows Society</a> through<span class='line-break'> </span>you, that this Corporation will<span class='line-break'> </span>guarantee the perpetual repair<span class='line-break'> </span>of said lot for the sum of<span class='line-break'> </span>three hundred and seventy<span class='line-break'> </span>five dollars. ($375.)</p>
<p>I am Very Resp.y</p>
<p>Your Ob<sup>t</sup> Serv<sup>t</sup></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
<p><date when='1866-03-01'>March 1, [186]6</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/74545' title='Danforth, Mary E.'>Mrs Benj. F. Danforth</a></p>
<p>Dear Madam,</p>
<p>I regret I was not<span class='line-break'> </span>at the office when you called in and left <span class='line-break'> </span>the papers which I sent you without being<span class='line-break'> </span>executed. I think you must misunderstand<span class='line-break'> </span>the legal position. The will gives the lot to<span class='line-break'> </span>yourself &amp; daughter equally, and unless <a href='/pages/subjects/74546' title='Vaughn, Mr.'>Mr<span class='line-break'> </span>Vaughn</a> sees fit to transfer <ins>by deed</ins> all<span class='line-break'> </span>his interest to you, the only proper course<span class='line-break'> </span>is to agree between you which of you<span class='line-break'> </span>shall <ins>represent</ins> the lot, then both of you<span class='line-break'> </span>sign the petition and send it to me. If<span class='line-break'> </span>you do not understand it, please see<span class='line-break'> </span><ins>me</ins>, as I have nobody who can ad<span class='line-break'></span>vise you on a matter of this kind.</p>
<p>As we are fast progressing with the<span class='line-break'> </span>catalogue, we wish your decision.</p>
<p>Resp.y yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
<p>325<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133817">
<h3><a name="page-1133817">CB01_0326</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><date when='1866-03-05'>March 5 [186]6</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'>Geo W<sup>m</sup> Bond Esq</a>. Treas<sup>r</sup> &amp;c</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>At the meeting of the<span class='line-break'> </span>Trustees today, the followiong order was adopted:</p>
<p>"Resolved That the Treasurer,<span class='line-break'> </span>Secretary, Superintendent and Gatekeeper,<span class='line-break'> </span>be and they are hereby directed in no<span class='line-break'> </span>case to act as paid agents or brokers<span class='line-break'> </span>for the sale or exchange of lots, and are<span class='line-break'> </span>hereby forbidden to receive any commis<span class='line-break'></span>sion, fee or reward for negotiating<span class='line-break'> </span>or effecting such sales or exchanges".</p>
<p>The subject of salaries  was<span class='line-break'> </span>reported and referred to the next<span class='line-break'> </span>meeting. It is proposed to put<span class='line-break'> </span>everything on a salary basis, and<span class='line-break'> </span>abolish compensation by commissions.</p>
<p>Similar notice was sent the Sup<sup>t</sup> &amp; Gatekeeper</p>
<p>Truly yours,</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
<p><date when='1866-03-05'>March 5 [186]6</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'>Geo. W.<sup>m</sup> Bond</a> Esq, Treas<sup>r</sup></p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>At the meeting <span class='line-break'> </span>of Trustees held this day, it was</p>
<p>Voted that the Com<span class='line-break'></span>mittee on Grounds be authorized<span class='line-break'> </span>to cause the <a href='/pages/subjects/54812' title='Perimeter Fence'>Iron Fence<span class='line-break'> </span>enclosing the Cemetery</a> to be<span class='line-break'> </span>painted, at an expense not<span class='line-break'> </span>exceeding nine hundred<span class='line-break'> </span>dollars. -- ($900)</p>
<p>At the last meeting, it was voted <span class='line-break'> </span>"that the Secy be authorized to purchase<span class='line-break'> </span>^<sup>for the use of this board</sup> 120 car tickets of the <a href='/pages/subjects/74549' title='Union Railway Co.'>Union Railway Co.</a> from<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a> to Mt Auburn, &amp; distribute them<span class='line-break'> </span>among the Trustees."</p>
<p>Which has been done, &amp; the<span class='line-break'> </span>[a/c?] rendered you &amp; paid. --</p>
<p>Truly yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
<p>326</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133818">
<h3><a name="page-1133818">CB01_0327</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><date when='1866-03-12'>March 12 [186]6</date></p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>There was but<span class='line-break'> </span>one vote which related <span class='line-break'> </span>to the Cemetery, and that was<span class='line-break'> </span>the following: --</p>
<p>"That the Committee on<span class='line-break'> </span>Grounds be authorized to<span class='line-break'> </span>cause the <a href='/pages/subjects/54812' title='Perimeter Fence'>Iron Fence enclosing<span class='line-break'> </span>the Cemetery</a> to be painted<span class='line-break'> </span>at an expense not exceeding<span class='line-break'> </span>nine hundred dollars."</p>
<p>Respectfully yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a> Sec.y</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'>Capt D.L. Winsor</a></p>
<p><date when='1866-03-17'>March 17 [186]6</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/74558' title='Rice, Henry, Jr., Mrs.'>Mrs Henry Rice Jr.</a><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/74556' title='Flushing, NY'>Flushing, Long Island</a></p>
<p>Dear Madam,</p>
<p>In reply to your<span class='line-break'> </span>note of <date when='1866-01-20'>Jany 20, 1866</date> asking if the<span class='line-break'> </span>present name of the proprietor of<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/74557' title='Lot 1683'>lot no. 1683</a>, should be entered on our<span class='line-break'> </span>catalogue, I say "Yes" -- we desire to<span class='line-break'> </span>reform our catalogue as much as possible.<span class='line-break'> </span>I am now preparing one for the press, &amp;<span class='line-break'> </span>will thank you to give me the lady's<span class='line-break'> </span>name in full and also her residence.</p>
<p>If you are that lady (which your<span class='line-break'> </span>note does not say) please give me your<span class='line-break'> </span><ins>own</ins> christian name. Your husband's<span class='line-break'> </span>name I have.</p>
<p>Your early reply will oblige</p>
<p>Yours Resp.y</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
<p>327</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133819">
<h3><a name="page-1133819">CB01_0328</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>328</p>
<p><date when='1866-03-17'>March 17 [186]6</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/74559' title='Coffin, Edward'>Edward Coffin</a> Esq<span class='line-break'> </span>27 Nassau St. <a href='/pages/subjects/64140' title='New York, NY'>New York</a>.</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>I have been so severely pressed for time<span class='line-break'> </span>as to be unable to earlier attend to your request of Feby [1?]<span class='line-break'> </span>and I cannot now send you all I would like. Our catalogue<span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; by laws are out of print -- have not a single copy, but<span class='line-break'> </span>are preparing one for printing within two or three months.</p>
<p>I send you some of our forms which may be useful<span class='line-break'> </span>also the reports for last four years.</p>
<p>The Sup<sup>t</sup>'s Report of Sales has to be approved by Com. on Lots before<span class='line-break'> </span>deeds are issued. I send form of deed -- form of contract for Per<span class='line-break'></span>petual Repair of lot, with <ins>guaranty</ins> -- form of application of heirs or <span class='line-break'> </span>devisees of deceased prop<sup>r</sup> for designation of one of their number to rep<span class='line-break'></span>resent lot -- (see Sec. 8. at bottom of form) the notice which usually accom<span class='line-break'></span>panies it -- form of orders for work -- form of permits for work --<span class='line-break'> </span>and the application for the same -- forms of order of interment in ^<sup>private</sup> lot --<span class='line-break'> </span>in <a href='/pages/subjects/61319' title='Public Lot'>public lot</a> -- deposit in <a href='/pages/subjects/57656' title='Receiving Tomb'>Receiving Tomb</a> -- &amp; for <ins>removals in or from</ins><span class='line-break'> </span>the Cemetery. The record of interments is <del>left</del> ^<sup>made up</sup> in duplicate &amp; our<span class='line-break'> </span>copy kept at Secretary's office &amp; one at Cemetery. I send also<span class='line-break'> </span>cards of admission issued to different persons -- the<span class='line-break'> </span>rule respecting work on Lots -- and the report made by the Sup<sup>t</sup><span class='line-break'> </span>on the condition of a lot which the proprietor wishes to<span class='line-break'> </span>endow.</p>
<p>I could give much more valuable information upon<span class='line-break'> </span>a personal interview.</p>
<p>Very truly<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a> Sec.y</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133820">
<h3><a name="page-1133820">CB01_0329</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><date when='1866-04-07'>April 7 [186]6</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/74566' title='Bradlee, F. H.'>F.H. Bradlee</a> Esq</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>One <a href='/pages/subjects/70551' title='Gardner, Henry N.'>Henry N.<span class='line-break'> </span>Gardner</a> came here today with a<span class='line-break'> </span>paper signed by you requesting a permit<span class='line-break'> </span>to issue to you to authorize him to paint<span class='line-break'> </span>the fence on your lot. I informed him<span class='line-break'> </span>that the rule required you to come <ins>in<span class='line-break'> </span>person</ins> to sign this application; &amp; he then<span class='line-break'> </span>said -- "you refuse to give me one -- do<span class='line-break'> </span>you?" I said -- "certainly; I treat you<span class='line-break'> </span>as all others. This is the rule which I am<span class='line-break'> </span>required to observe." He then called to<span class='line-break'> </span>one with him -- "Sam! you hear do you".<span class='line-break'> </span>He was quite drunk, and I called<span class='line-break'> </span>the porter to put him out, but he agreed<span class='line-break'> </span>to go himself. He then said, he should<span class='line-break'> </span>go there Monday, &amp; paint the fence, <span class='line-break'> </span>at all events.</p>
<p>I have thought it my duty to inform<span class='line-break'> </span>[this line of letter faded] <span class='line-break'> </span>a violation of the rules, openly and<span class='line-break'> </span>avowedly. -- He is well informed of this<span class='line-break'> </span>being the rule.</p>
<p>Very Resp.y yrs</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133821">
<h3><a name="page-1133821">CB01_0330</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><date when='1866-04-09'>April 9<sup>th</sup> [186]6</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'>Capt D.L. Winsor</a></p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>I send you the<span class='line-break'> </span>permits for work up to this date,<span class='line-break'> </span>in favor of <a href='/pages/subjects/74568' title='Fox, Joseph'>Joseph Fox</a> -- <a href='/pages/subjects/74569' title='O&apos;Brien, Patrick'>Patrick O'<span class='line-break'> </span>Brien</a> -- &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/74570' title='Weeman, Ebenezer'>Eben<sup>r</sup> Weeman</a>. --</p>
<p>I also enclose a letter which was<span class='line-break'> </span>lying on the table when you were here,<span class='line-break'> </span>but I was so busy as to forget it,<span class='line-break'> </span>and you do not appear to have<span class='line-break'> </span>noticed it.</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/74571' title='Markham, W. B., Mr.'>Mr W. B. Markham</a>, prop<sup>r</sup> of<span class='line-break'> </span>the little lot next to <a href='/pages/subjects/74572' title='Jenks, John H.'>John H. Jenks</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>writes me today that he has been<span class='line-break'> </span>again to Mount Auburn, and <span class='line-break'> </span>found a lot on <a href='/pages/subjects/54338' title='Indian Ridge Path'>Indian Ridge</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>which he likes, next to <a href='/pages/subjects/74573' title='Lot 334'><!--lot-->334</a> (<a href='/pages/subjects/74574' title='Hills, George'>Geo Hills</a>)<span class='line-break'> </span>and opposite <a href='/pages/subjects/62117' title='Lot 417'><!--Lot-->417</a> (<a href='/pages/subjects/74575' title='Fearing, Sarah B.'>Sarah B. Fearing</a>).</p>
<p>He judged it to contain about <span class='line-break'> </span>150 feet. Upon looking at<span class='line-break'> </span>our large plan, I don't see<span class='line-break'> </span>any other lot on the N.W. side<span class='line-break'> </span>of  <a href='/pages/subjects/74573' title='Lot 334'><!--lot-->334</a> not separated by a space<span class='line-break'> </span>of 200 feet or so. --</p>
<p>I therefore wish you to inform<span class='line-break'> </span>me how it is. If he asks this<span class='line-break'> </span>where you can lay out large<span class='line-break'> </span>lots, of course he can't<span class='line-break'> </span>have it. If it is between<span class='line-break'> </span>lots, then please say whether there<span class='line-break'> </span>is any objection to letting him<span class='line-break'> </span>have it. If not, I will write<span class='line-break'> </span>Mr Jenks.</p>
<p>Truly yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a></p>
<p>330</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133822">
<h3><a name="page-1133822">CB01_0331</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><date when='1866-04-20'>April 20 [186]6</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/74577' title='Simmons, John'>John Simmons</a> Esq<sup>r</sup></p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>The application<span class='line-break'> </span>made by you to know for what<span class='line-break'> </span>sum this Corporation would assume<span class='line-break'> </span>the perpetual repair of your lot<span class='line-break'> </span>in the Cemetery, <a href='/pages/subjects/74578' title='Lot 585'>no. 585</a>, has<span class='line-break'> </span>rec<sup>d</sup> due attention.</p>
<p>The character and condition<span class='line-break'> </span>of the same having been reported<span class='line-break'> </span>upon by the Superintendent, and<span class='line-break'> </span>been considered by the Committee<span class='line-break'> </span>on Lots, said Committee have<span class='line-break'> </span>directed me to inform you that<span class='line-break'> </span>they will contract to guarantee<span class='line-break'> </span>such perpetual repair for the<span class='line-break'> </span>sum of five hundred &amp; fifty dollars.</p>
<p>I am most Respy Your Ob<sup>t</sup> Serv<sup>t</sup></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a> Sec.y</p>
<p><date when='1866-04-20'>April 20 [1866]</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/73391' title='Smith, Charles A.'>Chas. A. Smith</a> Esq</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>Your application to know<span class='line-break'> </span>for what sum this Corporation would<span class='line-break'> </span>assume the perpetual repair of your<span class='line-break'> </span>lot in the Cemetery, <a href='/pages/subjects/74579' title='Lot 1976'>no. 1976</a>, has received<span class='line-break'> </span>due attention.</p>
<p>I am directed by the Committee<span class='line-break'> </span>on Lots to inform you that<span class='line-break'> </span>they will guarantee the perpetual<span class='line-break'> </span>repair of said lot for<span class='line-break'> </span>four hundred and<span class='line-break'> </span>fifty dollars.</p>
<p>I am Most Respy<span class='line-break'> </span>Your Ob<sup>t</sup> Serv<sup>t</sup></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
<p>331</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133823">
<h3><a name="page-1133823">CB01_0332</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><date when='1866-04-20'>Apr. 20 [186]6</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/71708' title='Spring, Isaac H.'>Isaac H. Spring</a> Esq</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>Your application to know<span class='line-break'> </span>for what sum this Corporation<span class='line-break'> </span>would assume the perpetual <span class='line-break'> </span>repair of your lot in the Cem<span class='line-break'></span>etery, <a href='/pages/subjects/71706' title='Lot 177'>no. 177</a>, has received due<span class='line-break'> </span>attention.</p>
<p>I am directed by the Com.<sup>ee</sup><span class='line-break'> </span>on Lots to inform you that they <span class='line-break'> </span>will guarantee the perpetual<span class='line-break'> </span>repair of said lot for<span class='line-break'> </span>the sum of four hun<span class='line-break'></span>dred dollars. --</p>
<p>I am Resp.y<span class='line-break'> </span>Your Most Ob<sup>t</sup> Serv<sup>t</sup></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
<p><date when='1866-04-20'>Apr. 20 [186]6</date></p>
<p>Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Rand</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/56312' title='Norcross, Otis'>Norcross</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/54833' title='Bowditch, J. Ingersoll'><!--J. I.-->Bowditch</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Com. on Salaries</p>
<p>Gentlemen,</p>
<p>The enclosed paper<span class='line-break'> </span>accompanying the report of the Com<sup>ee</sup> was<span class='line-break'> </span>originally intended for the inspection of in<span class='line-break'></span>dividual Trustees, or of the Board as<span class='line-break'> </span>might be deemed advisable. Circum<span class='line-break'></span>stances which transpired at the last<span class='line-break'> </span>meeting rendered it unnecessary to<span class='line-break'> </span>present it. I have neither the<span class='line-break'> </span>time nor inclination to revise<span class='line-break'> </span>it. I see nothing which does<span class='line-break'> </span>not fairly state the question.</p>
<p>I am satisfied that<span class='line-break'> </span>my services are worth to<span class='line-break'> </span>the Corporation at least<span class='line-break'> </span>fifteen hundred dollars</p>
<p>(over)</p>
<p>332</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133824">
<h3><a name="page-1133824">CB01_0333</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>and I am persuaded<span class='line-break'> </span>that the Committee will<span class='line-break'> </span>be satisfied that such<span class='line-break'> </span>is the fact, if they will<span class='line-break'> </span>take the opportunity to inquire<span class='line-break'> </span>into my duties and<span class='line-break'> </span>the method of performing<span class='line-break'> </span>them.</p>
<p>I am Very Resp.y<span class='line-break'> </span>Your Ob<sup>t</sup> Serv<sup>t</sup></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a></p>
<p><date when='1866-04-25'>Apr. 25 [186]6</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/58451' title='Tuckerman, Joseph'>Jos. Tuckerman</a> Esq</p>
<p>Dear Sir</p>
<p>Yours of 23<sup>d</sup> is<span class='line-break'> </span>just at hand. I supposed I had<span class='line-break'> </span>sufficiently indicated in my note of<span class='line-break'> </span>13<sup>th</sup> inst that no record is made by our<span class='line-break'> </span>Corporation of any interest in any lot<span class='line-break'> </span>less than the entire ownership. This<span class='line-break'> </span>results from the provision of the char<span class='line-break'></span>ter that "lots are indivisible". The<span class='line-break'> </span>Corporation do not object to a man's<span class='line-break'> </span>owning a part of a lot, but there<span class='line-break'> </span>is no way to make such ownership<span class='line-break'> </span>appear upon our records. It results<span class='line-break'> </span>then that, unless <ins>all</ins> the separate<span class='line-break'> </span>interests of <a href='/pages/subjects/74580' title='Lot 496'>lot no. 496</a> are gathered<span class='line-break'> </span>up in you or someone else, and<span class='line-break'> </span>so the entire interest is recorded,<span class='line-break'> </span>the title of record must [ ? ]</p>
<p>333</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133825">
<h3><a name="page-1133825">CB01_0334</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>[ ? ] the heirs of <a href='/pages/subjects/74581' title='Tuckerman, Henry H.'>Henry H. Tuckerman</a>.<span class='line-break'> </span>I see the difficulty, but cannot cure<span class='line-break'> </span>it, unless you will buy or sell. You<span class='line-break'> </span>know whether that is desirable. If<span class='line-break'> </span>the heirs of <a href='/pages/subjects/71991' title='Tuckerman, Gustavus'>^<sup>Gustavus</sup></a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/74581' title='Tuckerman, Henry H.'>H.H. Tuckerman</a><span class='line-break'> </span>are all of full age they can<span class='line-break'> </span>join in a deed to you, and the<span class='line-break'> </span>record of such a deed together with<span class='line-break'> </span>that which you already have from<span class='line-break'> </span>W.<sup>m</sup> with his from Henry H. will<span class='line-break'> </span>give you the entire title.</p>
<p>If I were sure such course would<span class='line-break'> </span>meet your approbation, and had the<span class='line-break'> </span>names &amp; residences of the heirs (where there are<span class='line-break'> </span>married women the names of husbands ^<sup>also</sup> should<span class='line-break'> </span>be given, but the <ins>husbands need not sign.</ins>) I<span class='line-break'> </span>could prepare &amp; send you on such deed.</p>
<p>If the heirs are of age, &amp; that course suits you,<span class='line-break'> </span>I will prepare the deed when you send the<span class='line-break'> </span>names. If it is impracticable, the lot will<span class='line-break'> </span>have to be represented by the heirs of H.H.T.</p>
<p>When you write, if you can please tell me who<span class='line-break'> </span>and where are the heirs of <a href='/pages/subjects/74583' title='Tuckerman, Edward G.'>Edw<sup>d</sup> G. Tuckerman</a>, died<span class='line-break'> </span><date when='1864-09-02'>Sept. 2, 1864</date>.</p>
<p>Truly yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a></p>
<p><date when='1866-05-05'>May 5<sup>th</sup> [186]6</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/67877' title='Browne, T. Quincy'>T. Quincy Browne</a> Esq</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>I send you du<span class='line-break'></span>plicate copies of the deed agreed<span class='line-break'> </span>upon between <a href='/pages/subjects/65211' title='Hemenway, Mary Tileston'>Mrs Hemenway</a> <span class='line-break'> </span>and the Corporation for the exchange<span class='line-break'> </span>of land. Will you please <span class='line-break'> </span>obtain her signature to both<span class='line-break'> </span>copies and return them to me<span class='line-break'> </span>for record. And I will cer<span class='line-break'></span>tify to the record of one of them,<span class='line-break'> </span>and return to you.</p>
<p>Yours truly</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
<p>334</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133826">
<h3><a name="page-1133826">CB01_0335</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>For letter to<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/79861' title='Osgood, George M., Mrs.'>Mrs Geo. M. Osgood</a><span class='line-break'> </span>see other letter book<span class='line-break'> </span>inserted there by<span class='line-break'> </span>mistake -- p. 108 --</p>
<p><date when='1866-05-07'>May 7, [186]6</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'>Geo W<sup>m</sup> Bond Esq</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Treas<sup>r</sup></p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>The Trustees at the<span class='line-break'> </span>meeting today fixed the salaries of<span class='line-break'> </span>officers for the ensuing year as follows:</p>
<p><table class='tabular'><thead><span class='line-break'> </span><tr><th>Sup<sup>t</sup> --</th> <th>$2250</th> <th>house rent--<span class='line-break'> </span></th></tr></thead> <tbody> <tr><td>Treas<sup>r</sup> --</td> <td>$1000 --</td> <td>[ "      " ?]</td> </tr> <tr><td>Sec.y</td> <td>$1350</td> <td>-- fees payable to Treas<sup>r</sup></td> </tr> <tr><td>Gatekeeper</td> <td>$650</td> <td>-- Sunday allowance--</td> </tr> </tbody> </table> <span class='line-break'> </span>from 1<sup>st</sup> Jany last --</p>
<p>Truly yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
<p>335</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133827">
<h3><a name="page-1133827">CB01_0336</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><date when='1866-05-07'>May 7, [186]6</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/71445' title='Southack, George P.'>Mr Geo. P. Southack</a></p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>The Trus<span class='line-break'></span>tees this day in fixing sal<span class='line-break'></span>aries for the ensuing year<span class='line-break'> </span>voted that yours should<span class='line-break'> </span>be $650 with the allowance<span class='line-break'> </span>of 75 cts. per Sunday, for every<span class='line-break'> </span>half day that you employ<span class='line-break'> </span>a substitute, as heretofore.</p>
<p>Yours Resp.y</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
<p><date when='1866-05-07'>May 7, [186]6</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'>Capt. D.L. Winsor</a></p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>The Trustees<span class='line-break'> </span>today fixed the salaries of<span class='line-break'> </span>the several officers of the Corpor<span class='line-break'></span>ation for the ensuing year, and<span class='line-break'> </span>established the salary of the<span class='line-break'> </span>Superintendent for the present<span class='line-break'> </span>year at $2250 with the<span class='line-break'> </span>former allowance of house.</p>
<p>Respy yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
<p>336</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133828">
<h3><a name="page-1133828">CB01_0337</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><date when='1866-06-08'>June [8?] [186]6</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/73701' title='Haven, Thomas'>Thomas Haven Esq</a></p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>I have long searched<span class='line-break'> </span>for a <a href='/pages/subjects/73701' title='Haven, Thomas'>Thomas Haven</a>, the proprietor<span class='line-break'> </span>of <a href='/pages/subjects/73700' title='Lot 503'>lot no. 503</a> in the Cemetery, situ<span class='line-break'></span>ated upon <a href='/pages/subjects/60336' title='Willow Avenue'>Willow Avenue</a>, who appears<span class='line-break'> </span>to have been in the <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a> Directory fom<span class='line-break'> </span>1835 to 1839, as a merchant at 30 [Centred?]<span class='line-break'> </span>Wharf and to have disappeared from the<span class='line-break'> </span>Directory after the latter year: and<span class='line-break'> </span>finally from inquiries and correspon<span class='line-break'></span>dence have been led to the belief<span class='line-break'> </span>that you are that man. --</p>
<p>I am preparing a new cat<span class='line-break'></span>alogue of the proprietors, and<span class='line-break'> </span>wish so far as possible to<span class='line-break'> </span>make it accurate and complete.</p>
<p>Will you please inform me<span class='line-break'> </span>whether I am correct?</p>
<p>Respy. yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
<p><date when='1866-06-08'>June 8 [186]6</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'>Capt Winsor</a></p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>Please send two<span class='line-break'> </span>men to set four 8 in. post to the Lowell<span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; Putnam lots on <a href='/pages/subjects/72315' title='Fountain Avenue'>Fountain Av.</a> <ins> the first<span class='line-break'> </span>job you do</ins> -- I beg of you, and stop my<span class='line-break'> </span>prayers on the subject; which have been<span class='line-break'> </span>earnest, and from the heart, for the last three<span class='line-break'> </span>years: So that the surveyor can get<span class='line-break'> </span>them for the plan. He has the minutes<span class='line-break'> </span>of survey.</p>
<p>Please report for perpet.<span class='line-break'> </span>care on <a href='/pages/subjects/79729' title='Lot 2015'>Lot 2015</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/79730' title='Phelps, Sewall'>Sewall Phelps'</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Estate, on <a href='/pages/subjects/61204' title='Honeysuckle Path'>Honeysuckle Path</a>.</p>
<p>Also of</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/79731' title='Lot 1530'>1530</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/59901' title='Olive Path'>Olive P.</a> 100 ft. <a href='/pages/subjects/79732' title='Wallack, Mary'>Mary Wallack's Estate</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Don't get this over $200 if you can<span class='line-break'> </span>help it. She gave $200 in her will out of which<span class='line-break'> </span>will have to come <ins>$6</ins> legacy tax to U.S. --</p>
<p>Yours truly</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a></p>
<p>337</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133829">
<h3><a name="page-1133829">CB01_0338</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><date when='1866-06-09'>June 9 [186]6</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/104081' title='Robinson, Mr.'>Mr Robinson</a></p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>It appears from<span class='line-break'> </span>our records of interments that <a href='/pages/subjects/79733' title='Woods, Harriet'>Har<span class='line-break'></span>riet Woods</a> was interred in Grave<span class='line-break'> </span>no. 383 <a href='/pages/subjects/61319' title='Public Lot'>St John Lot</a>, <date when='1858-07-14'>July 14, 1858</date>.</p>
<p>It further appears from our books<span class='line-break'> </span>that on the same day Grave nos.<span class='line-break'> </span>383 and 384 were purchased of<span class='line-break'> </span>the Corporation and paid for, the<span class='line-break'> </span>receipt for which has not been<span class='line-break'> </span>found: and the books state that<span class='line-break'> </span><ins>384</ins> was purchased for future<span class='line-break'> </span>use.</p>
<p>I understand from <a href='/pages/subjects/79735' title='Woods, A. Emily'>Miss A.<span class='line-break'> </span>Emily Woods</a>, who paid for the graves,<span class='line-break'> </span>the sister of Harriet, and the bearer<span class='line-break'> </span>of this note, that you examined<span class='line-break'> </span>the record of the <a href='/pages/subjects/61319' title='Public Lot'>St John Lot</a> when<span class='line-break'> </span>she was out on Thursday last<span class='line-break'> </span>and did not find any record<span class='line-break'> </span>of an interment in <a href='/pages/subjects/79736' title='Lot 384'>lot 384</a>.</p>
<p>I wish you to make sure of this,<span class='line-break'> </span>if you have not, by examining<span class='line-break'> </span>the interments there since <date when='1858-07-14'>July<span class='line-break'> </span>14, 1858</date>.</p>
<p>If you find it, note the<span class='line-break'> </span>name and date of deceased <del>of</del> ^<sup>&amp;</sup> the<span class='line-break'> </span>place where from, and the<span class='line-break'> </span>undertaker, if given. If you<span class='line-break'> </span>do not find it, please<span class='line-break'> </span>proceed this afternoon, to<span class='line-break'> </span>the grave 384, open it and<span class='line-break'> </span>ascertain if there is a body there --<span class='line-break'> </span>if so, what name and date<span class='line-break'> </span>&amp;c. on [plate?]: and close it<span class='line-break'> </span>up again for the time being as<span class='line-break'> </span>you find it, and report the<span class='line-break'> </span>facts to me.</p>
<p>Yours respy</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
<p>338</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133830">
<h3><a name="page-1133830">CB01_0339</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><date when='1866-06-12'>June 12 [186]6</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/79745' title='Bender, Walter'>Walter Bender Esq</a><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/64807' title='Baltimore, MD'>Baltimore Md</a>.</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>The accompanying<span class='line-break'> </span>paper came back to us from your sister<span class='line-break'> </span>in <a href='/pages/subjects/64140' title='New York, NY'>New York</a> signed only by her husband.<span class='line-break'> </span>There should if possible, be the signatures of<span class='line-break'> </span>a majority of the heirs. Please add your<span class='line-break'> </span>signature, and, if you know where <span class='line-break'> </span>your sister in Washington ^<a href='/pages/subjects/79746' title='Mcdermott, Mrs.'><sup>Mrs. M<sup>c</sup>Dermott</sup></a> is, get hers<span class='line-break'> </span>also, and return the petition to me.</p>
<p>It is several years since I began<span class='line-break'> </span>to look for the heirs of <a href='/pages/subjects/58399' title='Bender, Jacob'>Jacob Bender</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>and I trust they are at last to stand<span class='line-break'> </span>upon our files, and be known here<span class='line-break'> </span>as the parties in interest. <a href='/pages/subjects/79747' title='Mears, Mr.'>Mr Mears</a><span class='line-break'> </span>has kindly lent me assistance. As we are<span class='line-break'> </span>about to send a new catalogue to press,<span class='line-break'> </span>your immediate attention will much<span class='line-break'> </span>oblige us.</p>
<p>Respectfully yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a>, Secretary</p>
<p><date when='1866-08-18'>Aug. 18 [186]6</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/79748' title='Homer, Henry'>Henry Homer</a> Esq</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>I am directed <span class='line-break'> </span>by the Committee on Lots to inform<span class='line-break'> </span>you that the Corporation will<span class='line-break'> </span>contract for the <ins>perpetual</ins> repair<span class='line-break'> </span>of your <a href='/pages/subjects/79749' title='Lot 1669'>lot, ^<sup>no. 1669)</sup></a> (you first having<span class='line-break'> </span>a brick drain put in to carry off<span class='line-break'> </span>the superfluous water to rear of next<span class='line-break'> </span>tier of lots) for the sum<span class='line-break'> </span>of <ins>four hundred dollars.</ins></p>
<p>When notified by you of<span class='line-break'> </span>your acceptance of the terms<span class='line-break'> </span>proposed, I will prepare<span class='line-break'> </span>the necessary papers.</p>
<p>Yours very Resp.y</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
<p>339</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133831">
<h3><a name="page-1133831">CB01_0340</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><date when='1866-08-18'>Aug 18, [186]6</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/81757' title='Singleton, T. C.'>T.C. Singleton  Esq</a></p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>I am directed<span class='line-break'> </span>by the Committee on Lots<span class='line-break'> </span>to inform you that the<span class='line-break'> </span>Corporation will guarantee<span class='line-break'> </span>the <ins>perpetual</ins> repair of your<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/79751' title='Lot 40'>lot no 40</a> on payment<span class='line-break'> </span>of three hundred and<span class='line-break'> </span>fifty dollars.</p>
<p>When notified that the<span class='line-break'> </span>terms are accepted by you,<span class='line-break'> </span>I will prepare the necessary<span class='line-break'> </span>papers.</p>
<p>Very Respy<span class='line-break'> </span>Your Ob<sup>t</sup> Serv<sup>t</sup></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
<p><date when='1866-09-08'>Sept<sup>r</sup> 8 [186]6</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/79752' title='Gove, John'>John Gove Esq</a></p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>The Committee on<span class='line-break'> </span>Lots have directed me to inform<span class='line-break'> </span>you that the Corporation will<span class='line-break'> </span>contract for the perpetual repair<span class='line-break'> </span>of your <a href='/pages/subjects/79753' title='Lot 2176'>lot numbered 2176</a><span class='line-break'> </span>for five hundred dollars.</p>
<p>This estimate covers the four<span class='line-break'> </span>headstones contemplated. --</p>
<p>Whenever notified of your<span class='line-break'> </span>acceptance of this proposition, I<span class='line-break'> </span>will prepare the necessary<span class='line-break'> </span>papers.</p>
<p>I am Respy<span class='line-break'> </span>Your Ob<sup>t</sup> Serv<sup>t</sup></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
<p>340</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133832">
<h3><a name="page-1133832">CB01_0341</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><date when='1866-09-08'>Sept<sup>r</sup> 8 [186]6</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>James Cheever</a> Esq</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>The accompanying<span class='line-break'> </span>report upon the lot of the late <a href='/pages/subjects/79754' title='Gove, Mr.'>Mr<span class='line-break'> </span>Gove</a> with the comments of the<span class='line-break'> </span>Committee, will explain the [?]<span class='line-break'> </span>in taking a contract for its<span class='line-break'> </span>perpetual repair. I understand<span class='line-break'> </span>from <a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'>Capt Winsor</a> that the [die?]<span class='line-break'> </span>is cracked.</p>
<p>Please return the report<span class='line-break'> </span>to me, when you have<span class='line-break'> </span>examined it.</p>
<p>Yours very Resp.y</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
<p><date when='1866-09-08'>Sept<sup>r</sup> 8 [186]6</date></p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>On <a href='/pages/subjects/79755' title='Lot 77'>Lot 77</a><span class='line-break'> </span>heirs of <a href='/pages/subjects/79756' title='Flagg, Josiah Foster'>Dr Flagg</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'>Capt Winsor</a><span class='line-break'> </span>says the repairs required have<span class='line-break'> </span>been completed as you see en<span class='line-break'></span>dorsed upon the report.</p>
<p>I also send report on<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/79729' title='Lot 2015'>lot 2015</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/79730' title='Phelps, Sewall'>Sewall Phelps</a> Est.<span class='line-break'> </span>to see if the Com<sup>ee</sup> can<span class='line-break'> </span>agree upon the am<sup>t</sup> to<span class='line-break'> </span>be charged. See Mem. made<span class='line-break'> </span>by <a href='/pages/subjects/79757' title='Messrs N. &amp; B.'>Messrs N. &amp; B.</a> --</p>
<p>Please return papers<span class='line-break'> </span>when you have affixed<span class='line-break'> </span>signatures.</p>
<p>Yours Resp.y</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54832' title='Austin, Edward'>Edward Austin</a> Esq</p>
<p>341</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133833">
<h3><a name="page-1133833">CB01_0342</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><date when='1866-09-10'>Sept<sup>r</sup> 10 [186]6</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/104069' title='Merrill, James C.'>Jos. C. Merrill</a> Esq</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>Please refund<span class='line-break'> </span>Cont. for Pertpet<sup>l</sup> Rep. to <a href='/pages/subjects/79759' title='Lot 2121'>2121</a><span class='line-break'> </span><ins>finally</ins> passed upon and recorded.</p>
<p>By one of the strange anomalies<span class='line-break'> </span>the Corporation charges you for receiving<span class='line-break'> </span>money of you, that is to say - <span class='line-break'> </span>the charge for drawing, getting<span class='line-break'> </span>execution of and recording the <span class='line-break'> </span>contract is $5. which<span class='line-break'> </span>you can remit at your<span class='line-break'> </span>convenience.</p>
<p>Truly yours,</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
<p><date when='1866-09-10'>Sept<sup>r</sup> 10 [186]6</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'>Capt. D.L. Winsor</a></p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>Contracts for repair<span class='line-break'> </span>of lots have been taken this year<span class='line-break'> </span>as follows: -</p>
<p><table class='tabular'><thead><span class='line-break'> </span><tr><th/> <th>When Paid in</th> <th>Guaranty</th> <th>G. means.</th></tr></thead> <tbody> <tr><td><a href='/pages/subjects/71352' title='Lot 2517'><!--Lot-->2517</a> -</td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/73639' title='Vose, Josiah'>Josiah Vose</a> -</td> <td><date when='1866-02-05'>Feby 5, 1866</date> -</td> <td>G.</td> <td>1100. </td> </tr> <tr><td><a href='/pages/subjects/72314' title='Lot 3031'><!--Lot-->3031</a>.</td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/79760' title='Wyeth, Nathenial J.'>Nath<sup>n</sup> J. Wyeth</a> -</td> <td><date when='1865-12-26'>Dec. 26, 1865</date> -</td> <td>G.</td> <td>500 </td> </tr> <tr><td><a href='/pages/subjects/66436' title='Lot 291'><!--Lot-->291</a> -</td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/66438' title='Hildreth, Charles T.'>Chas. T. Hildreth</a> -</td> <td><date when='1866-04-02'>Apr. 2, 1866</date> -</td> <td>G.</td> <td>375 </td> </tr> <tr><td><a href='/pages/subjects/79761' title='Lot 1248'><!--Lot-->1248</a> -</td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/79762' title='Everett, Otis'>Otis Everett</a> -</td> <td><date when='1866-08-06'>Aug 6, 1866</date></td> <td>-</td> <td>200. </td> </tr> <tr><td><a href='/pages/subjects/79763' title='Lot 2122'><!--Lot-->2121</a></td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/79764' title='Sunders, Charles'>Chas. Sunders</a> -</td> <td><date when='1866-06-16'>June 16  1866</date></td> <td>G.</td> <td>500 </td> </tr> <tr><td><a href='/pages/subjects/72277' title='Lot 1142'><!--Lot-->1142</a> -</td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/72296' title='Cogswell, Sophia M.'>Sophia M. Cogswell</a> -</td> <td><date when='1866-07-10'>July 10 1866</date></td> <td>G.</td> <td>300 </td> </tr> <tr><td><a href='/pages/subjects/71706' title='Lot 177'><!--Lot-->177</a> -</td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/71707' title='Spring, Isaac S.'>Isaac S. Spring</a></td> <td><date when='1866-09-10'>Sept 10 1866</date></td> <td>G.</td> <td>400 </td> </tr> </tbody> </table> <span class='line-break'> </span>Please send me reports on<span class='line-break'> </span>following: -</p>

C.'>P.C.
