Lot</a>, Give me contents</td> <td/> </tr> </tbody> </table> <span class='line-break'> </span>Survey the following <ins>unsold</ins> lots  - I give <ins>prob.</ins> measures - <ins>all posted</ins></p>
<p><table class='tabular'><thead><span class='line-break'> </span><tr><th>Sec</th> <th>16</th> <th><a href='/pages/subjects/72181' title='Lot 284'>{284 -</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/60652' title='Crocus Path'>Crocus<!--Path--></a> -</th> <th>200f<span class='line-break'> </span></th></tr></thead> <tbody> <tr><td> "</td> <td>'20'</td> <td>{</td> <td/> </tr> <tr><td> "</td> <td>11 -</td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/72182' title='Lot 342'>342 -</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/61147' title='Celastrus Path'>Celastrus <!--Path--></a></td> <td>300</td> </tr> <tr><td> "</td> <td>11 -</td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/74854' title='Lot 375'>375 - </a>"</td> <td>300</td> </tr> <tr><td> "</td> <td>11 -</td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/72184' title='Lot 374'>374 - </a>"</td> <td>300</td> </tr> <tr><td> "</td> <td>19 -</td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/72187' title='Lot 531'>531 - </a><a href='/pages/subjects/58080' title='Maple Avenue'>Maple<!--Ave--></a> -</td> <td>430</td> </tr> <tr><td>Sec.</td> <td>22 -</td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/71414' title='Lot 536'>536 - </a><a href='/pages/subjects/61129' title='Bellflower Path'>Bellflower -<!--Path--></a></td> <td>134f</td> </tr> <tr><td> "</td> <td>19 -</td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/72188' title='Lot 576'>576 - </a><a href='/pages/subjects/58080' title='Maple Avenue'>Maple -<!--Ave--></a></td> <td>435 "</td> </tr> <tr><td> "</td> <td>12 -</td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/79905' title='Lot 2420'>2420 </a><a href='/pages/subjects/79906' title='Lot 1987'>rear 1987 </a><a href='/pages/subjects/59904' title='Spruce Avenue'>Spruce -<!--Ave--></a></td> <td>abt 222f</td> </tr> </tbody> </table> <span class='line-break'> </span>Yours truly</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a></p>

<div id="page-1133864">
<h3><a name="page-1133864">CB01_0373</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><date when='1867-06-04'>June 4 [186]7</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'>Capt. Winsor</a>,</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>I believe I promised<span class='line-break'> </span>to send you a statement of the granite<span class='line-break'> </span>posts needed for points /or surveyors,<span class='line-break'> </span>which you were to order: -</p>
<p>150 posts - from 2 1/2 to 3 feet long - <span class='line-break'> </span>not less than 2 1/2 feet. The <ins>small</ins><span class='line-break'> </span>end to be six inches square, with<span class='line-break'> </span>a drill hole in the centre, say an<span class='line-break'> </span>inch deep. The surveyor prefers they<span class='line-break'> </span>should be tapering, to heave less with frost.</p>
<p>The sooner we have these<span class='line-break'> </span>on the ground, the better it will<span class='line-break'> </span>please the surveyor.</p>
<p>Yours truly</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
<p><date when='1867-07-18'>July 18 [186]7</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/81519' title='Floyd, Edward E.'>Edw<sup>d</sup> E. Floyd</a> Esq</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>In case<del>s</del><span class='line-break'> </span>where a lot is sold with a<span class='line-break'> </span>condition to erect a granite curb within<span class='line-break'> </span>a specific time, as I understand yours<span class='line-break'> </span>is one - the deed is not delivered<span class='line-break'> </span>until the condition is performed.</p>
<p>The proprietor is not com<span class='line-break'></span>pelled (I will say in answer to<span class='line-break'> </span>your question) to employ the Corpor<span class='line-break'></span>ation to put up his granite work;<span class='line-break'> </span>but it must be done under the su<span class='line-break'></span>pervision of the Superintendent.</p>
<p>If there is any misunderstanding<span class='line-break'> </span>on your part, I doubt not the<span class='line-break'> </span>Corporation will refund the money<span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; take your lot.</p>
<p>Respy yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
<p>373</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133865">
<h3><a name="page-1133865">CB01_0374</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>374</p>
<p><date when='1867-07-31'>July 31 [186]7</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'>Capt. D.L. Winsor</a></p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>You have described the following<span class='line-break'> </span>lots on <a href='/pages/subjects/72315' title='Fountain Avenue'>Fountain Avenue</a> as rectangular, each con<span class='line-break'></span>taining 300 square feet <a href='/pages/subjects/81522' title='Lot 3753'>3753,</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/81523' title='Lot 3754'>3754 &amp;</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/81524' title='Lot 3760'>3760 -</a> <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/81525' title='Lot 3741'><!--Lot-->3741</a> you have reported square, containing 400 sq. ft.</p>
<p>The surveyor has returned them as follows: - <span class='line-break'> </span>Lots <a href='/pages/subjects/81522' title='Lot 3753'><!--Lot-->3753</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/81523' title='Lot 3754'><!--Lot-->3754</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/81524' title='Lot 3760'><!--Lot-->3760</a> as per diagram: -</p>
<p>[Diagram: lots with measurements and orientation]</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/81522' title='Lot 3753'><!--Lot-->3753</a> accordingly contains^<sup>nearly</sup> 298 feet<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/81523' title='Lot 3754'><!--Lot-->3754</a> accordingly contains^<sup>nearly</sup> 287 feet<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/81524' title='Lot 3760'><!--Lot-->3760</a> accordingly contains^<sup>nearly</sup> 293 feet</p>
<p>[Diagram: lot 3741 with measurements and orientation]</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/81525' title='Lot 3741'><!--Lot-->Lot 3741</a> accordingly contains 410 feet</p>
<p>within the posts should be made<span class='line-break'> </span>to conform to 300 &amp; 400 respectively<span class='line-break'> </span>or these proprietors should be settled<span class='line-break'> </span>with as the facts require. It is probable<span class='line-break'> </span>however that Lewis, Thomas &amp; Haynes would<span class='line-break'> </span>not wish to be owners each of less than 300 feet.</p>
<p>Yours Respectfully</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A. J. Coolidge</a></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133866">
<h3><a name="page-1133866">CB01_0375_1</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><date when='1867-08-07'>Aug 7 [186]7</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/71343' title='Franklin Smith &amp; Son'>Messrs F. Smith &amp; Son</a>,</p>
<p>Gentlemen,</p>
<p>It is probable<span class='line-break'> </span>we shall admit advertisements<span class='line-break'> </span>of marble men, granite men<span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; undertakers to a limited<span class='line-break'> </span>extent to the cover of the<span class='line-break'> </span>catalogue. As there are but<span class='line-break'> </span>the <ins>two</ins> inside pages, the<span class='line-break'> </span>number who can avail them<span class='line-break'></span>selves of the opportunity will<span class='line-break'> </span>be small.</p>
<p>We have printed 4500 copies<span class='line-break'> </span>and one will be sent to every<span class='line-break'> </span>proprietor who can be found.</p>
<p>They are all sure of cir<span class='line-break'></span>culation -- the greater part<span class='line-break'> </span>of them within a month, and <span class='line-break'> </span>among the best of the com<span class='line-break'></span>munity. As the book<span class='line-break'> </span>will be the constant ref<span class='line-break'></span>erence for years to come,<span class='line-break'> </span>to the people patronizing your<span class='line-break'> </span>business, this medium of<span class='line-break'> </span>advertising (if you care to<span class='line-break'> </span>advertize at all) is superior<span class='line-break'> </span>to any you can select.</p>
<p>If you wish a page or<span class='line-break'> </span>any part of one, see me<span class='line-break'> </span>tomorrow at this ofice,<span class='line-break'> </span>as I shall not keep the<span class='line-break'> </span>space open beyond then.</p>
<p>The price will be neces<span class='line-break'></span>sarily high, but will un<span class='line-break'></span>doubtedly well repay the<span class='line-break'> </span>advertiser.</p>
<p>Respy yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A. J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
<p>375</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133867">
<h3><a name="page-1133867">CB01_0376</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><date when='1867-09-03'>Sept<sup>r</sup> 3 [186]7</date></p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>The Committee on Lots<span class='line-break'> </span>have directed me to notify you<span class='line-break'> </span>that they will contract to keep<span class='line-break'> </span><ins>forever </ins> in repair <a href='/pages/subjects/81699' title='Lot 454'>lot no. 454</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>of late <a href='/pages/subjects/81729' title='Atkins, Isaiah'>I. Atkins</a>, after some<span class='line-break'> </span>repairs shall have been made<span class='line-break'> </span>on payment of four hundred<span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; seventy five dollars ($475)</p>
<p>The regrading &amp; painting which<span class='line-break'> </span>is required will cost about<span class='line-break'> </span>$36. --</p>
<p>Very Respy yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a> Sec.y</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/101340' title='Dobson, J. F.'>I.F. Dobson</a> Esq</p>
<p><date when='1867-09-03'>Sept. 3 [186]7</date></p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>Your application made<span class='line-break'> </span>through <a href='/pages/subjects/81702' title='Gay, Mr.'>Mr Gay</a> to know for what<span class='line-break'> </span>sum this Corporation will guarantee<span class='line-break'> </span>the perpetual repair of your <a href='/pages/subjects/81703' title='Lot 558'>lot no. 558</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>has been laid before the Com<sup>ee</sup> on Lots,<span class='line-break'> </span>and I have been directed to inform<span class='line-break'> </span>you that they will contract with<span class='line-break'> </span>you for the same on payment<span class='line-break'> </span>of four hundred and fifty<span class='line-break'> </span>dollars ($450.)</p>
<p>Very Respy yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a> Sec.y</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/59990' title='Willis, Stillman'>Stillman Willis</a> Esq</p>
<p>376</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133868">
<h3><a name="page-1133868">CB01_0377</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><date when='1867-09-10'>Sept 10 [186]7</date></p>
<p>Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/25009039' title='A. Wentworth &amp; Co.'>A. Wentworth &amp; Co</a></p>
<p>Gentlemen,</p>
<p>At the last<span class='line-break'> </span>meeting of the Trustees of this<span class='line-break'> </span>Corporation, your memorial re<span class='line-break'></span>specting the privilege of doing<span class='line-break'> </span>work in the Cemetery without<span class='line-break'> </span>obtaining a special permit in each<span class='line-break'> </span>case was presented, and <span class='line-break'> </span>it was voted --</p>
<p>That leave to enter the<span class='line-break'> </span>Cemetery with teams and to work<span class='line-break'> </span>on lots be granted to <a href='/pages/subjects/25009039' title='A. Wentworth &amp; Co.'>A. Went<span class='line-break'></span>worth &amp; Co.</a>, revokable at the<span class='line-break'> </span>pleasure of this Board,<span class='line-break'> </span>said firm first giving a<span class='line-break'> </span>proper obligation to save<span class='line-break'> </span>the Corporation harmless.</p>
<p>Respectfully yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a> Sec.y</p>
<p><date when='1867-09-10'>Sept 10 [186]7</date></p>
<p>Sir: --</p>
<p>At the last meeting of the<span class='line-break'> </span>Trustees of the Cemetery the<span class='line-break'> </span>following vote was passed: --</p>
<p>"That hereafter no<span class='line-break'> </span>teams shall enter<span class='line-break'> </span>the front gate at<span class='line-break'> </span>Mount Auburn."</p>
<p>Respectfully yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a> Sec.y</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'>Capt. D.L. Winsor</a>, Sup.<sup>t</sup></p>
<p>377</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133869">
<h3><a name="page-1133869">CB01_0378</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>378</p>
<p><date when='1867-09-25'>Sept<sup>r</sup> 25 [186]7</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'>Capt. D.L. Winsor</a>, Sup<sup>t</sup></p>
<p>Sir,</p>
<p>The Trustees of Mount Auburn<span class='line-break'> </span>recently voted that <a href='/pages/subjects/25009039' title='A. Wentworth &amp; Co.'>A. Wentworth &amp; Co.</a> of <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>marble workers, should have a license, until revoked<span class='line-break'> </span>by the Trustees, to send their men and teams into<span class='line-break'> </span>the Cemetery for work on lots, without obtaining the<span class='line-break'> </span>obligation of the proprietor of each lot upon which<span class='line-break'> </span>the work was to be done, to be responsible for them,<span class='line-break'> </span>upon their giving a satisfactory obligation to be so res<span class='line-break'></span>ponsible themselves.</p>
<p>A bond for that purpose has been executed<span class='line-break'> </span>by them and [lodged?] in my hands. They are there<span class='line-break'></span>fore to be permitted hereafter to enter without the<span class='line-break'> </span>usual permit.</p>
<p>One condition of the bond is that "they shall<span class='line-break'> </span>cause the Superintendent to be informed of the work to be<span class='line-break'> </span>done, in each case, and the name of the proprietor,<span class='line-break'> </span>and the number of the lot upon which such work<span class='line-break'> </span>is to be done, and shall well and truly abide by<span class='line-break'> </span>all the regulations ^<sup>for admission to</sup> the Cemetery."</p>
<p>Respectfully yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A. J. Coolidge</a></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133870">
<h3><a name="page-1133870">CB01_0379</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><date when='1867-09-25'>Sept. 25 [186]7</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'>Capt. Winsor</a>,</p>
<p>Sir:</p>
<p>Mr <a href='/pages/subjects/58459' title='Jones, Josiah M.'>Josiah M. Jones</a>, who<span class='line-break'> </span>is the Ex<sup>or</sup> of <a href='/pages/subjects/81712' title='Fairbanks, Otis, Mrs.'>Mrs Otis Fairbanks</a>, (just<span class='line-break'> </span>deceased) representative of <a href='/pages/subjects/71333' title='lot 659'>lot 659</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/61194' title='Greenbrier Path'>Greenbrier --</a><span class='line-break'> </span>wishes to know how much needs to be done<span class='line-break'> </span>to the lot to put it in order, &amp; what it will<span class='line-break'> </span>cost. Mrs F. three years ago gave the Cor<span class='line-break'></span>poration $100 to keep the lot in order. She has left<span class='line-break'> </span>in her will $200 more. Mr Jones says the<span class='line-break'> </span>lot looks badly -- I told him, if a lot was<span class='line-break'> </span>in bad order the income of $100 would not<span class='line-break'> </span>help it, &amp; it was probably not in good<span class='line-break'> </span>order 3 years ago.</p>
<p>Perhaps it will be well for you<span class='line-break'> </span>to report on both at same time --<span class='line-break'> </span>cost of present repair --<span class='line-break'> </span>cost of perpetual repair</p>
<p>Resp.y yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A. J. Coolidge</a></p>
<p>379</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133871">
<h3><a name="page-1133871">CB01_0380</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><date when='1867-09-28'>Sept 28 [186]7</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/58459' title='Jones, Josiah M.'>Josiah M. Jones</a> Esq  Ex<sup>or</sup></p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>The Sup<sup>t</sup> has reported<span class='line-break'> </span>upon the lot of the late <a href='/pages/subjects/71334' title='Fairbanks, Otis'>Otis Fairbanks</a>.<span class='line-break'> </span>He says there is an oak tree that should <span class='line-break'> </span>be removed and lot wants new<span class='line-break'> </span>grading &amp; sodding.</p>
<p>It will cost $55; to put it in<span class='line-break'> </span>perfect order - When that is done<span class='line-break'> </span>it will be worth $<ins>350</ins>; for<span class='line-break'> </span>perpetual care. -</p>
<p>Very Respy yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A. J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
<p><date when='1867-09-28'>Sept 28 [186]7</date></p>
<p>Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/81716' title='Chester, G. A., Jr.'>G.A. Chester Jr.</a>, Chester + <a href='/pages/subjects/81717' title='Guild, Charles H.'>Chas. H. Guild</a></p>
<p>Gentlemen,</p>
<p>I owe an apology for<span class='line-break'> </span>not earlier giving you the reply of the Trustees<span class='line-break'> </span>to the question - For what sum will the Corporation<span class='line-break'> </span>guarantee the perpetual repair of <a href='/pages/subjects/81718' title='Lot 2397'>lots nos.<span class='line-break'> </span>2397</a><a href='/pages/subjects/81719' title='Lot 2400'>-2400</a>, owned respectively by you. - The<span class='line-break'> </span>report was mislaid -</p>
<p>I am directed to inform you<span class='line-break'> </span>that they will contract for such per<span class='line-break'></span>petual repair for twelve hundred<span class='line-break'> </span>dollars ($1200), <ins>after said lots shall<span class='line-break'> </span>have been put in proper condition.</ins><span class='line-break'> </span>"The steps require new leading, fence wants<span class='line-break'> </span>painting &amp; lot requires regrading and<span class='line-break'> </span>resodding."</p>
<p>Respy your Ob<sup>t</sup> Serv<sup>t</sup></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A. J. Coolidge</a> Sec.y</p>
<p>380</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133872">
<h3><a name="page-1133872">CB01_0381</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>381</p>
<p><date when='1867-11-12'>Nov. 12<sup>th</sup> [186]7</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'>Capt. D.L. Winsor</a></p>
<p>Sir: -</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/81720' title='Hovey, Phineas B.'>Mr Phineas B. Hovey</a>, of <a href='/pages/subjects/64864' title='Cambridgeport, MA'>Cambrige<span class='line-break'></span>port</a>, a friend of mine, was quite desirous to get a<span class='line-break'> </span>lot on the southerly side of the Cemetery, and I<span class='line-break'> </span>pointed out to him <a href='/pages/subjects/67066' title='Lot 525'>lot 525</a> on <a href='/pages/subjects/61270' title='Rose Path'>Rose Path</a>, &amp; sent him<span class='line-break'> </span>to you, to see how you would sell it as to quantity<span class='line-break'> </span>shape &amp; grade. I am informed today that he has <del>agreed</del><span class='line-break'> </span>decided to take it. I remember a year or two since when<span class='line-break'> </span>it was proposed to sell the lot to another gentleman, you<span class='line-break'> </span>thought, it should be run down on the easterly side between<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/61242' title='Oleander Path'>Oleander P.</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/81721' title='Lot 534'>lot 534</a> so as to take in some 20 or 30 ft<span class='line-break'> </span>more than 300. I send you a sketch from the large plan<span class='line-break'> </span>with measurements. The lot is not 15 ft wide on the front. You<span class='line-break'> </span>can tell best by the land how much of the vacant space<span class='line-break'> </span>the bank will require. I think he should take what there<span class='line-break'> </span>is there, not naturally required for the bank, whether [300?]<span class='line-break'> </span>more, or less. There seems to be a good deal to spare between<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/81722' title='Lot 187'>lot 187</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/61242' title='Oleander Path'>Oleander P.</a> - not less than 13 ft - a great waste.</p>
<p>Please inform me of the <ins>address</ins> of <ins><a href='/pages/subjects/81723' title='Heath, Hannah'>Mrs Hannah Heath</a></ins>,<span class='line-break'> </span>to whom you reported, on <date when='1867-07-20'>20<sup>th</sup> of July</date>, as sold a <a href='/pages/subjects/81724' title='Lot 3780'>lot^<sup>(no 3780)</sup></a> of 400 ft on<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/72315' title='Fountain Avenue'>Fountain Av<sup>e</sup></a> amounting to $700. She has not paid for it.</p>
<p>Please also state whether your report of <date when='1867-10-19'>Octo. 19<sup>th</sup></date> <a href='/pages/subjects/81725' title='Lot 3808'>lot <ins>3808</ins></a><span class='line-break'> </span>to <a href='/pages/subjects/81726' title='Vose, John, Jr.'>John Vose Jr.</a> on <a href='/pages/subjects/61214' title='Kalmia Path'>Kalmia P.</a>, 400 ft, is to be superceded by <a href='/pages/subjects/81727' title='Lot 3817'>lot<span class='line-break'> </span><ins>3817</ins></a> on <a href='/pages/subjects/61184' title='Galanthus Path'>Galanthus P.</a> 360 f. reported^<sup>Nov 2<sup>d</sup></sup> as sold him, <del>Nov<sup>r</sup> 2<sup>d</sup></del> He today</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133873">
<h3><a name="page-1133873">CB01_0382</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>382</p>
<p>called at the Treas<sup>r</sup> &amp; paid $630 for the lot<span class='line-break'> </span>last reported, but nothing was said about lot<span class='line-break'> </span>3808. In your report of the last, no reference is<span class='line-break'> </span>made to the former.</p>
<p>Please send in report as to perpetual care<span class='line-break'> </span>of <a href='/pages/subjects/67016' title='Lot 358'>lots 358</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/65623' title='Lot 359'>&amp; 359</a> on <a href='/pages/subjects/55273' title='Narcissus Path'>Narcissus Path</a>. <a href='/pages/subjects/58363' title='Stone, William W.'>W<sup>m</sup> W.<!--Stone--></a> + <a href='/pages/subjects/58367' title='Stone, Henry B.'>H.B.<span class='line-break'> </span>Stone</a>. -</p>
<p>Also of <a href='/pages/subjects/73706' title='lot 2144'>lot 2144</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/61174' title='Elder Path'>Elder P.</a> - <a href='/pages/subjects/73704' title='Woods, John'>John Woods</a> - A fund<span class='line-break'> </span>of $300, with its accumulations amounting to $357.04 has been<span class='line-break'> </span>paid in to the Treas<sup>r</sup> and it is important to know<span class='line-break'> </span>how much of it must go to <ins>present</ins> repair of the lot,<span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; how much into the <ins>fund</ins> for repair.</p>
<p>On <a href='/pages/subjects/81699' title='Lot 454'>lot 454</a> - <a href='/pages/subjects/81729' title='Atkins, Isaiah'>Isaiah Atkins</a> - you stated that<span class='line-break'> </span>the regrading &amp; painting would cost $36. Please have<span class='line-break'> </span>it done at once as the Ex<sup>ors</sup> are ready to pay<span class='line-break'> </span>the $475 required - besides the $36. - I think<span class='line-break'> </span>I gave the order for this last week - but wish to<span class='line-break'> </span>make sure.</p>
<p>Very Respy yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A. J. Coolidge</a></p>
<p>P.S. ? <a href='/pages/subjects/81730' title='Stimson, A. G.'>A.G. Stimson's</a> bill<span class='line-break'> </span>for cutting down trees - </p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133874">
<h3><a name="page-1133874">CB01_0383</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><date when='1867-11-15'>Nov<sup>r</sup> 15 [186]7</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'>Capt. D.L. Winsor</a></p>
<p>Sir:</p>
<p>The Exors. of late <a href='/pages/subjects/81732' title='Fairbanks, Nancy'>Nancy<span class='line-break'> </span>Fairbanks</a> accept the terms of the Corporation<span class='line-break'> </span>for the perpetual repair of <a href='/pages/subjects/71333' title='Lot 659'>lot 659</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/61194' title='Greenbrier Path'>Greenbrier P.</a> - <span class='line-break'> </span>that is $360 - and "$55 for putting the lot in per<span class='line-break'></span>fect order," as described in your report of Sep. 28<sup>th</sup></p>
<p>Please proceed at once, if possible to do it before<span class='line-break'> </span>cold weather, with the present repairs. Please reply<span class='line-break'> </span>by mail, or when you come in tomorrow,<del>if</del> <sup>whether</sup> you<span class='line-break'> </span>can finish it, and if the estimate includes<span class='line-break'> </span>the removal of a tree, which Mr Jones says<span class='line-break'> </span>needs to be taken out.</p>
<p>He is ready to pay the fund &amp; bill as<span class='line-break'> </span>soon as we are ready. -</p>
<p>Very Respy yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A. J. Coolidge</a></p>
<p><date when='1867-11-22'>Nov. 22 [186]7</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/81733' title='Mack, John'>Mr John Mack</a></p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>I am informed<span class='line-break'> </span>that you have called once or twice<span class='line-break'> </span>at my office for a deed of <a href='/pages/subjects/81734' title='Lot 3800'>lot no. 3800</a><span class='line-break'> </span>in the Cemetery. I presume you mis<span class='line-break'></span>apprehend the practice with the Corpor<span class='line-break'></span>ation. The invariable course is not to<span class='line-break'> </span>make a deed until <ins>after</ins> the purchaser<span class='line-break'> </span>has been to the Treasurer &amp; paid for the lot.</p>
<p>Please call upon our Treas<sup>r</sup> <a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'>Geo W<sup>m</sup><span class='line-break'> </span>Bond</a>, <ins>13<sup>th</sup> Federal</ins> St. (new place) &amp;<span class='line-break'> </span>pay him $213.25, and you will get a receipt<span class='line-break'> </span>which will enable you to go forward with<span class='line-break'> </span><del>your</del> the use of your lot. I shall then make<span class='line-break'> </span>the deed so soon as I can get a return<span class='line-break'> </span>from the surveyor.</p>
<p>Resp.y yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A. J. Coolidge</a></p>
<p>383</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133875">
<h3><a name="page-1133875">CB01_0384</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>384</p>
<p><date when='1867-11-29'>Nov<sup>r</sup> 29 [186]7</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'>Capt. D.L. Winsor</a>, Sup<sup>t</sup></p>
<p>Sir,</p>
<p>Please endorse upon the enclosed de<span class='line-break'></span>scriptions of lots for perpetual repair the fact<span class='line-break'> </span>that the repairs preliminary to the acceptance<span class='line-break'> </span>by the Corporation of said lots have been made - <span class='line-break'> </span>as fast as each is done.</p>
<p>I have placed the form on the 2<sup>d</sup> page in case<span class='line-break'> </span>of <a href='/pages/subjects/81729' title='Atkins, Isaiah'>Isaiah Atkins</a>' <a href='/pages/subjects/81699' title='Lot 454'>lot 454</a> - of <a href='/pages/subjects/71334' title='Fairbanks, Otis'>Otis Fairbanks</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/71333' title='Lot 659'>lot 659</a> - <span class='line-break'> </span>and of <a href='/pages/subjects/73704' title='Woods, John'>John Woods</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/73706' title='Lot 2144'>lot 2144</a> -</p>
<p>Will you please review your estimate in<span class='line-break'> </span>the case of <a href='/pages/subjects/73704' title='Woods, John'>John Woods</a> of $400. - It seemed to me<span class='line-break'> </span>from the description, the guarantee might be<span class='line-break'> </span>given for $350. As we shall have about $312 left<span class='line-break'> </span>in the fund after your bill for repairs is in (that is<span class='line-break'> </span>if your bill is $45.) I am anxious to induce the pro<span class='line-break'></span>prietor to pay in enough more to make it up to<span class='line-break'> </span>a guaranty: and I don't believe I can do it, if<span class='line-break'> </span>$400 is required. The lot does not seem to me to involve<span class='line-break'> </span><del>much</del> greater risk than <a href='/pages/subjects/81754' title='Lot 3040'>3040,</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/81755' title='Sargent, Mary'>Mary Sargent</a>; <a href='/pages/subjects/79755' title='Lot 77'>- 77</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/79756' title='Flagg, Josiah Foster'>J.F. Flagg</a><span class='line-break'> </span>and <a href='/pages/subjects/79751' title='Lot 40'>40,</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/81757' title='Singleton, T. C.'>T. C. Singleton</a>, every one of which the Trustees<span class='line-break'> </span>have agreed to guarantee for $350. -</p>
<p>Will you strike from the description of <a href='/pages/subjects/67016' title='Lot 358'>lots 358</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/65623' title='Lot 359'>&amp; 359</a> the ^<sup>final</sup> terms at<span class='line-break'> </span>bottom, "when put in order," unless the lots really need repair. You have not<span class='line-break'> </span>stated any to be necessary. My impression is that the lots were recently newly<span class='line-break'> </span>graded. If new grading is required, probably nothing will be done towards<span class='line-break'> </span>paying in the fund until another year. -</p>
<p>Respy yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A. J. Coolidge</a></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133876">
<h3><a name="page-1133876">CB01_0385</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><date when='1867-12-06'>Dec<sup>r</sup> 6 [186]7</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/81759' title='Binney, C. J. F.'>C.J.F. Binney Esq</a></p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>The Treas<sup>r</sup> of our<span class='line-break'> </span>Corporation has sent me a bill<span class='line-break'> </span>against you of $61.25 incurred in<span class='line-break'> </span>the year 1865, for work on your lot - <span class='line-break'> </span>for collection; the prompt pay<span class='line-break'></span>ment of which will<span class='line-break'> </span>oblige</p>
<p>Respectfully yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a> Secy.</p>
<p><date when='1867-12-06'>Dec<sup>r</sup> 6 [186]7</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/67174' title='Blaisdell, John C.'>John C. Blasdell</a> Esq</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>The Treasurer of<span class='line-break'> </span>our Corporation has sent me<span class='line-break'> </span>a bill of $212.25 incurred<span class='line-break'> </span>by you in 1866 for work on<span class='line-break'> </span>your lot in the Cemetery. -</p>
<p>Your immediate provision<span class='line-break'> </span>for the payment of the same<span class='line-break'> </span>will oblige</p>
<p>Respectfully yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a> Sec.y</p>
<p>385</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133877">
<h3><a name="page-1133877">CB01_0386</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><date when='1867-12-10'>Dec<sup>r</sup> 10 [186]7</date></p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>The memorial<span class='line-break'> </span>of <a href='/pages/subjects/81761' title='Coolidge, John'>John Coolidge</a> touching<span class='line-break'> </span>the alleged damage to his<span class='line-break'> </span>land by overflow was pre<span class='line-break'></span>sented at the meeting of the<span class='line-break'> </span>Trustees this morning: and<span class='line-break'> </span>the same [was?] referred<span class='line-break'> </span>to the Committee on Grounds,<span class='line-break'> </span>of which the President, <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Dr Bigelow</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>is chairman.</p>
<p>Respectfully yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/81762' title='Adams, George Z.'>Geo. Z. Adams</a> Esq Atty &amp;c.<span class='line-break'> </span>19 Court St</p>
<p><date when='1867-12-10'>Dec<sup>r</sup> 10 [186]7</date></p>
<p>Dear Sir:</p>
<p>The accompanying <span class='line-break'> </span>memorial of <a href='/pages/subjects/81761' title='Coolidge, John'>John Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>was this day, by the Board<span class='line-break'> </span>of Trustees, referred to the<span class='line-break'> </span>Committee on Grounds.</p>
<p>Very Respy.</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a> Sec.y</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Dr Jacob Bigelow</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Chairman Com<sup>ee</sup> on Grounds</p>
<p>386</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133878">
<h3><a name="page-1133878">CB01_0387</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><date when='1867-12-10'>Dec<sup>r</sup> 10 [186]7</date></p>
<p>Sir:</p>
<p>At the meeting of the<span class='line-break'> </span>Trustees held this day the<span class='line-break'> </span>following vote was adopted: -</p>
<p>"That hereafter, a charge<span class='line-break'> </span>of ten dollars be made<span class='line-break'> </span>to all parties on whose<span class='line-break'> </span>account the <a href='/pages/subjects/53239' title='Bigelow Chapel'>Chapel</a><span class='line-break'> </span>may be ordered to be<span class='line-break'> </span>heated. - "</p>
<p>Respectfully yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a> Sec.y</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'>D.L. Winsor Esq</a> Sup<sup>t</sup></p>
<p><ins>16 Pemberton Square</ins></p>
<p><date when='1868-01-15'>Jany 15 [186]8</date></p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>Enclosed is the list of lots kept<span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; to be kept in repair by the Corp<sup>n</sup> made up to date.<span class='line-break'> </span>All added in ink are since the date of <del>your<span class='line-break'> </span>reports</del> <date when='1866-10-01'>Octo. 1<sup>st</sup> 1866</date> to which date your report<span class='line-break'> </span>extends [?] made [?] 4/67. <a href='/pages/subjects/60252' title='Lot 840'>Lots 840</a>,<a href='/pages/subjects/81754' title='Lot 3040'> 3040,</a><span class='line-break'> </span>and<a href='/pages/subjects/73772' title='Lot 3553'> 3553</a> were contracted for between<span class='line-break'> </span>Oct. 1 '66 &amp; Jany 1 '67. All the other prop<span class='line-break'></span>erly belong to the Treasurer's report of<span class='line-break'> </span>increase for 1867, and amount in the<span class='line-break'> </span>aggregate to $2,762. The three lots<span class='line-break'> </span>referred to <a href='/pages/subjects/60252' title='Lot 840'>(840,</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/81754' title='Lot 3040'>3040,</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/73772' title='Lot 3553'>3553)</a> amount to $1450 - <span class='line-break'> </span>making $4212 not embraced in<span class='line-break'> </span>your last report -</p>
<p>I also send printed list <ins>without</ins><span class='line-break'> </span>the additions.</p>
<p>Very Respy yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A. J. Coolidge</a></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54832' title='Austin, Edward'>Edw<sup>d</sup> Austin</a> Esq, Ch<sup>m</sup> Com. on Lots</p>
<p>387</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133879">
<h3><a name="page-1133879">CB01_0388</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>388</p>
<p>16 <ins>Pemberton Square</ins></p>
<p><date when='1868-01-20'>Jany. 20, [186]8</date></p>
<p>Hon. <a href='/pages/subjects/56312' title='Norcross, Otis'>Otis Norcross</a></p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>Two years ago last Autumn<span class='line-break'> </span>the Trustees appropriated $2350 for preparing, com<span class='line-break'></span>pleting and delivering the Catalogue and plan of<span class='line-break'> </span>the Cemetery.</p>
<p>There has been expended of the appropriation<span class='line-break'> </span>fifteen hundred and forty two dollars &amp; ninety cents $1542.90<span class='line-break'> </span>leaving a balance of $807.10 -</p>
<p>There is yet to be rendered a small bill - not exceeding<span class='line-break'> </span>$15. I think for^<sup>additional</sup> work by binder on same: and<span class='line-break'> </span>I submit to you the accompanying bill, being<span class='line-break'> </span>entirely for moneys paid out by me, and none<span class='line-break'> </span>(379.27) of which I have received back. I have<span class='line-break'> </span>withheld the bill until the catalogue was completed<span class='line-break'> </span>and delivered, although it had required much more<span class='line-break'> </span>time than was originally supposed. -</p>
<p>By another memorandum you will see that my<span class='line-break'> </span>sales of maps up to January, and moneys rec<sup>d</sup> for<span class='line-break'> </span>advertising on the cover^<sup>of catalogue</sup> will more than pay my bill.</p>
<p>If there is anything which you wish to understand more<span class='line-break'> </span>fully, I will explain. If convenient, will you please call<span class='line-break'> </span>at the rooms tomorrow say from 10 to 12 o'clock. The Treas<sup>r</sup><span class='line-break'> </span>wishes my [a/c?].</p>
<p>Very Respy yours,</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A. J. Coolidge</a></p>
<p>P.S. I also send papers in case of <a href='/pages/subjects/81796' title='Richard, W. H., Mr.'><!--W. H.-->Richardson</a> + Adams.<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133880">
<h3><a name="page-1133880">CB01_0389</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><ins> 16 Pemberton Square </ins></p>
<p><date when='1868-01-28'>Jany, 28 [186]8</date></p>
<p>6</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/81770' title='Hastings, A. Winthrop'>A. Winthrop Hastings</a> Esq</p>
<p>Dear Sir: -</p>
<p>Your communication of <date when='1867-12-21'>Dec<sup>r</sup><span class='line-break'> </span>21<sup>st</sup></date> last, tendering to our Corporation, in<span class='line-break'> </span>behalf of the <a href='/pages/subjects/65978' title='Spring Grove Cemetery, Cincinnati'>Spring Grove Cemetery</a>, as<span class='line-break'> </span>I understand it, a pair of "American<span class='line-break'> </span>Trumpter Swans" was laid before<span class='line-break'> </span>the Trustees at their first subsequent<span class='line-break'> </span>meeting, on the <date when='1868-01-14'>14<sup>th</sup></date> inst.</p>
<p>And it was thereupon</p>
<p>Voted that the communication<span class='line-break'> </span>be referred to the Committee on Grounds.<span class='line-break'> </span>The Committee on Grounds through<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Dr Bigelow</a>, the Chairman, have<span class='line-break'> </span>directed me to return the<span class='line-break'> </span>thanks of this Corporation to<span class='line-break'> </span>the donor, and state that<span class='line-break'> </span>they will be ready to receive them<span class='line-break'> </span>at the suitable season of the year, <span class='line-break'> </span>if you will give <del>them</del> notice<span class='line-break'> </span>a short time - say a day or two<span class='line-break'> </span>before hand.</p>
<p>They have no particular direction<span class='line-break'> </span>to give in the matter of transportation,<span class='line-break'> </span>and will be glad to leave that to you,<span class='line-break'> </span>the Corporation, of course paying<span class='line-break'> </span>charges. -</p>
<p>I suppose it will be best now<span class='line-break'> </span>to wait until Spring - will it not?</p>
<p>Whenever you may be ready, please<span class='line-break'> </span>address a note stating time, &amp;c.<span class='line-break'> </span>to me at this place. -</p>
<p>Yours very Respectfully</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A. J. Coolidge</a> Sec.y</p>
<p>389</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133881">
<h3><a name="page-1133881">CB01_0390</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><u>16 Pemberton Square</u></p>
<p><date when='1868-01-31'>Jany. 31 [186]8</date></p>
<p>6</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'>Geo. W<sup>m</sup> Bond</a> Esq</p>
<p>Dear Sir: -</p>
<p>Please notify the<span class='line-break'> </span>parties in interest, for me, that the<span class='line-break'> </span>Corporation will contract to guarantee<span class='line-break'> </span>the perpetual care of <a href='/pages/subjects/67016' title='Lot 358'>lots numbered<span class='line-break'> </span>358</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/65623' title='Lot 359'>&amp; 359</a> in the Cemetery, belonging to<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/58363' title='Stone, William W.'>W<sup>m</sup> W. Stone</a> Esq + heir of <a href='/pages/subjects/58367' title='Stone, Henry B.'>H.B. Stone</a><span class='line-break'> </span>on payment of seven hundred<span class='line-break'> </span>dollars. - ($700.)</p>
<p>I could not find the address<span class='line-break'> </span>of <a href='/pages/subjects/81772' title='Parker, Mr.'>Mr Parker</a>, whose name you gave<span class='line-break'> </span>me, or I should have sent earlier<span class='line-break'> </span>notice. Learning from you that he<span class='line-break'> </span>is a neighbor of yours, be so kind<span class='line-break'> </span>as to inform him of the result of<span class='line-break'> </span>the Committee's consideration of the matter.</p>
<p>Very truly yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a> Sec.y</p>
<p><u>16 Pemberton Square</u></p>
<p><date when='1868-01-31'>Jany. 31 [186]8</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/81795' title='Wood, Amos L.'>Mr A.L. Wood</a></p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>The Treas<sup>r</sup> of our<span class='line-break'> </span>Corporation has sent me a bill against<span class='line-break'> </span>you amounting to $187.75 which I<span class='line-break'> </span>am instructed to collect.</p>
<p>Presuming that you may prefer<span class='line-break'> </span>that such collection shall be without<span class='line-break'> </span>resort to legal process, you are<span class='line-break'> </span>respectfully requested to call at<span class='line-break'> </span>this office and pay the same. -</p>
<p>Respy,<span class='line-break'> </span>Your Ob<sup>t</sup> Serv<sup>t</sup></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a> Sec.y<span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; Atty.</p>
<p>390</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133882">
<h3><a name="page-1133882">CB01_0391</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><u>16 Pemberton Square</u></p>
<p><date when='1868-01-31'>Jany. 31 [186]8</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/81774' title='Whitman, E. F., Dr.'>Dr E.F. Whitman</a>,</p>
<p>Dear Sir:</p>
<p>The Treas<sup>r</sup> of our Corpor<span class='line-break'></span>ation has sent me a bill against<span class='line-break'> </span>you amounting to $226.75 which<span class='line-break'> </span>I am instructed to collect. -</p>
<p>Presuming that you may prefer<span class='line-break'> </span>that such collection shall be without<span class='line-break'> </span>resort to legal process, you are<span class='line-break'> </span>respectfully requested to call at<span class='line-break'> </span>this office and pay, the same.</p>
<p>Respy,<span class='line-break'> </span>Your Ob<sup>t</sup> Serv<sup>t</sup></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a> Sec.y<span class='line-break'> </span>&amp;Atty</p>
<p><u>16 Pemberton Square</u></p>
<p><date when='1868-01-31'>Jany 31 [186]8</date></p>
<p>6</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/73704' title='Woods, John'>John Woods</a> Esq</p>
<p>Dear Sir:</p>
<p>To give definite<span class='line-break'> </span>form to the matter arranged be<span class='line-break'></span>tween yourself and the Corporation<span class='line-break'> </span>today. -</p>
<p>We have in hand paid in by<span class='line-break'> </span>you as the Ex<sup>or</sup> of <a href='/pages/subjects/81775' title='Whiting, Harriet'>Harriet Whiting</a> $357.04</p>
<p>The bill upon the lot for repairs<span class='line-break'> </span><u>preliminary</u> to contracting for the<span class='line-break'> </span>perpetual repairs. If you shall complete<span class='line-break'> </span>said contract, bill be - <u>45.00</u><span class='line-break'> </span>312.04</p>
<p>The Corporation will guarantee<span class='line-break'> </span>such perpetual repair for $350. - <span class='line-break'> </span>Therefore there will be payable<span class='line-break'> </span>from you balance of - <u>37.96</u><span class='line-break'> </span>$350.00</p>
<p>Resp.y your Ob<sup>t</sup> Serv<sup>t</sup></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a> Sec.y</p>
<p>391</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133883">
<h3><a name="page-1133883">CB01_0392</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><u>16 Pemberton Sq</u></p>
<p><date when='1868-02-06'>Feby 6 [186]8</date></p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>Please report upon<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/81784' title='Lot 3356'>lot no. 3356</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/61115' title='Anemone Path'>Anemone Path</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>belonging to the estate of the late<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/81785' title='Kelly, John T.'>John T. Kelly</a>, for perpetual<span class='line-break'> </span>repair, as soon as the face<span class='line-break'> </span>of the earth will permit.</p>
<p>Also upon that of <a href='/pages/subjects/81786' title='Gregg, William P.'>W.<sup>m</sup> P.<span class='line-break'> </span>Gregg</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/81787' title='Lot 2579'>2579,</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/59993' title='Laburnum Path'>Laburnum Path</a>.</p>
<p>Very Respy,</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a> Sec.y</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'>Capt D.L. Winsor</a></p>
<p><u>16 Pemberton Square</u></p>
<p><date when='1868-02-06'>Feby 6, [186]8</date></p>
<p>6</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'>Capt. D.L. Winsor</a></p>
<p>Dear Sir: -</p>
<p>Please send me<span class='line-break'> </span>answers to the following questions?<span class='line-break'> </span>1<sup>st</sup> Does the granite enclosing the lots<span class='line-break'> </span>of <a href='/pages/subjects/81788' title='Bundy, John G.'>John G. Bundy</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/81789' title='Rolfe, E. C.'>E. C. Rolfe</a><span class='line-break'> </span>on <a href='/pages/subjects/61143' title='Camellia Path'>Camellia Path</a> represent Bundy's<span class='line-break'> </span>lot to be <a href='/pages/subjects/73831' title='Lot 3629'>3629</a> and Rolfe's <a href='/pages/subjects/81790' title='Lot 3630'>3630?</a></p>
<p>2<sup>d</sup> Position and character of the inscrip<span class='line-break'></span>tions of name and number. Are they<span class='line-break'> </span>on the long stone between corner &amp; steps,<span class='line-break'> </span>and in raised or sunk letters?</p>
<p>3<sup>d</sup> Is <a href='/pages/subjects/73831' title='Lot 3629'>3629</a> to the left <a href='/pages/subjects/81790' title='Lot 3630'>&amp; 3630</a> to<span class='line-break'> </span>the right as you face them?</p>
<p>4<sup>th</sup> <del>If <a href='/pages/subjects/81790' title='Lot 3630'>3630</a> is right</del> How much<span class='line-break'> </span>would <del>a</del> new stones connecting the<span class='line-break'> </span>numbers cost?</p>
<p>Very Respy</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a> Sec.y</p>
<p>392<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133884">
<h3><a name="page-1133884">CB01_0393</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><u>16 Pemberton Square</u></p>
<p><date when='1868-02-13'>Feby. 13 [186]8</date></p>
<p>6</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'>Capt. D.L. Winsor</a>,</p>
<p>Dear Sir: -</p>
<p>Please to send to<span class='line-break'> </span>the lot of <a href='/pages/subjects/81788' title='Bundy, John G.'><!--John G.-->Bundy</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/81789' title='Rolfe, E. C.'>&amp; Rolfe</a> on <a href='/pages/subjects/61195' title='Halesia Path'>Halesia<span class='line-break'> </span>Path</a>, and sketch the front on a suffi<span class='line-break'></span>cient scale to represent the length of<span class='line-break'> </span>the different pieces, and their form,<span class='line-break'> </span>and place letters and numbers upon<span class='line-break'> </span>them as they exist. Mark the distances<span class='line-break'> </span>of each  piece, show where the joints<span class='line-break'> </span>occur, and represent the letters &amp; num<span class='line-break'></span>bers on the respective pieces.</p>
<p>We shall then have a tangible<span class='line-break'> </span>basis for correction.</p>
<p>Very Respy yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A. J. Coolidge</a> Sec.y</p>
<p><u>16 Pemberton Square</u></p>
<p><date when='1868-02-13'>Feby. 13<sup>th</sup> [186]8</date></p>
<p>6</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/81795' title='Wood, Amos L.'>Mr A.L. Wood</a>,</p>
<p>Dear Sir:</p>
<p>Yours of Feby 1<sup>st</sup> in reply<span class='line-break'> </span>to my request that you will pay the bill<span class='line-break'> </span>of the Corporation against you for $187.75<span class='line-break'> </span>is before me. I have taken oppor<span class='line-break'></span>tunity to make further inquiries touching<span class='line-break'> </span>the points stated by you, and am<span class='line-break'> </span>satisfied that the bill is due from<span class='line-break'> </span>you. Your early response to my<span class='line-break'> </span>request that you will pay the same,<span class='line-break'> </span>by making such payment, will save<span class='line-break'> </span>you and me further trouble and<span class='line-break'> </span>expense. -</p>
<p>Respectfully yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a>, Sec.y<span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; Atty.</p>
<p>393</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133885">
<h3><a name="page-1133885">CB01_0394</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><u>16 Pemberton Square</u></p>
<p><date when='1868-02-21'>Feby 21 [186]8</date></p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>Yours of 30<sup>th</sup> alt was rec<sup>d</sup> this<span class='line-break'> </span>morning. I am happy to hear from an old<span class='line-break'> </span>acquaintance through the "Golden Gate."</p>
<p>I have enclosed four maps as you<span class='line-break'> </span>as you requested " by Steamer," each of<span class='line-break'> </span>which weighs 2 oz. subj. with weight of wrapper<span class='line-break'> </span>to 4 cts newspaper postage, &amp; so prepaid.</p>
<p>These maps have, I believe, always<span class='line-break'> </span>gone safely so. The letter rate, if they<span class='line-break'> </span>had been sealed, would have amounted<span class='line-break'> </span>to 54 cts. If they do not come<span class='line-break'> </span>safely, inform me, and I will try<span class='line-break'> </span>it again. - Each^<sup>map</sup> is enclosed in a<span class='line-break'> </span>long envelope with the lappet tucked<span class='line-break'> </span>in over the map, directed as requested.</p>
<p>Very Resp,y<span class='line-break'> </span>Your Ob<sup>t</sup> Serv<sup>t</sup></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A. J. Coolidge</a> Sec.y</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>J.B. Bigelow</a> Esq<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/70999' title='San Francisco, CA'>San Francisco</a>, Cal.</p>
<p><u>16 Pemberton Square</u></p>
<p><date when='1868-02-22'>Feby 22<sup>d</sup> [186]8</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54832' title='Austin, Edward'>Edw<sup>d</sup> Austin</a> Esq<span class='line-break'> </span>Chairman Com<sup>ee</sup> on Lots</p>
<p>Dear Sir:</p>
<p>I find that the an<span class='line-break'></span>nual reports show the following<span class='line-break'> </span>account of the <a href='/pages/subjects/56255' title='Joseph Story Statue'>Story Statue Fund</a>.</p>
<p><table class='tabular'><thead><span class='line-break'> </span><tr><th>Dec<sup>r</sup></th> <th>31,</th> <th>1847</th> <th/> <th>1102.67<span class='line-break'> </span></th></tr></thead> <tbody> <tr><td>"</td> <td>"</td> <td>1848</td> <td>-</td> <td>1144.67</td> </tr> <tr><td>"</td> <td>"</td> <td>1849</td> <td>-</td> <td>1144.67</td> </tr> <tr><td>"</td> <td>"</td> <td>1850</td> <td>-</td> <td/> </tr> <tr><td>"</td> <td>"</td> <td>1851</td> <td>-</td> <td>1358.60</td> </tr> <tr><td>"</td> <td>"</td> <td>1852</td> <td>-</td> <td>1428.81</td> </tr> <tr><td>"</td> <td>"</td> <td>1853</td> <td>-</td> <td>5528.00</td> </tr> <tr><td>"</td> <td>"</td> <td>1854</td> <td>-</td> <td>6,326.68</td> </tr> <tr><td>Dec<sup>r</sup></td> <td>31,</td> <td>1855</td> <td>unappropriated portions of fund</td> <td>995.18</td> </tr> <tr><td>"</td> <td>"</td> <td>1856</td> <td>-</td> <td>984.18</td> </tr> <tr><td>"</td> <td>"</td> <td>1857</td> <td>-</td> <td>980.68</td> </tr> <tr><td>"</td> <td>"</td> <td>1858</td> <td>-</td> <td>990.97</td> </tr> </tbody> </table> <span class='line-break'> </span>(over)</p>
<p>394</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133886">
<h3><a name="page-1133886">CB01_0395</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>Since the year 1858, I find<span class='line-break'> </span>no report of this fund. -</p>
<p>I cannot account for the<span class='line-break'> </span>slight variations in the fund<span class='line-break'> </span>from 1855 to 1858, unless the<span class='line-break'> </span>Treas<sup>r</sup> was in the habit of<span class='line-break'> </span>crediting income, &amp; then <del>receiving</del><span class='line-break'> </span>debiting the fund with bills<span class='line-break'> </span>for cleaning marble. Whether<span class='line-break'> </span>this has been the practice<span class='line-break'> </span>I am not aware; if so,<span class='line-break'> </span>the charge would seem to<span class='line-break'> </span>have been about equal to<span class='line-break'> </span>the income. -</p>
<p>Very Respy yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A. J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
<p><date when='1868-02-24'>Feby 24 [186]8</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'>Capt. Winsor</a></p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>The Counsel of <a href='/pages/subjects/81795' title='Wood, Amos L.'>Amos L.<span class='line-break'> </span>Wood</a> against whom we have a bill<span class='line-break'> </span>for 157.12 for grading lot Octo. 1864,<span class='line-break'> </span>has called upon me this p.m., &amp; says if we<span class='line-break'> </span>can show that W. ordered the work, he will not<span class='line-break'> </span>resist the claim.</p>
<p>Will you please look at the book,<span class='line-break'> </span>and recall what you can. Either by con<span class='line-break'></span>versation with <a href='/pages/subjects/73016' title='Barker, Alexander Augustus'>Mr. Barker</a> or anyone else that<span class='line-break'> </span>has any knowledge of it, &amp; write me the<span class='line-break'> </span>result.</p>
<p>I had some conversation with you here<span class='line-break'> </span>the other day of the matter; and ask you<span class='line-break'> </span>to look the matter over because you are<span class='line-break'> </span>where your books &amp; letters are, &amp; will more<span class='line-break'> </span>readily recall facts there. -</p>
<p>Please write what you are able to prove<span class='line-break'> </span>either from documentary or oral evidence</p>
<p>Respectfully yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a></p>
<p>395</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133887">
<h3><a name="page-1133887">CB01_0395a</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><date when='1868-03-04'>March 4 [186]8</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/81796' title='Richard, W. H., Mr.'>Mr W.H. Richardson</a></p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>I fear you are<span class='line-break'> </span>only using the fact stated by the Com.<span class='line-break'> </span>on Lots that your version of the con<span class='line-break'></span>troversy respecting <a href='/pages/subjects/67226' title='Lot 3431'>lots 3431</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/67227' title='Lot 3432'>3432</a><span class='line-break'> </span>in the Cemetery &amp; the Superintendent's are<span class='line-break'> </span>contradictory and irreconcileable, and<span class='line-break'> </span>^<sup>their</sup> calling upon you to agree upon the facts,<span class='line-break'> </span>for gaining time, I think you have<span class='line-break'> </span>abused my patience in offering to lay<span class='line-break'> </span>the matter before the Committee on Lots.</p>
<p>I must now say that unless you<span class='line-break'> </span>can, without further delay, get a de<span class='line-break'></span>cision from the Committee, I shall be<span class='line-break'> </span>obliged to commence suit against<span class='line-break'> </span>you. -</p>
<p>Yours Respectfully</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A. J. Coolidge</a></p>
<p><u>16 Pemberton Square</u></p>
<p><date when='1868-03-04'>Mar. 4 [186]8</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/81774' title='Whitman, E. F., Dr.'>Dr. E. F. Whitman</a></p>
<p>Dear Sir: -</p>
<p>The Superintendent has<span class='line-break'> </span>returned the bill against you with deduc<span class='line-break'></span>tion for error of $20.00 which, with the dim<span class='line-break'></span>inution of interest charged, saves you<span class='line-break'> </span>$22.20. The amount due now and<span class='line-break'> </span>interest stand $204.55 instead of $226.75</p>
<p>This is what we shall expect you<span class='line-break'> </span>to provide for.</p>
<p>Your immediate attention<span class='line-break'> </span>will oblige.</p>
<p>Yours most Respectfully<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133888">
<h3><a name="page-1133888">CB01_0396</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><ins>16 Pemberton Square</ins></p>
<p><date when='1868-03-10'>Mar. 10 [186]8</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'>Capt Winsor</a>, Supt. Mt Auburn</p>
<p>Dear Sir:</p>
<p>Your communication<span class='line-break'> </span>respecting a new boiler to the engine was this<span class='line-break'> </span>morning referred to the Com<sup>ee</sup> on Grounds.</p>
<p>The Com<sup>ee</sup> held a meeting after the meeting<span class='line-break'> </span>of the Board, and adjourned to meet at<span class='line-break'> </span>this place, next Saturday at 12 o'clock,<span class='line-break'> </span>noon. -- I am directed by the<span class='line-break'> </span>Chairman to notify you to be<span class='line-break'> </span>present here at that hour. --</p>
<p>Very Respy yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a> Sec.y</p>
<p><ins>16 Pemberton Square</ins></p>
<p><date when='1868-03-14'>March 14 [186]8</date></p>
<p>Dear Sir:</p>
<p>Please revise your Report on <a href='/pages/subjects/93745' title='Upton, George B.'>Mr<span class='line-break'> </span>Upton's</a> lot. State on 1<sup>st</sup> page what number<span class='line-break'> </span>of headstones. I seldom save the second leaf of<span class='line-break'> </span>the start in filing the reports -- but if you<span class='line-break'> </span>wish to refer to these on the 1<sup>st</sup> page, I will<span class='line-break'> </span>file the second leaf with the first. In that<span class='line-break'> </span>case say, "described on fly leaf." <ins>Also</ins>, note<span class='line-break'> </span>the <ins>amount</ins> for which you think the lot should<span class='line-break'> </span>be taken.</p>
<p>Examine &amp; report on <a href='/pages/subjects/81797' title='Lot 3772'>lot 3772</a> --<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/81819' title='De Grushe, Sarah E.'>Mrs Sarah E. De Graske</a>. -- I send<span class='line-break'> </span>blank ^<sup>filled</sup> on far as I have any knowledge<span class='line-break'> </span>of lot. --</p>
<p>Also report on <a href='/pages/subjects/81801' title='Lot 582'><!--Lot-->582</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/81799' title='Worcester, Joseph E.'>Jos. E. Worcester</a>.<span class='line-break'> </span>Also on the others, before asked for. --</p>
<p>Respectfully yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a> Sec.y</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'>Capt. D.L. Winsor</a></p>
<p>396</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133889">
<h3><a name="page-1133889">CB01_0397</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>397</p>
<p>16 Pemberton Square</p>
<p><date when='1868-03-16'>March 16<sup>th</sup> [186]8</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'>Geo W<sup>m</sup> Bond Esq</a>.<sup>r</sup>, Treas<sup>r</sup> &amp;c.</p>
<p>Dear Sir: --</p>
<p>At the meeting of the Trustees<span class='line-break'> </span>of Mount Auburn held on the <date when='1868-03-10'>10<sup>th</sup> inst.</date>, resolut<sup>s</sup><span class='line-break'> </span>were adopted of which the following is a copy: --</p>
<p>"That it is the opinion of this Board, that the<span class='line-break'> </span>convenience of the Corporation and the proprietors of<span class='line-break'> </span>lots in the Cemetery requires that the duties of the Sec<span class='line-break'></span>retary and Treasurer should be performed at the<span class='line-break'> </span>same office, and that the rooms hired by the Trustees<span class='line-break'> </span>on lease furnish the most desirable location." --</p>
<p>"That a Committee be chosen to confer with<span class='line-break'> </span>the Treasurer, and report to the Trustees upon the<span class='line-break'> </span>subject of the foregoing resolution." --</p>
<p>It was further voted</p>
<p>That said Committee consists<span class='line-break'> </span>of three; and upon nomination by the President --</p>
<p>Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/54832' title='Austin, Edward'>Austin</a>, Read &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/56312' title='Norcross, Otis'>Norcross</a> were so chosen. --</p>
<p>I am directed by the Chairman to notify you<span class='line-break'> </span>that there will be a meeting of said Committee, on<span class='line-break'> </span>Wednesday, the <date when='1868-03-18T09:00:00'>18<sup>th</sup> inst. at 9 1/2 o'clock a.m.</date> at these rooms,<span class='line-break'> </span>at which your attendance is requested. --</p>
<p>Truly yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a> Sec.y</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133890">
<h3><a name="page-1133890">CB01_0398</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><ins>16 Pemberton Square</ins></p>
<p>March 18<sup>th</sup> [186]8</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/81786' title='Gregg, William P.'>W.P. Gregg</a> Esq</p>
<p>Dear Sir: --</p>
<p>We have but just<span class='line-break'> </span>been able to make examination of<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/81787' title='Lot 2579'>lot no. 2579</a> belonging to you, &amp;<span class='line-break'> </span>I have laid the report thereof before<span class='line-break'> </span>the Com<sup>ee</sup> on Lots, who have consid<span class='line-break'></span>ered the matter, and directed me<span class='line-break'> </span>to notify you that the Corpor<span class='line-break'></span>ation will guarantee the perpetual<span class='line-break'> </span>repair of said lot, when you<span class='line-break'> </span>shall have put the same in <span class='line-break'> </span>good condition to the satisfaction<span class='line-break'> </span>of the Superintendent, for four<span class='line-break'> </span>hundred dollars. -- $400.</p>
<p>I am Respectfully</p>
<p>Your Ob<sup>t</sup> Serv<sup>t</sup></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a></p>
<p><ins>16 Pemberton Square</ins></p>
<p><date when='1868-03-18'>March 18 [186]8</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/81802' title='Kelly, D. Joseph'>D. Joseph Kelly</a> Esq</p>
<p>Dear Sir: --</p>
<p>As the snow has left<span class='line-break'> </span>the ground, we have been able to<span class='line-break'> </span>make the proper survey of <a href='/pages/subjects/81784' title='Lot 3356'>lot 3356</a><span class='line-break'> </span>the report of which I have laid<span class='line-break'> </span>before the Com. on Lots: and I<span class='line-break'> </span>have been directed to notify you<span class='line-break'> </span>that the Corporation will guar<span class='line-break'></span>antee the perpetual repair of said<span class='line-break'> </span>lot for six hundred dollars<span class='line-break'> </span>$600. --</p>
<p>Respectfully</p>
<p>Your Ob<sup>t</sup> Serv<sup>t</sup></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A. J. C.</a></p>
<p>398</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133891">
<h3><a name="page-1133891">CB01_0399</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>399</p>
<p>16 Pemberton Square</p>
<p><date when='1868-03-26'>March 26<sup>th</sup> [186]8</date></p>
<p>Hon. <a href='/pages/subjects/54842' title='Curtis, George T.'>Geo. T. Curtis</a>.</p>
<p>Dear Sir:</p>
<p>Your name stands with the names<span class='line-break'> </span>of forty or fifty subscribers to the <a href='/pages/subjects/56255' title='Joseph Story Statue'>Story statue</a> at Mount<span class='line-break'> </span>Auburn, by far the greater number of whom are<span class='line-break'> </span>deceased. As several years elapsed before the com<span class='line-break'></span>pletion of the statue, the original subscriptions which<span class='line-break'> </span>amounted to $3680, from the accumulations of interest<span class='line-break'> </span>increased to $6518.97 out of which the cost of the Statue<span class='line-break'> </span>$5528 left a balance of $990.97. As this has stood<span class='line-break'> </span>some time on the books of the Corporation the Trustees of<span class='line-break'> </span>the Cemetery desire the instruction or cooperation of<span class='line-break'> </span>the subscribers to its disposition.</p>
<p>I enclose you a paper which has been drawn<span class='line-break'> </span>up after mutual consultation between some of <span class='line-break'> </span>the parties interested, already signed by several. If<span class='line-break'> </span>it meets your approbation, will you be so kind<span class='line-break'> </span>as to affix your name, and return the<span class='line-break'> </span>paper to me within a day or two.</p>
<p>You represent the <a href='/pages/subjects/53237' title='Story, Joseph'>Judge Story</a> Lot still.</p>
<p>Very Respectfully yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>Austin J. Coolidge</a> Sec.y</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133892">
<h3><a name="page-1133892">CB01_0400</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><ins>16 Pemberton Square</ins></p>
<p><date when='1868-03-27'>March 27 [186]8</date></p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>In the confusion of<span class='line-break'> </span>removal to this place, your note was<span class='line-break'> </span>mislaid. You request a copy of our last<span class='line-break'> </span>report. I send a copy of the last Annual<span class='line-break'> </span>Report: but have some idea that you may<span class='line-break'> </span>have had in mind "the Catalogue of Lots<span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; Prop<sup>rs</sup> , Charter, By-laws, &amp;c. &amp;c. which is pub<span class='line-break'></span>lished once only in three, five, or six years,<span class='line-break'> </span>as may be needed. The last publication<span class='line-break'> </span>was in 1867 -- a duodecimo of 263 pages.</p>
<p>We have so many applications for this,<span class='line-break'> </span>that we have made it a rule to charge<span class='line-break'> </span>50 cts a copy, unless by way of exchange.<span class='line-break'> </span>If you have a catalogue of your<span class='line-break'> </span>Cemetery, I shall be happy to forward<span class='line-break'> </span>a copy of ours in exchange.</p>
<p>Very Resp.y</p>
<p>Your Ob<sup>t</sup> Serv<sup>t</sup></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a> Sec.y</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/81803' title='Vosburgh, J. W.'>J. W. Vosburgh</a> Esq</p>
<p><ins>16 Pemberton Square</ins></p>
<p><date when='1868-03-28'>Mar. 28 [186]8</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/81770' title='Hastings, A. Winthrop'>A. Winthrop Hastings</a> Esq</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>The Superintendent<span class='line-break'> </span>informs me that he can<span class='line-break'> </span>arrange for the reception<span class='line-break'> </span>of the <a href='/pages/subjects/65978' title='Spring Grove Cemetery, Cincinnati'><!--Spring Grove Cemetery-->Cincinnati</a> Swans<span class='line-break'> </span>whenever it is thought best<span class='line-break'> </span>to send them on. --</p>
<p>Will you please give <span class='line-break'> </span>us a few days notice, if con<span class='line-break'></span>venient.</p>
<p>Very Respy</p>
<p>Your Ob<sup>t</sup> Serv<sup>t</sup></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
<p>400</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133893">
<h3><a name="page-1133893">CB01_0401</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><ins>16 Pemberton Square</ins></p>
<p><date when='1868-04-07'>Apr. 7 [186]8</date></p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>I have been waiting<span class='line-break'> </span>for Wood's answer to our<span class='line-break'> </span>demand. Are you not<span class='line-break'> </span>allowing him to take more<span class='line-break'> </span>time to make up his mind<span class='line-break'> </span>whether to pay than was pro<span class='line-break'></span>posed? I must request<span class='line-break'> </span>the matter be closed now,<span class='line-break'> </span>one way or the other.</p>
<p>Truly yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/67128' title='Parker, H. G.'>H.G. Parker</a> Esq</p>
<p><ins>16 Pemberton Square</ins></p>
<p><date when='1868-04-09'>Apr. 9 [186]8</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/81804' title='Forbush, R. N.'>Mr R.N. Forbush</a>,</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>Some years<span class='line-break'> </span>since you requested me to make<span class='line-break'> </span>a copy of the deed of your lot in<span class='line-break'> </span>the Cemetery, for you. I made &amp;<span class='line-break'> </span>certified said copy, but after<span class='line-break'> </span>doing so, could not by some<span class='line-break'> </span>means find you. I sent a<span class='line-break'> </span>messenger to 21 Merchants Row, &amp;<span class='line-break'> </span>he was sent to the <a href='/pages/subjects/81805' title='Blackston Mansion House'>Blackston Man<span class='line-break'></span>sion House</a> -- but didn't find you.</p>
<p>This copy remains on our files, &amp;<span class='line-break'> </span>I wish you would call and<span class='line-break'> </span>take it. Please do so immediately,<span class='line-break'> </span>or inform me that you do<span class='line-break'> </span><ins>not</ins> wish for it.</p>
<p>Respectfully yours,</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y</p>
<p>401</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133894">
<h3><a name="page-1133894">CB01_0402</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>402</p>
<p>16 Pemberton Square</p>
<p><date when='1868-04-09'>Apr. 9<sup>th</sup> [186]8</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'>Capt. D.L. Winsor</a> Sup<sup>t</sup></p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>The 29<sup>th</sup> by-law requires you<span class='line-break'> </span>annually before the 1<sup>st</sup> Monday in April to report<span class='line-break'> </span>to the Trustees a list of all lots out of repair, &amp;c. --<span class='line-break'> </span>The first and last report of such lots was made<span class='line-break'> </span>in the spring of 1865, and embraced a few more than<span class='line-break'> </span>a hundred lots. In connection with this subject,<span class='line-break'> </span>it was found that many of the lots are still<span class='line-break'> </span>without stone or iron bounds: and these you proposed,<span class='line-break'> </span>a year or two since to report upon -- but I think<span class='line-break'> </span>the snow frustrated your work. Late in Autumn or<span class='line-break'> </span>early in Spring is the only practicable time for this. --<span class='line-break'> </span>I suggest that you endeavor this time to put<span class='line-break'> </span>on <a href='/pages/subjects/79942' title='Safford, Frederick Marcy'>Fred</a> or some one that you are satisfied can<span class='line-break'> </span>do this work accurately. I don't know who you have<span class='line-break'> </span>besides <a href='/pages/subjects/79942' title='Safford, Frederick Marcy'>Fred</a>. that can. You now have a good plan<span class='line-break'> </span>to work by. I would examine all lots by the plan<span class='line-break'> </span>^<sup>&amp; catalogue</sup> following the avenues &amp; path in course, making a x on<span class='line-break'> </span>the lot or plan, &amp; writing against the number in the catal<span class='line-break'></span>ogue a letter for what is wanted as N.S. for<span class='line-break'> </span>new sodding, P. for painting fence and B. for stone<span class='line-break'> </span>bounds, or whatever initials you may think best,<span class='line-break'> </span>making of course more extended notes where<span class='line-break'> </span>needed.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133895">
<h3><a name="page-1133895">CB01_0403</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>403</p>
<p>The by-laws are now sufficient for making<span class='line-break'> </span>a finish of all such cases &amp; it is high<span class='line-break'> </span>time we had done with the matter of getting<span class='line-break'> </span>lots bounded. --</p>
<p>Can you not, as fast as you get the raking<span class='line-break'> </span>along, have this work going on? I presume<span class='line-break'> </span>there are comparatively few cases where raking<span class='line-break'> </span>the leaves would be an assistance to this work.</p>
<p>The Committee some time since decided<span class='line-break'> </span>to have all the unbounded lots reported, and<span class='line-break'> </span>posts put to them.</p>
<p>I have before me some papers that have<span class='line-break'> </span>been a good while on my files, &amp; wish to finish the<span class='line-break'> </span>matter. A bill dated <date when='1862-09-28'>Sep. 28, 1862</date> was made &amp;<span class='line-break'> </span>sent me for putting bounds to <a href='/pages/subjects/71737' title='Lot 498'>lot no 498</a> -- <a href='/pages/subjects/81806' title='Lathrop, S.'>S. Lathrop</a><span class='line-break'> </span>amounting to $8. -- Just before <del>this</del> sending the bill to<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/71739' title='Sewall, Samuel E.'>Mr Sam. E. Sewall</a> who is the Trustee under L's will,<span class='line-break'> </span>he wrote me a note stating that the heirs com<span class='line-break'></span>plained that we have removed from the lot four<span class='line-break'> </span>freestone posts &amp; chains from the lot, and no one<span class='line-break'> </span>could give any account of the matter. I well<span class='line-break'> </span>remember that the lot had these posts &amp; chains, &amp;<span class='line-break'> </span>suppose it got reported without bounds by reason of<span class='line-break'> </span>the absence of one of the posts -- perhaps all the chains. Have<span class='line-break'> </span>you ever made any further discovery in the matter? If<span class='line-break'> </span>not, &amp; we have set new posts, we ought certainly to resend<span class='line-break'> </span>the bill, which Mr Sewall very properly refused to pay.</p>
<p>Very Respy yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133896">
<h3><a name="page-1133896">CB01_0404</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>404</p>
<p>16 Pemberton Square</p>
<p><date when='1868-04-10'>Apr. 10, [186]8</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/81812' title='Rice &amp; Kendall'>Messrs Rice &amp; Kendall</a></p>
<p>Gentlemen,</p>
<p>We wish you <span class='line-break'> </span>to sell on [afc?] of this Corporation six<span class='line-break'> </span>reams of map paper of a lot<span class='line-break'> </span>purchased of you last year -- made<span class='line-break'> </span>at <a href='/pages/subjects/81813' title='Tileston&apos;s Mills'>Tileston's Mills</a> --</p>
<p>Size 36 x 46 inches 60 lbs to the ream --<span class='line-break'> </span>We paid you 45 cts --</p>
