<p>The balance we shall retain for future<span class='line-break'> </span>use -- It is now stored in our safe<span class='line-break'> </span>here -- , &amp; we will send it to your ware<span class='line-break'></span>house -- , if you wish before sale -- or will<span class='line-break'> </span>send a sample --</p>
<p>Respy your Ob<sup>t</sup> Serv<sup>t</sup></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a> Sec.y</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133897">
<h3><a name="page-1133897">CB01_0405</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><date when='1868-04-16'>Apr. 16<sup>th</sup> [186]8</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'>Capt. D.L. Winsor</a></p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/81814' title='Richardson, Benjamin, Mrs.'>Mrs Benj. Richardson</a><span class='line-break'> </span>widow of the late proprietor of <a href='/pages/subjects/81815' title='Lot 978'>lot no 978</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>on <a href='/pages/subjects/59584' title='Cypress Avenue'>Cypress Av.<sup>e</sup></a>, near the <a href='/pages/subjects/61319' title='Public Lot'>St James</a>, has<span class='line-break'> </span>been here today, and wishes to <ins>add<span class='line-break'> </span>to the lot</ins> as much as the bylaws<span class='line-break'> </span>allow, in the rear of the lot. She has seen<span class='line-break'> </span>you or <a href='/pages/subjects/79942' title='Safford, Frederick Marcy'>Fred</a>, she says, &amp; you under<span class='line-break'></span>stand it. Will you please survey<span class='line-break'> </span>it -- send <del>her</del> me the certificate, &amp;<span class='line-break'> </span>enter it in your next report. I think<span class='line-break'> </span>she is sole residuary devisee under his<span class='line-break'> </span>will: but I will arrange that<span class='line-break'> </span>with her. --</p>
<p>The Hon. <a href='/pages/subjects/81817' title='Rice, Alexander H.'>Alex<sup>r</sup> H. Rice</a> whose<span class='line-break'> </span>wife's remains were placed in the R.T., has<span class='line-break'> </span>called to say that he has suddenly decided<span class='line-break'> </span>to go abroad by tomorrow's steamer, &amp; will<span class='line-break'> </span>probably return in Sept<sup>r</sup>. At his request,<span class='line-break'> </span>under the circumstances, I assured him<span class='line-break'> </span>that we would take no action until<span class='line-break'> </span>his return -- probably in 5 mos. -- Immediately<span class='line-break'> </span>on his return he proposes to select a lot. --</p>
<p>Very Respy yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a> Sec.y</p>
<p>405</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133898">
<h3><a name="page-1133898">CB01_0406</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>406</p>
<p>16 Pemberton Square</p>
<p><date when='1868-04-21'>Apr. 21 [186]8</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'>Geo. W<sup>m</sup>. Bond</a> Esq Treas<sup>r</sup>.</p>
<p>Dear Sir: --</p>
<p>The Trustees at the meeting held<span class='line-break'> </span>this day adopted the following votes: --</p>
<p>"That the Treasurer be directed to transfer the<span class='line-break'> </span>balance now at the credit of the "<a href='/pages/subjects/56255' title='Joseph Story Statue'>Story Statue fund</a>"<span class='line-break'> </span>on the books of the Corporation amounting to $990.97 -- to<span class='line-break'> </span>the Perpetual Repair fund of the <a href='/pages/subjects/53237' title='Story, Joseph'>Joseph Story</a> lot on <a href='/pages/subjects/55273' title='Narcissus Path'>Nar<span class='line-break'></span>cissus Path</a>. In accordance with with the conditions of<span class='line-break'> </span>release of the surviving subscribers to said fund<span class='line-break'> </span>as contained in document dated March 26, 1868."</p>
<p>"That, on and after the <date when='1868-05-01T09:00:00'>first day of May 1868,</date><span class='line-break'> </span>the Treasurer's office shall be in the Mount Auburn<span class='line-break'> </span>Rooms, no. 16 Pemberton Square: and the office<span class='line-break'> </span>hours of the Treasurer shall be from nine A.M.<span class='line-break'> </span>to three P.M. for each working day." --</p>
<p>"That the Com<sup>ee</sup> to which has been referred the subject<span class='line-break'> </span>of the office of Treas<sup>r</sup> be requested to nominate a Treas<sup>r</sup> &amp; report<span class='line-break'> </span>at the adjournment of this meeting."</p>
<p>Adj<sup>d</sup> to Tuesday <date when='1868-04-28T10:00:00'>28<sup>th</sup> inst. at 10 o'clock a.m.</date> --</p>
<p>Truly yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a> Sec.y</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133899">
<h3><a name="page-1133899">CB01_0407</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><u>16 Pemberton Square</u></p>
<p><date when='1868-04-21'>Apr. 21, [186]8</date></p>
<p>Dear Sir:</p>
<p>Your application to know<span class='line-break'> </span>for what sum the Trustees of this Cemetery<span class='line-break'> </span>will guarantee the perpetual repair of <a href='/pages/subjects/81818' title='Lot 1363'>lot<span class='line-break'> </span>no. 1363</a> owned by yourself, with its appur<span class='line-break'></span>tenances, has been laid before the Committee<span class='line-break'> </span>on Lots. Said Committee, after a personal<span class='line-break'> </span>inspection of the premises, have considered<span class='line-break'> </span>said application, and have directed<span class='line-break'> </span>me to notify you that the Corporation<span class='line-break'> </span>will contract for such perpetual<span class='line-break'> </span>repair on payment of <u>five<span class='line-break'> </span>hundred dollars.</u></p>
<p>If accepted<span class='line-break'> </span>by you, when notified, I will<span class='line-break'> </span>prepare the proper papers. --</p>
<p>Very Respectfully yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a> Sec.y</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/93745' title='Upton, George B.'>Geo. B. Upton</a> Esq</p>
<p>Respecting the question of charging &amp; crediting interest<span class='line-break'> </span>presented by you at the last meeting, the Trustees<span class='line-break'> </span>voted that the disposition of the same be<span class='line-break'> </span>referred to the Com<sup>ee</sup> on Lots with full<span class='line-break'> </span>power.</p>
<p>So if you will please apply to Mr<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54832' title='Austin, Edward'>Austin</a>, I presume you will be enabled to<span class='line-break'> </span>adjust the <a href='/pages/subjects/56311' title='Lot 313'>Story lot</a> [a/c?].</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J.C</a>.</p>
<p>407</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133900">
<h3><a name="page-1133900">CB01_0408</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><u>16 Pemberton Square</u></p>
<p><date when='1868-04-21'>Apr. 21, [186]8</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/79771' title='Worcester, F. A.'>F.A. Worcester</a> Esq. Ex<sup>or</sup>, &amp;c.</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>The application to know for<span class='line-break'> </span>what sum the Corporation will guarantee<span class='line-break'> </span>the perpetual repair of <a href='/pages/subjects/81801' title='Lot 582'>lot no. 582</a> belonging to<span class='line-break'> </span>the estate of <a href='/pages/subjects/81799' title='Worcester, Joseph E.'>Joseph E. Worcester</a>, dec<sup>d</sup>, has<span class='line-break'> </span>been laid before the Com<sup>ee</sup> with the usual<span class='line-break'> </span>report on said lot: and the Com<sup>ee</sup> after<span class='line-break'> </span>personal inspection of the premises, have<span class='line-break'> </span>directed me to notify you of their<span class='line-break'> </span>decision -- &amp; that the Corporation<span class='line-break'> </span>will assume such perpetual<span class='line-break'> </span>repair for the sum of four<span class='line-break'> </span>hundred and fifty dollars, when<span class='line-break'> </span>the Sup<sup>t</sup> shall have certified that the<span class='line-break'> </span>lot is in good order. The Sup<sup>t</sup> reports<span class='line-break'> </span>that "the front bank requires new grading,<span class='line-break'> </span>which will cost $12.00". --</p>
<p>Very Respy. yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a> Sec.y</p>
<p><u>16 Pemberton Square</u></p>
<p><date when='1868-04-21'>Apr. 21, [186]8</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/81819' title='De Grushe, Sarah E.'>Mrs Sarah E. DeGrushe</a></p>
<p>Dear Madam,</p>
<p>The application to know<span class='line-break'> </span>for what sum the Corporation will guar<span class='line-break'></span>antee the perpetual repair of your <a href='/pages/subjects/81797' title='Lot 3772'>lot, no.<span class='line-break'> </span>3772</a>, has been laid before the Committee,<span class='line-break'> </span>who after a personal examination of<span class='line-break'> </span>the premises, have directed me to <span class='line-break'> </span>notify you that the Corporation<span class='line-break'> </span>will contract with you for such <span class='line-break'> </span>perpetual repair, on payment<span class='line-break'> </span>of one hundred and fifty<span class='line-break'> </span>dollars.</p>
<p>When you are ready, I<span class='line-break'> </span>will prepare the necessary con<span class='line-break'></span>tract.</p>
<p>Very Respectfully yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a> Sec.y</p>
<p>408</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133901">
<h3><a name="page-1133901">CB01_0409</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><u>16 Pemberton Square</u></p>
<p><date when='1868-04-25'>Apr. 25 [186]8</date></p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>The Committee have<span class='line-break'> </span>considered <a href='/pages/subjects/59579' title='Adams, Mr.'>Mr Adams</a> note<span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; have returned the papers<span class='line-break'> </span>to me, for settlement.</p>
<p>Will you call and<span class='line-break'> </span>see me this morning, if<span class='line-break'> </span>at leisure, as we are not<span class='line-break'> </span>either of likely to be troubled<span class='line-break'> </span>much with callers -- and<span class='line-break'> </span>let us have an end of <span class='line-break'> </span>this matter, if possible. --</p>
<p>Yours Respectfully</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a> Sec.y</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/72297' title='Richardson, William H.'>W<sup>m</sup>. H. Richardson</a> Esq</p>
<p><u>16 Pemberton Square</u></p>
<p><date when='1868-04-27'>Apr. 27 [186]8</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/81820' title='Sales, H. W.'>H.W. Sales</a> Esq</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>It is a year &amp; a half<span class='line-break'> </span>since the addition of 309 feet was<span class='line-break'> </span>reported to <a href='/pages/subjects/59203' title='Lot 459'>lot 459</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/60390' title='Holly Path'>Holly Path</a>. I<span class='line-break'> </span>fear it is left in rather a loose state,<span class='line-break'> </span>as the surveyor does not indicate<span class='line-break'> </span>such addition on the plan, &amp; no deed<span class='line-break'> </span>is made until survey.</p>
<p>If you do not propose to make<span class='line-break'> </span>any extension improvement this<span class='line-break'> </span>Spring, please order some 8 inch posts<span class='line-break'> </span>to be set so as to indicate the<span class='line-break'> </span>bounds, &amp; we will make the<span class='line-break'> </span>survey &amp; deed.</p>
<p>Truly yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a> Sec.y</p>
<p>409<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133902">
<h3><a name="page-1133902">CB01_0410</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><u>16 Pemberton Square</u></p>
<p><date when='1868-05-02'>May 2<sup>d</sup> [186]8</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/67128' title='Parker, H. G.'>H.G. Parker</a> Esq</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>You must have<span class='line-break'> </span>forgotten your promise made to me<span class='line-break'> </span>a fortnight ago this day, as I met<span class='line-break'> </span>you on the passage out of Pemberton<span class='line-break'> </span>Square -- to wit: that you would<span class='line-break'> </span>inform me within one week, whether<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/81795' title='Wood, Amos L.'>A.L. Wood</a> would accept of<span class='line-break'> </span>the proposition made to pay the<span class='line-break'> </span>face of his bill without interest.</p>
<p>Please inform him that this is<span class='line-break'> </span>the last proposition that I shall<span class='line-break'> </span>make, &amp; the last time I shall inquire about it.</p>
<p>Respectfully yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a></p>
<p><u>16 Pemberton Square</u></p>
<p><date when='1868-05-05'>May 5<sup>th</sup> [186]8</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/81795' title='Wood, Amos L.'>A.L. Wood</a> Esq</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>Enclosed is the<span class='line-break'> </span>receipted bill of $157.12 for work<span class='line-break'> </span>on your lot in 1864. --</p>
<p>I regret that after nearly four<span class='line-break'> </span>years of patience with you and<span class='line-break'> </span>a remission of $35.35 interest<span class='line-break'> </span>on the bill, and an actual loss to the<span class='line-break'> </span>Corporation on a just bill, you should<span class='line-break'> </span>still allow yourself to characterize<span class='line-break'> </span>the charge as a "swindle". I trust<span class='line-break'> </span>that you will live long enough to<span class='line-break'> </span>find ample satisfaction in the<span class='line-break'> </span>lot, and to be convinced that your<span class='line-break'> </span>judgment was unduly severe.</p>
<p>Very Respy,</p>
<p>Your Ob<sup>t</sup> Serv<sup>t</sup></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a></p>
<p>410</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133903">
<h3><a name="page-1133903">CB01_0411</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><u>16 Pemberton Square</u></p>
<p><date when='1868-05-06'>May 6<sup>th</sup> [186]8</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/58363' title='Stone, William W.'>W<sup>m</sup> W. Stone</a> Esq, <a href='/pages/subjects/64140' title='New York, NY'>New York</a>,</p>
<p>My dear Sir,</p>
<p>I have torn off the last<span class='line-break'> </span>leaf of <a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'>Capt. Winsor's</a> letter because it<span class='line-break'> </span>relates to business foreign to your purpose.<span class='line-break'> </span>I send you the note relating to your business,<span class='line-break'> </span>instead of attempting to write about it, as<span class='line-break'> </span>I am wholly ignorant of the matter of which<span class='line-break'> </span>it treats. I know he will gladly<span class='line-break'> </span>do all in his power to facilitate<span class='line-break'> </span>your wishes -- but the thing is so<span class='line-break'> </span>late that he has a large load of<span class='line-break'> </span>orders to dispose of.</p>
<p>I suppose you trying to reach the <u>perpetual<span class='line-break'> </span>repair</u> of the lots, on which we conversed.</p>
<p>By the way, I lately notified the owners of<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/67016' title='Lot 358'>lots 358</a> &amp;<a href='/pages/subjects/65623' title='Lot 359'> 359 </a>through our Treas<sup>r</sup> (not knowing from<span class='line-break'> </span>whom the request to know came) that the Trustees<span class='line-break'> </span>would <u>guarantee</u> the perpet<sup>l</sup> care of both for $700. -- I<span class='line-break'> </span>suppose you must have got notice.</p>
<p>Very Respectfully</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a> Sec.y</p>
<p>411</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133904">
<h3><a name="page-1133904">CB01_0412</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>412</p>
<p>16 Pemberton Sq.</p>
<p><date when='1868-05-06'>May 6<sup>th</sup> [186]8</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'>Capt. D.L. Winsor</a></p>
<p>Dear Sir: --</p>
<p>In February of 1867 I wrote <span class='line-break'> </span>you requesting a report on the lot of the late<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/65850' title='Humphrey, Benjamin'>Benj. Humphrey</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/65849' title='Lot 1341'>1341</a> on <a href='/pages/subjects/61146' title='Cedar Avenue'>Cedar Av.</a> for perpetual<span class='line-break'> </span>repair. You examined said lot, and instead of<span class='line-break'> </span>sending me a report wrote: --</p>
<p>"I have examined the<span class='line-break'> </span>Humphrey lot. It requires to be regraded and<span class='line-break'> </span>resodded; especially its banks are very mossy. The<span class='line-break'> </span>pedestal which is attached to the figure which is with<span class='line-break'> </span>the same composed of one block of marble, is slightly<span class='line-break'> </span>cracked. The die of the monument is cracked in four<span class='line-break'> </span>or five different places and one of its cracks is a<span class='line-break'> </span>bad one, and probably the piece will come off in the<span class='line-break'> </span>course of twenty years".</p>
<p>I sent your letter to Mr Humphrey, who now<span class='line-break'> </span>says that the heirs have reached a point where<span class='line-break'> </span>they wish to make a contract for repair: but<span class='line-break'> </span>in consequence of the uncertain condition of<span class='line-break'> </span>the monument they propose to assume the<span class='line-break'> </span>perpetual care of that.</p>
<p>Will you please report this week stating <span class='line-break'> </span>the condition and facts, and add that the<span class='line-break'> </span>heirs wish in said contract expressly to</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133905">
<h3><a name="page-1133905">CB01_0413</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>413</p>
<p>except the care of the monument, and<span class='line-break'> </span>the estimate of price will of course exclude<span class='line-break'> </span>that. They wish to keep the lawn of the<span class='line-break'> </span>lot perfectly level without mounds, as the<span class='line-break'> </span>position of the graves are marked upon<span class='line-break'> </span>the fence. There is no tomb.</p>
<p>Truly yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a> Sec.y<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133906">
<h3><a name="page-1133906">CB01_0414</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>414</p>
<p>16 Pemberton Sq.</p>
<p><date when='1868-05-09'>May 9 [186]8</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'>Geo W<sup>m</sup> Bond Esq</a></p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'>Capt. Winsor</a> says that you have<span class='line-break'> </span>requested him to sell two old lots belonging to the Corporation.<span class='line-break'> </span>I presume you mean those contained on your annual report<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/62009' title='Lot 567'>nos. 567</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/81822' title='Lot 592'>&amp; 592.</a> --</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/62009' title='Lot 567'>Lot 567</a> on <a href='/pages/subjects/54338' title='Indian Ridge Path'>Indian Ridge Path</a> belonged to <a href='/pages/subjects/81823' title='Curtis, Samuel S.'>Sam<sup>l</sup> S. Curtis</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>which he transf<sup>d</sup> to the Corp<sup>n</sup> <date when='1853-11-01'>Nov. 1, 1853</date> for $100. -- The number<span class='line-break'> </span>has been applied to a lot in another part of the Cemetery &amp; such<span class='line-break'> </span>lot has been sold. The land which is nearly identical with<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/62009' title='Lot 567'>old 567</a> on <a href='/pages/subjects/54338' title='Indian Ridge Path'>Indian Ridge</a>, as I find by plan, is shown by the<span class='line-break'> </span>record to have been sold on the <date when='1864-07-12'>12<sup>th</sup> of July 1864</date> as lot <a href='/pages/subjects/67175' title='Lot 3493'>3493</a><span class='line-break'> </span>on <a href='/pages/subjects/59984' title='Rosebay Avenue'>Rosebay Av.</a> to <a href='/pages/subjects/81824' title='Clark, B. C., Mrs.'>Mrs B.C. Clark</a> for $360. But there are<span class='line-break'> </span>480 feet in lot <a href='/pages/subjects/67195' title='Lot 3497'>3497</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/62009' title='Lot 567'>while 567</a> contained but 300 ft --</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/81822' title='Lot 592'>Lot 592</a> was on <a href='/pages/subjects/61229' title='Mayflower Path'>Mayflower Path</a> (as then named).<span class='line-break'> </span>This ^<sup>with the tomb</sup> the Corp<sup>n</sup> bought <date when='1862-06-14'>June 14, 1862</date> of <a href='/pages/subjects/81825' title='Phalen, James'>James Phalen</a> for $215.</p>
<p>The land has since been graded, &amp; if not already<span class='line-break'> </span>sold as some new lot near the junction of <a href='/pages/subjects/58083' title='Ash Avenue'>Ash Av.</a><span class='line-break'> </span>with <a href='/pages/subjects/72315' title='Fountain Avenue'>Fountain<!--Ave--></a> (on <a href='/pages/subjects/58083' title='Ash Avenue'>Ash<!--Ave--></a>) very soon will be. The locality is<span class='line-break'> </span>probably ^<sup>partly</sup> in the rear of lot <a href='/pages/subjects/73813' title='Lot 3608'>3608</a> cor. of <a href='/pages/subjects/72315' title='Fountain Avenue'>Fountain<!--Ave--></a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/58083' title='Ash Avenue'>Ash<!--Ave--></a>, &amp; partly<span class='line-break'> </span>covered by lot <a href='/pages/subjects/73813' title='Lot 3608'>3608</a> -- which was sold, to the heirs of <a href='/pages/subjects/81826' title='Jones, Eli'>Eli Jones</a><span class='line-break'> </span>for $2 per foot.</p>
<p>If the <a href='/pages/subjects/54281' title='Massachusetts Horticultural Society'>Horticultural Society</a> have shared a second time<span class='line-break'> </span>without right in the sales, it is probably not worth while to disturb it now.</p>
<p>Very truly yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a> Sec.y</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133907">
<h3><a name="page-1133907">CB01_0415</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>415</p>
<p>16 Pemberton Square</p>
<p><date when='1868-05-12'>May 12, [186]8</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'>Geo. W<sup>m</sup> Bond</a> Esq<span class='line-break'> </span>Treas<sup>r</sup> of Proprietors of Cemetery of Mount Aub.</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>At the monthly meeting of the Trustees<span class='line-break'> </span>held this day, the several notes of <a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'>Geo. W<sup>m</sup> Bond</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Esq<sup>re</sup>, addressed to the Trustees of Mount Auburn and<span class='line-break'> </span>also to <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Dr Jacob Bigelow</a>, President of the Board,<span class='line-break'> </span>tendering his resignation of the Office of Treasurer<span class='line-break'> </span>of the Corporation, requesting that the same might<span class='line-break'> </span>take effect upon the first of June next, were<span class='line-break'> </span>read: --</p>
<p>And it was therefore</p>
<p>Voted that the resigna<span class='line-break'></span>tion of <a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'>Mr Bond</a> as Treasurer to take<span class='line-break'> </span>effect upon the first of June next, be and<span class='line-break'> </span>the same is hereby accepted.</p>
<p>The Board then adopted certain amend<span class='line-break'></span>ments to the by-law relating to the duties of<span class='line-break'> </span>Treasurer &amp;c. -- proposed at the last meeting.</p>
<p>The Board next proceeded to the choice of<span class='line-break'> </span>a Treasurer, by ballot -- and<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>Austin J. Coolidge</a> was chosen Treasurer.</p>
<p>(over)<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133908">
<h3><a name="page-1133908">CB01_0416</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>416</p>
<p>It was then</p>
<p>Voted that the Committee on Finance<span class='line-break'> </span>be requested to audit the accounts of the present<span class='line-break'> </span>Treasurer to the first of June next, and to deliver<span class='line-break'> </span>to his successor, upon receiving a satisfactory bond,<span class='line-break'> </span>all books, papers, funds and other property of<span class='line-break'> </span>this Corporation, which may be in his possession,<span class='line-break'> </span>giving and taking proper receipts therefor, and<span class='line-break'> </span>report to the Trustees.</p>
<p>At the meeting of the Trustees held on<span class='line-break'> </span>the <date when='1868-04-28'>28<sup>th</sup> of April</date>, the following vote was adopted: --</p>
<p>"That the Committee on Finance be requested<span class='line-break'> </span>to exchange so many of the 5/20 U.S. Coupon<span class='line-break'> </span>bonds for Registered bonds as they may deem<span class='line-break'> </span>for the interest of the Corporation."</p>
<p>I am</p>
<p>Very truly yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a> Sec.y<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133909">
<h3><a name="page-1133909">CB01_0417</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>417</p>
<p>16 Pemberton Square</p>
<p><date when='1868-05-18'>May 18 [186]8</date></p>
<p>My dear Sir,</p>
<p>I feel much mortified at my long<span class='line-break'> </span>neglect of your note of <date when='1867-11-27'>Nov<sup>r</sup> 27<sup>th</sup> [18]67</date>, inquiring where<span class='line-break'> </span>you "can procure such a jet as is in <a href='/pages/subjects/58209' title='Asa Gray Garden'>the Lawn<span class='line-break'> </span>Fountain</a>". --</p>
<p>First let me thank you for the beautiful "Hand<span class='line-break'></span>book for <a href='/pages/subjects/65969' title='Green-wood Cemetery, Brooklyn'>Greenwood</a>" by Mr Cleveland. It is exe<span class='line-break'></span>cuted in a style of rare elegance.</p>
<p>I was unusually engaged in the winter in pre<span class='line-break'></span>paration &amp;c. connected with the removal of our<span class='line-break'> </span>office, and since being here have found difficulties in<span class='line-break'> </span>replying lucidly to the question, owing to the fact that<span class='line-break'> </span>the jet, while in use in two or three places, was made<span class='line-break'> </span>by persons now away. Still it is thought by two<span class='line-break'> </span>or three of whom I have inquired that it can<span class='line-break'> </span>be easily produced.</p>
<p>I have finally been advised to refer you to<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/81827' title='Mott&apos;s Iron Works'>Mott's Iron Works</a> 266 Water St, <a href='/pages/subjects/64140' title='New York, NY'>New York</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; enclose the card of <a href='/pages/subjects/81828' title='Messrs Lockwood &amp; Lamb'>Messrs Lockwood &amp; Lamb</a> giving<span class='line-break'> </span>the reference. If you have any difficulty of getting it<span class='line-break'> </span>made there, and wish one, I have no doubt they<span class='line-break'> </span>can do it here. I understand that it is<span class='line-break'> </span>a very simple thing: it might be called "the reversed<span class='line-break'> </span>umbrella jet". If I can be of further aid, command<span class='line-break'> </span>my services.</p>
<p>Very truly yours</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/65968' title='Perry, Joseph Alfred'>J.A. Perry</a> Esq<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133910">
<h3><a name="page-1133910">CB01_0418</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>418</p>
<p>16 Pemberton Square</p>
<p><date when='1868-05-23'>May 23<sup>d</sup> [186]8</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/81829' title='Lee, Henry, Jr.'>Col. Henry Lee Jr</a> --</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>Your note respecting the lot of<span class='line-break'> </span>the late <a href='/pages/subjects/81830' title='Butler, Pierce'>Pierce Butler</a> &amp;c. is rec<sup>d</sup>.</p>
<p>I enclose the usual form of transfer, which<span class='line-break'> </span>will be found in blank on the 3<sup>d</sup> page of the<span class='line-break'> </span>deed of his <a href='/pages/subjects/81831' title='Lot 434'>lot (434)</a> if said deed can be found.</p>
<p>If Mr Butler left a will, it should first<span class='line-break'> </span>appear from it who are the heirs to the lot. As<span class='line-break'> </span>lots in the Cemetery are declared by the Charter<span class='line-break'> </span>to be real estate, it would pass (if not specifically<span class='line-break'> </span>mentioned) either under a general clause or a residu<span class='line-break'></span>ary clause. A copy of so much as covers this<span class='line-break'> </span>ground attested by the Recorder, with the date of<span class='line-break'> </span>the instrument, and of registration, would be all that<span class='line-break'> </span>we should require to ascertain who are the heirs.</p>
<p>If he died intestate, then let the heirs in making<span class='line-break'> </span>conveyance to <a href='/pages/subjects/81832' title='Kemble, Mrs.'>Mrs Kemble</a> (if that course is desired)<span class='line-break'> </span>refer to the fact in the ^<sup>blank</sup> transfer sent or the other if found.</p>
<p>In either case, they would use the blank transfer.<span class='line-break'> </span>If the claim under the will, they would use some such<span class='line-break'> </span>clause as this: "Know all men" &amp;c "that we, _____ of ____<span class='line-break'> </span>____ of ____  &amp;c ^<sup>[residuary heirs]</sup> devisees under the will of P.B. late of " &amp;c --<span class='line-break'> </span>If no will, "that we, ___   ___   ___ being the children &amp;<span class='line-break'> </span>only heirs at law of P.B. late of who died intestate," --</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133911">
<h3><a name="page-1133911">CB01_0419</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>419</p>
<p>If the title remains in the present heirs, <span class='line-break'> </span>we should be furnished with the documentary<span class='line-break'> </span>evidence of their title as I first suggested if they<span class='line-break'> </span>inherit under a will. Then I will furnish<span class='line-break'> </span>a blank petition to the Trustees of the Cem<span class='line-break'></span>etery to designate one of them to represent<span class='line-break'> </span>the lot --</p>
<p>It will shorten the matter a little,<span class='line-break'> </span>however, if the heirs release to <a href='/pages/subjects/81832' title='Kemble, Mrs.'>Mrs K. --</a></p>
<p>I believe I need not explain <span class='line-break'> </span>anything further --</p>
<p>Very Respy your Ob<sup>t</sup> Serv<sup>t</sup></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a> Sec.y</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133912">
<h3><a name="page-1133912">CB01_0420</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>420</p>
<p>16 Pemberton Square,</p>
<p><date when='1868-05-26'>May 26, [186]8</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/81833' title='Chapman, T. A.'>T.A. Chapman</a> Esq.  <a href='/pages/subjects/70546' title='Milwaukee, WI'>Milwaukee Wis.</a> --</p>
<p>Dear Sir,</p>
<p>Out Treas<sup>r</sup>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'>Mr Bond</a>, has sent <span class='line-break'> </span>me your note of <date when='1868-05-13'>May 13<sup>th</sup></date> requesting me to reply to it:</p>
<p>I regret to perceive that you have got an erro<span class='line-break'></span>nous impression in the matter. The bill as <span class='line-break'> </span>I see, is $53.25 for the first grading and sodding<span class='line-break'> </span>the lot. Your lot (no <a href='/pages/subjects/67186' title='Lot 3530'>3530</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/61235' title='Mound Avenue'>Mound Avenue</a>) was<span class='line-break'> </span>graded up with a line of lots of which <a href='/pages/subjects/67213' title='Collier, Mr.'>Mr Collier</a>'s<span class='line-break'> </span>is first and <a href='/pages/subjects/60648' title='Clark, E. P., Mr.'>Mr Clark's</a> last -- in advance of sale.<span class='line-break'> </span>The Corporation only occasionally grades lot before sale, and<span class='line-break'> </span>invariably, when this is done, adds the price of grading to<span class='line-break'> </span>the piece of land. Your land (400 feet) as you find<span class='line-break'> </span>in your deed cost you $600. This was for land in<span class='line-break'> </span>its naked condition. You may have got the idea that<span class='line-break'> </span>the $600 covered the whole from the fact that it was<span class='line-break'> </span>graded when you first saw it. The reason we make<span class='line-break'> </span>the charge for the land and grading separate is<span class='line-break'> </span>that we divide proceeds of land with the <a href='/pages/subjects/54281' title='Massachusetts Horticultural Society'>Massa<span class='line-break'></span>chusetts Horticultural Society</a>, and it has no interest<span class='line-break'> </span>in the work -- so we keep separate accounts, &amp; the<span class='line-break'> </span>bills are rendered separately to the purchaser.</p>
<p>Every other gentleman near you has been<span class='line-break'> </span>charged this separate bill in the same way<span class='line-break'> </span>and has paid it. The fact, that if one<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133913">
<h3><a name="page-1133913">CB01_0421</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>421</p>
<p>who wishes to put on stone-work finds<span class='line-break'> </span>it necessary to do a part of the work once again,<span class='line-break'> </span>has nothing to do with the question. That is<span class='line-break'> </span>an expense that we all incur if we see fit<span class='line-break'> </span>to make an alteration in our dwellinghouse<span class='line-break'> </span>or any other structure. In point of fact, how<span class='line-break'></span>ever you were saved expense of the greater<span class='line-break'> </span>portion of your ^<sup>filling</sup> materials, when you curbed<span class='line-break'> </span>your lot. --</p>
<p>The same land we sell today for<span class='line-break'> </span>$2.00 per foot without any improvement.<span class='line-break'> </span>I know you will cheerfully pay, when<span class='line-break'> </span>convinced that our charge is no imposition.<span class='line-break'> </span>We none of us are willing to submit to a<span class='line-break'> </span>"gouge", as it is termed, and I am sure<span class='line-break'> </span>the officers of this Corporation are as unwilling<span class='line-break'> </span>to ask a purchaser to submit to any improper<span class='line-break'> </span>charge as he can possibly be to pay it. --</p>
<p>You may feel assured, my dear Sir, that<span class='line-break'> </span>what I tell you now is true -- that this<span class='line-break'> </span>is a regular and proper charge, and one that<span class='line-break'> </span>has been invariably made, where a lot is fitted<span class='line-break'> </span>up in advance of sale. --</p>
<p>As I become <u>Treas</u><sup>r</sup> of the Corporation from<span class='line-break'> </span>the 1<sup>st</sup> of next month, you will please remit<span class='line-break'> </span>the am<sup>t</sup> of the bill to me.</p>
<p>I am respy your Obt Serv<sup>t</sup></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a>, Secretary.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />

<p>422</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a> in a/c with the Proprietors of the Cemetery<span class='line-break'> </span>of Mount Auburn</p>

<h3><a name="page-1133915">CB01_0423</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p><u>16 Pemberton Square</u></p>
<p><date when='1868-06-09'>June 9<sup>th</sup> [186]8</date></p>
<p>Dear Sir: --</p>
<p>Please enter upon<span class='line-break'> </span>your repair book the following lots:</p>
<p><table class='tabular'><thead><span class='line-break'> </span><tr><th><a href='/pages/subjects/64020' title='Lot 21'>Lot 21</a> --</th> <th>Heirs <a href='/pages/subjects/58439' title='Raymond, Edward A.'>Edw<sup>d</sup> A. Raymond</a></th> <th/> <th>300. --<span class='line-break'> </span></th></tr></thead> <tbody> <tr><td><a href='/pages/subjects/79731' title='Lot 1530'>" 1530</a> --</td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/79732' title='Wallack, Mary'>Mary Wallack</a> (corp int r.)</td> <td>G.</td> <td>200.</td> </tr> <tr><td><a href='/pages/subjects/81818' title='Lot 1363'>" 1363</a> --</td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/93745' title='Upton, George B.'>Geo. B. Upton</a></td> <td>G.</td> <td>500</td> </tr> <tr><td><a href='/pages/subjects/81797' title='Lot 3772'>" 3772</a> --</td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/81819' title='De Grushe, Sarah E.'>Sarah A. De Gruske</a></td> <td>G.</td> <td>150</td> </tr> </tbody> </table> The following I think have<span class='line-break'> </span>been given you before. --</p>
<p><table class='tabular'><thead><span class='line-break'> </span><tr><th><a href='/pages/subjects/81699' title='Lot 454'>454 --</a></th> <th><a href='/pages/subjects/81729' title='Atkins, Isaiah'>Isaiah Atkins</a></th> <th>G.</th> <th>475.<span class='line-break'> </span></th></tr></thead> <tbody> <tr><td><a href='/pages/subjects/93748' title='Lot 596'>596 --</a></td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/62839' title='Torrey, Charles'>Charles Torrey</a></td> <td>G.</td> <td>425</td> </tr> <tr><td><a href='/pages/subjects/93749' title='Lot 3648'>3648 --</a></td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/93750' title='Pallier, Eliza'>Eliza Pallier</a> (corp. in tr.)</td> <td>G.</td> <td>125.</td> </tr> <tr><td><a href='/pages/subjects/73706' title='Lot 2144'>2144 --</a></td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/93751' title='Wood, John'>John Woods</a></td> <td>G.</td> <td>350.</td> </tr> <tr><td><a href='/pages/subjects/79863' title='Lot 3281'>3281 --</a></td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/79862' title='Booth, Edwin'>Edwin Booth</a></td> <td>G.</td> <td>550</td> </tr> <tr><td><a href='/pages/subjects/71333' title='Lot 659'>659 --</a></td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/71334' title='Fairbanks, Otis'>Otis Fairbanks</a></td> <td>G.</td> <td>350 --</td> </tr> </tbody> </table> <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/93745' title='Upton, George B.'>Mr Upton</a> was out last<span class='line-break'> </span>Sunday, &amp; says he noticed that<span class='line-break'> </span>the lot next to his was cut [so?], but<span class='line-break'> </span>his was not. --</p>

<p><date when='1868-06-18'>June 18<sup>th</sup> [186]8</date></p>
<p>Dear Sir: -</p>
<p>Please report upon<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/93752' title='Lot 2887'>lot 2887</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/59222' title='Larch Avenue'>Larch Av</a>. 60 ft - belonging to<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/93753' title='Goodwin, Anna R.'>Mrs Anna R. Goodwin</a> for perpetual <span class='line-break'> </span>repair -- also state what repairs will cost<span class='line-break'> </span>if any are first needed. --</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/93754' title='Richardson, Thomas'>Mr Thos. Richardson</a><span class='line-break'> </span>is very anxious about the price<span class='line-break'> </span>of land -- 200 feet more or less<span class='line-break'> </span>on the northerly side of the Alger<span class='line-break'> </span>lot -- at the end of <a href='/pages/subjects/61175' title='Elm Avenue'>Elm Av </a>--<span class='line-break'> </span>Somebody has reported to him that<span class='line-break'> </span>it has been sold; but I told him<span class='line-break'> </span>I thought not. He is in the Alger<span class='line-break'> </span>family, &amp; wishes to purchase it --</p>
<p>Will you survey it <u>up to the Alger<span class='line-break'> </span>line</u>, &amp; let him know through me<span class='line-break'> </span>how much it contains --</p>
<p>Truly yours,</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A. J. Coolidge</a></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'>Capt. D. L. Winsor</a></p>
<p>423</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1133916">
<h3><a name="page-1133916">CB01_0424</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>424</p>
<p><date when='1868-06-17'>June 17, 1868</date></p>
<p>For <a href='/pages/subjects/81482' title='Shedd, J. H., Mr.'>Mr Shedd</a> --</p>
<p>Make survey of following : --</p>
<p>If any of them have no stone bounds yet, set<span class='line-break'> </span>the stakes for such and ask <a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'><!--Winsor-->the Sup<sup>t</sup></a> to have<span class='line-break'> </span>them put in without delay. --</p>

<div class="page-content">

<p><table class='tabular'><thead><span class='line-break'> </span><tr><th><a href='/pages/subjects/93767' title='Lot 3799'>3799 --</a></th> <th><a href='/pages/subjects/59904' title='Spruce Avenue'>Spruce Ave.</a> ^<sup>opp.</sup> Junc. with <a href='/pages/subjects/59585' title='Pine Avenue'>Pine Av.</a> --</th> <th><a href='/pages/subjects/93768' title='Sweetser, Henry F.'>Henry F. Sweetser</a> --</th> <th>680 ft --<span class='line-break'> </span></th></tr></thead> <tbody> <tr><td/> <td>Survey as soon as curbed</td> </tr> </tbody> </table> <span class='line-break'> </span>Addition to<span class='line-break'> </span><table class='tabular'><thead><span class='line-break'> </span><tr><th><a href='/pages/subjects/93769' title='Lot 2404'><!--Lot-->2404</a></th> <th><a href='/pages/subjects/55287' title='Lawn Avenue'>Lawn Av.</a></th> <th><a href='/pages/subjects/93770' title='Phillips, William'>W<sup>m</sup> Phillips</a> --</th> <th>Ad<sup>n</sup> of</th> <th>54 ft --<span class='line-break'> </span></th></tr></thead> </table> This appears to have been so reported because you found the<span class='line-break'> </span>entire contents to be 54 feet more than the deed shows, which<span class='line-break'> </span>is 1800 feet -- If you can show on which side it lies, give<span class='line-break'> </span>me the facts. --</p>
<p><table class='tabular'><thead><span class='line-break'> </span><tr><th><a href='/pages/subjects/81727' title='Lot 3817'><!--Lot-->3817</a></th> <th><a href='/pages/subjects/61184' title='Galanthus Path'>Galanthus P.</a></th> <th><a href='/pages/subjects/81726' title='Vose, John, Jr.'>John Vose Jr.</a></th> <th/> <th>360 ft<span class='line-break'> </span></th></tr></thead> <tbody> <tr><td><a href='/pages/subjects/81725' title='Lot 3808'><!--Lot-->3808</a></td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/61155' title='Coleus Path'>Coleus P.</a></td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/93771' title='Deblois, Stephen G.'>Stephen G. Deblois</a></td> <td/> <td>341 [ft]</td> </tr> <tr><td><a href='/pages/subjects/93772' title='Lot 3821'><!--Lot-->3821</a></td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/60406' title='Amaranth Path'>Amaranth P.</a></td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/93773' title='Bourney, William L.'>W<sup>m</sup> L. Bourney</a></td> <td>Lot contains</td> <td>405 [ft]</td> </tr> <tr><td>[3821]</td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/60406' title='Amaranth Path'>Amaranth P.</a></td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/93773' title='Bourney, William L.'>W<sup>m</sup> L. Bourney</a></td> <td>ornamental gr.</td> <td>124 [ft]</td> </tr> <tr><td><a href='/pages/subjects/67275' title='Lot 3482'>3482</a> --</td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/72315' title='Fountain Avenue'>Fountain Av.</a></td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/93774' title='Brown, Joseph A.'>Jos. A. Brown</a> --</td> <td>ad<sup>n</sup> to original 250 feet --</td> <td>163 [ft]</td> </tr> </tbody> </table> (Brown's half of tomb lot was 250 ft -- Davis's half<span class='line-break'> </span><u>was &amp; is</u> 250 ft -- Brown adds to his side 163 ft.)</p>
<p>I wish for the foregoing first --<span class='line-break'> </span>After that survey all that are ready in regular<span class='line-break'> </span>order --</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a></p>
